My husband had the Bison Burger with the Sweet Potato Hash and Kale sides. He said it may have been the best burger he's had. The sweet potato and kale sides were scrumptious. Love this place.

This place is great! Quick service. Unique menu.  Large variety for vegans/veggies/carnies. The teriyaki quinoa is amazing! I had it with tofu and they char it just a little...its delish! The beet bruschetta is interesting...im not into beets at all and I liked it. The drink options are great too.the pressed apple soda is awesome... Different than just an apple Italian soda. Very fresh with great flavor. This place is on my top 5 list.
Kale, miso, shrimp dumplings... all good

Awesome, healthy place to eat. Most things can be made gluten-free, if thats important to you. The staff are nice and friendly. Foods a bit overpriced to be sure, but it is high quality! The Bison Burger was FRIKKIN SWEET

This review is written especially for other yelpers out there with food allergies:  I was so excited to try TFK because eating out is so challenging for me due to my multiple food allergies (gluten, soy, dairy, egg yolks, and black pepper being the most difficult to get around). I have to be so careful. What a treat to be able to eat out like "normal" people.  Bottom line: I was very pleased with my experience and they seemed to take my allergies seriously.  Please note: I am one of those people who had no idea I had any food alleriges (i.e., I don't know that I'm ingesting allergens b/c my symptoms are so subtle), so this review may not be helpful if you're very sensitive. Sometimes I wonder if I'm ingesting allergens despite my best efforts not to.  First, I emailed the company that runs the restaurant, to inquire about their gluten free food/ prep/staff awareness of cross contamination issues, and heard back from someone after about 2 weeks. The response wasn't very specific about their awareness of gf cross contamination/prep, so I soldiered on and asked for more specifics. I actually got an email from the chef at TFK the next day. He explained they use different utensils/pots, etc for GF food, and would be able to accommodate my multiple issues.  When I arrived at the restaurant, our server didn't bat an eye when I laid out my laundry list of allergies. She patiently went over some menu items with me that I might actually be able to eat, but I ended up coming up with my own dish for them to make, and server checked with chef to make sure they could do it for me. I had diver scallops (4) on a bed of mixed greens with some avocado slices and caramelized onions. It was great, though a tad salty (that's what I get for being limited in what spices I can eat!). For this dish I was charged $22, that was the only downside. They actually had some gluten free, soy free and vegan sorbets available, but none of the flavors really interested me.  Service was great--absolutely no complaints.  I think TFK was the only place in the Phoenix area with "wholesome" food that I found when searching online that had GF options on the menu.

Excellent place to go if you want an extremely healthy meal. I love the concept of eating according to the food pyramid. We were greeted right away and sat immediately.  My companion had dietary restrictions and our Waitress was so sweet about it and understanding. When the food was brought out her order was wrong. It was handled so professionally. They apologized and immediately corrected the mistake. She even got a little snack while she was waiting.  The steelhead trout was amazing. The bison burger was a tad dry but very tasty. We both enjoyed our Juby fresh juices. I will be back!

Food was fabulous as usual & " Blue eyed handsome silver fox " made my day with an undeniable connection! Asked me if  " I would miss him when he left "   Here's a  yelp to re-connect, as you'll know who you are ;^)   vlwaloha@cs.com

True Foods is our go to restaurant in North Scottsdale.  They offer great service, a bright and airy atmosphere, and really wonderful and fresh food.  Also they have creative and unique cocktails.  You can't go wrong on their menu, and they have actually influenced my tastes over time to eat more vegetables which they prepare so deliciously.

I love True Food. The mint drinks, the layout, and the menu. I also like the friendly staff and overall good feel of the place.   I was just there last week celebrating a career change with my mother and we got there at a high volume time. A table opened up quickly, but there is one thing I will never understand and that is why the bus boys or waiters, DON'T clean the WHOLE table. I watched the guy do a quick rub down and there were still lettuce pieces on the table... Why? In my mind I was thinking, "Please wipe up the lettuce! The lettuce!"  Sadly, no.  Also, his rag was so wet that I didn't want to put anything down so we asked our hostess for a second wipe down. The same guy walked back over to redo the table and said, " You need another wipe down, huh?" As if it was strange.  Oh well! But the mushroom pizza was amazing and my kale salad was exactly what I needed.  Love the place but don't like rag wet tables!

Love True Food Kitchen (have been to the ones in LA and Houston as well). Food is consistent with the other locations - great quality ingredients, good portions, affordable pricing.   Personally, I felt the service was only ok. It felt staffed by teenagers who were keen but not very experienced. The hostess also had a bit of attitude. However the food made us forget everything else.

My fiancé and I ate here earlier in the week with the family. The service was excellent, and everything was spotless. My only complaint is that I didn't care for any of the food. I ordered the Bison Burger, which came on a dry flax seed bun, with flavorless sweet potato hash. My fiancé ordered the Mediterranean Salad with no meat, and the portion was very small and not very filling. Her salad was $11, and my entree was $16. I understand the restaurant's concept and I think it's great, but I think there should be better options for those who don't want an extremely clean meal. A beef burger with some deep fried french fries would be preferred! All in all, a great option for clean eaters and those with dietary restrictions, but not for the rest of us who eat whatever we want!

I just went in to buy a gift card and received the most rude service ever.  I have always wanted to try True Food Kitchen at the Biltmore but will definitely not based on this experience.  The man who helped me could barely muster out "Can I help you" and "how much?" for the gift card and definitely did not say 'how are you? "  or an obvious "thank you".  I truly don't think he would be capable of setting a positive dining experience.  I actually bought less of a gift card then intended.  Too bad, I wish it were better.

I heard this was a chic place with little options for rough, unruly, mountain man like myself.  After much coxing, I gave it a whirl to my surprise i found a Bison Burger and a salmon plate.......both worthy plates for someone like me.  I ordered and ate both and found them to be tasty!  I did however get some weird looks until i took my coonskin hat off and hid it in my shirt.

Medicine man....here I come! Right at the center of the Biltmore Square, True Food Kitchen is delicious, fresh and healthy. Eating clean in every bite, can't say no to a delicious tasteful and healthy meal! Girls you won't regret it, boys don't be afraid. Just what the Dr. Ordered. Nice ambiance for a great book club discussion on a Sunday for brunch. Don't miss it!

I love that no matter what I'm in the mood for, I can always find something fresh, flavorful, and outstanding at TFK.  I have their cookbook as well, and it's amazing!  Watermelon salad, bison umami burger, vegetable crudites, Kale-ade, edamame dumplings, honestly it's all delicious. They can take the most basic of dishes, and give it a simple twist that knocks it out of this world.  We always have very friendly servers and amazing food, not to mention creative, not-too-sweet cocktails.  One of my go-to places in Phoenix.

Went here for a girls night out a few months ago and was very impressed! The menu is quite varied, and I love that it boasts healthy options that change seasonally. The only thing better than the food was the service. Our waiter (I wish I remembered his name!) was quite patient and accommodating to a table of six picky women. He brought samples, gave his best recommendations, answered every question, dealt with splitting checks, and did it all with a smile. I particularly enjoyed the outside seating (we were there in April). Everyone loved their dish, from the quinoa burger, tacos, and lasagna to the delicious lemonades. It was a wonderful experience and I can't wait to go back and try the strawberry rhubarb crisp if it's still on the menu!

I'll be blunt:  True Food is my go-to place when I feel like I'm getting doughy, because the food feels healthy.  Don't get me wrong, I'm sure that with proper ordering you could make this place just as unhealthy as the average restaurant, but it's nice to have options that are not bad for you and also delicious.  Also the service I've had here has ranged from outstanding to average, never below that, and most of the time they're on the high side of that scale.

My wife and I went to True Food Kitchen tonight for the first time; I'd been wanting to try it since it opened and we finally had some time alone to give it a go. All I have to say is -- WOW!  The food is so unique and interesting at  TFK. All of the menu items are organic or locally grown (or at least locally sourced) and the menu was created with Dr. Andrew Weil. But this is not your father's hippie health food.  We shared a shrimp dumpling dish as an appetizer, which was delicious. For dinner my wife had a curry noodle with shrimp dish that was light and just a tad tangy from the curry. I'm usually not a curry person but this was just enough curry to add flavor without being overpowering.  I had a pizza with shrimp, caramelized onions, sweet red peppers and goat cheese. It was amazing...one of the best pizza dishes I've ever had. I'm a huge California Pizza Kitchen fan and I'd put this up against any of my favorites at CPK.  For dessert we shared an apple-cranberry crumble with non-dairy maple ice cream in top. It was sort of like a sweet granola with huge chunks of baked apples, soft cranberries and this amazing ice cream that was so good it was hard to believe it wasn't actually ice cream. Delicious.  We're definitely going back to True Food Kitchen!

Love the food, but the service is so bad that I will not be back. It felt they were graciously "letting" my dine there, ignoring me for a while before I got the first recognition and menu (maybe they were hoping I would go away on my own?) Throughout the meal not a comment, not a question whether I would like another juice when I finished the first one and then it took at least 10 minutes for them to figure out that I was actually done - I had to place my credit card on the receipt for them to get it. No question on how it was or whether I wanted a dessert menu. No thanks, there are plenty of restaurants with great food and great service. Do not need this condescending atmosphere. FYI, sat at the bar.

I have eaten here a handful of times and every time I have a good dinning experience.  However, last time I was there they were out of 5 of the juices that I ordered.  (Guess it wasn't my day)  Besides that the food was great and service was super.  Great atmosphere, great spacing and great concept.  Super happy to have this located right down the street!
Sooo good!!! I love the Dr Weil themed menu and the seasonal and fresh foods! I enjoyed every bite of my spaghetti squash casserole and melon/mint soda! What a fun atmosphere - I'll be back!

This place is very hit or miss. I like the food and love the concept (it's dr. andrew weil! he has an awesome beard! and makes healthy food! and stuff for origins!), but some of the portions are woefully small for the price. I have tried the flat breads, salads and wraps, and all have been healthy, tasty and super fresh. Also a great place if you are dining with someone who is vegetarian, vegan and/or gluten free as everything is clearly labeled. and, the lemonade with honey sounds weird, but it is really, really yummy. tart and sweet in a totally different sort of way.   Also, the decor is very interesting. It all appears to be sustainable/eco friendly and the herbs and edible grasses growing all around are appealing and really bring home the fresh, natural, healthy vibe. Hopefully this concept will catch on...
Always fresh, always good....love this place!  It's probably not the right choice if you're expecting the typical restaurant menu with food that's heavy on the salt and/or sugar.

This place is phenomenal! Everything is delicious. I love the Vegetable Crudités with Tzatziki & Black Olive dips and the "Inside Out" Quinoa Burger with Hummus, Tzatziki, Tomato, Cucumber, Red Onion, Avocado & Feta. Yum!!
The food was great.  We ordered dinner (3 courses).  The food tasted great. Wow it was good.  The next time I go I will eat before I go- The portions were to too small.  That is my only complaint.

I have been here 5 times now. The service is solid and friendly, the food is wonderul (ask for the quinoa salad if not on the menu)...The cucumber margarita is my favorite drink.  It's about time restaurants have come around to offering Gluten free, vegan, and vegetarians option
We ordered tsteak tacos, tuna tataki , chocolate cake, key lime pie, Prosecco and watermelon monitors.  All was decent.  Liked the tacos the best.  Service was decent as well for a busy Friday night.
I love this place. The setting is so beautiful amidst all the palms. Sitting outside is great day or night. Our server Jacqueline was particularly nice today. My favorite stop in The Quarter.

True food is love, true food is life. Everything I've tried is divine, yet so modern and nutritious. The Roasted Ingredient Salad  is my favorite thing off the menu but the Red Chili Shrimp, and Tuscan Kale Salad are good as well. For appetizers, the Vegetable Crudités is the way to go (black olive dip is drool worthy). As far as desserts go, the Flourless Chocolate Cake takes the cake (haha). For a nice night out without completely weighing you down and swearing to begin a cleanse or diet the next day, this is your place.

All the puzzle pieces  fit together. Great food, great service, and good atmosphere. I had the squash, sons had the chicken sausage pizza, and shriltaki  noodles, wife had teriyaki rice bowl. Chicken was a little dry on the pizza other than that everything else was good.

Love this place!  Lots of options for all types of appetites.  We were in town last week from Chicago and based on the yelp reviews came here for dinner.  Cocktails were tasty and food was delicious.  Nice vibrant atmosphere too.  Service was good too.

The food and service were excellent and if my rating was solely based on that I would have given True Food 5 stars.  BUT, after using the restroom, and witnessing my server cleaning the splash zone around the urinal, my rating went down to 2 stars. Even though I saw my server wash his hands, I was still grossed out. I know someone needs to clean the bathroom, but does it really have to be my server?!?!  Don't get me wrong, I was not mad at the staff, because I am sure they were just doing their job, but I really wish I did not have to see that.    I really love this place and always get good service and delicious food but I just don't appreciate my servers also cleaning the bathrooms and then handling my food.  I don't know if this is their policy, but unfortunately I have not been able to bring myself back there since then.

This was my first time at True Food and I was a little disappointed.  The combinations of drinks were inventive and tasty, not to mention colorful.  The meal was well presented and I didn't have to worry about where anything was from - the wait staff knew where the lettuce was from down to the pistachio nuts sprinkled on my salad.  While the food was healthy and very fresh, overall it lacked in flavor. I first ordered the spicy shrimp and Asian noodles. The texture of the tofu, mushrooms and shrimp was underwhelming. The flavor was below average. I sent it back and ordered the Turkey Pita in it's place which good. I ordered it without the grapes and yogurt but the sandwich was very fresh & flavorful. The ambience is open and light with outdoor seating. They even grow their own herbs and some of the greens. I would pay far more for food like this - even remotely advertised as organic - in some locations. I felt good about eating locally and healthy - for at least one night of my trip anyway. Overall a good experience. I would go back if I was on that side of town.
My favorite restaurant. Always consistent with amazing food and wonderful service. I am never disappointed.

My family and I come to the Biltmore location quite often for many reasons. I have severe food allergies and True Food Kitchen is always so accommodating to all of my allergies. I can confidently say that True Food is the ONLY restaurant that I can fully depend on to make my food right every time. Not only is it geared perfectly to my allergies but it is absolutely delicious. The chefs definitely know what they're doing in the kitchen. Secondly, the service in all areas of True Food at the Biltmore are excellent. The greeters and the hosts at the door are always so welcoming. It's refreshing to walk into an establishment with such smiling faces. Additionally, Ari (the manager) greets us every time we are in there like we are family. She is always smiling and out on the floor helping every one out...seems like a really great manager. However, what we truly look forward to most is coming to visit ANDREW. With his quick wit, kind heart and superb service, it is always a treat. Andrew was our first server here, and from then on we were hooked! He was so accommodating and knowledgeable about the menu and the concept that True Food Kitchen prides itself on, we instantly felt at home. He is one of the best servers we have had the pleasure of being with!

Though I was sad to learn Coffee Plantation was gone, Fox has done a great job with this new restaurant. Clean, fantastic foods with veg, began, and gluten free options that are great on taste! Service was outstanding and our first visit was memorable. Will be back on our next visit to Phoenix.

I really want to love this place, I've eaten here multiple time, and have ended up with very mixed feelings about True Foods. I will clarify my rating to say that overall, this location is better than the one in the Scottsdale Quarter.   On one hand, I love the healthy concept, I love the look of the restaurant, and I love the menu choices. One of my favorite menu options is the Vegetable Crudite. I also love all of the salads.   On the other hand, the cooked food is just never prepared right. Last time we were there I had the salmon. I asked for it medium and it came well done and with no flavor. I had a similar problem when I ordered the sea bass and it came smothered in heavy umami sauce. Another great idea is the bison burger, but that came dry, overcooked and salty.   If you want to enjoy true foods order something that isn't cooked and you will, but otherwise you might find your visit disappointing.

A must eat!   Visited this restaurant for a late lunch after a recommendation from a friend...so glad we stopped by! The atmosphere was adorable; tables weren't too close together and chairs were very comfy. A very open view into the kitchen, which is always comforting.  Service was very friendly and helpful in answering questions and choosing a dish. I started with the green tea and lemonade drink, but the star is the food. I enjoyed the butternut squash pizza and was really hungry, so I ate the entire pizza, but still didn't feel TOO full. My friend had the tacos, which she also really enjoyed.  I can't wait to visit this restaurant in Denver!

I love True Food Kitchen and highly recommend it to my family and friends.  That said, I was highly disappointed with the new curry dish--I was truly addicted to the old preparation.  PLEASE BRING IT BACK!

I love love true foods. My most favorite dish is the autumn ingredient salad with grilled salmon. It's so good. I can eat that every day. My kids love the teriyaki chicken bowl and the kids grilled chicken with veggies and seasonal fruit. I always order the kale aid. So refreshing. Love that they can accommodate all food allergies.

Fresh healthy fun food.  The Kale-aid is rich and refreshing.  I recently had the lasagna. Tasty and the perfect portion but I'd definitely pair it with a side salad next time.   I've ate here about 5 times now and I've never been disappointed.  The healthy drink concoctions alone make this place worthy of visiting.
Food was very tasty and lots of options but this place is totally overpriced like most health food restaurants which is why it only gets 3 stars!

Talk about totally Fabby location!  Absolutly beautiful patio and gorgeous views all around.  Scottsdale Quarter is on it's way to being a Fabby Shopping distict which delights all the senses.    House Smoked Salmon & Pita Crackers was delicious  Edamame Dumplings were very interesting  The Hangover RX Elixer was FANTASTIC! {& just what I needed for a Saturday morning!}  Bison Burger not my choice, but hubby enjoyed the change  I was in love with my Panang Chicken Curry Bowl!  Y U Mmmmers !  The Hybrid Martini, with Belvedere & Hibiscus was too sweet for  my taste - hole the Hibiscus and more basil lemon next time :-)  The bottle of NZ Sav Blanc was a perfect pair with the curry!  Pomegranate Sorbet was refreshing  Chocolate Flourless Cake was good to share {x 3} - caramel sauce was too sweet, but again, really enjoyed the 3 spoonful's.  It was a beautiful brunch time on a  perfect Fall day in AZ !   Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm .....

Attended an amazing event in which Dr. Andrew Weil hosted and provided a wealth of fantastic information pertaining to diet, health and cooking.  I really hope something else along these lines might be presented again.    Luved all the samples of the new menu, which included smoothies, tofu breakfast wrap (surprisingly good!) pistachio loaf, yummy pancakes, and yummy granola & greek yogurt.    I appreciate that all their ingredients are upheld in very high standards, and they are being recognized all over, hence opening in other locations such as Scottsdale Quarter (will be much closer for me to visit) and in California.

Let's start with the food. Everyone enjoyed their vegetarian and non-vegetarian option. Have eaten there many times and the food quality is always delicious with many unique options for vegetarians.   Service was bizarre our last visit. First, our server offered to have our wine decanted and another person actually performed the service at our table. Then things turned south. Three of the four entrees arrived together but after telling several servers that we were waiting on our fourth did it show up at five to ten minutes later with no apologizes. We ordered another bottle of the same wine and it comes to the table already decanted without the original bottle. Really? I was speechless and again no accommodation was given. Should have been comped for something but just paid the bill and moved on. No manager came by to make amends.
One of my favorite places to eat in the valley.  Everything is fresh and delicous and perfectly portioned.  My recommendations are the TLT sandwich or the Turkey Bolognese.
Excellent food.  I have been here for breakfast, brunch, and lunch and everything I have tried has been wonderful.  There are many vegetarian options to choose from.

True Food is a great spot for a tasty lunch or dinner, especially if you are very into healthy food. There are some drawbacks, and it can be a hit or miss with the service. I have been verbally attacked by a waiter for not leaving "enough" of a tip, But, the food is always good and fresh. But this isn't a place for a quick drop in, usually it's quite busy and can take a while.

Amazing options for the whole family! Their specialty drinks were fantastic (especially the pomegranate, lime and chia seed)! There was so much to choose from but my mother and I shared the tofu/shiitake lettuce cups, margarita pizza and a kale salad! they were all delicious. the prices aren't cheap but it's worth it! very cool atmosphere and super clean. Highly recommend stopping in even if it's just for a drink and small appetizer. Awesome shopping area surrounds it too(:

I used to be a huge fan of True Food, but the food has gone downhill.. safe to stick with the pizza. Although I will say, they have an egg white sandwich with turkey bacon on the weekends which is delicious.   Drinks, on the other hand.. amazing. They will juice anything you ask for. And the Prana martini is definitely one to try.  Overall...Totally overpriced. Service has never been that great. And it's too open and loud. Plus bathrooms are outside, which is just annoying if it's cold out.

We arrived at the True Food Kitchen at about 3pm. As soon as we entered we were greeted in a very warm and welcoming way. I loved the T-shirts the servers were wearing. They all had an inspiring message such as "Shine On" "Honest" "Green Goddess" "Truth". Those messages instantly brought a smile on my face.  The atmosphere was pleasant. The servers were speaking softly and with kindness. This is something I appreciate. The menu was a good mixture Omnivorous :) Vegetarian and Vegan. There is something for everyone. So if you are Vegan you can go there with your meat eating friends too. I liked the fact that it is not strictly vegan or vegetarian but that there is a healthy choice for everyone. The food was delicious.I particularly liked the Teriyaki Quinoa Vegan bowl and the Vegetarian Edamame dumplings with asian herbs and white truffle oil! Yum Yum!  A healthy and happy place to eat for ALL! I will definitely go there again!

Clean, simple, healthy food with a good amount of variety on the menu. I love restaurants like this that prove healthy food doesn't need to be boring or bland. I got the turkey burger which was delicious, as was the kale salad and sweet potato hash. There was no shortage of food options that sounded tasty and quite a few choices for gluten-free and vegetarian diets. They also had a lot of really interesting looking (non-alcoholic) drinks and I kind of regret not trying one out--next time I suppose!

I used to live in Phoenix and True Food Kitchen was across the street from my apartment. I went all the time and it is a fabulous restaurant! Now, whenever I come to visit, I make an effort to stop by and meet friends for dinner and drinks. Great food and booze options! In addition, I have a food allergy and every waiter I have interacted with has been knowledgeable about the menu and kitchen operations. Greatly appreciated!

The food is amazing but head to the Quarter location for way better service.  Last Sunday, I roll through my girlfriend after a weekend seminar and we're starving.  1. There's a huge line out the door to get seated and they're at 30% capacity. 2. We get seated, order a drink and it takes over 15 minutes to get a beer. 3. Our waitress disappears, so we have to order from a random. 4. They bring me the Grass-Fed burger, ordered incorrectly. 5. I gave them the token to validate and they forget to do it. 6. No apologies, no 20% off, no "hey, we messed up tonight."  Overall, a terrible experience and as big True Food fans, we were beyond disappointed.

The food was tasty, but the service was lacking. I understand that a Friday night can be busy, but we were in need of a flare to get our waitress to come to our table to take our order. The hostess was very nice. Our waitress was pleasant, but it took forever to place our order, get food and dessert, and finally get our check. I will return but most likely to get takeout. For the prices you pay here, the service has room for improvement.

Great location, fresh food and good service. It's a little on the pricey side, but you can also tell that you're getting a balanced, quality, mostly healthy meal. You get what you pay for. It can get pretty busy during peak times, so you may not get a seat on their nice patio, however the interior is nice and airy. Try the matcha horchata iced and always get the 1/2 and 1/2 side option (half sweet potato hash and half kale salad)

This is one of my favorite spots in all of Phoenix. But, I have a BIG problem.  The "Andy's Favorite TLT" sandwich is so damn good, I can't get to trying more things on the menu.   Great food, great atmosphere.  Best in class!
Great place for a Healthy Lunch! If your in Scottsdale, you will enjoy the atmosphere and fresh food!

I used to frequent this place when it first opened;  however, I'm a HUGE eater and like to get as much food as possible for my money;  I found the amount of food for the price was a bit off.    What finally sealed the deal was when my friends mentioned something about  ex-cons and anorexics;  combined with  the long annoying wait;  it was just so much easier to head east to new cool restaurants in Scottsdale.    I have to say my recent revisit after 2 years was well worth it.     Food is fresh and presentation is simple and organic.  I forgot how fun it is to go to a health-conscious restaurant.     It's certainly not a meat and potatoes place, and the clientele and staff still look like they need Ensure IV infusion, however, if you want  to eat light  and make yourself  feel like you're eating healthy for a change, this is your place.  Go early!
Amazing organic (when possible) local food! Curry is a must!

Been to the True Food in North Scottsdale and this one.  My choice for a last dinner would be a ribeye with everything else that goes with a great steak dinner so it's hard to believe I could give five stars to this place.  Had dinner with four others and we all shared.  I didn't try anything I didn't like.  Both restaurants had a great layout but we especially enjoyed the n. Scottsdale location.  Left satisfied but still felt like you could hike Camelback.

I hit the True Food Kitchen on 4th of July, because I received an email for a 25% off discount at a Fox restaurant. True Food is one of my favorites, so I called up my best friend and we headed over.   I highly recommend the tomato and watermelon salad. It's so light and refreshing. We also ordered the lemon tart. It was delicious as well.   Every time I hit this restaurant, I receive excellent service! The food and drinks are always beyond delicious as well.

I have had nothing but great experiences at both the Scottsdale and Biltmore locations.  I'm a regular and have been going for years. I really like how drinks are made with fresh ingredients. And you can't go wrong with anything salmon!

I've been to True Food a bunch of times but I still can't make up my mind as to how much I like it.  The food is consistently good, kale salad is awesome, tacos, pizza, soup are all good and I love that they have interesting drink choices - I tried the sparkling iced tea the last time and it was great.  Service can be spotty, I even had one waiter sell me on a vegan sweet potato soup only to take a bite and find it had chicken - not good, not good at all, that's a big mistake - they were completely unapologetic about it and blamed the kitchen staff for the mix up.    My main gripe with this place is flies, yes flies.  Every time I've been here there are flies in the restaurant.  The last time I was here my husband looked at me and said, "oh right that's why we don't come here more often, I forgot about the flies".  All things considered, it's just OK.

Great food, great service.  I came here with my sister that is a vegan.  My wife and I are not vegan but there was a delicious selection for all.  This is my second time coming here and I will definatelty return.

The service was great - I'll give it that, especially since they did individual checks for a group of 7 ladies which I know is always a pain.  However, I felt the food was way overpriced - $23 for 3 tiny street tacos, an iced tea and tip.  The tacos were pretty good but the meat was very rare for my taste, the beans that came as a side were blah.  I left hungry.

Overrated. I had a $17 bowl of ramen. Food was pretty bland and uninspiring. Not terrible, just not worth the prices. I had a smoothie also, which was also meh. The desert tasted like a cliff bar with some stuff on top. The appetizers were ok.

One of my new favorite and they are opening more locations around the country,  can't wait.  I thonk I'm in most locations at least once per year now.   The cucumber honey lemonade is delish add is the seafood special I had sea bass seared with umami sauce.  Service was a little slow but I thunk my server was in the weeds he was very nice the whole time and the manager helped. I think he should have let on he needed help a little sooner. I would go back several times for the food and juices regardless amy time I'm near a location. Where else can you get local source,  ?luten free, preservative free and catering to any dietary needs.

We were on a mission . . . to check out the space for a possible 18-guest dinner on a Saturday evening in March. We were excited as it was the most perfect day to enjoy the patio at True Food Kitchen. Apparently, everyone else had the same idea! What we didn't expect was that at 12:15 pm on a Friday afternoon, the wait for a table for two would be 40-45 minutes! Yikes! So we decided to not put our name down and try somewhere else . . . but before we left, we scoped out the building and patio. On the far end, the side with the really picturesque view of the mountains and the fountains (no streets), was a near "lounge" area with large comfy patio like chairs and low cocktail tables. I made a beeline to the hostess and asked if they were reserved or available . . . she said "the table is a little low . . . " We said, "no worries." We had our seats and we were ecstatic!!!!   And our experience continued to get better the longer we lingered. The patio area is much more conducive to talking . . . inside, it is very loud, and it would be difficult to carry on leisurely lunch (or dinner) and good conversation. My friend commented how nice it is to go out to eat and feel like you are doing something healthy for yourself. That is the foundation of True Food Kitchen and we likey!!!!   The menu offers so many wonderful choices to nourish your body. Their refreshing nonalcoholic elixirs were calling my name, so I had the Green Arnie which was perfectly sweetened with honey. They also have a beautiful selection of hot teas not usually found in most restaurants, and they serve it with honey as well. (Not a Splenda in sight!)   For our entrees, my friend chose the Panang Curry with Tofu. I was skeptical (having visited Thailand with the real deal). It is a large portion filled with a plentiful amount of tofu and veggies. The tofu was cooked to perfection so that the fragrant and delicious sauce clung to it just so. Yes, I tasted it -- I couldn't help it -- my friend was inhaling it at a vigorous pace! I ordered the Spaghetti Squash Casserole. It was delicioso. The squash and zucchini maintained a little of their crunchy vegetable texture, the tomato sauce was smooth and not too tangy, and it was just perfectly topped with just the right amount of slightly browned mozzarella cheese.   What I loved was that our server, while attentive, was not in the least bit smothering. On such a busy afternoon, she was gracious when we asked for more time to order; she offered my friend more hot water for her tea; and didn't rush us to leave and turn the space when we concluded our entrees . . . she gave us the opportunity to linger . . . and so we did.   No doubt that we will be back again and again. And I'm pretty sure my friend will be booking her 18-guest dinner there, too!

Excellent restaurant! I am a vegetarian and there are tons of options on the menu, even for vegan or gluten free diets. Everything is so fresh and delicious. We went with a group for brunch and not a single person left unsatisfied. You have to order the banana quinoa Johnny cakes or an omelet, they are divine. Even the juice/smoothie menu looked great.  The staff is quick and friendly and the food is even better! My favorite part is if you sit inside, you can see all of the food being prepped right in front of you. Quality ingredients and great taste/prices. Even if you aren't observing a special diet, I highly recommend True Food Kitchen for any meal of the day!
Food was great staff pleasant.  I ordered the turkey burger and it was fantastic I will definitely come back.

Really different! I like this place for the atmosphere, quick and friendly service, and the healthy options they offer. It's convenient in the sense that it's a good place to stop and eat while you're shopping or for just getting a nice meal when you need a change from the regular. I think this is a great place to try out and see if you're in the mood for something more for your palate.
Great food and great staff! Expect line ups on the weekend but it is worth it. Try any of the chopped salads and the curry!
We had an amazing evening at True Foods. Andrew our server took care of every need we had and Sean the manager gave us extra attention...so much fun and great great food. Thanks for a great evening.

This is one of my favorite places to eat. Whenever my boyfriend takes me out and I get to choose, this is my go to place. And whenever a friend wants to meet for lunch or a dinner, I always suggest True Food.  The food is fresh, as well as the different drinks. I always feel good about what I eat because I know that the kitchen is using the best ingredients, and keeping the dishes light and healthy.   I recently ordered the trout and absolutely loved it. I also usually get the chicken chopped salad.   The best drink the The Natural (cold).  I have never had a bad experience with the service as well. They are friendly, knowledgeable, and want to give you the best time.  I HIGHLY recommend going!

I eat at True Foods about 4-5 times a week. Compulsively. Deliciously. Fun, what a concept Scottsdale! Yee-haw! About 3 years ago my (now) fiancee, her daughter and I sat down for our first meal at TFK. A fellow named 'Ted' who later came to be a friend warmly greeted us and we had a few chuckles. Great meal. Well then I graduated to the very cool U-shaped counter where I have been a regular ever since, particularly on my solo date nights when my fiancee is out of town. As a military vet I had a couple pick up my check even on Veteran's Day. I have met several new friends there 'sitting around the counter.' The vibe and action is better than a reality TV show to watch from this vantage point. The people behind the bar are awesome, it's like the Dream Team: Aly, Sarah, Randon, Brandon, Jess. (Jess? She could have her own show, lol!) I mean any one of these 'servers' could run a restaraunt on their own, and I hope one day they will. And the managers are just as awesome and have become good friends: Curtis, Adele, Matt. They really MENTOR their people! ANYONE visiting from out of town this is the happening spot! Saddle up to the bar whether you drink or not. Since they don't have sasparilla I drink iced tea. Yeh OK, it IS passion fruit-tinged, which took some time getting used to for a ruffian like me, but now I crave the stuff! A great time all around!

We visited True Food for a birthday celebration and are pretty upset after waiting more than an hour for our food with no apologies and not even a complimentary round of drinks or desserts to make up for the long waiting time. The food was ok, except for one entrée which was cold. Food portions were small and overpriced. Because of the long waiting time we missed an appointment. Overall a very unpleasant dining experience.  Edit: I got contacted by the owner after posting my review. He didn't apologize or offered me something as a compensation for my bad dining experience. He only asked for our location in the restaurant and our server. Amazing customer service...

Walked in last nite around 630, sat at bar. Dining room was busy but bar quiet. Horrible service, dirty glassware. Rude bartender. Mushy albacore sashimi, coulda used a straw to eat it  Didn't order a entree , left
If you are in to organic food or a vegetarian this will be your new spot.

Such a great place to eat. Amazing food... And great customer service...I  eat here regularly because I love the food... But today was exceptional... I had an issue that had nothing to do with True Foods. I asked an associate for some help on how I could handle the issue. The manager came out and actually jumped through hoops to help us out. Wonderful place and great people working here.

Looking for a great dining experience come here!  It's not you're normal staple and the ingredients used are fresh and inviting.  I tried things I was a little hesitant to try but so glad I did!  All the food we ordered was fabulous!  Our waitress was very informative and extremely pleasant.  I would come here again if I'm traveling through.

I love this place, never thought I would originally when I checked out the menu. We have tried many items and haven't had anything we don't like. I have been to locations in Scottsdale, Houston and Chicago. The food and service has been consistently good.

4 of us arrived on a Friday night, and the place was hoppin'.  We were seated promptly after a 10 minute wait, and since it was Friday night, it was time for a beverage! I started out with a blood mary, and it was great!  Followed that up with a skinny margarita, which was tasty in my book :).  Appetizers: onion flatbread and dumplings.  The dumplings came in a great broth, but the onion flatbread was awesome! Really thin, almost cracker like crust!  Sides: Kale salad - my friend raved about this dish, but I thought it wasn't anything special.  It definitely looked and tasted healthy, interpret that how you will.  Entrees: grilled salmon -- this dish was really tasty! could have used a tad more seasoning, but it was perfectly cooked. I really enjoyed the arugula salad that accompanied it, and the terrific crunch from the pomegranate seeds.  Dessert: The four of us split the cobbler, which was topped with a non-dairy ice cream.  This was surprisingly not bad, especially the ice cream! Great textures.  Overall Food: Good "healthy" food, try the salmon and the onion flatbread.  A little pricey, but that's necessary for organic, farm-raised, etc.  The four of us + tip was $150 +.  Environment: it was LOUD, we almost were screaming at each other to be heard.  The decor is modern casual.  Service: Our waiter was fabulous, she definitely lives the Dr. Weil lifestyle.
Very good food. The kale salad is amazing! I don't think I have had something I didn't like here!

Great place to eat well and eat healthy.  the food options are great and light but satisfying at the same time.  The Red Chili Shrimp is so good.  but the restaurant favorite seems to be the Spaghetti Squash Casserole. The drinks are good and have nice refreshing options like the acai pomegranate mojito.

The hunny and I stopped in here for dinner Saturday night around 8:30.  There was a 20 minute wait but it have us chance to scope out the nearby h&m and apple store.  The buzzers they give you work in the surrounding stores at Scottsdale Quarter!  We got a great booth/table combo so of course we both snuggled on the booth side!  Alyssa grabbed us cocktails (me acai rum drink??) and the half veggie crudités.  I love the tzatziki!  The drink was not my fav.  I had the spaghetti squash casserole which is my usual favorite at the biltmore location.  Same yummy saucy squash with melted mozzarella. My sweetie got the bison burger and offered to share- no thank you!  Not too much of a meat eater!  I did try a bite and did not hate it.  He loved the mushroom flavor but I was not a huge fan.  He ordered medium well which it was very well done.  He was still happy and are every bite.  The food here was a 4 star and the service from Alyssa was a 6 so it evens out!  A team member of hers took our card and quickly after Alyssa came back to say bye.  Such a nice down to earth person with attention to detail!!

Absolutely a healthy favorite that doesn't skimp on flavor, inspiration, and creativity!!  The veggie crudités is typically my starter if I dine in or take anyone who has never been.  The dipping sauces are yummy and fresh and the one is gluten free.    I usually opt for the turkey pita which is absolutely delicious.  House made pita and roasted turkey shredded with tomatoes grapes and a yummy yogurt sauce never disappoints.  You can either get roasted sweet potatoes or kale salad as a side which I usually get 1/2 and 1/2.  My favorite entree here for dinner is the squash casserole.  Yummy tender squash covered in a zesty marinade with freshly melted mozzarella is light but satisfying.  I love heart veggie dishes that satisfy more than even a steak or a burger.  Dessert wise I've tried the olive oil cake which is yummy but tiny!! It's a muffin size with about 7 berries.  I could eat 10 of those things.  For take out lunch everyone always gets the kale salad.  I personally really prefer the Mediterranean chopped salad with quinoa.  The dressing is light enough so the yummy pea shoots don't get soggy.  The Marcona almonds and feta are the perfect touch.

This is the place we go when we need to feel really good about our food. Natural ingredients, vegan, vegetarian, amazing drink concoctions (non-alcoholic), sinful deserts and, all of it "good for you." Dr. Andrew Weil wins big with this one... haven't been to the Camelback location yet - I hear the Scottsdale one is bigger.  Get there early - they don't take reservations. Worth the wait.
Gluten free pizza, loved it. Very healthy fresh drinks

True kitchen is my absoult favorite restaurant in Phoenix . The manager Ariana and her staff are incredible and very friendly ! I brought my from Portland in for lunch and we had a wonderful experience , the food was amazing as always , Arians stopped by our table and we had a fun conversation with her ,she is so friendly and welcoming  . we ordered the heirloom tomato pizza (recommended by our waiter I wish I could remember his name he was great , very  informative , funny and very friendly) charred cauliflower and the torched avacodo followed by the flourless chocolate cake and key lime pie ! The food is always so good and I'm always pleasantly surprised , I always try to have something new each visit . my friend and I both have dietary restrictions and finding restaurants we can go to can be very difficult which is one of the reasons I love True kitchen they meet my restricts and the food is always so good . big thank you to Ariana and her wonderful staff , thank you for giving my friend and I such a great experience!

2 salads ordered, and nobody bothered to include the dressing. $30 bucks for chopped veggies. Yay!...However, manager called me to apologize and I certainly appreciate that effort to make things right.
Central location. Loved sitting outside under the heat lamps. Attentive servers that clearly stand behind the vision of the seasonal food the serve. I got lasagna - so good and a treat to find it gf.

We were here on vacation and this was an oasis in the desert. Fresh vegetables, creative flavors, and food for kids that actually had vegetables in it (that shouldn't be a wow, but can be when on vacation!). My wife had fish tacos, the kids the chicken teriyaki bowl, and I had the ancient grain bowl. We also shared the lettuce cup appetizer that had a nice flavor. Overall, a great meal. And on top of that our server, Natalee, was awesome. Super nice and very helpful; she helped make this a 5 star experience! (note for those with kids: if you sit outside there is a great space outside for kids to run. A real plus!).
No other words but AMAZING. -the food -the service  - the menu  - the drinks  -great location

Love the concept, the ethics, the philosophy, the decor...was hoping I'd love the food and service, too.  And luckily, I did!  Awesome, attentive service (Elyse), and simply phenomenal food.  We shared a crudite, edamamme dumplings (outrageous), and the delicious kale salad, and then I had the panang chicken curry over brown rice, which was rich, flavorful, and spicy.  My boyfriend said the cod was incredible, and he's picky about fish.  Dessert was the strawberry-rhubarb crisp (also outrageous), and a super light and refreshing lemon sorbet.  My one gripe was the coffee was lukewarm.  Other than that, the meal was perfection.  I am 7 months pregnant, so I was pleased to see that they offer several non-alcoholic drink concoctions.  I tried two, a cucumber refresher and a ginger-agave soda.  Both fantastic.    Prices are reasonable.  I NEED one of these in Milwaukee!!

Great concept but the service was so slow and unresponsive that it made it hard to enjoy the food. Was surprised to be charged for a mere change in vegetable choice...bad form. Food was good, well seasoned, and nicer portions--not too big, not too small. Very nice outdoor patio area.

I am always judgemental about restaurants located within a mall.  I guess I am leary of it being just so-so.  True Food Kitchen definitely surpassed that!  Great selection of gluten free, vegan, and vegetarian dishes!  Well appointed restaurant, casual but classy. We had the dumplings in hoisin sauce.  Light and flavorful.  The quinoa asian salad had a mix of veggies and super fresh avocados.  We also had the mushrooms on toast.  Great earthy tasted from the mushrooms and well balanced.    Overall a win!

We tried this place for the first time this week after hearing about from several folks...   The lunch was $35 for two with only one drink inclusive of tip and you should not expect gargantuan portions...  What I liked: - Excellent, fresh food served in a healthy fashion - Reasonable portions - Great service even during the lunch rush  We tried the Ahi Sliders - nice wasabi and good crunch, the roasted asparagus - just rights and perfectly seasoned, The "TLT" - good sized sandwich, I recommend it with the avocado, and the Kale Salad - OK but it needed a little more zip  What I did not like:  - Really noisy, I can't recommned this place for a quiet lunch... it is pretty hard to carry on a conversation even when seated side by side

I love this place, and every time I go I'm never disappointed. Last night I reserved the private dinning room for a group of my patients and our health/wellness meet-up group. I had a great time! The private dining room is nice because it's quite enough to have a conversation with the entire table. The downside is that it only holds 12 people.   I had the caramelized onion tart (loved it!), the farmers salad (wonderful spicy sesame dressing!) and the roasted veggies with farro (loved the farro!). And don't forget dessert, - loved the flour-less chocolate cake (dark chocolate with a hint of sweetness)  This place is awesome and everything on the menu is healthy and tasty!!

everything on the menu is fresh and delicious- Prices are reasonable on the brunch/lunch menu, and the egg white burrito is delicious!! I recommend asking for half sweet potato hash and half kale on the side. The kale salad is amazing and does not come with the dish unless you ask.

I can't say enough about this place! The food is always delicious. Great atmosphere. Great service. Today my friend and I split the mushroom pizza and the kale salad. SOOOO good!!! I also had the antioxidant juice which was amazing. Love it.
Today I'm having the hummus as a appetizer and ancient grains bowl it was all good and like always great service

Edamame dumplings---delicious  Caramelized onion tart---good Pan seared sea bass --- I really enjoyed the Brussels sprouts, I didn't really care for the purple potatoes it tasted dry and overcooked, the fish itself was cooked well Almond Olive Oil cake with greek yogurt---the combination of both of the ingredients did not seem to pair well with each other. I think had the almond olive oil cake been topped with anything else it would have been much better.
I was forever waiting at the Apple Store, so I decided to eat here.  Amazing food, great experience!!  Everyone of the employees had a smile on their face.

My husband and I were visiting the area and some friends recommend True Foods knowing my hubby was GF. I wanted to give this place 5 stars but my meal was just okay. John got a spinach lasagna(GF) that was delicious! My red chili shrimp was more like a mediocre pad Thai - similar to what I get at Noodles and Co. Our waiter was awesome and helpful. They have lots of other delicious looking options, as well as some awesome natural beverages. My "medicine man" sparkling tea was pretty tasty. The outdoor seating was heated and comfortable. If you want a beautiful atmosphere and healthy food - this is the place to be.
Good stuff. Great atmosphere. Unique menu with plenty of great options for herbivores or carnivores.
Recently visited here and it was a great experience. Food was amazing and the service was impeccable at very affordable prices. Definitly will be coming back here again!

While I enjoy this restaurant, I just want to bring something to the attention of management. We have been here several times, always enjoying the salad with chicken, dates, cheese, apples, and a champagne vinaigrette. Always quite pleasant, until recently. Both today, as well as our previous visit a few weeks ago, the salad just was not up to par. First, I noticed they used a disproportionate amount of different ingredients, and it's never quite the same on every visit. Even if we both order the same salad, our 2 salads come out quite differently Sometimes you get more apples, and almost no dates, sometimes you get large chunks of cheese, no apples. Sometimes you can barely find the cheese. I think they need to make sure each salad is prepared consistently, with the same amount of chicken, apples, dates, cheese, etc.  It just seems like their focus is on other items, and not on making a quality salad.  You can do better.

I've been a few times and the draw is clearly the quality of the food. Service has been pretty good each time I've been there. They do a great job focusing on the food experience and use excellent ingredients. They homemade ice cream is worth stopping in for just a dessert stop.

Excellent menu, great service and a very healthy product.  Great concept from the FOX family of restaurants!  They seem to execute well with hiring friendly and competent employees that get behind their vision.  I thought the food was delisous!

Table of 4 adults.... Spent $100 bucs and we all left hungry!!!  Super small portions. Sweet potato hash, bland and undercooked. Burger meat tasted good but was small. Tasted more bread than burger!!!  Wouldn't go back, would recommend paradise bakery or jimmy johns, subway over this place!!!

Nice atmosphere. I love the place. It's gets really busy during lunch. Longer waits. Make sure you have more than an hour when you're going to eat at this place. It gets crowded. Good was great though! Def coming back for more.

Stopped in for dinner Sunday night.  This was my first visit to True Food Kitchen.  Wow!  I'm sold.  It took me forever to decide what to order because so many of the items on the menu were appealing.  The beverage menu (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic) was impressive.  Lots of fancy and healthful options.  I ended up with the turkey burger, kale salad and sweet potato hash.   Everything was tasty.  The restaurant draws the trendy, hip-cool crowd.  It was a little loud and had a long wait.  Fortunately, I by-passed that and took a seat at the bar.  I'm so glad I did.  I had the best service I've experienced in a long while.  The bartender who waited on me was AWESOME.  He could teach a class in how it should be done.  I'd return just to tip him again.  Thankfully, I loved my meal too.

Let's hear it for waiter BILL who served FOUR TABLES with courtesy, efficiency and attention!!! There was a mix up on our cocktails and he subtracted the total for them from the bill! Maitre D' Kelly was also excellent/gracious. FOOd??? Absolutely delicious!!!!! A tad noisy, not much atmosphere but do go for the food and service!!!
Great ambiance, severs, food, location. Enough said.  Must try their edaname dumplings and their banana pudding.

This is not a restaurant that I would frequent  often.    While I thought the food was good, the menu is very limiting for me.  I am much more of a meat and potato kind of guy.  We started out with appetizers which were all good.  For the main course, I had the only meat dish on the menu, The beef tacos.  They were very good.  The beans that came with them were outstanding.  My biggest complaint about true is that they do not offer equal/sweet-n-low for your coffee or tee.  They have natural sweetener which is not sweet.  The service was ok, not great.    Finally, if you are a vegetarian and into organic food, this is your place.

I am impressed with this place, love their flavors, you can actually enjoy veggies, makes a difference when using fresh grown & organic. Fox restaurants go all out in decor and Ambiance feels delightful, nothing better than eating and enjoying a space! So worth every $ can't wait to come back, wish they offer a 6-8 shots on their juices so I can try them all...I had the Kale Aid, was amazing! Loved the texture, very smooth & Tasty.  I'm not a fan of black coffee but can I just say Cafe Americano was a home run.... I enjoyed every zip of it. Final our Server Kim was amazingly attentive, she was super pleasant, honest as her shirt said Lol! Fun & easy to engage conversation. Can't wait to come back for more.

Desserts and apps are great. Great servers. The entrees are okay and it can be pricey. I'd go back for: the sauteed onion/fig tart, the almond oil cake and the vegan chocolate pudding. (Alcoholic) drinks are meh.
This is as close as I can get to a "favorite" restaurant.  It's fresh, delightfully flavorful, and the service is above average.  "It's ALL good".

If you're willing to run out for lunch a little early, enjoy the lively patio atmosphere will dining on yummy vittles. A When-Harry-Met-Sally picky eater, I, um, grilled the waiter on seafood's sustainability and ingredient origin, and he was good-natured and knowledgeable. A perfect eatery for a casual date or girls' day out.  Yay!
Decided to come base on reviews. In the area on business. Very very friendly staff. I ordered the summer seafood soup and the hangover elixir drink. Both were good. I'm sure I will be back.

When I fly to AZ for business I immediately go to True Food upon landing. It is hands down my favorite restaurant in the Scottsdale area. The Bison Burger, the chocolate dessert, the hummus, oh my! Maybe my obsession stems from having nothing like it here on the Main Line in PA? I have heard through credible sources that they are opening one up near KOP in 2016. To hold myself over until then, I made sure to go twice when I was in AZ this past December...

I loved the food and the atmosphere!!  I ordered a Teriyaki Quinoa bowl with tofu.  It was so delicious!  The food had the right amount of teriyaki (meaning it wasn't drowning in sauce), with tons of veggies (broccoli, carrot, bokchoy, mushroom, avocado, sesame seeds).  Two others in my party ordered the Ancient Grains bowl, which they also loved.  the fourth person ordered Panang Curry, which she loved because it was definitely spicy.  We sat out on the covered patio, which extremely nice.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  Definitely recommend this restaurant!

Great concept, but menu options were a bit limited for my palate. Need a bit more creativity and variety. Liked the non-alcoholic drink options, but none of the desserts were calling my name. Servers were attentive and friendly, which is a big plus!
Really good juice. Good food. But Minus one star for farm raised steelhead from Scotland! Unacceptable!

I ate dinner at True Food Kitchen in Scottsdale for the first time last night.  We started off with skinny margaritas which was by far one of the best and creative margaritas I've ever had and perfect for a hot Arizona evening. The hummus appetizer was exceptional and when asked, the wait staff brought more pita.  I had the beef tacos which were OK but tended to be a little on the dry side.  The atmosphere was enjoyable and the decor charming.  I will definitely go back.  If I get a more tasty entree, I might just give True Food Kitchen 5 stars.  5/14/13 I recently went back for dinner and am now giving True Food Kitchen five stars.  The meal was fantastic and the cucumber lemonaide drink was out of this world. I want that recipe!

This is a natural junkie's paradise.  Everything fresh, organic, non-gmo & most importantly, TASTY!  A bit on the expensive side but when is healthy food not?  Our server was very knowledgeable and personable.  I wish we had a place like this where we live.

Had a great meal here while on spring break. Excellent menu, including options for some very picky kids. I am not always healthy when eating out, so I thoroughly enjoyed eating well and healthy at the same time.

Great food and service had the vegetable Crudités  Was fabulous filling and Fresh came with two sauces to dip very filling and loved the honey lemonade  So many good healthy choices I will be a regular here... The Staff here is quick to make sure you are satisfied with your dining  experience here if something isn't right they will make it right immediately !

I was in Phoenix for a business trip and avoided going to TFK my first night because it was so crowded.  The second night it wasn't too busy so I went in.  After eating the food, I know why it was so busy the first night.  Great food and a friendly atmosphere.  I eat a gluten-free diet which in most places makes you feel like your selections are limited...not at TFK.  Excellent selection - my only problem was that I was only there for one night and didn't have enough room in my stomach to try all of the things I wanted.  Next time I am in Phoenix, I will be back...and will wait on line if I have to.  (Note:  went to Christopher's on the first night - what a waste.  Should have went to TFK both nights)

Used to be one of my go-to spots, and still is however lately it's gone down hill a little.   The last few times I've been here I've either had really slow service, missing ingredients in my salad because of them running out or floaties in my water.   Food is still for the most part good but please keep this place up! Would be devastated if it continued down this path. Love True Food!
I LIKE THIS PLACE.... nice for ladies lunch but menu begins to bore you if you go very often. Cute design concept. But lacks new excitement. Needs up do & pep talk!
Seriously, BOMBASSFOOD!! Not really much else to say then if you're looking for a yummy/ healthy spot then this is the place...
Always one of my favorites you never did even though I had a bad time at one of the other Fox Concepts  today

Five stars is not enough for True Foods! This place is my FAVORITE restaurant, with a beautiful atmosphere, kind considerate staff who are cautious of food allergies and make True Foods the amazing place it is! I recently celebrated my birthday party yesterday here and our server- Richa did a phenomenal job! She took care of all 16 of us, kept our drinks refilled and was so kind and patient! It's so hard for me to not to eat here for every meal! Thank you True Foods for inspiring me to keep balance in every aspect of my life! Your food makes my soul and belly full and content!

Sweet Potato Hash - Not a sweet potato fan, but thought I would give it a try.  It is very good.  Order it extra crispy and its like little nuggets of goodness.  Kale Salad - Who knew I would like kale?  It was very good.  Bison burger - Excellent.  The sauteed onions are great.  Grilled Shrimp Fresh Roll - Very good, great peanut sauce on the side.  Honey Lemonade - Awesome!  Someone else in the party had the Spaghetti squash casserole and said it was very good.  I've been twice now.  Got there at 11:00 both times and sat right away.  By the time I've left, its standing room only.  So go early.

As a vegan, I've eaten here a few times and my dishes have been hit or miss.  The delicious ones are the Edamame Dumplings (amazing!), Tofu Stir Fry and the Hummus and Pita Plate.  When I ordered the Seasonal Roasted Vegetable plate, all that came out were 3 different types of potatoes and some carrots.    The non-vegan options that my friends and family get are usually amazing and my favorite thing on the menu besides the dumplings is the Vegan Chocolate Pudding.    Also took away one star cuz it's overpriced (lots of upcharges, $5 for a glass of iced tea).

Oy, stop trying so hard.   Cheesy uniforms, design, bathrooms all for some pho-eco wanabe globally conscious restaurant with mediocre food at Scottsdale prices. Nothing other than the wine and Kale salad were memorable. The Bass was really watery with no crispness to the outsides, the tuna special app was really boring and my mom's lasagna was equally unmentionable. All three glasses of wine i had were damn good; the Evolution, DXG, and one other i forget.   Really everything was far over priced and just not worth it.  Our server was however super knowledgeable but a little fawning.  I doubt i would come back save for some wine and a cheap salad otherwise i leave this to the Camelback Corridor housewives on trendy diets and health kicks.   http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/XMMLRvV4IMxIGyc4H37LxA?select=Jxmrw-IXVOHX3WgfL-r0Ng http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/XMMLRvV4IMxIGyc4H37LxA?select=24YjhsAUDhX4Jeh9pEUQzg http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/XMMLRvV4IMxIGyc4H37LxA?select=7SCnxk6-hBOpC_r1oNgo2Q http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/XMMLRvV4IMxIGyc4H37LxA?select=IWd58vjnTO1LbcIeWKuJpA

In Phoenix for the weekend and wanted to try something we don't have in Tucson! First of all, I would not be writing this yelp review if our server wasn't so incredible. We probably asked Rory 40 questions and he knew the answer to every single one. He was super personable and kept us entertained the whole time. We had the herb hummus to start and then we have the moroccan chicken and the brussels sprout and mushroom pizza! And finished with the flourless chocolate cake (10/10) with the vegan ice cream you couldn't even tell was vegan. 100% would go back again, and Rory made the experience for us for sure!

This was a great place for kids! They had a kids' menu and the waiter even made special plates for my niece who wanted vegetables and dip. The waiter was also attentive and realized the kids would need food quickly so he brought over a dish of pita bread. Unfortunately, I didn't love the seasoning/spices of the roasted cauliflower appetizer or my seasonal ingredient salad, which is why this is only a 3 star review. I love the concept of the restaurant though and I'd be interested to go again if I see another location to try a different meal.

I was in town for business with some coworkers and we stumbled upon this place. The menu was super creative and the food was delicious, which is a big win for a healthier food environment. Our waitress was super bubbly and sweet and made it a great experience. For those of you who enjoy a drink with dinner: their red sangria was insane! it was the best sangria i have ever had.  I only wish we had more places like this in new york!

Food was really good.  Based on the waiters recommendation I ordered the kale salad and the spaghetti squash casserole for dinner. I would highly recommend both.  The only negative is how loud it is inside...it made conversations a little challenging.

I have been here several times now. A very healthy place to come to eat. The food is wonderful and very fresh. Nice and modern decor as well. The only down side is it is very expensive i think. But it is in the Biltmore so that ups the price. You can have your car valeted, or park in yourself in the nice cool parking Garage in the back. I opted for that.  It was started by Dr. Andrew Weil and the first time i went there with my friend Kris, he was sitting right next to us at a table.  It is a very nice place to go when you want to have a lovely relaxing lunch and really enjoy yourself.

By now you would think True Food would have their act together for holidays.  Reservation today,  ordered from their fixed menu.  Nearly an hour to get main dishes,  and 25% were wrong or cold.   The wait staff and manager were very responsive and apologetic.  The shit show   seems to be the kitchen.  Come on Sam Fox,  pay attention. Good ideas poorly executed still is a bad customer experience.

Although it is always so crowded, this is one of my favorite places.  Great atmosphere and very friendly staff, I always love my meal.  Sometimes a bit oily but very consistent and amazingly delicious for us picky eaters.  Great for people watching but not pretentious at all.

Great service, menu limited for carnivore types, ginger soda was excellent, the chicken curry was excellent as well. The teriyaki shrimp was not authentic teriyaki and some of the shrimp were undercooked. Mixed results overall. My Filipina wife rated it 2 stars, I rated it 4, hence the 3.

I love True Food! I get the same thing every time, but I always try what others get. I get the bison burger and it's so good. The Parmesan cheese and meat go so well together. You also get the choose of a yummy kale salad or hash! You can't go wrong.

Another Sam Fox creation...Yummy, healthy, with an open-kitchen concept (meaning the staff are chopping veggies on giant counters in the dining room), and a varied menu (from mediterranean salad to spicy asian noodles). The problem with this place is...the price! Non-alcoholic drinks are like $6 each and they come in these narrow glasses full of ice. (I tried the "no ice, please" thing and they just give you less!") For that price there should be a shot or free refills. Also, my fave is the Med. salad and I add chicken which runs me a full $20 and barely fills me up. For a big guy, there is no way that would be enough. Add a drink and it's like $30/person to eat in for a salad and lemonade! So the food is good but too pricey to be sustainable and I rarely go for this reason.

I had lunch here and had the sashimi tuna salad. It was fresh and tasty. I also ordered the miso soup which was actually quite good. Real chopped mushrooms and scallions and it wasn't too salty. It didn't taste like standard powdered miso that you would get at an average japanese restaurant. I also tried the cucumber lemonade which was quite good. Overall the service was attentive and our food came out promptly. My coworker had the seared tuna sliders and sweet potato hash which he looked pleased with. The portions were perfect for what we were in the mood for which was just something really light. It's a great place for lunch, the ambiance is nice especially if you're sitting on the patio. I'm not a huge fan of fusion style restaurants so it gets a 3 star rating out of me, but it's a nice place for a quick healthy meal if you're in the area.

Food was amazing. It is wonderful to enjoy food which you can actually taste the favors, and not have those flavored based on chemicals (as if often the case at many restaurants). I had the quinoa burger and it was best one I've had in my life (although truthfully probably only had 5 in my lifetime). Juice was exquisite and could taste the fresh fruit and vegetables.   Waitress was excellent during our visit. Friend ordered a beer, didn't suit his taste, and she offered to replace it for no cost.   Only downside is the place is busy. I tried to return the next day for lunch and the wait was more than 30 minutes, and we were starving so went to another restaurant.
Even if you aren't vegetarian or vegan, you will love this place! Their food is amazing, and the presentation is incredible : )

Absolutely love TFK! Only problem is their absurd wait times (1-2 hours) if you can't get a reservation (they fill fast on weekends and especially around dinner time). Luckily, the TFK at Scottsdale Quarter is surrounded by many stores to go trough while you wait. The patio is dog friendly but unfortunately dogs have to stay on the ground and can't lay down on the cushioned benches (I suggest bringing a towel or blanket for your dog to lay on if the ground is hot). My waiters and waitresses are always kind and prompt and will offer a water glass for dogs.

Great concept.  Great food!  Wide variety for a variety of dietary preferences or considerations.  OMG...try the Chia Pudding!  I even took an extra one to go!  Outstanding.  I had the spaghetti squash casserole without cheese and it was great.

Buttersquash pizza, spaghetti squash spaghetti, and medicine man teas...we sat outside it was a bit chilly would've loved to have had one of those warmer things by us...our waiter was great...the rest of the menu looked tantalizing and healthy all in all We had fun!

Great food!!! So good that I didn't take any pictures of the meals. We had a large party and multiple dishes all of which were excellent- we had the lettuce cups and the fresh vegetables with Tzatziki and olive dips. Many teriyaki and pad Thai bowls, salmon, pizza, turkey burger, steak tacos and a chicken salad.

Ture food is just so so good. There is nothing quite as great as food that tastes delicious and you feel good after eating. I need to stay away from food that inflame and true food is just the place for that. I love the crudite which is basically just blanched veggies with yummy dipping sauces. It was a little disappointing that the sauces that now come with it are oh so small where as they used to be much bigger. We also had the quinoia bowl with steak and it had some sort of delicious glazed sweet potatoes, and yes I will now crave that and need to drive to phoenix. Overall true food is  very yummy but in all reality is a bit overpriced for what it is but thats expected with sam fox restaurants right? You're mostly paying for the uber hipster staff and trendy environment?!
Always good food and great salads.. Just feel refreshed and healthy after eating here.  You have to love the Chicken Chop Salad

True Food Kitchen uses all those buzz words that reels in the health nuts. Sustainable, gluten free, references Dr Andrew Weil's anti-inflammatory diet,etc. I ordered the chicken chopped salad-$14 and medicine man antioxidant blast drink-$6. The salad was very good and fresh. The drink was ok not worth $6 to me. I guess it was better for than an alcoholic drink.  My husband ordered the sashimi tuna salad -$14. He said it was very good but wanted to stop by and get fast food later. My husband and I got a few laughs from the server and hostess. They kept referencing the Doctor that helped with the menu like we were supposed to know who he was. They were very nice and attentive though. Overall the food was good but overpriced and the portions  were  small. It's a great place if you are vegan, vegaterian or on a strict diet. Don't think we will be back.
Delicious, fresh, and healthy food. I love the atmosphere too! The kids menu is great and the honey lemonade is delicious.

(Here's my disclaimer:  I usually think Fox restaurants are pretty meh...not bad and just good enough.  However, True Food is the exception.)  Ugh, last Sunday was a REAL whammy at work, so I told the woman we were going out for food and drinks and on me.  Thankfully, she picked a place that would have more than one item for me to eat.    Each time we visit True Food we're greeted promptly and by friendly staff. We've never experienced a wait longer than five or ten minutes and the atmosphere is nice and bright, especially considering what I used to be (anyone? Coffee Plantation?? Ugh..that bathroom always reeeeeked! I digress)   Anyway, on this particular stop I ordered the Spontaneous Happiness (a cocktail with St. Germain, lime, and ginger/vanilla infused sochu) and m'lady opted for the Apple Carrot and Ginger tonic  to start.  My bev was silky smooth and went down way too fast.  So, then we ordered a bottle of Moscato. What? I was in the mood for sweet drinks...I'm allowed to be frou frou once in a while.    For our appetizers, we ordered the Shiitake and Tofu Lettuce Cups (tofu, cashews, garlic and a gingery sauce) and the Local Vegetable Crudites (fresh veggies from McClendon's farm that came with tzatziki and olive tapenade...neither of which worked for us, so the server brought it with hummus and a champagne vinaigrette instead!! YUM!).  Then we moved on to the Tuscan Kale salad (kale, lemon vinaigrette, Parmesan, and breadcrumbs) sans cheese.  For entrees (I know, it was a feast) she ordered the Shirataki Noodles, and I ordered another Tuscan Kale....it's that good, peeps.    When dessert time came around, we decided on their chocolate pudding (vegan) that came topped with walnuts and pistachios.    Our server (I can't remember her name and I feel like a jerk about it) was rad, the food was perfect and the drinks were divine!

Kathryn, my girlfriend, loves True Food kitchen and I am a skeptic of anything done by the FOX group especially when it aligns itself to a single philophers idea of eating well, in this case Dr. Weil. I am also a pretty critical person and enjoy critiquing most everything especially eatieries and restaurants.  One issue we have is that we are Vegans and while they do have a number of items listed as Vegan on the menu there are a few things that just seem silly. The first one is that they have no Salads listed as Vegan and the second is that they do not offer Vegan Mayo. The last time we mentioned the Mayo thing our server gave us a reason why they didnt but that we are welcome to bring our own in.  Today has been a fun day so I thought going to True Food would be a good treat for Kathryn and maybe distract me from other events occuring recently. Our server, Chris, has waited on us before and is always very nice. When we mentioned the Soy Mayo thing she offered to go talk to the chef and managers. When she returned the reply was that "at some point we have to draw the line." To which I explained that by offering Vegan/Soy Mayo they would lower costs, increase shelf life, and even start substituting it with real Mayo without anyone noticing. She thought these were valid enough and again went to talk with the chef and managers. To which Kathryn and I exchanged glances and began eating our soup.  To our surprise our next visitor was none other than Michael Stebner the Executive Chef of the restaurant. We began a 10 minute conversation about their philosophy and methodology for creating the menu. He explained that they are not a health food restaurant but rather a restaurant with a health focus. He also pointed out that they are happy to modify anything on the menu to accomodate a number of eating requirements. This was really cool stuff.  He then went further and talked about his history as a chef and what he has seen work and not work from a practical perspective. This was a real conversation and I appreciate his engagement with us both. At no time was he demeaning to us and he never brushed a point of ours off.
