While I disagree with the philosophy of their menu I respect their methodology and see that they are interested in doing something more than just sell as much food as possible.  Overall this was a great experience and while it did not result in everything I wanted I am more than happy to refer anyone to eat here and will be back again!

Vegans - tofu burrito, spring salad no cheese, tofu lettuce cups. Those are my faves  But everything is amazing try it all. I love this place. It's so fresh and dope and everyone who works at every location in the world is so fucking sweet.

Tru Food has yet to disappoint. I frequent this establishment as a place to get good food that leans on the healthy side.  Whenever I visit I have to get the salmon with quinoa and an arugula salad - the quinoa is perhaps the best I have ever had and I always crave it. The salmon is cooked a perfect medium rare and the arugula and beet side dish is a nice light side.  My most recent experience was a date for the wife and I. We got the lettuce wraps, the Asian salad, the chicken tandoori and the salmon. The lettuce wraps and salad were fantastic and I highly recommend both for a light start to a meal. The salmon was superb as usual, and the chicken was a generous portion with good flavor.  As usual, the staff was attentive, respectful and helpful - adding to the dining experience and not taking away from it.   The only downside was the dessert (the chocolate cake) - it was the first time I tried it and may be the last but it was a special treat for the evening.  Thanks Tru Food for another fantastic experience!

First time here, and I'm so happy. My husband put it perfectly "I don't feel bad about what I ate" . We ordered the vegetable crudités, and it was nice for my kids to try new vegetables. Our table had the fish tacos, the chicken chopped salad, and the Mediterranean salad, also margherita pizza, everything was wonderful. Jessica, our server was so helpful. She answered all our questions with a smile. Thank you Jessica!

Gluten free and vegan options are back.   Used to be me and my wife's favorite restaurant because of the kale pizza on gluten free crust. It was a great pizza and was vegan.  They no longer have this pizza or any vegan pizza options. We won't be returning until they again support vegans. Also, the prices are quite high for the quality of food. There are many other great option in the area.

Best sweet potatoes and kale salad I've EVER had! I have been trying to replicate the sweet potatoes at home and just haven't had any luck. Mine taste similar but turn mushy. This place is sort of pricey and the portions are small but we enjoyed it. I went with some friends and everyone seemed to like their food. My friends shared a turkey pita and it looked pretty big. My goat cheese pizza was actually just right. I left satisfied, not hungry, which seems to be a concern with other reviewers. My table ordered roasted veggies to share (which were delish) and I got The Hangover Cure to drink which was tasty as well.   Overall there aren't many complaints. It is sort of loud but a beautiful atmosphere. We did sit on the patio which was quiet and our server was great. Thumbs up from me!

My girlfriend and i thought this place would be amazing, given the amount of people were here but honestly the food was not great. I got the Grass Fed Burger and she got the Spicy Punang Curry. The curry had no flavor and the burger was undercooked. Not pleased with this place at all.
sadly, they took the wild sockeye salmon lox off the menu.. *sniff sniff*  (but the spaghetti squash casserole i tried was a great alternative!)
This place rocks! They have the best food around not to mention the biltmore fashion park is there its very easy to eat then shop!

Really enjoyed my recent experience at Phoenix's True Food Kitchen.  Got the Medicine Man natural refresher which has sea buckthorn, cranberry, pomegranate, blueberry, honey, black tea ($6).  It definitely was really refreshing and was not too sweet, I really liked it.  The Wild Caught Albacore Tataki was delicious, very fresh and light, a great choice on a hot summer night.  For my entree I had the Grilled Fish Tacos which were packed with a generous portion, definitely a very healthy take on fish tacos.  The fish was very meaty and tender.  Got to also taste the Moroccan Half Chicken which was delicious.  Loved the sauce and the chicken was just flavorful and juicy.  The Half Chicken is one of the heartier dishes on the menu and it tasted guilt-free and so tasty.  Would definitely have all of what I had ordered again in the future.

This place has amazing food. I've been here a number of times and still think it's the best place to eat in the Scottsdale Quarter. I usually get the Kale Salad with Chicken which hits the spot or the Turkey Lasagna which has a surprising amount of greens in it (gluten free). If you're looking for something quick try their juice bar (Juby True) on the side. My only complaint about this place is that the wait can be a little long at times since it is so popular. Other than that I highly recommend it as it's casual enough for a quick stop and trendy enough for a great date and drink.

OMG I'm gonna be sick!  Yeah... True, it's a kitchen, but not so sure on the "food" part.  The food was EXTREMELY bland and without flavor and in smallish portions.  Nothing that we had at our table was ever worth going back for.  This was a few months ago when we went, but we won't be going back!

I wanted to give four stars but the service was not good. We've been here many times and had never experienced this. We were sitting on the patio on Sunday at 11 am and it was not crowded at all. It took forever for our server to find us and service us. Getting the check was such a hassle. I have almost forgotten what we ordered because of the poor service. Wait, the charred cauliflower starter was delicious as was the panang curry. The hummus with gluten free pita was delish, as usual. I'd just say, don't be in a hurry if you eat here.
Your chicken sausage pizza is so F***ing delicious. I haven't had the option of buying a lot from you guys but I look forward to it. Keep up the great service and great cooking.

The food was awesome.  Chopped chicken salad with jicama was out of this world. The trout was top notch. The atmosphere was WAY TOO LOUD. Not relaxing at all. Hard to take. But the food and juice were fabo.

Amazing eccentric dishes with gluten free, vegetarian, options! Price is right and will certainly be back.  We were in town for one night, found this restaurant on Yelp with my family of 7, and walked out EXTREMELY satisfied. Will recommend to anyone in Phoenix!!!

I'm sorry, but there's nothing special about this place...except for the ambience. The dishes are small and lack flavor. Just another overpriced, "healthy" restaurant. Was very disappointed in my experience here, and our waiter was not so great. Wish I had nicer things to say.

I love the decor of this place.  It is bright, airy and colorful...a warm welcoming environment.  And the decor matched the staff.  What wonderful customer service!  I was greeted very warmly.  I couldn't decide on a salad due to one of the ingredients it had that I typically don't like.  A second server went to get me a sample of said veggie and it turned out to be really good and fresh tasting!  My bartender explained to me that their produce is shipped fresh locally everyday.  I ordered the Farmer's Market Salad and the Kale-Aid.  The Salad was a little unexpected as the veggies are served tender, but it was tasty.  The Kale Aid was SO good!!!  I'm definitely coming back to dine in and luxuriate!

The food was pretty tasty, though nothing special. I had a salad that I could have gotten at pretty much any contemporary american restaurant. My friend had a sandwich that he declared "high end deli-ish." The appetizers were actually the star of our meal - some kind of seared ahi/sesame concoction and seafood potstickers. They seem to be relying a lot on the organic schtik, which really only works if the raw ingredients are used artfully. In this case I think they are missing the boat. The mock-tails were fun (but a lot of money for no hooch). Added gin to the 2nd one and was much more satisfied. This actually probably would have been a 4 star experience except the service just flat out sucked. Took 10 minutes for someone to bring waters and another 10 for the waiter to show up. I think they must have gotten their sections screwed up or something. Sadly it never really improved. They do get brownie points for seriously sprucing up the old Coffee Plant though. Nice atmosphere and gorgeous patio.

Ok ok what's not like about this place? I'm highly impressed with Andrew Weil's work, and this place seems like an exemplary example of his philosophy. Fresh, organic, local when possible plant centered menu is right up my alley! When we were seated, my daughter immediately read the info/propaganda sheet about the restaurant and squealed with delight because it meshed so well with our philosophy on food..... However, I'm not impressed when young PEOPLE (often called children or worse "kids" in our culture) are disrespected. The hostess put two real menus in front of my 13 year old daughter and me, and then she slapped the "kids menu" on the table in front of my 10 year old son without even really looking at him or asking if we wanted a child's menu. He and I were both insulted immediately. Unfortunately that feeling didn't improve. We normally don't even consider the child's menu because my children have been treated as "people" their entire lives, so they eat real food with real flavor like the rest of us!   Never the less after he slid around the table so he could look at my menu, we did look at both menus because their child's menu actually WASN'T filled with pasta, hot dogs, and chicken strips like most kid menus. It looked like a smaller version of the other menu... almost. For example, apparently children only eat cheese pizza?! Really? Dairy and crust alone with no veggies are anti-inflammatory? That's not what my research shows. How does one expect to start people on a healthy path of eating if we don't start right away. Shall we stick with the old "four food groups" concept when we are young and then magically develop a taste for vegetables once we're old enough to understand how healthy they are? That makes no sense! It's just stupid.... On that particular day, however my son had a cold and didn't have his normal appetite, so smaller portions of regular food was appealing to us. When the waiter arrived I asked about their "kids"menu. Shaun was nice enough --in an aloof and subtly condescending way. Just for the record I look like the old punk rocker that I am, but don't judge a person by his appearance these days. You don't know my income level or food/health knowledge and experience. You might be surprised. Anyway back to the menu! So I asked Shaun, "what about your child menu, is it bland and tasteless like most?" I told him we had raised our children eating the same food we eat, the same food your establishment is pushing, and he assured me that wasn't the case here. These were just smaller portions.    Onward to the show!! --The food. I started with a root and remedy drink and my daughter ordered the kale aid. Both were very good except for the typical over abundance of ice. I wish they had asked if we wanted ice, so we could have made our own choice, but like the kid menu, assumptions were the rule of the day not choice. We all shared the Tuscan kale salad and it was the highlight of the meal. Although vegans beware it is covered in cheese. The salad was fresh and had lots of garlic. I highly recommend it. For my main dish, I ordered the shrimp chili which cost extra to be gluten free. Why? I don't know. It's well documented that the hazards of gluten to the human intestinal wall lining are a likely suspect in inflammation. Seems like a no brainier for rice noodles to be standard. That being said, the chili was excellent. It was well spiced and had lots of fresh veggies. My daughter ordered the spaghetti squash and it was also good. As for my son, it was not his day.... insult followed insult! He ordered a chicken breast, peas and rice. His dish arrived early, so he was out of sinc with our meal. Furthermore, his food was bland and luke warm at best. Just as I feared, the assumption seems to be that young people, aka "kids," can't take flavors so it better be plain. Yuck! We were in sensory heaven, and he got cold, bland chicken. He ate two bites of chicken and half the peas and rice which were also cold. He and I felt as if he was being treated as a second class person the entire time we were there. As for the dessert choices.... Blah! There are so many wonderfully good dairy free and even raw desserts that everybody likes and can eat. The only desserts here that we're gluten free and vegan were chia pudding and scoops of ice cream. Uhh coconut? and nut crusts? Why be so limited? We skipped dessert!   I may try the Scottsdale location because I want options that are of this quality, but we won't be back here. I wish we had just gone down the road to the Whole Foods which has a fantastic food selection! ...... Ahhhh but that's another review.

This place is about four minutes from my house, every time I go there it's super busy but they work hard to get everybody seated, usually I can find a seat at the bar. But the reason so busy is because they have great staff great food and everyone that works there seems to be super happy and loves their job!  Also nice cocktails.

I love 'em. The steelhead salmon A-mazing. Sometimes I just go for their tuna appetizer... so fresh and yummy. I live near the Biltmore to it's fast and close. Oh! And speaking of fast... you a=order and 5 mins later, you get you dish. Love the presentation of the food as well. Go! They're great!

Still delicious as ever! The server was awesome, I wish I got her name! I had the red chili shrimp this time and once again, did not disappoint. I also tried some turkey lasagna that my dad ordered, and that was delicious as well. This restaurant is very consistent - great service and great food!
Excellent food that is prepared and served in a clean and healthy environment, Ask the staff about what food is good and they will help you find their best entrees!

I have been to True Food Kitchen twice. The ambiance is great. I love the little push carts of fresh herbs as you walk through the door. The smell of rosemary is intoxicating. The kitchen is open and so it can make for it being a little noisy. But nothing that is unbearable. You do get to see the staff handling the gorgeous fresh foods.  So a must have for me is the Cucumber Refresher drink. It is exactly what is states...refreshing. I tend to share a bit with my friends and both times they really like my drink. So much so the first time I gave my drink to my friend and I had her ginger drink that was OK. The first time I was there I ordered the Roasted Autumn Vegetables with Farro and Figs. It was alright nothing to write home about. The farro was great. Last week I had the Edamame Dumplings for an appetizer and the Miso Glazed Black Cod for an entree. These two dishes were right on.  I was scoping out the Cod on my first outing but did not get it. Go with your first instinct. The sauces on these dishes were amazing. They were light and flavorful. Both times my friends ordered the Teriayki Brown Rice/Veggie/Meat. Don't waste your time on this dish as you can get something very similar at Pei Wei or any other Asian place.   All in all I like True Food. They offer something different in a great location. They have good food and good service. I do have to say in the realm of restaurants that are going this route I would rather go to a smaller local place. It's just a choice I guess. But it is just something about the little places that is more exciting than a chain. I guess it is the feeling or intent in the preparation of the food.

My dinner was the size of a small tapas plate. Spaghetti squash casserole, you are considered an entree here but should be a $5 side. To me the food here is mediocre, small portioned, and lacking taste. You can cook healthy and still have food taste great. Each time we come here is a letdown, so I think we have had our last meal at TFK.

My only complaint about this place is the noise level.  It is difficult to have a conversation.  The food is wonderful.  We said we would share a salad to start and they brought it already split, with both of us getting quite a large amount.  I ordered the bison burger with all of the fixings on the side.  It was recommended medium and it was perfectly cooked.  The sweet potato hash made it impossible to finish the whole burger. We had a 25% off coupon only good for the 4th of July.  Fox concepts sends them for most holidays when you sign up for their email...will try there new seafood Ola e on the next one!
Went for dinner last night and while the food was very good, the service was rushed and attention to detail was definitely lacking. Didn't live up to my expectation.

I am not a huge organic guy, nor do I have any dietary restrictions. So maybe I am not True Food's target audience. With that said, I have had organic and gluten-free fare that has been very tasty. Unfortunately, I cannot say the same about the food at TF. The dishes we ordered (chili shrimp and fish tacos) were bland and unimaginative. The setting inside was sleek and the open kitchen idea is novel. The service was slow and forgettable. And since it is organic and fresh ingredients, the prices are a bit higher. I would not refuse to go back to TF, but I certainly would not recommend it.

Simply outstanding.  Everything about this concept works.  The minute you walk in the door you instantly feel healthier.  From the apparel of the waitstaff to the food prep servers working out in the open, everything exudes fresh, inviting, warm, and good for you.  The elixirs are not to be missed.  Dig honeydew?  Then get the Hangover.  Jonesing for Cucumber?  Get the cucumber drink.  I opted for the Mediterranean chopped salad with grilled salmon.  What is not listed on the menu is you can order a 1/2 portion of anything on the menu (except a burger or the pizza).  So, I ordered a half portion of the salad.  Dee-licious.  My friend got the Tuscan Kale salad and it was fantastic.  We shared the herb hummus and my goodness, best hummus I've ever had.  Service was great.  Arrive early!  We got there at 11am for lunch and by 11:45am the place was packed with a line out the door!  The best part?  You can find the recipe for the Kale salad and the hummus on Dr. Weil's web site!  Love it.  Love it.  Love it.

I chose this restaurant because it has a reasonable number of vegan options, and it was within easy walking distance from the hotel where I was staying.  I chose the teriyaki quinoa bowl for dinner and a vegan "flan" with berries for dessert. Both dishes were absolutely delicious! And I felt like I was eating real food, and getting real nutrition. The price is a little more than what I normally pay, but the quality of the food made it acceptable.  The only thing that would make this restaurant better in my eyes is if it was 100% vegan.  But I would definitely eat there again.

Good portions of healthy options.  There's a lot of good food in Arizona, but there's only a limit as to how much one can indulge in enormous, hearty meals. This place is a good change of pace. Definitely felt refreshed rather than lethargic after having some healthy food here.  Kale Quacamole ($10) Big, crispy, and thin pita chips with a refreshing blend of quac.  Seasonal Ingredient Salad ($14 w/o add-ons) The roasted brussels sprouts and butternut squash had a good bite to them, added with some cauliflowers, and flavored with a citrous-flavored vinaigrette. Even without the extra protein, this was enough to fill me up for lunch.  Hangover Rx ($5): While this drink was refreshing, I wish I could taste more of the coconut water..  Overall, refreshing food and drinks.

I was excited to see a True Food here since I love the one in Fashion Valley as well. I had dinner with some vegetarian friends and this place was the perfect choice. Their green juice is great and we shared the hummus to start and I had the teriyaki rice bowl with tofu.  The food isn't amazing but is pretty good, and I love the selection of healthy dishes.

The two words I would use to describe the food at True Food Kitchen would be FRESH and FLAVORFUL! I probably will never be able to enjoy a vegetable from Safeway again after the amazing produce from True Food!   I don't even especially like veggies and the crudite plate was amazing.  I could go on and on about every dish, dessert, and drink that we ordered.  The staff was incredibly accommodating and knowledgeable.    The ambiance, service, and food make it a great place for a fun lunch with girl friends or a lunch meeting.

Nice to have a restaurant in the 'hood that's dedicated to serving locally sourced, seasonal, and healthy produce. But! Most of what I've tried is just eh--kinda bland. Healthy can be tasty and this place can be hit or miss. Props for converting me over to kale doe!

Wow!  Vegetables are good for you!!!!  Raw ones not soaked in oil or boiled to mush!!! Do you like lululemon and telling people just how invigorating Bikram is ?than this is the place for you!   Yes lululemon is just a big corporate company now but you remember when they were new.  As far as pretentious goes, this place has got it down perfectly....you'd never even realize you were just served part of a produce aisle on a tres chic bamboo plate if you could tear your eyes off of how incredibly clever the other diners are.   You can go home feeling fresh and clean after lunch here.  The silliest interpretation of dining I've ever seen.  Seriously, just buy some carrot sticks and eat them in the park, except no one will notice and that is half the point.

The service here is terrible...called in to make reservations and was told they do not accept reservations. So I came to the restaurant in person to put my name on the list only to find it less than half full. I asked why I could not be seated at any of the 35 open tables and was told that they were reserved. When I explained that I was told they do not take reservations, an ogre like manager came over and rudely explained that they accept reservations online and that she would be happy to seat us in 1 hour and 15 minutes and that it was a mistake on their part to deny my reservations but that's just the way it is and I would have to deal with it.

I'm back :) How many updates am I going to write? Well, it depends on how many times I visit. I spent another evening at True Foods last night with a group of friends.   The service was just a hint slow but what do you expect with a big group? The food was good, everyone at the table mentioned several times how happy they were with their entree choice.   My boyfriend and I ordered our own dishes and then split so we could try two of the entrees. I got the steak tacos and he got the chicken. Both were really good.   What we didn't realize was that True Food actually allows you to order half portions for half price. We could have tried 4 different menu items had we known this. Oh well, next time... and there will be a next time!!!
First time here. Many choices for those looking for a very healthy meal. I had a Wonderful salad but my beer was warm. When it is 110 degrees outside beer should not be served warm!

We came here because it had a dog-friendly patio and we had dogs with us.   We got the curry with quinoa, guacamole, and the veggies and dip. Overall, I wasn't wowed by anything, and I'm always of fan of eating healthy and yummy! While the veggies were fresh and crisp, the hummus dip was just ok. The quinoa has a pretty good kick to it, and, for me, it was verging on a little too spicy. The guacamole didn't seem like guacamole because it had grapefruit and (I believe) kale. It was interesting...not sure good or bad, ha.

There's a reason why my trips home from Seattle always end up starting here :) Great food that changes seasonally and awesome ambiance! Service is always excellent - it's a bit of a minor detail, but having water attentively refilled is so wonderful, especially during the summer!!
The bombest food ever. Always blows my mind. And Seth is the bestttttttt. Will return on the reg just to see his sexy face

I've been here several times and it's amazing every time I go. The vegetables are fresh and crunchy - and the dishes are super tasty! I can't wait to go back. My favorite is the shrimp noodle dish; one of their specialties.
Grilled Chicken salad w/medjool date, dried cranberry, jicama, apple, manchego, farro, marcona almonds,and champagne vinaigrette...Spectacular!  FYI:  For lunch, arrive early during tourist season.

Came here on a Sunday and it was jam packed but luckily there was room at the bar. Sit there if you don't mind the Sunday brunchers standing close next to you as you eat. I ordered the grass fed burger and it was cooked nicely, tasty and the portion was just right, not too much and not too little. Great ambiance, very clean/maintained and good service at the bar. If you have more time, sit outside on the patio and enjoy the people watching, it's beautiful people everywhere.

I came away from my meal (complete with cocktail + dessert) with no guilt. Local, fresh, tasty and healthy cuisine here. For the first round, order the fig tart! I'm a sucker for ahi sashimi and this salad had some homemade pickles that were just out of this world. I didn't miss the fact that there was no dressing on the salad. Almond Olive Oil Cake made me curious, and while it was tasty, I will be getting the Lemon Tart next time!

I had dinner here with friends last Friday.   Aside from being a bit hot outside, the experience was a pleasant one.  The staff and manager - Andrea - are extremely helpful and make you feel like a VIP.  *I LOVE the kale salad* - amazing!  Starters we had the edamame dumplings and the smoked salmon - delish!  I had the halibut - it was a touch dry and not my favorite.  Surprising - because halibut is typically my "go to."   However, after tasting my boyfriend's Miso Glazed Black Cod - my palette was pleased!  I will definitely go back for that dish!  Actually - going there for lunch today to get my kale salad!

Ate dinner there on a Saturday night.  Came right from the gym and workout clothes were completely acceptable attire.  Food was fresh and service was good.  Portions worked for me but for the guy with me, the trout dish was a bit too small.  Main problem was the noise level - I like the industrial look but I also like to have a conversation.  We sat at a communal table.  At first we were across from each other.   We had to change seats so we were next to each other and wouldn't need to shout.  Probably the outdoor seating would be better.   The server had asked if I wanted a glass for my beer or would I prefer to drink it from the bottle.  Tried the glass, but the shape just wouldn't let the beer be poured without getting a lot of foam.  Even the server couldn't pour it without the foam.  For a more positive experience, sit outside, drink beer from the bottle, and if small portions aren't for you, order something filling like lasagne.

If you like sub marginal food-True Food is the place to eat. I had the summer salad-I've tasted better salads at an airport concession stand. My husband had the halibut-chewy and dull tasting. My daughter was the only one that enjoyed her steak tacos-tasted the exact same at Blanco's.  Service was great but sitting on the patio was fine till the misters turned off. The temp.outside was a mere 100.  I would never recommend this restaurant, many great restaurants nearby.

This is my favorite restaurant! I always order the mediterranean chopped salad. I recently stopped adding the grilled chicken to it because I found it way too expensive. It's $11 for the salad but an additional $5.50 for the chicken on top. That's close to $17 and in my opinion that is too much for a salad. I will say though, it tastes just as good and is just as filling without the chicken.  A must here is the kale avocado dip appetizer. The homemade chips are amazing! I always have to ask for more chips because they only serve it with a couple of pieces. They never charge us extra when we ask for more though. There is huge chunks of grape fruit in the dip! So unexpected but insanely good!  Bf usually gets the street tacos or bison burger. He loves them.  The view from this location cant be beat! Love the palms at the Scottsdale Quarter. Make sure to sit outside :)
Food is good.  Service is pretty good.  Its a restaurant that definitely reminds you of LA, as it is very loud in there.  Definitely will go back.

My favorite fox restaurant. Had the edamame dumplings and red chili shrimp. Brother had the miso soup (a little salty for my taste) and turkey lasagna. The turkey lasagna was good but wouldn't be something i would get here but it's good. The red chili shrimp is the best noodle and shrimp in town with flavors that balance the whole dish! Yum.

Absolutely loved it! From their fresh cocktails to their food. I got the ancient bowl grain with tofu. It was really filling for me and very tasteful. My friend got the turkey burger with kale salad- both very tasty! I will be back indubitably.
Loving the new Spring menu.  The new seasonal ingredients salad is a great blend of flavors.  The poke bowl is a loaded with fresh, light ingredients with just a hint of umami to balance the flavors.

True Food Kitchen provides proof that food-loving people can have a delicious meal that is also healthy. I've been to the Scottdsale Quarter and Biltmore locations. I prefer the restaurant at the Quarter because it has a much better design for "bringing the outside in". It's an open plan with plenty of patio seating.  As far as the food? I have several recommendations. The crudite appetizer is stunning. Raw veggies never looked so appealing. You get a huge bowl of beautiful vegetables along with two tasty dips. This appetizer is on my "get every time you come here" list.  Main courses provide a pretty good range, although folks that avoid most/all carbs are more limited. I like the bison burger, although I've only had it served on large leaf lettuce, not the bun. The spaghetti squash casserole is directly from Dr. Weil's healthy cook book. It's delicious, but it's also very easy to do at home. They do a reasonably good job with their fish dishes, although this isn't the first place I'd come if I was craving fish.  I've never had issues with service at either location. Even during the most crowded times, the staff and management have always worked hard to ensure a pleasant meal.   Here's the upshot: if you are eating healthily and want to try something different, this is a great place to visit. It's not cheap, but it certainly provides inspiration for creating healthy lifestyle choices at home.
Truly delicious, lightweight but high flavor, and well-priced food!  Try to go every day that I'm in town. Absolutely delicious!

I was recommended Truefoods by a foodie friend of mine and decided to finally try it Sunday for brunch. I went along with another friend who likes to eat just as much as I. We were seated outside as requested in no more than 5 minutes at a 4-top, which is always a pleasant surprise. I started off with a Moscow mule. The waiter came back out and said they did not have ginger beer and said he could recreate it with fresh ginger and such. It was even better than expected. We split 3 entrees: spaghetti squash casserole, mushroom flatbread and shaved turkey. Everything was excellent. They even split the entrees up for us. Highly recommend coming here if you like good service and good eats.
While the concept of this establishment maybe a bit trendy, the execution is classic in every way. From the service to the food to the atmosphere, it is a restaurant that I truly enjoy being at...

Used to really like this place and you cannot beat the atmosphere but last night was a bust. I was meeting a friend who had never been before and was so excited to go. I sat at the bar waiting for her and wanted to order a drink and appetizer. The bar tender was so beyond rude. When she finally greeted me after 5 minutes of talking with her friends while I was sitting there I could barely get out my drink order before she flew off. Even the lady next to me was like "wow really" when she finally came back with my drink I literally had to speak up just to order an appetizer.  When my friend got there she asked for a drink menu the bartender just replied "you have it right there" I flipped the menu over to show her.  Dinner was ok once we got out of the bar and our server was great. My chicken was over cooked and had a lot of fatty skin. I took about 5 bites because I was starving and was done.  Little disappointed but hopefully the menu changes up and you get someone nice behind the bar so

I've traveled to Phoenix several times for business trips and stayed at the Ritz. True Foods was my go to spot in Phoenix because it was right across the street from the hotel. I love this restaurant for the casual vibe and healthy food. My favorite dishes are the Edamame Dumplings and the Miso Glazed Black Cod. It was often hard to get out of work for lunch, so coming to True Foods at the end of the day was always a treat.   I only wish they had one in San Francisco!

True Food has an interesting concept of including a "superfood" with every dish. I ordered a Penang curry, and I guess the superfood in it was coconut milk? I'm not sure. It comes with three protein choices: chicken, shrimp and tofu. I chose tofu, and was expectantly awaiting my side of brown rice only to see it nowhere in sight when the food arrived. Alas, the brown rice was drowning at the bottom of the bowl, soggy and soaked in curry sauce. That was really disappointing for me, because the idea of rice is so that you can modulate how salty you want each mouthful to be, but because every grain of rice was drenched in milky, creamy curry, that proved to be impossible. The taste is decent, although not quite spicy enough for my tastes, but if you ever order this, be sure to request for your rice on the side. I also ordered some shrimp dumplings, which was probably overcooked as the dumpling skin was gelatinous and gluey.  Service was bright and chirpy, but I guess coming from NYC, everyone else will seem angelic in comparison.
Wonderful place full of positive energy.  Never a bad meal here.   Scottsdale Quarter location  very busy but worth the wait.
Great food always.  I sometimes order with post net home dilevery.  I like the chili shrimp and hummus plate,   The dark chocolate flourless cake is supper rich for someone who craves dark chocolate.

Both times I ordered the yellow curry chicken. Both times it was great! It is a bit soupy, so I ask for extra brown rice to mix in. I have not ordered the specialty drinks yet, but likely will try one out since they look very refreshing and healthy.

My favorite restaurant... Kale salad, chicken sausage pizza (gluten free crust is amazing), curry, shiratake mushroom dish- yum yum yum! The natural cold to drink... Half order of most apps- amazing!!

This is a location specific review.  I've attempted to come to this location a couple occasions.  I live closer to the Biltmore location and love it.  The atmosphere and food is great.  So, I was happy that there is a location near my in laws (it's always exciting to be able to eat healthy and enjoy their company).  We went for father's day, it wasn't all that impressive and the service was pretty lackluster, but my meal was good.  I went again with my MIL a few weeks ago for a late lunch.  The place was swarming and our electronic notifier never went off.  We waited for about half an hour before I went in and asked if we were ever going to be seated.  And then I got attitude.  And the service was SO SLOW.  It wasn't particularly happy, friendly, or polite.  There is a vibe at this location and I don't like it.  I'll keep my Biltmore location thank you very much.  And will not be going back to this TFK again.  It's a waste of time and money.

I AM GOING TO EXCLAIM THIS IN CAPITAL LETTERS BECAUSE IT IS SIMPLY A TRUTH THAT ALL OF HUMANKIND SHOULD BE AWARE OF!! Fox Restaurant Concepts are PERFECT. Now, you should know, I don't say this about many places... Or people, or things.. But when it comes to Fox, one cannot go wrong.   True Food is just one of the many Fox Valley restaurants I completely adore. Craving Italian? Head to North Fattoria Italiana in Arcadia. Need your pizza fix at work? Sauce is definitely the place to be. Truffle fries and fine dining with a modern twist? Olive and Ivy. Super cool comfort food that will fill you up and make you want to frequent Downtown Phoenix.. every night? Arrogant Butcher. Gosh darn it, even the names of these hotspots are uber cool!  Sam Fox is simply a genius. His concepts are flawless, food is impeccable and staff? CONSISTENTLY the best service I ever receive at any establishment. Shout out to Brock and the accommodating/super-friendly staff who took care of me tonight at True Food @ the Quarter! I will be back... A lot.  What can I say Fox? You have stolen my heart.... And all the doggy-bag space in my refrigerator.  Thank you for the excellence. I refer you to everyone I know, and the keen attention-to-detail NEVER goes unappreciated...  FOX ON!

We were visiting the Phoenix area in May, and my daughter took us to this restaurant. I loved the kale and avocado dip, and I let the server talk me into a drink, the Natural. Great food, and a shout out to the server for remaining professional in spite of my rolling my eyes every time she and my husband discussed turkey meatballs!

Kale. Turkey Burger. Sweet Potatoes. Need I say more? I'm in love with this place. Awesome location, awesome food... the staff is extremely friendly and so is the management. I'm already planning my next trip back!
If it weren't for the higher-than-they-should-be prices, the food is great. The kale is out of this world. If True Food has done anything, it has encouraged me to cook and eat at home more :)

In the past when we have eaten at the True Food Kitchen Phoenix location we have not noticed the negligence that we experienced this time at the Scottsdale Quarter True Food Kitchen. Many dissatisfactions at this Thursday night dinner hour.  It started out poor from the start. We asked how long the wait would be & the young, chaotic staff said 15 - 20 minutes - nope, it was a 45 minute wait - quite an inaccurate estimate. Once they texted us to tell us the table was ready, we waited another 5 minutes while the confused staff decided where we were going. Felt very disorganized - not cohesive. Maybe it was that the staff were all so young, but it seemed very chaotic at every interaction, like when we ordered the soup (it was a squash soup that night) and I had communicated I had special needs that night but received a spicy squash soup, which two of us returned not expecting this. Any question we asked, was answered with somewhat of an "attitude of too much trouble" -  the best way I can describe the server. It seemed like the staff didn't have proper training on how to interact with customers. Restaurant staff need to know how to cope with the busyness of a restaurant and not be acting hurried and rushed. Not welcoming. The best thing at our table turned out to be the mushroom pizza, ordered GF. But, when we got the bill there was not an extra $2.50 charge for the GF so we assumed that they had gotten that part of the order wrong too. If it had been someone who had severe allergies to gluten there could have been serious consequences. The best part of the evening was when we asked a bus boy where the bathroom was (outside and around a corner) and he  took the time to walk us out the door and point us in the right direction. Have no desire to support or frequent this location.

I must say....my favorite Sam Fox Concept by far!!!  Plus I'm an Andrew Weil, MD loyalist....have to mention two amazing stars on our Sunday brunch visit....Katharina and Amber. Keep being real...just like your amazing food!  Your smiles and warmth are a refreshing welcome in this self absorbed world!!!!  Kudos to you both and keep shining!
Open kitchen, organic and local food, amazing drinks (I recommend "spontaneous happiness") & friendly staff. Sold!

text.text: Who doesn't love this place? Fantastic healthy food, great service, happy to customize menu offerings. And I love their fresh cocktails made with real juices and no fake stuff. Great for kids too. Expect a wait because it's always busy!

First off we walk in and there are open tables everywhere but unfortunately for the young blond hostess the tables outside were dirty. Now it was a nice night out on a Friday and I felt like sitting outside which I requested. The hostess then scoffed, gave me a dirty look, and repeated that there where tables available inside and if we sat outside she would have to clean it first. We eventually got to sit outside...with an attitude. We apparently must have upset someone because we were neglected for about 15 minutes even though at that time the restaurant wasn't busy. When we did get service it to was with an attitude but the food was awesome. The edamame dumplings were seriously incredible. Now here is where it gets really bad...we gave a card to pay and when we received our receipt back the receipt read $54.00 but the copy we were to sign was charging us $68.00. Keep in mind we were a party of just 2 so the gratuity shouldn't have been added in.  When we pointed out the error no one seemed surprised or particular concerned that we were over charged. They corrected the issue but were so nonchalant about it that we walked away feeling like this was possibly a scam that the staff often tries to run that we were lucky enough to avoid. The moral of this review is to warn you to review your receipts carefully and if you don't want to wait on people you should get out of the service industry.

This place makes you feel good about what you eat. Everything is so creative and innovative. They have an ever changing menu. I have been going here for years, and over the seasons my favorite dishes have been the butternut squash pizza, the quinoa burger, yellowtail with ponzu, edamame dumplings.

The waiters are wonderful! Usually it's busy so try to call ahead and see if a reservation is available. Usually there is bar seating open. The honey lemonade was perfect. Just the right amount of honey and right amount of lemon. The best thing on the menu is the bison burger. It was cooked perfect and the sauce is delicious! I couldn't be more impressed with this place which is why I constantly come back!

We eat here often.  I love the menu and portion sizes are, in my opinion, perfect.  The fish dishes are always good, and I dream about the hummus.  I'm also a huge fan of the spaghetti squash, which is hard to find anywhere else.  The skinny margarita makes the meal complete.

True Food is awesome. It's great to find a place that has really good HEALTHY food!! Have been here on many,many occasions and it's always been a great experience. The shrimp and goat cheese pizza is a favorite but I've really liked everything I've had here with one exception...the butternut squash ravioli, I could do without this dish. Service is friendly and helpful and I dig the patio when it's cool enough to sit outside. Sam Fox seems to know how to do it up right. Thumbs up!
Definitely coming back.  Bison burger was lip smacking good, as well as the edamame dumplings.  Deeeeeelishhhhh

I really enjoy their food. It's always fresh and made from scratch. Salads are amazing. You can never get bored with their menu because they change it every season. In addition, their sparkling soda is so refreshing.

Loved the Kale salad. Kale is popular where I am from, but the person I brought along was staring at the dish, initially. When she ate it, she actually liked it. Love the presentation. Had a great sandwich as well, good  enough to share. Nice location as well

Delicious food. You can taste the freshness! I've tried something new every time and loved every single thing! Their drinks are refreshing options also! Downside is the price, fairly expensive! Great food though.

Finally getting around to reviewing this gem. Overall, excellent food and excellent service. I'm really big on eating healthy and this place has healthy foods that taste absolutely delicious. (Please try the bison burger). The reason I gave 4 stars and not 5 is because on one occasion the red chile shrimp came out missing an ingredient and tasted bad, although, it was taken off the bill. Secondly, I strolled in after the gym for a lunch time meal and they shut down food production for a kitchen malfunction. But in the scheme of things, I love true foods and its concept. They have really nailed delicious healthy food on the head and even my boyfriend who is a meat and potato kind of guy loves coming here anytime.
Chicken Curry was great. Service was great. Highly recommend the Kale salad that they serve.

Entrees are tasty. I love the PANANG CURRY curry most but you need to ask for extra curry to make it perfect. Then the SPAGHETTI SQUASH CASSEROLE is great (careful they will try to lure you into adding chicken/protein that will be another $6 dollars added to it).  The drinks are suppose to be good but to me they are rip offs (yes. Half of the cup are ice so you are paying half cup of juice not full cup). When ordering starters,  make sure you ask about the quantity we had 4 people and order the 9 dollars ADAMAME dumpling and it was only 3 small miserable pieces and it taste just average (it was a rip off for $3 dollars each). I don't mind paying premium but this establishment feels like they are trying to rip you off in every possible way.
Excellent food and great service. I had the goat cheese beet salad with steelhead salmon. Best sparkling tea ever. Yum! Perfect place to eat while you are shopping in the area.

Hands down my favorite place to eat! Amazing healthy food and great drinks! My Favorite part was the fact that they have organic liquor! It was awesome. I would recommend this place to anyone! Family friendly but also fun to go out with friends!
My wife and I stopped here for salads since we were at the Mall where this is located. Both of our salads were delicious and the service was excellent. Recommended.  Nice patio dining as well.
My wife ordered fish tocos and they made her sick not the first time we ate here but the first bad meal here

I am by no means a vegetarian.  I like meat, cheese, and all around unhealthy stuff to eat.  With that in mind, I really enjoyed what I ate here, for breakfast.   My husband and I were hungry on a Saturday morning, and desperate to get away from the house. Naturally, we went to the Quarter. Naturally.   I take one look at the menu, and I almost run out the door screaming. Not my cup of tea.  But I decide to try something new for a change, and suck it up, choose a greek frittata. (A frittata is an open faced omelette) It had kalamata olives, feta, zucchini and tomatoes. It was awesome.   Unfortunately, that was the ONLY thing on the menu that I would eat. So unless I get a craving for a healthy breakfast again, I probably won't go back.  Perfect for health-conscience, hippie type people.  I'm from the mid-west. :)

Food is great. Cocktails are delicious. The only downside is the cost of the restaurant. The portions are rather small for the price however the food quality is superb and you can always count on fresh and organic choices.

I've only been here once and I HAVE to write a review. I'm so pleased with this establishment I'm still sitting at the table of the restraint writing about how amazing it is. Though it's "expensive" it's very reasonable. If you're feeling the need for healthy fresh, and good food... THIS IS THE PLACE!  (The waiters are also friendly and helpful.)

I like that True Food is dependable. I've enjoyed everything I've tried here, and the service is great from the door. Stacey was our server last night, and was very helpful in suggesting things she liked and aided in our decisions for dinner. She was sincere and attentive, and not awkwardly crowding the table or trying to up sell us the whole night.  I love this Scottsdale Quarter location, with H&M right across the way it makes any wait for a table go by a lot faster. :) I'll definitely be back.

Hey all my Az peeps True Foods  has something for everyone . True foods won't disappoint with their organic fresh ingredients and bursting flavors in every bite your you sure to get a delight . Service great , prices affordable , atmosphere quant . Don't take my word for it experience it for yourself !

Let me start out by saying I wanted to rate this restaurant 2.5 stars, but because that isn't an option, I am boosting it up to a 3 because my Husband said so (LOL). Here's the thing, the food is WAY overpriced for what you get and it isn't even extraordinary. Personally, I don't mind paying more if the food really blows me away, but after my second experience at True Food, I have come to the conclusion that the food isn't that special.   The fact of the matter is, I didn't even pay for my meals the two times I came here, we were with family that paid. At the end of the meal I kinda felt bad for the price tag my family was paying. Honestly, I like the concept. I try to eat healthy, and when you have to go out to dinner it can be hard sometimes, but eating healthy doesn't mean eating NOTHING. Last night I had the pan seared halibut and left just as hungry as I arrived. Don't get me wrong it was ok, but not $24 good. The hummus appetizer was very delicious, but nothing more than most humus's I've had at other cheaper restaurants. My Husband had the shrimp and noodle bowl and loved the broth and shrimp, but hated pretty much everything else in the bowl. All in all, I don't think I will be back, even though the service was good, the food portions were way too small for the high price tag. Just my two cents (and I will save those two cents for another restaurant)!

In the nice new Scottsdale Quarter rests True Food Kitchen, which is part of a larger chain of restaurants. The concept is pretty cool; fresh, natural ingredients, open layout and unique menu options. The food was good, the dessert was good, but the service was slow and overly "ooo...look at me, I'm cool". Doesn't make any sense? Take a seat and you'll see what I mean.  Although the food is pretty delicious, True Food is on the border of being a bit pretentious with all the "natural" ingredients and what not. I've seen this type of food done much better at a lower price which much less snootiness. So, if you are OK with a bunch of snoot, then True Food is your place to go. Otherwise, stay with a non-chain restaurant.

KALE. KALE. KALE. who knew it could be so delicious? Had it in my salad and on my pizza. I love wood-fired pizza!  The spicy edamame was a nice way to start our meal. My girlfriend and I were STARVING after waiting 30 minutes for a table. We scarfed it down in minutes. Then we decided to just eat at the bar.   The martinis are SO fresh & creative. (but expensive!)   The kitchen is open so you can see your food being prepared.  No complaints about service.

The fresh albacore tuna salad has seasonal fresh veggies well dressed with generous amounts of avocados and delightful watermelon beets. My taste don't gravitate to salad but this will satisfy the pickiest of eaters.   Atmosphere: TFK's welcoming modern casual atmosphere fits the Scottsdale vibe. A open kitchen situated behind a spacious bar provides entertainment for foodie guests. I thought the combo of private tables (traditional seating)  and common table seating (strangers sit next to each other on a shared table) blended well with the atmosphere.

Very green food indeed and good taste. It took us about 10 minutes to wait until got a table. I ordered a Panang Curry with chicken and my wife ordered a Farmer's Market, For the kid we ordered a collection of carrot, apple, grape and chicken. All the veggies looks fresh and they are really are.   Drinks we ordered the cucumber refresher and carrot apple ginger tonic, very soft and fresh, even my kid can take a sip.   Although we cannot take every meal like this (imagine a whole week of veggies? No ...), but it really feels good having a meal you don't need to count the calories.

Absoulety obsessed with this place!   This is now my 3rd time in one week!   Ryan the GM is so sweet and his passion for this restaurant is amazing!  The service is so fab and the food is delish!  The spaghetti squash casserole is so yummy I couldn't stop eating it after how full I was off of the apps which was the edamame dumplings and hummus !  If you haven't been you must go!

Let me preface this review by saying that I really, really wanted to love this place. I mean, it's green, organic, environmentally friendly, they use local ingredients, organic and sustainable liquors, ... who couldn't love such a responsible corporate citizen. However, this visit fell short of my expectations.   My friend and I came here to enjoy dinner together. Seating was prompt. Drinks were ordered and arrived swiftly, at which point we ordered the entire meal (including an appetizer). We ordered the shrimp dumplings as our appetizer, I ordered the salmon open-faced sandwich, and he ordered a curry dish with shrimp. Much to our surprise, 10 minutes later, our entrées arrive. I asked the server where our appetizer was, he said he would go check. A minute later, our waitress shows up and says she FORGOT to put in the order for the dumplings. She had a pad and pen with which she was writing down the order, was she not listening? We still wanted them, and they were ordered. The manager promptly came to apologize for the error and corrected it. Other than this incident, service was pretty good.   My food was good, but not something that merits an "excellent" rating. I reserve "rave reviews" for food that is creative and tasty. The salmon was cooked well (under-seasoned, but nonetheless well done). My kale salad and sweet potato hash were de-lish! My friend said that he enjoyed the curry. Booze wise, I had the Fudo Myoo Sake which was quite tasty, and my friend had a cocktail with strawberry juice in it which was delicious. We were offered a dessert menu, but both of us were full. Price points were decent here with most entrées falling in the $13 - 14 range and appetizers in the $8-10 range. Wines and cocktails are also priced at a variety of points.   Overall TFK is a good mid-range restaurant with a good corporate social responsibility stance, and I liked it, but again, it's not something that I would rate "excellent".   And (drumroll) Grades:  Overall:    C   (the actual average would be a C+, however, I am                         doubling the impact of the service grade. Otherwise,                         no demerits taken)  Service:   C-   (the fact that the server forgot to write down our order                          is a major problem. Hopefully it's a once-in-a-great-while                         kind of incident. The only thing that salvaged the service                         grade to above a failure was the manager's quick action)  Food:       B-  (it's good, but nothing to write home about. Plus points                        for a well-executed sweet potato hash and kale salad)  Drinks:     B   (Tasty strawberry cocktail - which tasted a bit watery to                        me, but otherwise good. Sake was pretty good too)

Unique menu full of fresh and healthy options. The apple carrot ginger tonic and edamame dumplings stood out as winners among what we ordered, but everything was delicious!  The vibe is great, too - lots of energy from within the restaurant and from the surrounding Scottsdale Quarter plaza area.

Open air restaurant. Love the layout of seeing the kitchen and big windows. Got the heirloom tomato pizza and it was amazing. The almond ricotta was really yummy and a great cheese substitution. The server was really friendly, kept checking in on us and gave me vegan suggestions she liked when I asked. I food came out pretty quickly. The pizza was messy to eat because nothing is really holding the toppings to the crust. So the tomatoes kept sliding off. The almond ricotta comes in mounds so you need to spread it out a bit (unless you like it really concentrated). The pizza dough and olive oil/herb blend they used were fantastic. Great flavor. I've been putting off coming here because wasn't sure about the vegan options I saw on the menu but really glad I tried it.

Fantastic food! I didn't have much of an appetite so I just ordered the soup of the day, butternut squash. It was seasoned perfectly and tasted super fresh. I stole a little bit of my boyfriends kale salad which was phenomenal- probably one the best kale salads I've ever eaten. Friendly service as well. If we have enough time during our stay, we will definitely return!

I've eaten here MANY times and I've never been disappointed with the food or the service. Located in a nice shopping mall so there's lots to do when you're done with lunch or dinner. The food is always healthy, fresh and different.

This place is very good, their concept is definitely unique but be prepared to pay a little extra.  I had the coco pineapple concoction which was refreshing and complimented well with the ahi sandwich.  My wife had one of the salads and I failed to remember the name but it was delish. The turn off here is definitely the plastic surgery from the strange affluent population that calls this area of town, home.  Also one of my concerns when visiting the true food kitchen's (another one in biltmore area) is that the service is not up to par with the great food.
My favorite go-to restaurant in the Scottsdale Quarter area. Great options and atmosphere. The Natural drink (citrus, agave, ginger tea) is bomb

Ordered the cucumber honey lemonade and it was very refreshing. Turkey burger was great! Sweet potato hash was pretty good, a little greasy. Husband had the tofu teriyaki bowl and he didn't think it was anything great, tofu was a little dried out. Son ordered the pizza, crust was really good. Mother in law ordered the spaghetti squash and loved it.  We would try this place again, a lot of good option to try.

Bottom Line Up Front: if you have more money than nutrition, this will balance you out. Pricey and pretentious, meh food and great service.  Background: I was in Phoenix to run the Ragnar 202 mile relay race and we met the team here the night before we ran. We're a fairly healthy and athletic bunch, so the concept seemed like a great match. Here is how the stars breakdown:  My first (obligatory) star is for the concept of fresh healthy food in a gorgeous atmosphere. The open dining area is beautiful, though maybe not the most practical. The kitchen opens fully into the dining/bar area with nary a sneeze guard between you and the chefs.  My second star is for the extremely efficient and polite service. With a table of ten people all asking for separate checks, our server was fast, polite and willing to do more than we should have expected.  What would it take to get my third star? Basic comforts. The night we were there, it was cold outside and the patio has lots of doors which made for a chilly dining experience every time the servers passed by. The restrooms are outside and around the building (like a gas station?) and the seating arrangement was oddly grouped around the table which crowded some and left others eating on the corner of the table.  Once we've made it comfortable, the fourth star could be had by increasing the value for my dollar. I had the bison burger, which was more bun than burger and with water my bill was $17 before tip. It's ridiculous to propose that you must spend a fortune to get basic, healthy food. Perhaps it was the mysterious "umami" sauce, which is mostly nutritional yeast, kind of a vegan cheese substitute, that jacked up the price. Why you would need vegan cheese on a bison burger is beyond me.  The elusive fifth star, I'm afraid, may be out of reach for a couple of reasons. Even if the comfort and value were addressed, the food was nothing noteworthy. After speaking to other runners, few of us found the flavor to be memorable. Additionally, the restaurant places more value in the aesthetics of health than the practice of eating well. Health is not something you buy, it's something you live. Healthy food is not expensive unless it's over processed, or over marketed.  If you are truly looking for healthy food, try a Farmer's Market. If your looking for the latest food trends regardless of health or cost, this may appeal to you.

We went here for a great sunday afternoon lunch with kids and grandparents. Our waiter was very attentive. Food was very well presented and tasted amazing.  I have also been here for an employee's birthday celebrations for more of the drinks and app's and have always been impressed with their healthy, fresh and well prepared options. I would return here for any type of eating occasion ;)
I enjoy eating here when I am in town.  Food is healthy and fresh.

What's not to love about this place! If you're going for brunch on the weekend I highly recommend arriving around 11 or 11:15 as it gets packed. Great location in the middle of Scottsdale Quarter.  Every server we have had here has been so helpful and pleasant. Awesome spot if you are vegetarian, vegan or gluten-free. Their gluten-free pita is really good.  Menu has something for everyone. Open/modern restaurant with a lot of windows - super relaxed vibe. Great juices (a little pricey, but well worth it) -- I highly recommend their banana and date smoothie.  They also have a juice bar outside -- SO darn good. Highly recommend :)

My first time dining here for lunch and I was pleasantly surprised. The quacomole appetizer and the edammame dumplings were delishious perfect amount of chips to quac and it was a healthy sized portion (not a tiny scoop).   Now for the meals there was not much as far as what I was able to eat so I ended up ordering the turkey wrap eithout all the extras which ended up being to dry, but the waitress brought some taziki sauce which helped significantly. She side of sweet potato has was phenomenal to go with it. Between two appetizers and two meals is was more than the both of us could eat... so no worries on portion size here.   We were a little weaey having to sit outside in this heat but the misters were a saving grace and it was relatively comfortable. Would recommend to my friends and family, but would love a couple other options that are less healthy as strange as that may seem.

Have enjoyed every dish I've ordered ..been here at least 3 times (and once to the Scottsdale Quarter location) and have, each time, ordered something different (so many intriguing options I can't help it but want to try a new thing! PLUS, they change their menu items with a few staples that remain unchanged).    I've never tried their pizzas, but I can attest to their salads and sandwiches and entrees - the one that stands out the most is their Sashimi Tuna which was surprisingly filling (the fat of the fish and avocado) and not-surprisingly, very full of flavor and my favorite, ginger.  Their Steak Tacos were also fantastic and I love the cotija cheese they put on top and of course my other fave, avocado.  Their price point is competitive considering they serve premium ingredients and the food has never disappointed.  Also, servers are (cute enough), wearing matching capris and such and have always been friendly, down to earth, and prompt.  I enjoyed the outdoor patio that the Scottsdale Quarter location has better than the Biltmore's, but this place is still very enjoyable... I just hate the parking dilemma since it's so popular on a any night of the week.
Been here several times.. Always good food and the dessert is delicious as well. Their cucumber refresher drink is my favorite. A little pricy but still worth it.

Tried this restaurant out tonight... not having the highest hopes. I mean, come on, it is a "healthy" restaurant". I was pleasantly surprised. The food is pretty amazing. I had a pizza and my friend had a rice bowl. They were both tasty and decent sizes. Not too big and not too small. We didnt have any drinks, appetizers, or desserts... but what we did eat was tasty. I will be going back in the near future.

I LOVE True Foods Kitchen! The staff is always so friendly and helpful!! Brandon and Megan Helped me yesterday and our whole table loved them.    I personally love the shaved turkey with sweet potato hash on the side but everything Ive had there is exceptional!!

My gf and I wanted a nice and relaxing lunch and thought about doing some shopping and dining at the quarter in Scottsdale. We ended up here at tru foods and really liked the setting and had lunch on the patio and that was the highlight.  The meal was slow to arrive, service was slow, and the food was boring. I think the staff had to many of their famous elixir drinks that lulled the whole place into a catatonic state with no personality and it came across in the food.  Sam Fox let me down on this visit and with all the other options in his new neighborhood there is nothing that is going to pull me back into his joyless world of Tru Food Kitchen.

First time going to true food and have to say I am not impressed. We walk in the door and are seated quickly, however after sitting for 15 minutes I became confused as to why we hadn't been asked for a drink order or checked on etc.. never before have I had to ask a server to get service. Not happy I'm paying $50 for 2 people to eat when I have to ask for service.

If you place a priority on healthy clean eating, True Kitchen is your spot. I don't know that I have ever eaten at a restaurant with similar offerings.  If you are Vegan, you'll kill for True Kitchen. And if you prefer poultry, fish or other, they have that also. I had a Turkey sand which. It came on pita bread and included greens, onion, zucchini, a yogurt spread and succulent carved turkey in a smooth light broth. It was awesome!  Place The True Kitchen on your must visit list.

I have ate here twice and both times were great! The menu is very healthy but also tasty. You might be skeptical before you order but it's very filling and light. In other words, the food is great fuel for the rest of the day. I would recommend the teriyaki bowl, the wrap or the burger. The juices are great as well! It's just a bit pricey.

Ive been here 3x. First time, I had the organic ricotta ravioli. Which was quite good, but oh so salty. Almost unbearably salty, and I am a salt-loving girl. I had a hard time finishing it.   The second time, I had a a pretty bland salad that doesnt even seem to be on the menu anymore. I wonder why.    Third time, I ordered steak tacos.   I keep coming back because I want to love it. As you can see though, I havent found something worth ordering twice yet. Bad sign after 3 visits.  I ordered my tacos well done and another server brought them out. They were medium-well which was totally fine with me and I was about to start eating them when our server suddenly appeared, said something about them not being well done, and stole the plate out from in front of me without even giving me half a second to make a decision, and then took it back to the kitchen. When it returned, the steak was kind of chewy.  I guess Im just used to the high quality meat we use at home? The beans that came with it were...just okay.  The honey lemonade was too sweet. I had about 1/3 of it and couldnt handle the rest.   My mom ordered a soup (not the miso) and it smelled great but tasted...flavorless. *SIGH*   I'll probably give them one last try before I call shenanigans on the whole joint.
Fast, friendly, professionally served healthy food.  The TLT sandwich was amazing and the bowls were super filling .  We had the Medicine man and watermelon cooler.
I love this place! The food is healthy and delicious.  I seriously could eat here everyday.  The Kale Salad is really good and the Turkey Wrap is probably my favorite.

Such a great place for tasty health food!!! I love their weekend brunch chicken sausage & kale scramble & jube true almond milk dark chocolate cold pressed coffee!!!   Other great items i've had are: the turkey burger, panang shrimp noodles, & the crudite.

Please indicate if the following points are True or False:  -   You and Matt were really excited to visit True Food Kitchen during Restaurant Week. TRUE  -   Upon arrival, the two of you were happy to be seated promptly without a reservation. TRUE  -   The cheerful restaurant décor infused you with organic, healthy, and sustainable vibes. TRUE  -  You and Matt really enjoyed sitting outdoors on the cozy patio that was artistically bordered with green grass. TRUE   -   The menu's variety of healthy and fresh options initially looked impressive and yummy. TRUE  -   It took your waiter about 10 minutes to acknowledge your existence after being seated, even though the restaurant wasn't very crowded. TRUE  -   When the waiter finally arrived, he didn't welcome you to the restaurant, introduce himself or even explain the concept behind the menu that Dr. Weil & Mr. Fox created. Instead he looked bored and just wanted to know your order. TRUE   -   Waiters at Applebee's have made a better first impression than he did. TRUE   -   The seasoned hummus appetizer, topped with a flavorful Mediterranean mix of Kalamata olives, cucumbers, feta and sliced pearl tomatoes impressed both of you. However the amount of time it took this dish to make its way to your table did not. TRUE  -  It seemed like the entire restaurant staff was playing a game of "Guess Who?" - waiters kept moronically walking around with food, stopping at different tables and trying to guess who ordered what. TRUE  -   At least 4 times (it occurred so frequently you stopped counting), a random waiter placed someone else's food in front of you, and you had to tell them that they guessed wrong. TRUE  -  You ordered a salad, tofu teriyaki bowl and frozen yogurt with berries. Matt ordered the smoked salmon, steak tacos and flourless chocolate cake. It was healthy, fresh and good but definitely NOT worth the $100+ bill including a bottle of wine. TRUE  -  You both felt robbed. A much more pleasant, faster and cheaper alternative would have been to buy the wine and ingredients from Trader Joes or Whole Foods and prepare this "simple" meal yourselves. TRUE  -  A snail could have cooked and served your "simple" meal faster then the 3 painstaking hours it took your waiter. TRUE  -  The restaurant's parking validation is only good for two free hours in the lot - but the wait staff decided to play that irritating game of "Guess Who?" and couldn't serve your "simple" meal in less than two hours - so to top it all off, you STILL had to pay for parking, which was beyond upsetting after so many other let downs. TRUE   -   Although you liked the décor and really wanted to love this restaurant, you don't recommend it to anyone since you have most certainly tasted MUCH better health food. TRUE  Thank you for your responses to these True Food Kitchen statements. We are excited for when you return to enjoy more of our overpriced food and overwhelmingly bad service. FALSE!!!

Here is what really gets me - THEY DON'T POST NUTRITIONAL CONTENT OF THEIR FOOD!!!  The claim is that "we change our menu so often it would be impracticable" but they DO NOT CHANGE THE MENU!  I have been going to this restaurant since it opened, the menu is virtually identical.  And my guess is that when they create new items, they probably figure out the nutritional content. So we have a supposed "healthy" restaurant that won't post nutritional information, what does that tell you?????  Shame shame shame on your true foods.

I am usually not an organic food person, but this may change my mind.  Great food and service.  Nice simple menu, but food quality is great, never knew kale could taste so good.  Also sampled the pizza's, and black cod.  The only drawback is that it is loud inside, so if you a looking for a quiet place, this may not be the place for you.  But, it still deserves 5 stars in my mind...

This restaurant is very satisfying. I always order the kale & avocado dip (ask for extra chips, they never give you enough) For my entrée I get the red chili shrimp. (Just the right amount of spice!) Finish with the flourless chocolate cake & vanilla ice cream. There is almost always a wait for a table no matter what day & time you go. Great selection of meals for kids. My toddler enjoys the mozzarella pizza. Have also tried the margherita pizza which is delicious & we love the honey lemonade too! Food is pretty expensive but oh so worth it!!! 5 stars- love this place!

Let's just start off by saying I've never been into trends, especially the most recent "organic" foods one (well, I guess recent since the 90s?). While I did feel like I was in an episode of Portlandia when I read the menu, I was delighted with the taste of all the food. The waitress asked if we had every been there before, and told us about how, well, how healthy everything is.   My coworker has been there multiple time, and suggest we start with the edamame dumplings. Very good! Were there worth $2 per dumpling...? I don't know. I guess your wallet decides that.   I had to ask what multiple ingredients were (vegenaise = vegan mayo; hehe!) but finally choose the TLT. Tempeh, by the way, is a compressed soy bean (I think?), smoked, that "tastes like bacon." It was actually really good! I thought the TLT had turkey in it but about 1/2 way through I realized it was just the tempeh. Avocado was great too.  My TLT came with a couple of side options, and none sounded too appetizing (see: previous reviews. I like beer and fries, like every overweight American), but I've been on a health kick, so I went with the kale salad. It was actually very good- due to the grated parmesean and bread crumbs. Very "kale-y" still, but I guess kale is kale and there's only so much you can do to mask the healthy taste. The lemon dressing was good, but a bit too much actually and completely soaked my bread on my sammich that was sharing it's plate.   Everything else was generally good (service, decor) but I was surprised for such a busy place, they'd only have one sink in the bathroom. I had to wait for some chick to stop staring at herself (see: Scottsdale location) to wash my hands.   I think I'd go there again just for the TLT ($10)- everything else was out of my budget for a lunch. My coworker got the ravioli; 5 pieces for $15. I have to wait until I marry rich to enjoy those spoils.

Really good place to have lunch or dinner , place is well degisned and stuff are super nice and friendly I love the concept of the open kitchen and the bar area and high sitting as well to regular tables I ate the temp sandwich with sweet potatoes and it was really great Thank you very recommend

I came for a business lunch and was impressed by their menu! This was my first time at the restaurant and I ordered the Summer Market Salad. At first glance I was a little hesitant but after giving it a shot it was great! I usually don't like blueberries with goat cheese but it blended really well and was not a sweet salad (I try to stay away from sweet salads).   My coworkers and I had the lemon tart with coconut for dessert -YUM!!   Both are a must!
Visiting from Cali & heard about this spot! Awesome:) It's so much easier to eat super healthy, when the food tastes this good! We will come back whenever we are in town.

This place is pretty big! It's bright and modern. Check in with name and number while waiting to be seated and receive a text message when your table is ready. Service was very satisfactory. My particular waitress suggested a drink item and was very knowledgable on the menu. When she suggested her favorite menu item for lunch she was descriptive and happy to tell about it. Decent food portions; not too big. I ate every bite! Would be a great place for business meetings bcoz it's not very noisy a place. Casual vibe.
Awesome kale salad!  Spaghetti squash casserole was delicious!  Healthy vegetarian food!  Chicago - please open one now:)

I will say this place gets packed really fast.  I met a friend for lunch this day.  We skipped on the appetizers and went straight for the meals.  I ordered the grass fed burger and a side of fries.  I will say the burger was really tasty and fresh.  The fries were really good too.  I have had a lot of burgers in my time and this is one of the best.  I am not sure if it was buffalo or beef.  I had a buffalo at a different true foods location too.  It was excellent.  This is on the top 3 list for burgers.
This is possibly my new favorite restaraunt.  It's healthy eating, but yet it taste so good.  The Lasagna is my favorite dish.

I went with others to have lunch here. It was a place I wouldn't have gone to by myself. Service was good, but like I said before it just wasn't the restaurant I would usually go to. Menu was all natural foods. It just was hard for me to pick something I would like to eat. I am open to trying other types of food. I did find something to eat and I have to say it was good but I don't think I will go back. Like I mention before It is just not my normal place to go to eat.  https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g31350-d2105924-r422540049-True_Food_Kitchen-Scottsdale_Arizona.html#
Wonderful food & wonderful experience overall. My husband & I truly enjoyed the ambience & mostly the food. Their mission is empowering! You are what you eat :)

One of my favorites! Great service and always fresh, exciting meal options. My friends ordered The Hangover RX and say it worked  we always come here when in AZ. It's worth the wait you will probably have!

I've always been a fan of this place. I was a frequent visitor of their Santa Monica location in California. I've never ordered something that I didn't like.  This time around, I split their new Roasted Vegetable Board with my cousin. It was so good! Came with a green goddess dressing & hummus. Couldn't decide which was better.  We also split a quinoa burger (see photos). It was a great healthy choice. The kale on the side was so flavorful (maybe rubbed with lemon & garlic?) and the sweet potatoes were good.  AWESOME DRINKS: spontaneous happiness & cucumber citrus margarita   This is a great lunch spot and I highly recommend!
I loved the salad & all the fresh food ! The tea was awesome & the service was excellent ! I would definitely tell friends to come here !

First, let me say that I am a huge fan of Dr. Andrew Weil.  He is an advocate of eating whole, natural and organic foods whenever possible.  He doesn't have a 'diet' book, but he does advocate for eating in a way that our bodies our truly nourished.  I was soo excited to find out about True Food Kitchen.  I found the decor to be light and festive.  My dad found the colors reminded him of the 70's. lol. Our waiter was really nice and took the time to explain all of the teas available to my mom.
