He suggested we try the hummus, and since I'm a sucker for chickpeas, we ordered it. I'm totally going to start making my hummus with some jalepeno!  It was great, but a tad spicy for some.  We loved it.  I had the steak tacos with adzuki beans.  The beans were quite spicy and I only ate half, but they were delicious. The tacos were great and I could tell the meat was "organic" (duh, of course meat is organic people!) because of the distinct taste of meat not raised with added hormones.    One plus about this place is that people who have allergies to certain food products are absolutely able to eat here.  There are plenty of vegan, vegetarian, and dairy-free items on the menu. I will definitely be back.  My only problem is that I found it to be a bit expensive, but then again, I'm cheap. lol.  Plus:  I saw some dogs seated with owners at their side patio tables!

I really really enjoy this place.  The people and service are always nice and the food is really good.  I was a bit standoffish as I had been told it was a bit more raw than it actually turned out to be but it was the best, with the freshest tasting ingredients I have ever had at a restaurant.  A bit pricey, yes. Always crowded yes. Good food yes.

Tasty, energizing food!  Liked this place enough to visit twice in one week. Right off the bat: Servers are extremely friendly and efficient. Also important to know, if you are very hungry, i would recommend ordering a few things.  That being said, the food tastes amazing and you will feel good eating it.   First trip: Ancient grains bowl with chicken. Not too filling but hit the spot and i could taste everything so well. Get it  Second trip: inside out Quinoa burger. Again very tasty but didn't fill me up. Should have ordered something else.   Overall: Definitely try his place! Only criticism, could get pricey to be full and satisfied.   Savor the flavors!

What a great surprise. I was initially skeptical when my wife showed me the menu but thought what the heck...glad I did   Super fresh veggies interesting plates and flavor combinations. Superb "squash" pie for dessert.   Service was fine. Not intrusive but always there.

Went here again yesterday and was blown away again by the service and the food. The managers that work here are very professional, friendly, and know how to run a restaurant. Friendly bartenders and waiters/waitresses also. Even though the place is packed and everyone is so busy, they look like they're having fun and still take time to make customers feel special. :)
Friendly staff with plenty of healthy options.   I got the casserole with a glass of wine. The casserole was okay, but was loaded with veggies which I liked. Excellent wine list with fair pricing.

I had the best experience here with my family. The food was delicious but what really made my visit was our server Chris. He was hands down the best server I've ever had. He was very patient and attentive. The BEST customer service ever! I wish every server was as awesome as he is! Awesome place and awesome staff! 5 stars all the way!

I can't even begin to tell you how TRULY underwhelming this was, and for the price you pay for it, you're probably better off loading up on junk at the Whole Foods salad bar.   The folks who run True Food (and a handful of other non-related "concept" restaurants) are the kind of people I have a hard time taking seriously. If you believe so much in a product or a concept, I expect it to shine through your food and service. Instead, this was a streamlined operation with a perma-stoned spacey staff and the results were abysmal.   It's a shame that such a beautifully converted space (I can't believe this was that old Coffee Plantation) houses such mediocrity. I started my meal with the Tuscan kale salad. At first, I was very excited for this because it had been well over a year since I had seen any place in Arizona eve serve kale. The salad was simple- served with lemon juice, Parmesan, and bread crumbs, yet the lemon was so overpowering, it made the entire salad entirely too sour and bitter. The sea bass street tacos were a joke. Entirely overcooked and tasted way too fishy. Even the salsa and pickled onions couldn't mask the fishiness of this dish. The wild ahi sliders were fair-- perfectly seared, but lacked any depth of flavor. Thankfully, those didn't taste like it had been sitting out too long. We also got the sweet potato hash on the side...which was burnt on the bottom and tasted of smoke all the way through...I don't quite think they were meant to be that way though.  Got conned into ordering two juice infusion type things...not memorable at all. Opted out of dessert for all the obvious reasons.   The waitress bugged me so much. I don't know what hippie food co-op they dragged her out of, but if you're going to be a good waitress you probably should a) forget that you have tables and b) not look disgusted when your non-vegetarian customers order meat. The look on her face was more insulting to me than the meal itself, which is why I brought it down to two stars.   Care about selling customers your "concept" of quality, healthy foods?  Then SERVE quality, healthy foods.

This place explains why people do not eat healthy. I expected a certain health/environmental theme from restaurants like this.   For one: I was shocked they used plastic bottles for their juice, I mean aren't you trying to go for an environmental/healthy eating theme here?   Food/drink:  Order the shitake rock cod. Small portion, but very well executed. Sauce is light yet savory. Large pieces of shitake.  Roots Radical - A weird drink with a little too much spicy kick to it was stuck on my tongue. It later dried my tongue to the point where it start bleeding.   Service:  This is in a swanky shopping plaza....service better be good. And it was.   Environment:  The interior has a lot of open space. Exterior is well designed and feels like a fairly nice place to hang out in the outdoor seating area.   Price:  $26 for a small fish dish and $9 for a juice. After tax and tip I think I paid $44 or so, which is pretty pricey (to me at least).   Food: 4 Drink: 2 Service: 4 Environment: 4 Price: 1

I met up with a friend today for an early dinner and some serious catch up.  This was my second time eating there and I wanted to sit  outside (while we still can!) to escape the noise.  We had a good meal...I ordered the shrimp dish and was warned by my server that it was "very spicy".  I'm a native so I am not intimidated by that at all.  It was yummy but distinctly non-spicy.  It came with noodles and I brought half home with the intention of doctoring it up for another meal.  My friend ordered street tacos and another enter.  She was hungry and said the tacos were good.  We had a gift card, so had dessert---a really strong, but tasty, lemon tart and a yummy frut crisp .  Our service was polite and they were tolerant of our very long visit.  I'msure the generous tip didn't hurt, either.  So, after my second visit, I am still not blown away by True Food   The menu has some variety but things like street tacos can literally be found everywhere.  I think I have an expectation that the food be healthy , unique, AND creative, especially for the price .  This is a really competitive food town.  The way for True Food to distinguish itself is to innovate and give the diner value .Once that happens, I bet more folks will place it in their regular rotation.

I am seriously in love with True Foods. I can't afford to go all the time because it's very pricey but the food is amazingly delicious and extremely healthy. They have awesome drinks. I always start with the vegetable crudite. It's a nice bowl of yummy vegetables served with two sauces. I had the albacore tataki which is good but cost about the same as my huge bowl of veggies. I have had a couple of their salads which of course are so delicious that I am drooling as I write this. My finance got the street tacos which he thoroughly devoured but after we left, he was still hungry so portions are small and the price is large. We had two desserts, I don't remember what they were called but his was a lemon bar or pie of some sort. He loved it and I had a berry cobbler with frozen greek yogurt. Yum!!!

Came with my dad who's an omni and we both got to enjoy a nice, fresh meal! For an appetizer we shared the kale guacamole and I think it's safe to say this is the one of the best guacs I've ever tasted! For a main, I ordered the T.L.T sandwich and for desert, my dad and I shared a slice of the vegan key lime pie! I've never had key lime pie before so this was pretty awesome to see that the one on the menu was vegan! Definitely recommend if you're vegan/vegetarian and want to find a place that's great to dine at with an omni or simply want to enjoy some great food!
Ok.. you hummus people.... its awesome here.  Also the Kale salad was great...  Not a fan of the Turkey burger, came out cold but everything else was Great!

I absolutely love this place. I love the fact that they have indoor and outdoor seating. The staff is friendly and friendly. The food is absolutely wonderful. I have had almost everything on the menu and I do not have one bad thing to say about that.   However the downfall is, they do not take a reservation. At least for a party of four (4).
The strawberry salad is delicious.  Always nice but it's very loud at times and if you are going for lunch plan to wait in line.

This is the first true food location I visited. I've been here several times and have yet to be disappointed with my food choices. This is a great location in the middle of Scottsdale quarter. There is almost always a 30-45 min wait so plan ahead. We usually come and put our name in and enjoy some shopping at the surrounding stores while waiting.   The offer a wide variety of food choices. All the items are the menu are created to be antioxidant meals.   My favorite meal item is the grass fed burger. The sauce and mushrooms add an amazing flavor.   My favorite dessert is the flourless chocolate cake but the banana chia pudding is really good too!

I get it, the food is healthy and tasty. I personally think they sometimes try to hard with the menu. Finding anything 'normal' or simple can some times be a challenge. Overall the food is good and the atmosphere is great on a mild day. The place is usually crazy busy at lunch time so coming a little earlier may help to avoid the lunch rush.

After hearing so much about this place I finally tried it and was very impressed! Started with the lettuce wraps and they were great!  The Ahi sliders are good, but the Kale salad is amazing!  I have to get the recipe for it!  Do have the agree with the other post, the service is a little slow...
This place has an amazing selection for a plant-based diet.  I had a salad that was great.  I would highly recommend if you like fresh food and has many organic options.

We experienced so many restaurants in Scottsdale over the holidays and I'm very grateful to have tried True Food Kitchen.  Good, very tasty and healthy food is were it's at and how it should be.  The service was perfect and the interior is beautiful.  FYI:  I found it by searching "Vegan food".

We went there for dinner last night.  Friendly staff.  Good menu, however I was not impressed with the flavors.  I had the spaghetti squash casserole and it was bland.  I has a bite of the sea bass and it was cooked very well, however kind of flavorless.  Also, prices are very high for what you get.  Not worth it.  I won't be back.

Great food and service. A bit pricy for what you get during dinner but great lunch prices. I'm a big fan of Dr.Weil and his wellness teachings. The only thing that would make it better is if they'd take reservations.

We're already planning our next dinner at True Food. Well, actually we'd like to try the Happy Hour next!  We were kindly accommodated outside with our pup. We really appreciated TFK allowing us to have our dog outside, who fared well in the shade provided by the side of the building, the hanging canopies in the alleyway, the umbrella by our table, and the overhead misting.  Adam was our server and he was so genuine and his presence was truly a delight. He answered all of our questions concerning the menu and when we were stuck between dishes, he gave us recommendations that did not disappoint! As it was our first time here, he explained the philosophy and seasonal schedule of the restaurant to us, which is right up our alleys. A changing menu is awesome because it gives incentive to keep you coming back to try more.  We had guacamole as an appetizer which was fresh af on a hot September evening in the Valley. I ordered the chili noodles and my SO ordered some kind of grass-fed burger wrapped in lettuce. After we ate our meal, we didn't feel overly stuffed or uncomfortably filled with heavy food, as meals out often leave us feeling. We felt comfortable, light, and satiated, more than likely due to the fresh ingredients in our dinner. This really makes a difference in our dining experience, and is the main reason we're coming back to experience this place again in the near future.

As a mom of a kid with food allergies, I always have a hard time finding delicious food traveling. A few local friends recommend True Food and it was delicious! We went on a Saturday morning and I really loved how they open at 10am. My daughter had a yummy GF muffin. I mean yummy because it did not taste like cardboard. A lot of GF stuff taste like cardboard to me. And I was so happy that brunch had more choices than just egg related because my daughter is also allergic to eggs. I really enjoyed my farmed chopped chicken salad. Service was excellent. When I am in Scottsdale next time, I will definitely be back!

The lemonades are tasty. Very creative drink menu. The servers don't do well explaining the menu options. The hostess is really nice and attentive. However, when asked for water the server stands around the kitchen for a few minutes then goes to clean off some tables. Finally, when we cross his mind, he decides to bring water for our surprisingly spicy dishes. It's not like I had an urgent look in my eyes or anything. Also, the restaurant is very open so you know when the server blows you off. The food is pleasant, but I'll have to try something else on the menu to give an honest increase in stars. Maybe it's because we had Jewels bakery and cafe for breakfast that it didn't "wow" us.

Unbelievably amazing. The food was phenomenal. Had a nice table outside which set the ambiance. We ordered the edamame dumplings as an appetizer - fabulous, we should have ordered two for the three of us.  The curry dish was amazing. I can't stress how tasty it was! We asked for it spicy and it def had a kick. There was a lot too so that I was able to really indulge.  The quinoa burger was ok.  We also ordered a butternut squash pizza. This had a unique flavor but we really liked it. I found the spiced apple drink to be too spiced for me but many yelpers really love it. I can't wait to eat here again.
Ancient grains salad and hummus were excellent! The food was delicious and refreshing. Definitely recommend!

I'm a fan of Dr. Weil, so when I was looking for a place to go and found out through Yelp that he owns this restaurant, I had to try it out.  I was very happy with my experience.  The ambiance was cool, and the food my friends and I ordered all came out great.  I ordered their Kale salad, and it is pretty amazing.  I liked it so much that I looked it up online after and have been making my own version at home.  The service was good as well.

Admittedly, I have a bias up front because I'm a Dr. Weil groupie, so I got the fangirl goggles coming into this place. My expectations were actually exceeded, and am SO happy to discover this restaurant because they have a plethora of dairy free and egg free options which is awesome for someone like me with the allergies.  The decor is bright and energetic. Our service was fantastic. I loved how they display bins of fresh fruits.  Over at my food blog, you can see pictures of the dishes we ate: 2 appetizers and 2 dishes, the teriyaki tofu brown rice and Roasted Autumn Vegetables. My favorite was the Edamame dumplings: http://bit.ly/aeZmin  The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because I thought the pricing was a tad on the high side. I felt it was worth it, but this place is more of a treat than let's eat there twice a week kind of thing...at least for me.

A go-to brunch not to be missed especially when the fall weather permits friendly sunshiny days! Huevos rancheros $9 and Garden Scramble (I think it was $10) are my two favorites. Huevos rancheros is filled with the roasted chile, organic corn tortillas and yummy cotija cheese and a runny egg on top. Every bite served its purpose. Garden Scramble was equally delicious. Scrambled eggs with butternut squash, smoked onion, smoked Gouda, Swiss chard, broccoli. Squash slice of pie $7 with the tasty fall whip cream ended the brunch on a sweet note. Service was speedy and genuinely in good spirits. Can't wait for another outing here.

Great, healthy place to eat delicious food in Scottsdale.  I have come here a couple of times on business.  I had the Quinoa Salad and the Hangover Rx drink.  Our server Marco was super friendly and provides great service.  Out would recommend this place and definitely go back!

I wanted to like this place but its trendy and way overrated.  I love Fox restaurants and organic/local food so expected I would adore this place.  What we got instead was overpriced, bland food. I can cook better at home.  I would not return. :(

Yet another GREAT Fox Restaurant Concept - actually probably my favorite of all of them!  My wife and I had dinner here on Valentine's Day with another couple.  They had an enticing prix fixe menu that we couldn't pass up.  The server was friendly, even though we were there right up until close, and the food was very good.  I had the Herb Hummus as an appetizer and the Steak Tacos for my entree.  The hummus was delicious.  The tacos were also very good - I would have them again - but they fell apart very easily, which was a bit of a turnoff.  More than anything, you have to appreciate a mainstream restaurant like True Food dedicating itself to using seasonal, locally grown, organic food as much as possible.  That alone will make me return for another meal soon!
Prices up , quality down! They ruined the shaved turkey sandwich!!  I will not go back, period!!

A Fox concepts restaurant group restaurant, I've eaten at this restaurant many times n enjoy the seasonal changes. Some things are better than others but overall this is a nice spot. It also has the best location in the Scottsdale quarters in my opinion, I love the patio in the back by the green grass mole hills and palm trees. Very Scottsdale! Great place to eat before or after a movie at Ipic.  My favorites on the menu are, the salads!! especially Tuscan kale and the hummus...

Terrible does not fully capture the atrocious service and food this place dishes out. It's perfect for the snobs who pride themselves in how big the food bill and have rated this place so highly. Anyone with a shred of taste and pulse will never want to eat this bs dished out with bs ATTITUDE.

Wow wow wow!!!! Yum yum!   Everything on the menu is delicious.  It's healthy and tasty.  I love the edamame pot stickers. I have been craving them since I ate there. I can't wait to go back. The atmosphere was also awesome!
Interesting menu. Didn't realize they focus on an anti inflammatory diet. Definitely can taste the fresh and healthy foods. Great for brunch and has a fun California esque vibe! Coming back.

Great location, great views.  The patio is a great place to relax and visit with friends while people watching.   The palm tree lights in the courtyard give a soft, relaxing feeling.  Fun weekend night out!

One of my favorite places to eat! Great selection and variety of food and the location is perfect because it's in the Biltmore and who doesn't love that place. They are also dog friendly on their patio. It is pricy so be prepared for that. Friendly service with great food, what more can you ask!

I absolutely love this place! One of my favorite restaurants. I have been there multiple times and never been disappointed. The restaurant itself is clean, bright and beautiful! The staff are kind and knowledgeable about the menu. And best of all is the food!! If you're a health nut you will be in heaven!! It's a pricer place, so I consider it a special occasion to eat here but very worth it! We always get the bison burger! It's mouthwatering. I also love the kale salad and the sweet potato hash. Their specialty drinks are super yummy and my body always feels so happy after I leave! Quality food!!! Thank you True Foods!

Some friends and I went out for a birthday dinner last night at true foods. It was a really excellent meal! The food was incredible, we tried the spaghetti squash, which was great, especially with some bison burger mixed in, and the turkey lasagna and the tacos, they were all fantastic. but the highlight of the meal was our server, Caroline. She made recommendations, smiled and laughed with us, made several substitutions to our orders, and just made the whole meal more enjoyable and memorable. She even suggested a better spot when we asked her to take our photo, to get in the beautiful view and lights. Can't wait to come back and try all the other great looking items on the menu.

What happened to this place?  The first time I went about a year ago, both the food and service were great.  Second time, last May, I ordered the same dish and it was horrible.  Drowning in sauce.  But, at least the service was decent.  Just went a third time and it will be my last.  Both the food and service were horrible.  Went for lunch, sat inside and it wasn't very busy.  Our waiter was totally out of it and only had 4 tables and hardly paid any attention to us and kept forgetting things, like taking our order to start.    Then, even the food runner forgot to bring me half my meal after I asked her for it.  In the meantime, I counted at least 17 staff member hanging out in the kitchen area, which is open, so you can see them and half of them were folding napkins.  My food was not very good and actually made me a little sick.  This is a shame, especially because there aren't many places in Phx that have vegan choices, but for the price you pay, I would expect a lot more.

So I guess I'm the rare person who didn't think True Food was the best thing since sliced bread...I'll admit, I'm a pizza and wine, steak and potato kinda girl, and I like feeling full and satisfied after I pay for a meal...this did not happen here. The Husband and I were practically starving when we decided to go here. And since it was on our list of places to try, we thought, what better time. Without even looking at the menu really, (which is unlike us) we shot over there like we were racing other cars on the road. Here are the positives: The hummus was really good. Kindof reminded me of Olive and Ivy's, which I love. To drink I had the vanilla lemongrass sparkling tea which was so amazing. I could drink one everyday during the summertime. The Husband had the short rib, which was actually pretty tasty.  The not so positives: The portions are small. His short rib plate was kinda small and I knew he'd be hungry later. I had the steak tacos which I didn't enjoy because the steak was too charred so my whole taco tasted burned...that pretty much ruined it for me. The beans that came with it were ok, but kinda spicy...  Overall, I ate my burnt tasting tacos because I was starving...but I don't know if I would have liked them even if they weren't burned...outside of the burnt-ness, there weren't many other flavors going on. Husband said the leeks and carrots could've been cooked a little longer...but that's his personal preference.   While I appreciate the healthy aspect of this restaurant, it's just not my kindof place I guess. But I would definitely go back for the vanilla lemongrass tea!

Went for my girlfriends sisters birthday. Pros: sustainable food. Hip settings. Good food. Cons: over priced. The spagetti squash caserole was miniscule. Cool drinks though.  Largest complaint was a cold draft that kept hitting us because they refused to keep the patio door closed.   Sort of it is I don't think ill go there again. But I do like their healthy food vibe.

Overrated and overpriced!  The outdoor seating is nice, and I really liked my cucumber lemonade (Cucumber Refresher), but everything else is just OK. I felt like I was eating at IKEA but waited on by somewhat condescending hipsters who were part of a brainwashed cult of 'healthy' but not real healthy, just some commercialized version of it. I just felt uncomfortable.  All the food looked nice, that's for sure. But I didn't really like the bison burger - I cant remember why, I guess it was pretty forgettable. The tacos were OK and the vegetable salad was OK.  So much hype though. It just feels so pretentious!! Am I missing something?   I've definitely experienced better.

Oh how I loved this place! I wish Tucson had one of these restaurants! Every dish we tried was so tasty! I love the ambiance of this location too - looking out at the fountain.  There are a lot of choice for vegans and vegetarians and they were willing to be accommodating to our requests.  The menu is eclectic for every one to enjoy!  Parking is not close, we parked in the garage and had a 5-6 minute walk but it is well worth it plus you can burn off the extra calories you just consumed! :-)
Hands down the best hummus I've ever tasted! The only thing I'll avoid is the honey lemonade with macha.  The food is exciting and very colorful

Love their food!! As a vegetarian I don't have too many options in this town, and every time I go there the food is yummy, the service is great, they are always willing to modify a dish for me, and all the servers are very nice! Go eat there, you won't regret it!!

Sitting outside on the wraparound patio is the way to go.  There is plenty of space, and the seats feel like couches, so it is essentially like being in your living room with your own a private fire pit.  Then there is the menu, which is simple, yet intriguing, particularly due to the fact most of the ingredients are grown locally, some are grown on-site, and there are a number of nutrient dense items not commonly found on restaurant menus, i.e. quinoa, kale, etc..  I realized I couldn't try everything on the first visit, so I went with the Grilled Steelhead Salmon, came back later the same day for the Grass Fed Bison Burger, and then later visited their newly opened restaurant in Santa Monica, CA and had the Angus Steak Tacos with quinoa.  Equally important as the experience with the food was the experience with the service staff, which was friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu.  There are still things on the menu I'd like to try, so I'll be going back soon!

We love this place. Even though it's in a mall, I'd still eat here as my sole destination. The open kitchen boasts a confidence that cannot be argued with. For lunch, I had the kale salad with salmon. The salmon was cooked to a perfect medium-rare. My wife had the quinoa salad. While I loved my lunch, I tasted hers and will have a hard time deciding which to order when I return, but the entire menu looks good.
Great food with tons of vegan and vegetarian options on the menu. Delicious mocktails!

The food was very great quality. We ordered the lasagna and it was amazing. The lasagna was very flavorful, and smooth. The Moroccan chicken was great, and crispy.  The chicken farro salad was probably the best salad I've ever had, and it's champagne vinaigrette was to die for. We ordered a martini and asked for grand marnier, but the place didn't have any. The waiter went out of his way and went to another restaurant to get us grand marnier for the drink. That is amazing service!  Highly recommend this place!

Truly amazing food! Everything was incredibly fresh! I learned that I love kale which is quite exciting. :-) I ordered the bison burger which was delicious and my husband loved his shrimp curry! I only wish they would open a restaurant closer to where we live, but every time we visit our friend here, we will most definitely be coming back!

YUM! Vegan-friendly, paleo-friendly, allergen-friendly.. It was amazing. The menu includes all super local, fresh and mostly organic ingredients and everything is labeled. The wait staff is willing to accommodate for food allergies and were overall very warm and welcoming. We ate outside on the patio on the patio furniture and would go back in an instant!

Obsessed.  Ambiance is great, service also great.  The menu freakin' rules my life.  The beverages are always fun, and delicious.  I had something with lemon and kale and it was so good.   Bison Burger is good, Salmon is good, Ahi appetizer is good... although I am guessing every option would be delicious.  Lot's of stuff for dietary weirdo's such as myself.  My normal boyfriend also loves it.  I haven't had dessert, but it looks divine.  I will re-visit often.

Quality quality quality! Its in the name and the food is delish! The menu is seasonal and the food is fresh. Oh and we ran into Pink here! No, not the color silly, the singer!!! It was awesome! They must be doing something right to get that kind of celebrity to come to eat here! I definitely recommend!

absolutely amazing here. Fresh food that I can taste and know it was made well.   Unique drink and food options and an amazing, refreshing vibe throughout. THis is my favorite Sam Fox restaurant... and I like them all.
This place is awesome! I've never had a bad meal here. Hands down my favorite lunch spot in Scottsdale.

I had dinner at the True Food in Scottsdale on a Thursday a couple of weeks ago.  There is really nothing not to like here.  the restaurant itself is great looking and will be wonderful when the weather warms up as all the walls are glass doors.  I thought alcohol was well priced or least the wine was as you get glasses starting at $6.  we shared the lettuce cups as an appetizer and they were quite tasty although messy to eat as are all the dishes that use lettuce as a tortilla.  I had the puttanesca with a twist--no anchovies--instead with ahi tuna--it was quite tasty and was a right sized portion.  My sister in law had a tofu curry--that also was quite flavorful--even though I am not a fan of curry and can take or leave tofu.  head the chocolate cake for dessert which was just right.  I will definitely go back-all in all a pleasant evening.

Love True Food Kitchen! The menu is seasonal and delicious. I left feeling healthy and happy. The portions are a bit small.. or my appetite is to big lol. But I would highly recommend going. It's a perfect place to have a party or a special event. The atmosphere is lovely and fresh. Our waiter Trevor was awesome. He was so attentive and polite, my whole table left really impressed with his service.

I'm a big fan of True Food Kitchens.  I've been to the one in Virginia,  San Diego and now here. What I love is I can great consistent food in different places. I came around 7 pm on a Saturday and it was packed and quite a wait but the tall tables had availability so I ate there. The edamame dumplings were delicious and my usual  kale salad with steelhead was awesome as well. We also got an order of hummus which I don't always like but this was really good. I'll be back when I'm in town again

Super stoked on this spot. Creative healthy menu options, fun drinks, loved the decor, great energy, wonderful service by Marco. Seasonal menu, transparent kitchen (even the walk-in), integrity in their product. Wish there were more restaurants like this out there. Try the ancient grains bowl, the grilled avocado, and the sparkling wellness tea. Those were my favorites!

My husband and I were so excited to find this restaurant in Phoenix! We like to eat 100% organic, and this place delivered excellent service, delicious food, and a really nice variety of dishes. The food was fresh and in season, and the servers were knowledgeable and very friendly. The parking is very easy and we were seated almost immediately. It would have been nice to have a little more intimacy, since the seating outside and inside is a fairly wide open floor plan. Also, since we are from NYC, we are used to the prices. However, I believe high quality food is worth the money. We felt great a long time after eating, not heavy or sleepy.  I'd highly suggest eating here!
I have been to multiple locations and the food doesn't disappoint. Very consistent and service is great.

One of my favorite places! :) nice ambience, healthy food and friendly staff!  The place has this super clean and healthy vibe to it and when you eat your meal, you can very well tell it's healthy and fresh! I love the red chili noodles, which I think they call as pad-Thai now.  Perfect place for brunch or early evening!
This place is a rip off. Stay away. If you want to drop $70 on a kale salad hummus and iced tea do it.
Come on guys this place deserves a 1 star!!! service sucks !food sucks!! we paid $60 for two people and left not satified. Even my 100 year old grandma makes better food!!!

Food was absolutely amazing and so was Hailey our server! My colleague and I ordered the edamame dumplings to start, which were amazing along with the skinny margaritas. I had the ancient greens and my colleague had the sausage pizza. Both cooked to perfection. I asked if the kale salad was good during our wait and she kindly brought me a small bowl to try! Super sweet. Overall, the best food and service I've had in a while!

Like the concept although somewhat contradictory. Food was over priced, service extremely underwhelming and beer/wine list poor and not even remotely local. The "bar" is laughable. Typical, pretentious, under-educated scene you would expect from a restaurant in a mall.

I love True Food's philosophy. It uses organic ingredients for necessary ingredients such as the dirty dozen and not for the clean 15 and so on. I love having nicer restaurants where I can go on nice dates or grab delicious drinks and I especially love being able to take my non-vegan friends here.   My favorites here are all the vegan options! That's the hummus (no cheese), lettuce cups, TLT, teriyaki brown rice bowl, and mushroom pizza without cheese (my vegetarian husband says it tastes better without the cheese anyway).  Drinks are all great, and the chia seed pudding is just the best! You can't go wrong with any of the options at True Food!

Love this place for lunch. I always start with the hummus, It is delicious and the pita wedges are fresh and you can tell they are made daily. For the entree, the turkey pita is my fav, and the Kale salad that accompanies the sandwich is a perfect compliment. The only drawback is the place is a bit loud and impersonal at lunch, not really ideal for intimate conversations or a business lunch. Overall it is a solid 4 stars.

I consider myself a pretty healthy eater but I was nervous when I read this menu. Thought wow is there anything on here my kids will eat and I'm starving need more than veggies. I ordered the street fare tacos 1 fish, 2 steak. The fish was ok but wow I loved the steak ones. The neat was perfectly cooked a medium rare, tender with just the right amount of veggies. I did say no cheese and sauces. I don't like my food flavors taken over with sauces. The corn tortillas tasted like sprouted corn not processed. The kids ordered chicken noodle soup and cheese pizza. The pizza looked great and they are every bite. The soup I would say noodles they just clumped together but the broth and chicken was on point. My husband said the chopped chicken salad and miso soup was yummy. The water is really good. Nice and clean and cold. We also ordered a lemonade it seemed to be sweetened with honey husband loved it. Best of all we felt good after we ate to go explore the museum district.

Their menu has so many excellent-sounding items, I had a very hard time deciding what to order. I gambled on one of their in-house juices (carrot-lemonade), and am so glad I did. I got the street tacos, and they were very tasty. I'm excited to see that they have locations in other cities; I'll be hunting them down to try more!

True Foods, a name I'd heard seven million times before finally stopping in as a part of my "AZ Healthfood Tour", this was my first visit to the Phoenix location and this place had a lot of hype to live up to. Unfortunately my experience left a bad taste in my mouth. My experience started around 8 p.m. on a Thursday night, I was sat by the restroom by a young man that smelled terribly of B.O., myself and the young lady I was with spent quite a bit of time laughing about the "V.I.P. restroom seat" we got.....with a dining room full of open seating. We were on our way to a show and decided to have something we could split,as people who frequent the Scottsdale Quarter location, we decided to break our norm and try a Margherita pizza.... we'd come to regret this, as the pizza took much longer than it should have on a night as slow as this one, and when it did show up, it was burnt. Not even a passable "well done", just flat out burnt. When our waiter passed back by our table ten minutes later I called for him and let him know the pizza had "missed its mark" and was a little over done. He responds "is it?", now I smiled because it clearly  was not fit to feed to anything, let alone anyone. He takes the pizza and we are soon visited by a manager who let us know she would take care of it for us, and that she was sorry. Not long after our second attempt comes out, and its burnt.....again.... in their defense it wasn't as bad as the first one but was still not very pleasing. At this point its so bad its funny, so we order our favorite Banana and Coconut chia pudding and jasmine tea, which was exactly what we needed to sweeten our experience up a bit. We decided not to have the rest of the pizza and called it a night. All in all, its not the Scottsdale location, but that Chia Pudding is a highlight. Still a fan of the brand, just cant see myself coming back to this location.

I came here last spring while visiting my sister and her husband. I started off with a cucumber refresher. The name does it justice because it's very refreshing but a bit pricey so I only got one. For starters we had a bit of hummus that was actually very good and for entree we had spaghetti squash casserole and the teriyaki brown rice bowl with chicken. Both were very good. The service is pretty good too, it was a really big party and they were very accomodating.  The atmosphere is cool. The prices are a bit steep. The cucumber refresher was like $5 for a thin glass and the casserole was like $15 for a portion a bit bigger then a french onion crock bowl.

Delicious! Great place. The crunchy kale salad and spaghetti squash casserole are fantastic.   The best veggie food I have had in quite a while. Service was great:friendly and very helpful.  I don't understand some of the bad reviews. It was   3/4 full when we were there and service was fast and cheerful.

This place may be my very favorite restaurant in Phoenix! I've been here more times than I can count, and have LOVED everything I've ordered every single time. So many fresh, healthy options available, and they are so accommodating of vegetarian and vegan diets, BUT also have good options for carnivores (my huz is obsessed with their grass-fed burger). True Food Kitchen was a game-changer for me when I first tried their kale salad years ago. It was the kale gateway for me, and ever since, I have sung the praises to people who "don't like kale", that if they tried salad they would change their mind. I even found their recipe for the salad online, and have made it a million times at home since.... but I still keep coming back and ordering it here. I can't recommend True Food Kitchen enough... this is a happy place for me :)

Why do they get 5 Stars you ask? Because they know how to feed you the right way. Put service and wait time aside, if we ate this way all day everyday, there would not be an epidemic of obesity, diabetes and clogged colon's here in America!  Yes their prices are high, they are always so packed it feels like your rubbing elbow's as you eat, BUT wat's most important is that their food is made of whole food ingredients, not canned, boxed, processed or pre made foods. They actually do it all right there in the dining room.  You will see them peeling fruits & vegetables right in front of you. It almost feels like we're all in the Kitchen.  What's good there? The Kayle salad W/Chicken, Kayle & mushroom pizza and the red curry chicken! Yum!!!

Yuck! The portions were TINY and the food really wasn't all that good. My friend and I both agreed that we should've just gone to Paradise Bakery because at least then we wouldn't have gone hungry and saved money given what we spent at True Food. I know it's supposed to be "healthy" and such, but it doesn't mean it's supposed to be bland, boring, or otherwise a waste of my daily calorie count.

I was in Scottsdale for work, and stopped here for dinner on the recommendation of a coworker.  A great recommendation it was!  I sat at the bar, and had excellent , fast, and friendly service.  I had the sea bass, and the honey lemonade, The sea bass fell apart in my mouth, it was flaky and the vegetables were perfect in flavoring and cooking consistency.  I savored every bite, and wished for a bigger glass of the lemonade.  The environment was cozy and clean and fresh.  I ate  my food as I just finished a hike, and was hungry.  I wanted more, but it was perfect, and I didn't really need more.  I think I'm going here every time I'm in Scottsdale now.

I stopped at True Food Kitchen with a girlfriend a few weeks ago in the Scottsdale Quarter.  We both started with a glass of wine and a generous portioned hummus appetizer. I then had a chicken salad and my girlfriend the tacos.  Everything was so deliciously organic and reasonably priced. I would definitely stop back for round two!
Unique and familiar healthy options. I suggest the cucumber honey lemonade refresher, margarita pizza and strawberry rhubarb crisp. Friendly knowledgable staff in an open outdoor space.

This is one of my big favorites in the valley! Have been here a lot of times and will not get tired of coming back! =)  Refreshing and organic food, lovely ambiance...=) We fell in love with this place after our very first trip in their location in Biltmore. There was quite a wait but it was well worth it. If you are looking for a new refreshing taste with choices for vegan and gluten allergic people, this is the place to be! The concept does not stay away from making their food delicious while using the freshest and most organic ingredients. I love bragging this place both to our local and out-of-towner friends. I've tried a variety of what they have to offer in the menu but my favorites are the Tuscan Kale and Chicken Chopped Salad, all types of pizza esp the one with goat cheese and the spaghetti squash casserole which is very light and healthy! For dessert, the flourless chocolate cake is just amazing! =) Service is fast and efficient. Pricing is fair plus they offer half order to some of the selection in the menu.   Great place for lunch and dinner! Will have to try their breakfast menu soon! =)
My favorite lunch spot! Try the quinoa burger and the edamame dumplings! We visit every time we head to Phoenix/Scottsdale. Highly recommend!

OK, this place is just a cool restaurant!  It has a very fun atmosphere that is laid-back and contemporary along with an "I care about organic stuff" attitude!   The food was very fresh and had lots of flavor!  I will be back to try more dishes.    Be sure to try their coffee which is some of the best I've had.  They make it especially unique by serving it to you in the Bodum double wall coffee cups.

True Food Kitchen has me hooked!! The food here was delicious. I wish I had a True Food Kitchen back home in Chicago. The decor is modern, with a beautiful juice bar lined up with the most eye pleasing fruits and vegetables.  I had the mushroom miso soup with tofu, this was probably my favorite miso soup I ever had. The tofu teriyaki brown rice bowl tasted great. Tofu was made just right. The inside out quinoa burger is amazing, will be back just for that!  The service was wonderful, our server Brandon was awesome he did a fabulous job, very knowledgeable & informative about the menu & restaurant. Love the patio seating too.

I have eaten at both and love the one in the Quarter's atmosphere.  Surprised to see overweight wait staff in light of the healthy food served--Now they can get an education on nutrition and chase tables to become fit!  Most of the food served on the menu is stuff that I can purchase at Whole Foods and make on my own at home, however, the lasagna was awesome and a few other dishes that take time to create are worth indulging in.   I think Dr. Weil is Overrated and a hefty no-exercise pontificate, but it's a Fox Concept restaurant and I think they all about big business with lots of money. What are they doing about creating a greener environment?   I prefer to spread my earnings to independent small businesses. Too bad someone cannot succeed or create what you see in the organic and clean ingredient restaurants that are commonplace in California. Hmmm, I may just have a business plan after I finish paying the student loans...

True Food has so much going for it - a well thought out menu, delicious flavor combinations, a killer kids' menu, and good service.    We've been many, many times, and have always enjoyed ourselves.  The Husband and I particularly like the menu coding system (vegetarian? gluten-free? you know EXACTLY what you can/can't order).  The mock-tails are deliciously refreshing... light, bright flavors that just taste good for you!  The Husband swears by the crudite appetizer... and even I, who doesn't always love the green things, really enjoyed it.  The curry dish is my personal fave, and the carne asada tacos are pretty darn good, too.  The kids' gluten-free pasta with red sauce, greens (kale??), and lots of cheese is enormous and totally worth the money.    A good stand-by place, especially when we're feeling like eatin' some healthy stuff :)

The grapefruit martini was extra sweet, and the mint leaves were always getting sucked up. Meanwhile, the bartender appeared a little put off when I didn't want dinner from the menu, just a cocktail. Might try again, if I find myself in Scottsdale again...

This is a tried and true place. Been many times over the years and it's always good. I actually love the vegetable crudités, essentially a giant bowl of delicious veggies and awesome dips. A little on the pricey side but not too bad.

The Food is incredible! Their Kale salad & Sweet Potatoes were delicious and I've never been a fan of either. I ordered the Inside Out Quinoa burger without the dairy, incredible taste, just awesome. They have gluten free options, vegan options, its a win win if you are health conscious.

This is a nice spot on the edge of a mall.  Headliner here is "great food, but very very loud" - so loud that you can't have a reasonable conversation over your meal.  I started with a drink - "the natural" - ginger, agave and soda.  This is a very refreshing drink.  I really wanted more, but it's a little expensive to have a lot of them.  We then moved on to an appetizer of caramalized onion tart, with smoked garlic, black fig & gorgonzola.  Again, very delicious, and definitely a keeper.  The main course was halibut street tacos, side of beans with cojita cheese and salsa.  These were just the right size for a lunch entree.    Everything has that organic thing going for it - fresh ingredients, well prepared.  If this place wasn't so loud, I would consider it for lunch every day I was in Phoenix.

This place has a great atmosphere and patio area. Its a great place to go to lunch with the girlfriends.  I like the whole concept of healthy organic foods. I wish more restaurants would incorporate this into their menu.  They have some really good juices and drinks. I feel like some of the items are a bit pricey. The salads are super fresh. The hummus was just okay... Would recommend as it is a great healthy concept.

Right in the middle of Scottsdale Quarter next to the movie theater and the kiddy splash pool. Place looks really cool with fresh herbs growing outside as you walk in and a big open kitchen you see once inside. The aroma of the food they are cooking is fantastic. I like the simplicity of the interior design as well as the cozy eating areas outside.  Ordered off the brunch menu today. Started with the Thai Shrimp Dumpling with Basil, Mint & Red Chili Sauce. The wife got the Breakfast Burrito with Egg, Turkey Sausage, Provolone, Anasazi Bean & Salsa. The daughter picked the Market Vegetable Scramble which was Sweet Potato Hash, Onion, Parmesan & Two Eggs. I ordered the Panang Curry with Chicken, Brown Rice, Potato, Broccoli, Ginger, Carrot, Mushroom & Coconut Shellfish Broth. Even tried out an Andy's Elixir drink with Sea Buckthorn, Agave Nectar & Soda.  We all generally agreed that the food lacked a level of flavor that could have been easily achieved with so many fresh items and the proper seasonings. With all the herbs growing around we expected more of them in the dishes. Would liked to have seen some Thai Basil in the Curry and maybe a little sprig of Mint in the drink, etc. The Eggs in the Burrito seemed a bit dry or overcooked and tasted chewy.  The service is very friendly and relatively quick. Our server looked like and sounded just like the guy in the movie Office Space but without the 37 pieces of flare. I told him that he was his twin double and he humorously giggled.  Very kid friendly. Bought the granddaughter in her stroller and they were most accommodating. They even hooked us up with some hot water to warm up her meal. Just wish it was a cup or a glass and not a bowl. Hmmm?  Lots of Gluten free Healthy items to pick from and several Vegan items if you wish. A little too Tready and way too much Spendy for this bad boy.  3.5 STARS
Yummy healthy food, consistently delicious! I never feel bad after eating here because I know I did something good for my body!
Fresh and tasty!  Home grown vegetables and healthy.  The chicken curry is amazing!

This place far exceeded my expectations! The food was incredible and so is the concept behind it! Spaghetti squash, pomegranate mojito, kids teriyaki and strawberry crumble...done for the night! I'm going to bed VERY happy. I'll be back!!

My wife and I love this restaurant! So many great, healthy, options on the menu. We live almost 50 miles from this location in Queen Creek. We only wish they'd make one closer. We love bringing our little girl because in addition to their great kids menu, she can share our entrées and appetizers. Great drinks, dessert, and atmosphere. Bre was a wonderful server!!

Definitely one of my favorite places when I'm in the mood to be healthy or just guilty because I ate horribly the day before.   During lunch hour, there is usually a wait so that's a bummer. On Saturdays, expect 25 min+ during lunch time.   We started with the cauliflower appetizer and both thought it was a good start. I've been on a cauliflower kick the past few months when we go out to eat so I thought it was good - not great.   I'm the type of person that likes a variety so that I can sample a bit of everything. So we shared the Grilled Chicken salad and the Spicy Noodle bowl with shrimp. The salad was refreshing and the farro gave it a nice texture. We enjoyed it and would order it again. The Spicy Noodle bowl is something I always order and I was a bit disappointed this time because the noodles seemed to be overcooked. Even though we had mushy noodles, it was still a great dish.   The weather is perfect right now to sit outdoors and people-watch so take advantage of that.

I don't even know how to begin. The ambience, the farm to table food, the menu itself, the well prepared food that comes to your table beautiful... just all amazing. Everything we ate rocked. Well done True foods, well done

Traveling for work can be tough on the diet, but I know whenever I visit Gabi M in Phoenix there are healthy meals in store for me  And sure enough my first stop in Phoenix was oh so healthy True Foods.  We sat on their lovely heated patio (gotta love that in mid March) and enjoyed the veggie crudite appetizer.  They freeze the veggies to make them extra tasty...mmm.  There's all sorts of unique juice options on the menu and I opted for the Ginger Nojito, highly recommended by our waitress.  Liked it, a lot!  As for my main entrée it was a tough decision between the miso cod and the spaghetti squash casserole, but the squash was calling my way.  It was mixed with organic tomatoes, zucchini,  and lots of fresh mozzarella cheese. It was (almost) as tasty as a plate of spaghetti and definitely a lot healthier!  Rumor has it they may be opening other locations and I'm crossing my fingers one of those is in Chicago!

You know, I have a bit of an issue with Fox restaurants in general.  They are all amazing to look at but the food is overpriced and frankly, mediocre.  True Kitchen lives up to the legacy. I'll certainly admit to being an avowed carnivore, I mean I'm the head cook on a competitive BBQ team-I love meat, but hey I will try anything. I went with a bunch of friends, it was one of their birthday dinners, and they are into the whole organic, vegetarian thing.  Perfect spot for them. The place is definitely cool with a great open atmosphere.  I tried their herb hummus for an appetizer which was okay, and the miso glazed black cod as an entree.  The cod was perfectly cooked, however the $22 price tag gets you a ~5 oz. portion with one baby bok choy and maybe two sliced mushrooms.  I didn't really get a big flavor impact either...

I was a little worried when my friend suggested this place.  I knew it was "healthy" and thought it would be just salads and weird stuff. Ha ha However, it was very tasty and had a large selection of choices on the menu.  The onion tart was awesome; I had the mushroom pizza also excellent.  My friend had the pasta which was also good.   I would go back for sure!

This place is AWESOME!!  I love their salads. Tried the farmers market salad today and it was so freshly and tasty, especially for summer!  I never feel guilty eating here - just wished it was closer!!

We went to True Food on Camelback for lunch. My husband had the asparagusand smoked mozzarella pizza ($11) and I ordered the steak tacos ($14).  While the food was good, it lacked in flavor. I am sure the finest organic ingredients were used but the beans that accompanied my street tacos were probably the tastiest part of both meals.  For the price and the portion size I would not recommend the same things we ordered. It might be my fault for ordering the steak tacos at a "shi-shi" restaurant but to be fair at $14 I was expecting the best steak tacos I've ever had. I mean at least filet mignon quality meat. At best the meat was a crusty black-seared ribeye, which isn't bad but could easily be made at home.  Cheaper and tasty alternatives: Two Hippies Pizza Shack and America's Taco Shop, both not too far away.

Great place to eat....great food and service, however.....it was fairly comfortable when we sat down because the misters were on...then 1 person complained because the seat was wet when they sat down.....so the shut the misters off...no fans to move the air and then it just got claustrophobic...maybe they should have moved and let the other 50 people enjoy the misters....

Every time I eat here it gets better! My favorite is the edamame dumplings as a appetizer! I wish it was a full course meal! The chicken chopped salad is really good too and the staff are wonderfully nice.

Probably one of the best places in the valley. I have to say everything is as healthy as it gets. I love that they serve food based on the local market. If you are ever in town, and looking for a healthy and organic breakfast, lunch, or dinner this is the spot!! :)
Service great, informative waiter. Food was amazing, tasty, healthy and unique. Atmosphere was also very good. Will definitely be going back if I can find one within close proximity to Philadelphia

Today a friend and I went to True Foods for brunch.  The rancheros were dry and bland.  I had to ask for extra sauce.  My friend had the grilled chicken salad that she enjoyed.  I asked for a chicken salad to go, it was half the size as the salad served to my friend.  One brunch dish, two salads, two ice teas, $60!

I was lucky enough to dine at True Food as part of Arizona Restaurant Week. We went during the week, so it was full, but not too busy. This restaurant had to be one of the best deals for all of Restaurant Week. In addition to the three courses, we also received a hummus appetizer for the table and each of us received one of their Natural Refreshers. The hummus plate was delish; the refresher was okay . . . I liked my wine better. =) Our server was very nice and super knowledgeable without being pushy.  There were four of us at the table and we each ordered something different so everyone could try as much as possible. I am so glad we did this! My appetizer was the Smoked Salmon, which was great with the wasabi peas. The Summer Chopped Salad was delicious and so large it could have been a meal! I did not order the Edamame Dumplings because the description did not sound interesting to me, however when I tried them I was surprised at all of the flavor from one dumpling.   On to the second course. The Gluten Free Spaghetti was good, as was the Tofu Curry. The Black Cod was all right too. My Steak Tacos, on the other hand, were fabulous! Steak was perfect; the beans that came with it were ok.  Dessert was the best! We tried four of them; my favorites (in order) were The Banana Chocolate Tart (very rich, must share), the Apple-Cranberry Crumble (the maple ice cream really makes the dish), the Lemon-Ginger Frozen Yogurt (sweet, tart, and cold), and the Lemon Olive Oil Cake (very light, fluffy, and delicious)!  Not sure how soon I will make it back as it is not an easy drive for me, however if someone else is planning an outing, I would love to go!

Came in for lunch with a colleague on Friday. Ordered their non alcoholic sparkling green tea, which is phenomenal! Also enjoyed the salmon kale salad. Everything was good, but for lunch the timing seemed off. We were waiting a bit for the check and for boxes etc. They were pretty busy so no harm no foul, but if you're in a hurry keep that in mind!

AWESOME Food!  one of my fav places in Scottsdale.  I prefer the Biltmore location because the Quarter can be a bit too snooty / congested for me.  But both locations are great and highly recommended.

True Foods, love your concept - your food is pretty stellar too...however, I think you should consider either lowering your prices or bulking up your plates.  Regardless of the portion size and obesity issues in the U.S. you're healthy food isn't as filling as it should/could be.  I ordered the Tuscan Salad with chicken and my dining companion opted on ordering the edamame dumplings for our starter.  I enjoyed both of the items but didn't feel full (once again, I know it seems like I'd be a hefty gal after all my restaurant reviews and portion size issue but that's not the case!)  I'll end this review on a good note and say the latte that I had after my meal was incredibly, raw sugar cube and all.  Hope this helps with your decision to dine or dash, if you're feeling a lighter fare with meager portions this is the place for you.
I stopped coming here for months after they took the pan seared seabass off the menu.  Back in tonight.  Glad its back.
I love this place! The Kale salad is amazing! One of my favorite for healthy dining!

Just ate here for the first time this mothers day. The server was knowledgeable, suggestive and friendly. The place is super clean. The food was great! The only reason it didn't get 5 stars was the portion sizes did not make up for the pricing.

Ok first off, with the demise of Soma and the fact that Green is in Tempe.....this place is a welcome sight, and I know I'll be back. The food is excellent. However I feel that Dr Weil has has has the wool pulled over his eyes by Mr. Fox. Come one "Anazazi Beans" and a drink called the "Medicine Man"? Really- as an American Indian rights advocate you'd think we'd be past this. Actually, you'd think educated white men with lots of money would be past this --but ya know. Just because Anazazi really refers to Ancestral Pueblo people who lived mainly in NM and N. AZ and means "ancient enemy" in Navajo so that term isn't used by nearly ANYONE anymore...means that you probaby shouldn't call your dish by that name. Other than that- I give em props for trying.  I recently had another experience there where EVERYTHING was going wrong that night, and the staff recovered....kinda. My advice, shape up if ya wanna last.

My favorite place to go for health-conscious, fresh food. The ambiance is warm and inviting, and the staff is so great. They're prompt, attentive, and helpful with the menu. The bison burger is a must do for the meat eaters, and the market salad for the vegetarians (or someone looking for a great green). Hummus and pitas are my go-to starter. You will NOT regret this. Worth the wait every time.

I really really liked True Food but they changed their menu and it's not as good anymore. I used to love coming here but now I may not come back due to the menu change. The service is always top notch though! Please bring back the Hangover Rx drink and other menu items!

OMG THIS PLACE IS DIVINE. I seriously died and went to heaven. Can I eat here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner every day? I am a healthy foodie and this place meets all my needs. I get anxiety eating out because I always worry about food quality eating out but I know I am getting the best of the best and it tastes good too!

Don't order take out. There portions are so small. I was really disappointed. My chicken was literally raw inside, the service was crap, they forgot my dressing. All I ordered was sides and a piece of grilled chicken. Simple enough...I thought. Stick to the other location till they get all there kinks worked out.   The Biltmore location is much more laid back and not nearly as trendy and wannabe hollywood.  The waitstaff is much more together and the portions are consistent. Im staying with that location.

The only reason I'm changing my review is for the best waiter ever. Seriously. I have never had service in Arizona as good as his. John is an amazing waiter who clearly takes pride in his work. This to me is hard to come by. When you get good service it just makes everything taste better :)  My mom and I are very picky eaters...no oils, no dairy, no wheat or gluten. He was very understanding and didn't make us feel like changing around the menu was a bother (it has to be). He was on top of everything. Anticipated every want or need.   If you eat here, ask to sit in Johns section. It will be a great experience!

Of course, everyone was likely on their best behavior the night a friend and I tried True Food because Dr. Weil was sitting at the table next to us.  So the service we experienced could not have been better...and I love it when food is served "complimentary."  Love it.  To tell you the truth, I do not remember the prices, I remember the food.  I loved that the meal and pairings choices were different, and I have never had better fish anywhere.  It was so wonderfully flavorful!  The restaurant is clean and sparse, yet beautiful, and not pretentious by any means.    I will return!

I LOVE this place!  I usually avoid any restaurants that have gluten free or veggie friendly menus since I'm as true as a carnivore as you can get.  However, this place has absolutely amazing food, service, and drinks.  It's a relaxing atmosphere with fresh, healthy food that doesn't sacrifice flavor or appetite.  Both alcoholic drinks and nonalcoholic drinks are equally superb!

Very clean food! Fun atmosphere. We sat outside but if you are inside you can see the whole kitchen! Which I find to be pleasantly comforting. Our table ordered the kale salad, delicious, fresh, great portion size!  We also had the dumplings with creamy edamame inside. Heavenly! We ordered the carrots cooked to perfection! I also tried their chipotle Bloody Mary... it's intense but midway through my drink I was sold! Finally we ordered the chocolate vegan cake with coconut ice cream cake. It  was out of this world! Clean and delicious comes to mind with this restaurant. Also this is a fox restaurant chain so if you work for any of their other restaurants you are eligible for a discount. I would definitely return when visiting Scottsdale!
This place is awesome. Really great food ad they cater to customers like me with dietary restrictions. I will definitely be back :-)

My husband and I recently went here for a date night and I was blown away with how amazing this place is. It was our first time visiting the Scottsdale quarter. We were able to make a reservation online through open door. When we first arrived we were instantly greeted and sat within a few minutes. You can see the kitchen from inside the restaurant which I really liked and all of the fresh ingredients that they use. The waitress (Tiffany) was so friendly and attentive the whole time. I had the curry dish with chicken and shrimp and my husband ate the margarita pizza! They were both so delicious. I also tried the sangria cocktail and it was amazing! The food came out within ten minutes of ordering which never happens at any of the places that we eat lol. We will definitely be back for another visit.

I'm not sure what all the fuss is about over FOX Restaurants to me they are just ok but my recent experience at True Foods was so bad by the end of the night I just had to laugh. First off the Hostess never even looked up to greet us. And when we told her how many in the party her reply was "well dammit" -really I though her job was to greet us not be a brat. It took 15min for us to be greeted at the table by the waiter. When our food came the bread was so hard that I could not even eat my sliders. Then I noticed a long black hair in my Sweet potato hash. I called over the waitress and showed it to her and explained that the bread was stale. Her response was "what would you like me to do--bring you a new bun?" I politely requested some Hash w/o hair and said I would just  eat the tuna  w/o bread. She took my plate and returned it with only ONE slider--I had only had a bit out of one! She jipped me! We paid left our food and got out of there.  If I'm going to pay this much for food I would rather go somewhere else. If you are looking for healthy food try Seasons 52. We went last week and it was GREAT!
Love this place! Another good Fox Concept! Great to being your vegan or vegetarian friends along.

I won't give them Five Stars only because they kept forgetting my coffee and I was pretty much Hangry and hadn't had any coffee that day yet. But there food was FANTASTIC. A friend and I shared the salad that was the Autumn Salad? ( I forgot the name) Once we got the coffee (which was also delicious) I was in bliss. The place was pretty spacey and the staff was nice. We got the flourless chocolate cake and that was absolutely heavenly. I will for sure be going back

I've gone here a couple times and the reason I keep coming back is their bison burger. Other than that, I feel like everything else I've tried is pretty bland. They do have a cucumber drink and that's really good, but I feel like I can finish my drink in 10 seconds, half the glass is filled with ice. It does have a nice vibe though, feel like I'm in California.

I have avoided this place since it opened, because I was worried that it was too much of a scene.  I really just want to eat good food, and I don't care about who else is eating around me.  Anyway, I was wrong to avoid True Food.  I went for the first time last night, and it was terrific.  The food was great--not too fussy or freaky, but just yummy.  We had a mushroom pizza and soup.  We sat on the patio, which was very nice at this time of year.  But best of all was the service.  I don't usually gush over waiters, but ths group was terrific--attentive, kind, helpful, but not in-your-face.  Just great.  If you like green tea, the iced green tea here is a winner.
The menu changes with the season. I have food allergies and the wait staff is always helpful. The pizzas are great, the salads are transcendental. The lemon bars are amazing.

I wrote a review about True Foods a couple of months ago and it wasn't in their favor. I received a very nice email from them advising that my review was appreciated and while I didn't have a great experience, they would certainly like me to give their establishment another shot. After all, they pride their restaurant in great customer service and excellent food quality and they want their guest to return. I was provided a gift card to try it again and today was the day for me to see if my last experience was a fluke or if my experience was not uncommon.  Since I was by myself, I sat at the bar and was greeted by a friendly smile and immediate service. Already a better experience. I ordered the same thing as last time, grass-fed beef with no mayo nor bun and a kale salad without breadcrumbs. My food swiftly came out, but when I bit into the medium burger their was an abundance of char. Since I know that some restaurants like to char their burgers I asked the bartender if this was the way the burger was supposed to be cooked. It was cooked medium, as I asked, it was just charred on the outside. He immediately took my plate, apologized and advised he would get me a new dish. That was not my intention, but the proactivity and eagerness to please his customer was apparent. Within a short time a manager, named Desiree, approached me with my new order and graciously thanked me for my patience and apologized for how my previous burger came out. When I placed my cards on the table to pay the tab, I was brought a check without an amount due. Desiree again approached me thanking me for coming in.  I can tell you that my experience today was one that I will always remember, in a positive way. It's not about them taking care of the tab, it's 100% about the fact that my bartender took ownership without me asking for my burger being sent back, the manager apologizing for the mistake, my second meal tasting absolutely amazing, and having an optimal customer experience. I will be back and hope that others will read this review and give True Foods a try.  Well done, True Foods! Thank you for an amazing customer experience and a delicious lunch!

We ordered takeout and got the following:   Butternut Squash pizza (smoked onion, organic kale, vegan almond ricotta, dried cranberry)  House-Made Chicken Sausage pizza (organic tomato, roasted fennel, scamorza)  Ancient Grains bowl (miso glazed sweet potato, turmeric, charred onion, snow pea, grilled portobello, avocado, hemp seed)  Grass-Fed Burger (umami mushroom, caramelized onion, arugula, Parmesan, mayonnaise, flax seed bun) with side of Sweet Potato Hash   The Butternut Squash pizza was amazing - was very impressed by the vegan almond ricotta. House-Made Chicken was average, as was the burger and Sweet Potato Hash (bit dry). The bowl was mediocre and small on the portion side. Wish the glazed sweet potatoes were cooked a bit more. Overall, an okay experience. Maybe better if we dined in.

Yes...it's true, I found this place after devouring 8 Krispy Kremes over the weekend!  The visit was a detox! I searched for a place to dine where I would feel healthy and guilt-free after a weekend of indulgence, and I felt like I was dining with Bugs Bunny after I was served a heaping of fresh veggies...aka Crudités.  Then came the fresh fruit "elixir"...the Cucumber & Honey Lemonade...awwww  Oh, the Turkey Lasagna w/Spinach wasn't bad either.  The servers were friendly, and the atmosphere refreshing - like the drinks (non-alcoholic...this time) ;-)  Can't wait to go back!

This is one of my very favorite places!  The service is awesome and all the waiters I've had have been cool and competent.  The food is creative and healthy, and they have a smart menu with a variety of great choices, vegan and otherwise.  I can't get enough of this place and will be returning often!

This place really paid attention to details and flavor.  I would recommend the Bison short ribs and the brown rice teriyaki bowl.... DELICIOUS!!! Atmosphere- open and casual.  SERVICE IS OUTSTANDING!!!

Been to True Food on several  occasions. The service is very good and people are friendly.   I appreciate healthy meals and their menu has a lot of good choices.  For a normal guy, the portions are pretty small.  So I always leave hungry.  I wouldn't mind ordering additional appetizers or entrees, but the prices are high for the portion sizes served.   It can be a little pretentious, but in general I enjoy the atmosphere.  Probably not go back.

I must say I loved the food. Just didn't like the after effects. went with a group of 4. all samples the shrimp dumplins, Edamame dumplins, tasted the sashimi salad, I ordered the Sea Bass Street tacos. All was tasty - Sea bass slightly over cooked. Service was weak at the start and ok at the end. The highlight was the Edamame dumplings...but I've got to tell you...I have paid for it ever since. 3 of the 4 people had stomach issues and it isn't pretty if you know what I mean. Now 24 hours after and I still am on the pot...healthy food certainly cleans you out.

I had been eyeing this place since I moved to Scottsdale. I love the location within Scottsdale Quarter. I went on a Friday around 5pm and there was no wait.  My husband had a gluten intolerance so we were pretty excited by their menu. Hubby ordered the turkey lasagna and it was a big portion and he liked it!  I ordered the winter salad that I liked, but I didn't love it. I prefer the version you can get a sauce down the street. We did order the honey lemonade which we sent back. Did not like that at all. I like honey,  but it was too much.  The kids cheese pizza was delicious and so was my grapefruit martini - both wins. I like True Kitchen and will go back.

Where do I start?!  The True Food Kitchen is superb. It all started with the fresh house made juice. I chose the "Kale Aid" .  I thought it was very hydrating and delicious all at the same time. At first look I thought it would be a vegetarian rest. but it's actually more of a "anti-inflammatory" restaurant where they focus on healthy dishes that do more good than harm on your body. A nutritionist by the name of Dr Weil is the founder. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. We sampled multiple dishes. One that I ordered was called "Panang Curry". If you like thai peanut sauce get this. Overall...great experience. Thanks Dr Weil!

Sam Fox is a genius.  Period.  I have been to several Fox restaurants (Blanco, Culinary Dropout, Sauce, North, The Greene House, Zinburger) and not a single one has left me disappointed.  My boyfriend and I have eaten at True Food Kitchen at least a dozen times, and every time the food and service is outstanding.  I love the seasonal change of menu items, including the beverages. During the fall, they had a cinnamon grapefruit soda which was surprisingly delicious (I had never had cinnamon in a cold, bubbly beverage before), and most recently I had the strawberry rhubarb soda. The cucumber refresher is the best drink on the menu. It is exactly as it's name states: refreshing and so, so delicious.  We always get the herb hummus and the edamame dumplings for starters.  The hummus has a great flavor and is served with warm pita bread and a small blend of onion, cucumber, feta and black olives. The dumplings are nice and light, they make a perfect appetizer.  The pizzas are great, the chicken chopped salad and autumn ingredient salad are both delicious and have just the right amount of dressing.  My boyfriend has had the bison burger and thought it was alright.  I didn't try it, but the sweet potato hash that it came with was really good.  He has also had the rainbow trout and loved it.  More often than not, he orders the street tacos with steak and clears his plate within five minutes. The roasted chicken, turkey lasagna or spaghetti squash casserole are perfect if you're looking for some comfort food.    If you love this restaurant, I highly recommend picking up the True Food cookbook.  The hummus, chicken chopped salad and spaghetti squash casserole are just a few of the many recipes you can find in the book.    This is by far our favorite restaurant in the valley.  I only wish they would open one in Salt Lake City so we can get our fix once we move in a few months!

VERY nice staff! Prices are reasonable for "healthy" food. Lots of options and alternatives. We went there for a celebration of friends and their medical school accomplishments and arrived about an hour before closing. Our waitress was very accommodating. We stayed till well passed closing and they folks were great about it. I have been to the one in Newport beach and had a similarly nice experience.

Had turkey burger with kale salad and sweet potato hash.   Turkey was moist and had tomato, onion, cheese, avocado, and a jalapeno sauce on it. The kale salad was also great. My sweet potato was a little salty for my taste, but honestly everything else was on point.   Service was quick and polite. Definitely recommend!
I am not a vegetarian and the bison burger is outstanding. Kale salad is very good as well.

True Food serves up some bougie, and supposedly healthy, options.  Their dishes look and taste great.  I really enjoyed my tuna sliders with sweet potato hash and kale. However, portions are small and you'll get hungry again sooner than you should for the price you pay. Know this going in and you won't be disappointed. Nice to see cooks prepping your fresh veggies out in the open.  Our server started off doing a good job, but then disappeared somewhere so we had to flag down other servers.   Overall, this was a good place to try one time but it won't be on my list of regulars.

I loved this place! I got the Mediterranean chicken pita and it was so delicious and healthy. I love having healthy options that also feel like comfort food. The service was great too, no complaints! I will definitely come back

i LOVE this place. I have taken so many people here and the response has been unanimous: cool atmosphere and AMAZING food. This place is great for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Don't be surprised if you have to wait.  I love the natural refreshments like "the natural," fresh ginger + agave + soda. I always get the harvest chopped salad because it is so yummy. i always try and push myself to order something other than the organic ricotta ravioli because i should try other dishes. But it's difficult!  The ravioli is scrumptious!  Like, lick the plate good.   My only complaint is the dessert. I had the flourless chocolate cake.
