Other favorites are Red Chili Noodles, Spaghetti Squash Casserole, Kale Salad, and my boyfriend loves the turkey burger. I always crave this place and I hope they continue to thrive.
This place use to be amazing but, I feel like it slightly went down hill.  I still love the concept though and some of their unique dishes/drinks.

Food was really flavorful and not overly greasy.  We did takeout.  It was fast and easy.  The only issue was finding the place.  They need more signage on the major roads to show how to get there.  My wife and I are pretty choosy about eating out because of some health challenges.  My wife is gluten intolerant, has allergies to cooking oils and a bunch of other things.  True Food was very accommodating AND the food tasted great.  Great place to go if you want something tasty and healthy.

Loved this place. So difficult to find vegan/vegetarian places when we travel but True Food had a great selection of everything for all types of eaters. Food was awesome, service was fantastic, will definitely be going back!
Very good atmosphere, food was quality and had excellent flavor. The only problem was the price, you have to pay extra for meat.

With my new vegetarian diet, I can no longer get the turkey bolognese that I had previously raved about.  I ended up here last week and decided on the tofu curry and it was totally a win.  I barely even missed the previously favorite meat dish!  Everything from my previous review still applies.

I absolutely love the food and atmosphere but in the 3 times I have been to this location, the service has been terrible. I waited 45 minutes for a salad and another 20 minutes to get my credit card back after I paid as I watched my waiter serve other guests.

Love it, the food is great, the seating, the servers, quality of food is really fresh and light, they don't have anything that is greasy, their lasagna, I'm not a lasagna person if not made by my wife, but this True Foods lasagna is fabulous.   Love this place.

A couple of beers, a chicken sausage pizza and an order of spaghetti squash...what a great lunch in a posh location.  A much needed escape from a really hot summer day.  Our very helpful server  went through the entire food pyramid, and told us about Dr. Weil's quest to serve tasty healthy foods while utilizing his pyramid.  Truthfully, healthy was just a bonus and hopefully helped to fight off the negative effects of the two beers I downed however I did think that the food was really fresh and full of flavor.  So much so, that I find myself driving around my home town of Oahu wishing we had one of these restaurants here.  The decor lends itself to a mod industrial green vibe with tan wooden floors, metal chairs white stone counters and pot lights you might see in a 1930's meat packing plant.  Very chic, and very Scottsdale.  Apparently they have a good breakfast and dinner menu as well.  I'll make sure to come back next time I'm in town.  In the mean time, I'll just keep hoping one comes to Honolulu.

So I had no idea about this place before I showed up, other than it's my Phoenix based friend's *favorite* place and she's willing to drive an hour to get to it.   I love healthy eating, and was intrigued by the lunch menu, which ranged from really different salads (I live in the mountains - kale & lemon is decidedly exotic).  The plates that came out all looked so appetizing, and slightly higher end cuisine than the health food I'm accustomed to seeing.    My friend is a kale addict, so we had the kale salad and the kale & roast garlic pizza.  The salad was terrific, much better than my lame attempts at taming raw lacinato kale.  Our server must have been new (or frazzled) for we never received the 'Andrew Weil' card about the philosophy of the place.  The only reason I figured out he was involved was when I saw him sitting not 10 feet from me at a booth across the aisle, chatting amiably with his table mates, in a white apron.   Phoenix celebrity sighting!  Overall I really liked the concept of the place, and while one lunch there doesn't give me a full picture, it, more than anything else I experienced in this city, would encourage me to come back to the desert.  For someone who loathes temperatures above 70 degrees, that should be considered high praise.

I enjoyed the atmosphere and the service was great. However, the food was drenched in oil and really left both my husband and I uninterested in returning. We were so hoping to love this place because as vegans, there are so few healthy restaurants in the valley.

I used to love true food, but lately the quality has been terrible. Nothing tastes fresh, items are overcooked, dry, tasteless. It has been highly disappointing. I used to go here all the time, and now any time someone suggests it I decline and suggest somewhere else. I hope they fix whatever is going on.
Healthy options for both vegetarians and meat eaters. I love their non alcoholic drinks.

It is weird that I do not have a review for True Food Kitchen, seeing as I know I wrote one for their fabulous bison burger I inhaled ( hmm I mean ate slowly) over a year ago. I was just here again last week literally days before my lovely friend Melissa had her beautiful baby girl Isla! We had a chance to catch up while she enjoyed a huge bowl of Panang Chicken curry and I once again snarfed down a bison burger with half kale and half sweet potatoes ( I will admit I only ate half my burger and took the rest home to enjoy the next day). I swear if you have not enjoyed a bison burger from True Food Kitchen, your a really missing out. It is a lean cut of meat and it was cooked medium rare. Topped off with some onions and a little mayo on a Parmesan flax seed bun and washed down with Pomegranate limeade sweet baby Jesus I was in heaven! Ok now that I have made myself hungry once again, scoot your booty on over and check out their menu. It is healthy and good for you so that in itself lets you know that you are already winning before you place order!

Great food...great service...and they even brought out a little birthday surprise!!! You get the best feeling when you leave here because of the things we're stuffing inside of us!!! I would recommend this place to anyone even to the nay sayers...you have to try this place and you will be turned!!!! We will be back as always !

Thoroughly impressed with this place! Good atmosphere good service and quality food! I'm a picky eater and had lots of questions and the wait staff was great! I could taste the freshness of the veggie appetizer that was suggested To us! Will definitely be going back for more!

Bison Burger was great, I highly recommend it. Also got the hash side which was excellent. I was in a huge rush and they got me my food in 10 minutes. The ingredients clearly are a good combination, maybe it's just brilliant branding, but it tasted healthier... Cool building too!

$22.95 for your deliciousness? SIGN ME UP. Can I get frequent diner points or even a fast pass so I can get seated sooner?   Every time I go... you do not fail me. Amazing service, stellar food (hey, I'm vegetarian... it's yummy!) and a fun, dynamic atmosphere.  When we went the other day, it was Saturday night and we were seated right away which impressed me.   If able to be seated outside... you should. The people watching alone is priceless. And while I am not one of "those" pretty people, I think that is what I appreciate about here--I can come in my bermuda shorts, flip flops and polo without shame.  Our waiter the other day was hilarious and didn't rush us to complete our meal despite the extensive pile up outside. And while yea, it's a Fox restaurant, I don't care. They offer classy vegetarian (no, I don't eat fish) dishes not found elsewhere. For me, this matters.

A friend of mine recommended eating here. I was not disappointed.  Cool fun atmosphere,  friendly service,  creative menu. The food was very good.   I look forward to eating here again the next time I'm in Phoenix.

This is not my type of restaurant; one that touts a medically proven diet and has a funky new decor. I was afraid this was a big box restaurant and I'm still not sure that it isn't. The drink I got was very good, a cucumber lemonade that wasn't too sweet. The turkey burger was OK, not much flavor, but the sweet potato hash was really tasty. I had a bite of my friend's kale salad which surprisingly masked the bitter taste of kale. The price was what I expected, but I would be reluctant to return in the near future.

We spent 3 nights in Scottsdale, and we found ourselves here 2 of those 3 nights! Oh my gosh, what a fantastic spot wit diverse options, especially if you like a healthy twist on your meals. Not to mention, it is located in the Scottsdale shopping quarter and the ambiance is gorgeous with their glass walls and brightly lit palm trees on the perimeter.  The lighting in the evening is mostly dim, and just really adorable. People were here for anything to everything from work dinners to dates to family dinners out. We came here straight from the airport on our first night and were dressed veryyy casually and didn't feel like we didn't belong in this lovely restaurant in a fairly upscale area. The waiters and waitresses were kind and extremely helpful. We all had difficult times deciding what we wanted to order from the multiple mouth watering options, and they helped!   I had been sick with a terrible cough and a half present voice. I had the adaptogenic tea both nights and it was AMAZINGLY soothing, and just really, really tasty. It had a hint of lime and ginger - exactly what I needed both times on chilly nights.  The first night I ordered Moroccan chicken and it was some of the best grilled chicken I've ever had. Not to mention, it had pureed figs on top and was in a chickpeas sauce. So flavorful and amazing! I cleaned my plate. The second night I had cashew Pad Thai which was also excellent. Im always wary of how non-Asian places do Pad Thai, and while this was also a fusion entrée, it was still fairly true to the flavor of the noodles. I'd say it was the vegetables that were a little more nontraditional with it, but still amazing. The cashews instead of peanuts were also a great twist!  For dessert we had the flourless chocolate cake with ice cream both nights --- it was SO GOOD. It was rich and cocoa-packed, and probably the size of a cupcake in case you're wondering. It is good for one dessert-loving person or to be shared between two people.   We also tried the squash pie, which as strange as it sounds, was great. If you like pumpkin pie, you'll love this as well! Its maybe a little bit sweeter than pumpkin pie, but same consistency.   Overall, I highly recommend True Food Kitchen!! There is something here for everyone! Also very vegan or vegetarian friendly.

I'll agree that the fairly unique menu at True Food is what will draw folks in and the decor is beautiful, but the sales nature of the service and the talk up of menu items is enough to make me pause before I think about heading back. I enjoyed the ahi sliders but didn't feel like I couldn't get them somewhere else for less money and less pushy service.  That said, I think people need to give True Food a try and decide for themselves. It's a beautiful restaurant and having a place that serves healthy, albeit somewhat pricey, food is important in our fast food nation. On the plus side, the Natural Refreshment drinks are delicious. Especially the Cucumber Refresher. But at $4, I wouldn't mind a free refill. I may not head back while the memory of my not truly terrible, but not terrific experience is fresh, but I'll give it some time and reconsider.

I come here about every other month, and it's always simply perfect.  Presentation, food quality, and the cooking itself are all simply perfect.  I've never had a meal that's less than awesome.  They have some really creative combinations that give you unexpected tastes along with a very well balanced meal.  Service is always good, and the patio is great for most of the years since it's well shaded.  It's far from cheap, but worth it.

I went to True Food Kitchen this weekend expecting to eat healthy dishes with little taste... luckily I was disappointed! The food here is AMAZING!    We started with a sampling of appetizers:   There's the chicken sausage pizza- one of the better chicken pizzas I've had in a long time. They have CPK beat! The tomato fennel sauce was tangy and the chicken was very flavorful.   Next was the edamame dumpling appetizer. The edamame paste inside was good, but the sauce they were served in was so 'delish', it made this appetizer superb!   Mealtime: My sister and I split two dishes, the Panang curry and the Red Chili Shrimp. Actually, the kitchen split it for us (score!) since neither of us could decide between the two dishes. As a Curry lover, I was pleasantly surprised at how flavorful the curry was. It had just the right amount of Zing in it, was creamy and overall delicious. I think I have a new favorite dish! While the red chili shrimp was tasty, it was less bold (and memorable) than the curry.   For someone who dragged her feet thinking of eating at a 'healthy food restaurant'- I can't wait to eat there again!

This place is beautiful inside and out, with out a doubt it caught my attention. Now I'm a meat guy but wanted to treat my girl who prefers veggies and healthy over my steaks and bbq. This place popped up and let me tell you, ITS AMAZING. I got the vegetarian squash lasagna and I'm hooked, the flavor, the texture and I'm feeling full from it. If you haven't tried this place, you definitely need to. Yum!

This restaurant is not a good place for a vegan, or anyone that enjoys a relaxing atmosphere to have a meal. The selection is slim and what is offered is salty, bland and lifeless. This is a place that people either love or hate and let's just say I didn't love it.  You could get a vegan pizza at whole foods for cheaper and it's so much better than any of the food here. The waiter also took a long time to serve us and I didn't even go at a busy time it was 3pm on a Sunday.  This is one restaurant I will never be going back to.

Loved all the vegan options and that the servers were attentive to my allergies! Speedy and friendly service was notable, and the atmosphere is super awesome with wood tables, plants, and open sight lines into the kitchen!  We got the vegan chioggia beet bruschetta appetizer and we loved the texture and refreshing flavors! I tried the ancient grains bowl for my entree and the mister had the grass-fed burger. Both tasted good, but weren't too extraordinarily. The vegan coconut flan and key lime pie were both decent too!  Would eat here again!

Yum yum yum.  Humus- unbelievable. Mojito - best ever. Salmon- delicious.  Steak tacos- I die ( gotta say that like Rachel Zoe) Apple cranberry crumble dessert with maple ice cream - I'm stuffed. Best yet? You walk away patting yourself on the back for being a good boy/girl and eating a healthy ( but certainly yummilicious) meal.  Mom would be proud.

Tried a number of dishes- Chicken Salad, Spicy Panang, Ancient Grains, and the Red Chili Noodles. The concurrence of our group of 4 was Meh! Why would we ever go back to this overpriced, under qualitied place? It's not that they were all bad- they were just kind of blah. Not a lot of flavor in the salad, Ancient Grains was tiny and looked like what it was, a mish-mash of a random assortment of stuff, none of which really wowed us. All in all a disappointment, although the restaurant looked cool. If you are looking far a place that looks good and don't care about the food, this could be the place for you.

Shout out to the late night crew at TFK in the Biltmore! I came in for a last minute birthday on the 17th of January and was pleasantly greeted by management. She was a delightful and gave excellent recommendations on what to try and really enhanced our experience. The service was incredible and the food was on point! Thank you for making it a special night, you know I will be back again soon.

Elif A. dragged me up to Scottsdale for lunch recently.  The atmosphere is great- very open and relaxed. We ordered a salad and the organic tomato and roasted vegetable vegan pizza (we un-veganized it with cheese) and split both. Very tasty and very filling.  The service was friendly. Even though they were busy, they were really on top of it. I'll be back for more.
This place is awesome. The food is delicious. The atmosphere is inviting. The staff is always super friendly. I highly recommend the kale salad with chicken its delicious!

I love the food here. I've been to one in San Diego and it was just as good. Although, I do have to admit that our server at this location looked a little worn out. I could tell that she was tired and ready to get the hell outa there.   We were sat right away a week from today on the patio. Upon being sat we noticed that they were nearing closing time. I ordered the medicine man drink and we started with a vegetable crudites but substituted the hummus. The server forgot to sub it but it was remedied right away.   I did, however, love my medicine man drink.   To follow I got the chicken chopped salad. It definitely was an amazing salad. I loved the sweetness of the dates along with the sharp flavor of the champagne vinaigrette.  Nearing the end of our dinner we were offered dessert. Normally one would wait until the guest is all finished but we weren't too bothered. We were full anyways! haha. I thought it was a nice gesture of the server to offer us free food and drink that was going to be thrown out anyways. I love how they try not to waste!

Much to my surprise I enjoyed my lunch today.  The company of a couple girlfriends didn't hurt.  I had the turkey burger with a side of a 1/2 kale salad and 1/2 sweet potato hash.  Everything was very flavorful and filling.  Typically I find the portions small here but the burger definitely filled me up. I would not have a drink as they are greatly overpriced $4 for a lemonade.

Delicious vegan options - loved the TLT sandwich with a simple, flavorful kale salad on the side. Service was fast and friendly and the overall vibe was just the right amount of low-keyness. That's a word, right?

The place is absolutely delicious! I started off with Kale drink! Loved the ginger in it. Then we ordered the guacamole with pita chips , really good! Ended it with the Mediterranean Salad and that hit the spot. I left full but without the heavy feeling. I will be back to try other stuff in the menu.
Delicious food, thoughtfully conceived and prepared, nicely presented. Delicious nonalcoholic cocktails. I'll be back!

Decent ambiance.  I had the turkey lasagna, and it was pretty good, but a bit on the small side.  No draft beers.  Service was good, not over the top good, but good.  I just don't feel that there is anything about the place that pulls me back.  It's just..okay.

Daughter and husband took my wife and myself here for dinner. Really enjoyed the night with local beers and very good healthy food. Surprised how great tasting the organic and locally grown food was prepared. will be coming back for more.

The continued demise of the shaved turkey pita......  Today I made the mistake again of ordering the shaved turkey pita for takeout.  The pita was different. It was not soft as it should be. It was hard and ripped when it was folded. They no longer include grapes which were a nice touch. The sauce is different....bad different. The tomatoes are now slices not the tasty little cherry tomatoes. The cucumbers used to be thin slices and now are chunks. BUMMER. Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me. My bad. Will now search elsewhere. I really hope TFK gets it together because the concept is great, they've just missed the execution one too many times.

Admittedly I was looking for something with a bit more 'local flavor' on my quick work trip to Scottsdale, but my group was craving True Foods, and it did not disappoint. With temps upwards of 90 degrees, it was the perfect combo of light, refreshing, an satisfying.   We tried many apps which were all great - edamame dumplings, beet bruschetta, guac and chips. My entree was one of the grain bowls + steelhead salmon. I thought everything was tasty and flavorful. Also, our waitress was delightful.   Highly recommend for a casual, relaxing and healthy meal!

I'll start by saying I absolutely love this place and their food. However, I witnessed something yesterday during my late lunch with a friend that I found repulsive. I walked into the men's room as one of the cooks (shorter guy with a beard) was finishing at the urinal, when he finished, he walked out without washing his hands! Out of the corner of my eye a second cook who was in the stall walked out of the stall and also did not wash his hands! Gross! I pointed it out to our waiter and he said he would say something to the one person whom I was able to recognize and I opted to not have him say anything (for obvious reasons). The waiter offered that they have a hand washing station near the kitchen and the gentlemen probably washed their hands there....I'm not buying it. I know I may be somewhat of a germaphobe but that is inexcusable for a chef who is making salads and things which are not cooked to do something like this...furthermore, it is a major health code violation! Lavese sus manos amigos!!!

Healthy food, cooked and prepared well.  Rude bartending staff and less than jovial atmosphere.  Definitely catering to the pretentious crowd.  If that is your gig this will be a five star for you.  If you want super healthy food and can tolerate that crap it will be a 3 or 4.  If you just don't have time for it.. well you get this review. :)

I love this place!!! Cute waiters and delicious, healthy food.....what could be better?  The only thing I didn't like was the wait the fact that my chicken salad sandwich was small for 12 dollars.  Otherwise, everything tasted delicious and the service was awesome.

Love love love. I was shocked to hear there was a 30 min wait on a Tuesday night but was lucky enough to find a bar spot. The bar was incredible, staff were all helping one another, fresh made juice was delicious and incredible fresh vegan food topped the cake. Would recommend the edamame dumplings. Yummers

Took mom here for a late birthday lunch, but was a little skeptical since a few people have told me the food was not very good. When we got to the restaurant, we entered across from the hostess booth, so we walked across the inside of the restaurant. Very nice layout, bright colors, and you could see everything that was going on in the kitchen. Very impressive. The only thing that was a little off was the hostess station. There was no real order, and a lot of people were just standing around. I flagged down the hostess, who didn't know if she was supposed to be seating people or if someone else was. We opted for the patio since we could be seated right away.  Our server was amazing, and he reminded me a lot of our friend in Portland. He knew the menu in and out, and also new the portion size of the street tacos probably wouldn't fill up my boyfriend. Just an over all great server.  The food was amazing also. We started off with the hummus, worth it. Very flavorful and the texture was not watery or smooth. Loved it. We also got the specialty drinks, a little pricey, but also very good. When our food came out, it was again, all very delicious.   All in all, we most likely would come again. The prices are a little high, ($90 for 4 people, no alcohol) but since the food is made healthy and also packs a flavor punch, I guess it's worth it.

Love the food!! If it wasn't for the lunch wait time, this place would have 5 stars from me, however every time I go for lunch the place is half empty and 2 hostesses are always looking  frazzled. Go for dinner! :)

Fantastic service. On point with refilling drinks. Menu seemed simple and even kinda boring, but boy do the dishes taste fresh, flavorful, light, and delish. Small portion sizes, and nice variety of natural drinks, got the blood orange w soda water.
This restaurant has healthy food with lots of flavor. It has a very unique menu. I go out of my way to go here.

The food is creative and delicious. If you like going out to eat and want something that's not completely unhealthy I'd go here. You can tell they use fresh ingredients and don't cook with an overload of oil. All the staff here has been friendly each time I've been there. Went tonight and had the TLT & shiitake lettuce wraps.

I wish this were in every major city.  Organic, local, and options for gluten-free.  Nothing disappointed anyone in either party I was with- yes I went back the next day I loved it so much! Prices are very reasonable for the quality of foods.  Waitstaff are very knowledgeable.  Atmosphere is very laid back.

This place is a home-run to win the world series! The menu is unique and robust. Everything I had was perfect. The kale salad and sashimi were perfect. Great setting and interior. They have fresh nutrient rich juices, too! Wish I could eat here regularly and will make it a point to eat at True Food whenever I'm in Phoenix.

I won't be going back. The chia pudding and coffee are good, but the food is subpar for the cost. Almost everything has soy in it, and if it doesn't have soy it has wheat... Not truly allergen friendly or healthy. My servers have always been nice... But when I tried to be more casual (and respectful of their seating areas) and sit out at the large table with my coffee the staff was nothing but noisy and inconsiderate! It was so rude! They weren't courteous to my area of the table, or any acknowledgment that I was even there. Their noise and activity forced me to move. Absolutely unacceptable.  Talked to the manager and she came over for about two seconds, after the kind hostess reseated me. No real apology and she was half walking away pretty much saying "just sit here it's fine" but not any apologies for what happened or offer to make my experience better.

The Quinoa burger was exceptional.  Although it looks small, it's quite dense and filling.  I only ate have and saved the other half for later, which tasted even better.  You can op for either kale salad or sweet potato has or both and I would definitely chose both.  Fast and friendly service.  They will cut you off after 4 beers in one hour....not speaking from personal experience thought.

Was in town for business. Decided to check out a highly recommended restaurant. The service was incredible. The waitress was so accommodating. Absolutely love the open concept.  Will definitely be adding this to the list of recommendations.

I haven't been on a juice cleanse, and I don't shop at Whole Foods, so I might not be the target audience here.  That being said, I can't get enough of True Food Kitchen.  It's so relaxing to sit at the bar and watch the busy kitchen filled with fresh fruits and vegetables.    I had a really hard time ordering since the menu is super varied and everything sounds delicious.  I love how they have many yummy vegetarian and vegan options but still offer plenty of meat dishes.    I was here on a cold, rainy day, so I had the miso soup ($4) to start.  The generous chunks of wild mushrooms were fun to slurp up. There were snow pea slivers in the soup, which was unconventional but added a great crunch and freshness.  I also ordered the kale crunch salad ($12).  The many ingredients (watercress, cabbage, grapefruit, avocado, pickled radish, almonds) were all perfectly proportioned and carefully arranged.  Dressing always makes or breaks the salad for me, and this chili vinaigrette was absolutely a winner.  I only wish that the portion was a little bit bigger.  I like a huge bowl of chopped salad, and I know that if I had only ordered the salad I definitely would have left hungry.  I also tasted the chicken curry with brown rice, which was bursting with coconut milk flavor.  Unlike the salad, that portion is big enough to take half home for later!  I'm always a little skeptical when people from Arizona compare Arizona to its trendy neighbor California.  However, True Food Kitchen made me a believer.  This might be the best chain restaurant I've ever been to.  Come to the East Coast please!
Uhhhh - wow. Give me some time to write this up the right way. OMG. To start outstanding!

One of my fave restaurants in Scottsdale - large portions - most meals are enough for two! organic flavorful healthy food that is delicious - I couldn't ask for more! And the drinks- non alcoholic list is delish... definitely a place to check out. Cool atmosphere too. I keep going back to the vegan version of the BLT (I think it's called TLT?) yummy!!

This place is one of my top three favorite places to eat in Phoenix!  The yellow curry is the best I have had!  It is fresh and creamy with a good amount of spice.  You must try the lettuce wraps- they are meatless and taste better than P.F. Changs lettuce wraps (my meat-loving husband agrees!).  My husband also craves the steak from here as well.  The drink called the Medicine Man is so refreshing and leaves your body feeling wonderful.  This place may not be for your steak and potatoes type of person but if you want wholesome, natural, tasty food then please do yourself a favor and try True Food Kitchen.  Remember to get your parking token validated.  Menu selections barely ever change but the items they have are keepers.

Ate dinner here with the family last night.  Ordered the kale guacamole and roasted cauliflower for starters... they were delicious!  The kids meals are also so good (healthy and tasty... no icky boxed mac n cheese with fries!) Everything was amazing with great atmosphere and service!  Definitely will be back soon!

Well, I would like to personally thank True Food for ending my streak of 2 and 3 star restaurants.  As a foodie I have been pretty disappointed lately!!!  Not the case for True Food!   I finally got to eat here (my husband isn't as excited about healthy food as I am), but we had family visiting who have dietary restrictions so we all decided to try this place together.   The wait was very long.  It was a holiday but I hear that is common here.  When finally seated, we had very attentive service by Greg from start to finish.  It was quite loud inside, I think next time I will try to sit on the spacious and yet adorable patio.   The food was outstanding.  Quality over quantity, my friends.  Not that the portions are tiny but you are definitely getting your money out of the amazing blend of flavors.  Everything is made from scratch.  I had the ancient grains bowl and it seriously is one of the best things I've ever eaten.  Everyone was pleased!!! We also splurged on a couple desserts which were out of this world.  The strawberry rhubarb crisp as well as the lemon tart-both highly recommended! I can't wait to return!!!!!!!!!!  Oh and my husband can't either! :)

Are you one of the following?: dirty hippie, hipster, organic gardener, whole foods frequenter, vegan, gluten-free, lactose-free, summertime winter hat wearer? Then this place is for you. My friend who was with me also said that the attractiveness of the clientele was above average, but he is from Tucson.  They are awesome with any allergy or strange dietary request. The food is all locally sourced blah blah blah.   Very smelly hippie atmosphere, girls with dreadlocks and socks with sandals.   I had the pizza with the eggplant and bri. I loved it. I also had some kind of carrot tasting smoothie, it was alright but nothing to write home about. Apparently my organs will now function better due to that one drink...  My friends had the lasagna, gluten free of course and they loved it. My mom had the fish tacos and she eats them everywhere she goes. She raved about the flavor.  Overall this restaurant is good food-wise but a little too "I drive a Prius why don't you, environment destroyer??!!" For my tastes.

The Nojito's are fantastic!  I find mojitos a bit too sweet but the nojitos never are.  I had the salmon sandwich with the kale salad and the sweet potato hash.  I've had the salmon before (fresh, thick, tender) and the kale salad (the kale is cooked but far from limp and comes sprinkled with what appears to be parmesan cheese and bread crumbs). Today, I also had the sweet potato hash (sweet potato and caramelized onions - yum!) and that plus the nojito are reason enough to go.  My friend had a chicken salad and a medicine man drink.  He wasn't wowed by the salad which consisted of your basic salad with chicken but he said he'd try the place again.   The place is pricey though.  The sandwich was around $15, and the nojito might have run $5?   Went at 12:30 on a weekday and the place was packed.  We had to wait about 15 minutes.  It's easier to get in right away at dinner.

Herb hummus, Street Tacos, Chopped salad w/chicken, & Tabbouleh Salad all delicious!  If I had to make s suggestion it would be to spice up the fish in the tacos with a little more flavor, but they were perfectly cooked, flaky and moist.  The hummus appetizer is a generous portion; enough for 4-6 people.

Met with a friend I hadn't seen in 15 years.  She was working in Scottsdale for the week so I met her at True Food Kitchen.  We had such a great experience.  I have special dietary needs and the staff didn't hesitate when I asked specific questions about what was in the food and how it was prepared.    We split the VEGETABLE CRUDITÉS which were nice, fresh crisp raw veggies with dipping sauce (friend said sauce was good).  I ordered the turkey burger (no bun or cheese) and a side of the sweet potato hash.  The turkey burger was cooked to perfection.  A little salty for my taste, but for others it's probably just right.  I loved that it was put together without a bunch of fillers.  Really tasty.  The sweet potato hash was very good!  I was looking forward to this treat and it didn't disappoint.  Thank you True Food Kitchen for making our reunion such a positive one!

Vegan and Vegetarian friendly, just be warned you will wait for a table during business lunch hour.  We learned to eat early to get a table, once we did that, service is awesome and the food is great.  Lots of different items for the diner to enjoy.  I've had the fish tacos a couple of times and they are great!

Went here for din din when a friend was in town. I had dined at the Baltimore location  and enjoyed their food so I was eager to check out a different dish.When we arrived the hostess greeted us with a friendly smile and asked if we would like to sit out on the heated patio or inside. Being natives of Arizona, we of course opted for the heated patio because this time of year is the reason why snowbirds and transplants come to Arizona.   She lead us out to a corner table that had two sides surrounded by a short wall topped with grass which was a nice touch. This location has the patio pretty much in the center of a courtyard so the mild privacy was a plus because I tend to spill things on myself when I eat, cause I'm that classy. Anyhoo, the temperature of the heaters was heavenly! Not too hot, but enough to keep us thin-blooded Arizonians warm.  Service was okay. The waiter was nice but never offered to refill our beverages. I had the Cucumber Refresher to drink. This concoction is a combo of cucumber and honey lemonade, pretty refreshing so I probably would have ordered a second one if the waiter would have asked, which would have cause the bill to go up, increasing his tip, but whatevs. Also to note, there was quite  a selection of alcoholic drinks on the menu that are not so great for the liver, but healthy for ones social life.   For my entree I ordered the Red chili shrimp which was amazingly delicious! It consisted of sesame noodles, gai lan (that's fancy talk for broccoli), red spinach, and shiitake mushrooms. It had the right amount of spice and I couldn't scarf it down fast enough, dropping only four noodles into my lap (you were warned earlier). Some items can be a little pricey but you are getting quality ingredients. I will definitively be back.

Reasonable menu, decent service and nice food.  Bit sterile environment, not really friendly and healthy, more mass market roll them in and out. Also a bit odd with kitchen staff pre preparing meals right in the middle of everybody.  But can't complain as food was good as was service, first time I've been to a True Food Kitchen and would go back.

Fresh real food, great service and food arrived in a timely manner! Edamame gyozas, grapefruit avocado guac, and seasonal ingredient salad were absolutely perfect. All paired nicely with a ginger margarita! They'll even split entrees in half if you're sharing with a friend. I left very satisfied and would go back in a heart beat.

Went for Easter dinner.  Great atmosphere, super service, fun drinks and yummy healthy eats.  Explore the drink menu...both alcoholic and non.  Two patio areas to dine al fresco.  Sweet potato hash was awesome as was spiced chicken.  A new favorite for me!

Wonderful service and always amazing food!! We had a friend visiting out of town and he wanted a pizza. They customized his pizza and also found a Sprite for him because he was not into healthy veggie or fruit juices. We had our usual Kale Aid drink and also tried the hummus Greek salad with gluten free pita bread with fresh cucumbers and olives. Sat outside on the patio which was a nice area for conversation and great weather!

Food was OK. Just OK. No one at our $140+ table of three raved about anything. Have had fresher salads from Whole Foods. As other reviewers have noted, much of this place is nothing more than a giant picture window for the Scottsdale look-at-me crowd. Including the hostess, et al. If you like the trendy look of the moment, go. If you want to enjoy a True Meal, go somewhere else.
I could eat the kale salad every day. Refreshing and light but also filling. Turkey pits is excellent too.
Love the food but it's ruined by how POORLY managed this place is!!!!!! They Quoted us 30-40min wait and 2 hours later we're still waiting. Sadly we won't back.

After many visits to the TFK at Biltmore, I decided to check out the new establishment at Scottsdale Quarter. My friend and I went to this location a couple Saturday's ago for lunch. When we arrived we were told it would be about a 25 minute wait to be seated outside. We were given a little buzzer and stood outside for perhaps 10 minutes before it went off. What a pleasant surprise!   Upon being seated a super nice gentleman introduced himself as our waiter. He explained the days specials and was very attentive and courteous throughout the entire meal. Better yet, he kept our water glasses filled consistently.  We started with the lettuce cups which sadly weren't as good as we remembered them being at the Biltmore TFK. And unfortunately my friend felt her steak tacos were just as lackluster as the lettuce cups. Again, a disappointment as they weren't what she was expecting since the ones she had at the Biltmore location were "amazing."   I enjoyed the Panang Curry with chicken and asked that they include zucchini and red peppers as well. As usually is the case, the meal was FABULOUS. Just as I remembered it being from my last visit to the Biltmore location.   In regard to the ambiance of this location, I would say I prefer it much more than the Biltmore location. The outside seating area is so wonderful and roomy. There just seems to be a different, more relaxed vibe at this location. And I especially love that the restrooms are on the outside of the restaurant...as are the sinks! (although they still have sinks in the bathroom for those who prefer to wash up before leaving the facilities)   Overall, I will indeed be back--next time with the hubby for a delicious lunch and some shopping!

Once again, my favorite restaurant didn't not disappoint. From the moment my friend and I walked in the doors, we were greeted with authentic smiles and genuine hospitality. Once seated a wonderful waiter checked in with us to take our drink order. In a matter of minutes he was back to take our food order. Prompt, courteous, helpful, service is what I have become accustomed to receiving at TFK.  Our orders consisted of: shitaki and lettuce tofu cups (delish and fresh!), caramelized onion tart (sounds much better than it really is), harvest chopped salad (an absolute FAV which I order almost every visit!), street tacos (my friends go to staple food here) and the roasted chicken (absolutely gives the panang curry a run for its money!!   Honestly, the roasted chicken was SO incredibly phenomenal, I wish I would have gotten an order to go! Since I didn't...they may find me at dinner there again tomorrow--since this is the only time this meal is served.  Bottom line...this place keeps getting better and better!  As a side note--we heard from a reliable source this evening that the menu will be undergoing some changes in the coming months. I can only imagine the delectable meals that await us!

Um can you say unbelievably amazing, not to mention I am so bummed they don't have one of these back home, (I'm from Minnesota.)  Came to this delicious restaurant while visiting a girlfriend in the Phoenix area. I wish I hadn't; only because it's all I think about! Started with a Bloody Mary--best one I've had. You can taste the fresh-ness, like they literally made the tomato juice there themselves.  We ordered the edamame dumplings as an appetizer. So fresh and light. A great starter to a meal, as it was not too large/heavy.. We ordered three meals to share/taste: spaghetti squash, autumn salad, and turkey burger with sweet potato hash. The favorite by far was the spaghetti squash as our conversation revolved around the question of HOW to make this! The food is excellent. The service was "okay." Our server was somewhat nonexistent. Fortunately for her, the food makes up for that here. Yes, coming from a server veteran herself, I did just say that the service can be poor if the food is this delicious. I will be returning on my next visit to Phoenix. Until then, can you PLEASE OPEN ONE IN MINNEAPOLIS?!?

This was my first time here and it was a great experience. The wait staff and hostesses were nice and informative. Our server was knowledgeable about the menu and provided us with helpful suggestions and options regarding drinks and entrees. She also provided me with background information about the restaurant. The bar was also able to make a great Moscow Mule, a beverage not regularly on the menu. My friend got the fish tacos and I got the grilled chicken salad. We also got he kale guacamole which was not bad at all. The kale wasn't overpowering which I liked. It's a good place to go to if you are looking for a clean eating option. The flourless chocolate cake was delicious too. Very rich.

What a disaster.  For an organic restaurant the staff had no clue...couldn't even answer simple questions about the ingredients.  I have never rejected a bottle of wine untile the waitress tried to serve us a corked bottle of wine...she seemed suprised that we would not accept the bottle...  If you want to eat in a real locally sourced/organic restaurant try Quiessence.

We love True Food Kitchen!  We had two errors on our order today and our server did not return to the table for at least 15 min after we received the food. That was a bummer, but good still.  You will fall in love.

Excellent food, service and environment! Great choice for vegetarians and vegans! A tad on the pricey side, this place will satisfy the trendy person inside who wants good food and great service. My server was knowledgeable about the menu and made some great recommendations. In short: eat here!

Very great food overall great quality, but absolutely worst service I have ever experienced. It took my server 20 minutes to get us out drinks and then she was no where to be found for us to order our food. We had to tell another waiter what we needed and even then the whole process took 20 more minutes and we were at true foods for an hour an a half. Absolute worse service

I've been to True Food a couple of times now and both times were very pleasant experiences. The first time, I was sick so I got a juice to try and feel better. It may or may not have actually helped, but it was very tasty. I also got the heirloom tomato pizza, which was delicious. The second time, I went on a Friday night. Date night and all that. We got the roasted cauliflower app which was so good. As my entree, i got the ancient grains bowl. It consists of miso glazed sweet potatoes, charred tofu, quinoa, caramelized onions, mushrooms, and snap peas. So delicious! It's filling, but not in the way that makes you want to die. We decided to get the vegan key lime pie for dessert and omg. It was perfect! The manager was super awesome as well.
The best Tuscan kale salad, great customer service, yummy desserts every season and great appetizers. No guilty here, just a happy and healthy yummy

PLEASE open one in Chandler/Gilbert area next!  We love the concept, the service and the amazing food.  Very rarely near the Biltmore or Kierland - we would love to make this a regular spot on our side of town.

The location is beautiful. Perfect for a date. The Scottsdale Quarter is lit well and has beautiful landscaping at night. The restaurant itself is relaxing as the doors were open and the weather was just perfect.   Our waitress was very nice and helpful in recommending dishes for us.   Food was great. The hummus appetizer was very delicious. The Bison burger was healthy and had great side items. And the new strawberry salad was light but filling.   Overall a great experience for us! We will definitely be going back soon.

I'd only ever been to True Foods in California, so I was surprised to see one in the land of chimichangas. When I usually eat out, I generally choose inflammatory, non-local, synthetic foods, so eating lunch here was a departure from normal. Truthfully, my friend chose it because it was 10ft away from our breakfast at Frost. As usual, the restaurant is open and spacious, filled with green plants, and adorned with wooden tables. Although it was near lunch time, the place was nearly empty. We were seated immediately and our server was quite attentive.  The menu is diverse with cuisines from around the world using all local foods. I had the chicken chopped salad which was just like the salads I pack for lunch except more delicious. My salad made me want to be better. I think True Food changed my life because now I want to add manchego cheese to everything. This is where I imagine hosting future power lunches.

Stop changing the menu!  This used to be my favorite restaurant.  As a vegan, they had multiple options that I was willing to pay more for and wait on weekend nights for.  Since I started eating there, I think they have changed the menu 4-5 times.  Seasonal food doesn't excite me.  Consistency does.  I loved the BBQ tofu wrap.  It was my favorite meal...gone.  Kale cheeseless pizza...gone.  Apple crisp with maple ice cream....gone.  All that is really left for me is an uninspired teriyaki bowl that I can duplicate elsewhere.  The service is great.  The staff is friendly.  The pricing is a little high, but I was willing to pay it for many vegan choices.  I have a couple of gift cards left and I will likely be done after that.  5 star food (before the changes).  5 star service- GREAT servers!  3 star pricing. Zero stars for inconsistency with menu items.  I'm between a 2 and 3 on this one, but since I was served a lemon tart that I was told was vegan and found out later it isn't, I'm leaving a 2.  If you keep the menu consistent, we likely wouldn't have had this problem.  What if I had a dairy allergy?

People who routinely make healthy lifestyle choices eat here.  I don't make healthy lifestyle choices, but I figure if I hang out in places where there are people that do, their shit might rub off on me. I call this health by association.  TFK has a good beer offering with an organic porter that tastes heavenly. I washed it down with a bowl of seafood caldo. The soup was also delicious, with nice chunks of shrimp and sea bass swimming around in it. Five stars for the soup, beer and my attentive server.  Minus two stars for the cute little hostess, who upon seeing me was quick to conclude I wouldn't even qualify as butt-acne on Jennifer Grey's ass and promptly whisked me into a corner booth.  Yes, they put baby's butt-acne double in the corner.  What a little biatch.

We had family brunch here recently, and everything we ordered was delicious!  Lots of patrons, but the staff had a good handle on getting the tables turned over.  Lots of vegetarian, gluten free, and healthy dining options.  Many dishes could be made vegan as well.

Wow!!!! I wasn't sure who was running this place because everything is phenomenal. I asked to speak with the GM and this lovely sweet woman, Jessica, came over. Not only was she smiley and friendly, but had super positive energy. The food and staff was incredible, but Jessica was the icing on the cake! Thank you for making, what was an unbelievable experience, even more amazing! The food was out of this world fresh and delicious. Definitely start with the vegetable crudités!! The Thai grapefruit martini is so refreshing!! You won't regret it

Sorry to leave this but service was average at best.  Sat at the counter. It was a Sunday afternoon, not crowded.  She brought my drink and it was "dripping" on counter, my clothes. When she came back, I asked for a napkin which she did not provide. After 5 min, I asked another server for a napkin which she gave me right away. First server eventually came back and had a napkin for me. No "sorry" or anything. The whole experience turned me off. Maybe they were changing shifts but I say they could up their customer service/friendliness.   They seem to do more socializing with each other than the guests. I won't be back.

Great spot to have a nice, tasty bite and conversation.  Big bay windows that bring in the breeze from outside as well as the chatter of passer byers if you like to people watch.  I had hummus and a chicken salad, both fresh and delicious.  I'll definitely be back.

Entering True Food Kitchen is to enter Dr. Weil's anti-inflammatory food pyramid, now made available through a restaurant setting.  Ample vegetables, whole grains, and just straightforward "good for you food", is at the heart of True Food Kitchen's philosophy.   Their Scottsdale Quarter location is open and airy, with two entry-ways, along with indoor and outdoor seating.  Outside misters are available for hot days and for those colder nights in the Arizona winter, fire pits to keep warm.  Their menu boasts everything that is good for your stomach and general well-being for your body.  Salads, sandwiches, and various entrees will keep your options open as you select the right true and good food for you.  There are also many options for vegetarian and gluten-free diets.  Their Teriyaki Brown Rice Bowl ($12.00-$16.00) with your choice of tofu, chicken, or shrimp is a combination of ingredients made just for teriyaki sauce.  It is the perfect portion of Asian vegetables, brown rice cooked just right and for my serving - chicken slices glazed with teriyaki sauce.   If you want to go a step further, you can share one of their various pizza offerings. Their Chicken Sausage Pizza ($12.00), complete with tomatoes, fennel and fontina.  Theirs is a thin crust, so it is easy to more than one originally planned.    True Food Kitchen dares to be different and succeeds.  This is all in the efforts of providing us a better alternative to feed our bodies.  Day to day we get caught up with "standards," it is good to step aside and give your body some good food, food that was truly made to sustain your body healthily.

Can't believe I haven't written this yet. Had a great meal here with my family when they were visiting from the east coast. There was a bit of a wait but we occupied our time at the nearby shops.  Very unique and delicious menu. We each had different things and all enjoyed our meals.  The staff were wonderful. The outside seating was great. My family can't wait to come back to town to come here again.

The food was OK, but not for the amount we paid.  Their drinks are spectacular, however the entire menu is very overpriced.  I had a mixed cauliflower and veggie plate which cost $ 13.00. (Winter Ingredient Salad)  $ 13 dollars for veggies?  Come on.  I was starviing when I left.  If you want a pricy meal over at The Quarter, skip this place and visit Tanzy up by the i pic theater.  More bang for your buck.

Have been going here since it began.  We had a real problems tonight.  The veggie appetizer was 1/2 normal size.  We were told that they are having kitchen problems.  The kale salad is great but the salmon we ordered on the top was raw.  The service was wanting.  It took 15 minutes for a Latte to arrive even though the place was half empty.  To top it off my granddaughter did not want the salmon by the time it was offered and the waitress brought a piece of cake which was good.  When I questioned the bill because they charged us for the salmon I told the server it should have been removed from the bill.    Why didn't a manager come by to ask?   Seems like the restaurant needs a manager who sees to it that a repeat patrons are properly treated.  Our waitress (6 weeks on the job) was surprised when I refused to pay for the dish.  I was charged for the salad.  We don't mi d paying for quality.  A manager never appeared.    I have never experienced anything like that in a Fox Concept Restaurant before.  They are usually on the ball - but now a favorite place is in decline.  What a shame.    We like this place and would like to come back, but this needs a fix.  Hopefully Sam will make that happen.
The place has nice ambiance but is a little overpriced. The food is american style with little twists. Lots of vegeterian options and gluten free ones.

Loved the outdoor patio seating, the humus and Thai chili shrimp appetizers were really good, the street tacos were good and the apple crisp was excellent to be a "healthy" version of it.  The drinks were so/so.  I am debating between 4 and 5 stars, I am giving this 4.5 :)

I eat here a lot due to its close proximity to my work! I enjoy the atmosphere of its not too busy- if it's busy it's too noisy for my taste. The patio is nice and it's quieter out there. The food is usually delicious, but it has missed the mark on some occasions. That happens. The staff is always very nice and eager to make things right if they mess up your order which is very nice. I enjoy the Tuscan Kale Salad and cucumber lemonade!! Other things are yummy as well! I recommend it at off hours so it's a pleasant quiet experience!!
Great service at the bar! Omg, banana chocolate tart was orgasmic! And, I felt slightly less guilty since it was "healthy". Miso cod was excellent, too.

One of my favorite places to dine. Super nice and friendly staff. Food is always fresh, with the exception of one time I visited.. I ordered the steelhead, (I almost always get this dish), and I'm pretty sure it was microwaved or reheated, which is why I gave 4 stars. It tasted terrible but i was too hungry to send it back. They're normally good about serving fresh food so that was a bit disappointing but overall, amazing place.  If you're a clean eater like myself you'll love it here. The ambience inside is calming and the patio is nice in the day with the misters. They also have Juby True juices! Which I love. Try one, you'll love them too. I treat myself to lunch here almost every Saturday afternoon and I intend to continue to.

I went here for the first time yesterday. We beat the lunch rush by getting there at 11:30. By 12, there was a wait for a table. I was kinda scared of the menu because I typically eat 'bland with bland and a side of bland'. I ordered the turkey pita (not sure the official name) with a side kale salad. I skipped out of the provolone, which made the sandwich a little dry, but it was still really yummy. The kale salad was a big surprise....I liked it alot and had never tried kale before! My sister ordered the terriaki tofu. Her only complaint was that there wasn't enough actual tofu in her dish. I will definitely go back. Next time, I want to try one of their yummy drinks!

Been here a few times.  Like the scene.  Food is good and as advertised fresh and healthy.  Drinks are unique and juice based which means healthier.  But pricy but like he rest of the world claiming organic and fresh there's a premium so expect it.

I am giving this restaurant 3 stars simply because it is True Food Kitchen and I love the brand. I have visited this location several times but my normal spot is the location in Newport Beach, CA. This location is just always so incredibly loud. It's hard to go to lunch with friends just to have to scream over one another. Even the hostess has to get close to you to even hear how many people are in your party. The food is always great (no complaint there) but even when you sit outside the furniture isn't that comfortable and you're having to sit outside to escape the noise on the inside.

Hit or miss with food...  The drinks can be the same way.  The turkey burger is excellent, the ahi tuna sliders are great!  Service is decent, the crowd is mixed.  Certainly a bit overpriced at 50$ for lunch for 2.

One of our favorite spots. My wife loves, loves, loves the Fish Tacos! I generally order breakfast, and the Breakfast Sandwich is one of my go tos! We come here once or twice a month and it is in our rotation of can't miss places, especially when we have guests!

Dined here for lunch today on their one month anniversary of opening.  The restaurant was packed with Christmas revelers and shoppers, so we chose to sit at the bar with no wait.    I love the look of this place, it reminds me of so many restaurants back home (San Francisco) with clean, open, bright styling, lots of color and natural materials (e.g. organic paperweights - limes, lemons and tangerines to hold down your check and change).  The focus is on healthy and fresh.  Not so much slow food or organic per se, but in the same vein with real ingredients prepared simply with any eye toward health.  For example, when you order your turkey sandwich you get a choice of soup or KALE salad!  They have no red meat on the menu, lots of chicken, turkey and fish - perfect.    Today my hubby and I shared the special soup (Chicken sausage, white bean and kale), the edamame and truffle dumplings and the white shrimp soba.  All were very tasty on this unusually rainy day in Scottsdale.  Our waitress was slammed but was sweet and did her best to be prompt and attentive.  The prices are not ridiculous, but not exactly cheap - but that goes with the territory here in N Scottsdale.  I'll definitely go again in nicer weather and also explore all the great new sops opening in the SQ including a real, at least semi-independent (i.e. not Starbucks or Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf) coffee house (WOW!!!).  I think it is called International Coffee Press or similar.    All in all a super addition to my work 'hood.
My daughter contracted food poisoning from this restaurant. We will no longer eat here.
I adore this place...fresh doesnt describe the food. Loved the wines! I would definately recommend it.

I'm a fox lover and it's no different with true food. I could eat here everyday and feel good doing it. Bought the kids almond butter and banana and strawberry sandwich and he loved it.  Friend had the kale-aid which is his go to and would recommend to every mountain hiker in the valley.  Next up was the kale and avocado dip which has yet to disappoint. Can't find it anywhere else. Not too filling and a perfect start to lunch. I had the turkey rice bowl which is a clean combo to give you energy throughout the day.   I had the Spontaneous Happiness drink and sipped it in on the patio as we finished our meal when the rhubarb crisp that the server suggested. Our server was attentive but let us do our thing and the place was visibly clean in all aspects.

I go all the time. Sit at the oversized bar top because you get personalized service from the bartenders and you have plenty of room to setup and do work or read or just enjoy the food and lunches. Everything is catered to a meal style that is anti inflammatory. You'd think that means you would lose on flavor but it's not true. I haven't had a dish that I dislike. I went with the seasonal salad and a bison burger cooked to order.  They have a vast array of drinks and wines that are healthy and flavorful. Erich the manager always stops by and says hi and makes me feel at home. Good place, tell your friends.  Also park In the lot out front, they validate.
I was surprised by how good the food tasted in what I assumed would be a crunchy granola type of dining.   Very fresh,  very broad , excellent service.   Touch expensive but still I'd recommend.

Thank you (management) Mathew @TrueFoods, Scottsdale Quarter, for hosting my Birthday Girl, Mums, and treating her and I to a fabulous culinary explosion! All gratis, all healthy and delish. We had a lovely time tasting the ginormous menu. What a treat! Happy Birthday Month LuLuLuv... and today is my Grandmas Birthday too! So nice to celebrate them both in such a very special way. Our waitress 'Richa', was superb and adored. We will be asking for her in the future. True Foods @ SQ made right of a previous unfortunate situation that had occurred, and went out of their way to make up for it accordingly. I'm not only humbled but appreciative of the gesture. The food is and has always been amazing.

Few places get my highest rating and recommendation - True Food tops that list.  Without doubt, this is my favorite place to dine.  Perfect for business meetings, a place to take guests or just enjoy a relaxing, tasty foody adventure. The seasonal menu keeps it interesting and inspires a healthy lifestyle.  The ambiance just adds to the experience.   As far as service goes, it has always been impeccable, friendly and professional.   Try the fish dish!

So sorry to have to write this review as I am a big fan of True Food Kitchen. We have been dining with them for years -  since the first one opened on Camelback.  Second time in a month that my "stand by" favorites have come up short.  About a month ago I was at dinner with my family and ordered the Red Chili Shrimp.  It was watered down, no flavor and over cooked. This dish is usually delicious and flavorful.  I have ordered it over a dozen times.  Last week I brought my friends from Anchorage to lunch.  I ordered the Spaghetti Squash Casserole one of my other favorites.  It came out over-cooked on the top and mushy within. I really couldn't believe it.  Highly disappointed.   Not sure what is going on at this specific location.  It went from a 5 star ranking on my list down to a 1 star.

Here on a business trip, and went to dinner with several colleagues.  Was expecting amazing (on the basis of Yelp reviews) but nearly went for a two-star rating.  The place is pretty noisy which made conversation a challenge, and the decor, while sort of hipster (stolen from a previous review) reminded me of a university cafeteria in Sweden.  Maybe the patio would have felt a bit more sophisticated, but it was too chilly on this November evening.  Hummus was fine.  Salad with pomegranate seeds was sort of yummy, (but certainly wouldn't have made Meg Ryan erupt is glorious exclamation) and the pizza was just a tiny bit north of bland.  ALWAYS excited about a truly gourmet pizza, but this one wasn't even close.    Timing has a lot to do with these things, but there are loads of interesting restaurants in the neighborhood.  Don't know that I would choose this one again, even under the guise of eating healthy.

Delicious, delightfully healthy menu items.    Food: 5 stars.  Value: 3 stars (smallish portions for highish prices, great ingredients).  If you're super hungry, you might not get entirely full.  Try the Spaghetti Squash, which has wonderful tomatoey flavor and very nice, firm consistency.    The Ahi Tuna Sliders are just excellent - beautiful fish, a touch of wasabi mayo (or something similar), sprouts - not always on the menu, but often still available.  For sides, I love both the Sweet Potato Hash and the Kale Salad.  They'll give you half of each so you don't have to choose, (yummy when mixed together, too).    The Red Chili Shrimp is a really well-made dish - lots of flavor, great ingredients/ texture and bit of spicy kick.  Their fresh drinks (eg cucumber refresher) are super well made and very refreshing, but overly spendy, in my opinion.    Overall, a favorite for us!  The atmosphere is beautiful - very open, modern but warm, with a beautiful patio.  The service has been consistently pretty good (from large parties to dinner for two or three).

Fresh, healthy food and great service in a bright, open space.  The servings aren't large and the prices are high for the portion size, but everything is interesting, genuinely healthy and delicious.  Love this place!  I've come here for breakfast in smaller and larger groups (2-6) and the service is always on point.  The market scramble is lovely (not heavy with oil like a lot of breakfasts, yet quite filling), as are the Quinoa Johnny Cakes (they just taste like fluffy, delicious pancakes - get the yogurt on the side to make sure you like it as a topping).  The also have wonderful lunch/dinner options! A few favorites include the shitake tofu lettuce wraps (wow! flavor) and the new seared spicy tuna wrap (my friend tasted it and said, "Woah!  I didn't know tuna could be this good!"), the red chili shrimp and the spaghetti squash casserole (this one is a little smaller, so get an appetizer if you're hungry).  The regular drinks, like the Cucumber Refresher, are absolutely delicious, but the Juby True juices are quite hit-or-miss, according to a few juice-loving friends.

This place always has friendly service but the wait time is always awful.   I really like their chicken chopped salad. Last time I ventured here, I tried the hangover RX juice drink and liked it. No sugar, just good ol' juice!   Things I like about this place besides the salad, is the friendly service I have always received. People working here seem to be happy which makes the dining experience even better!   I also like the fact while I am waiting to be seated, (which averages about 30 minutes each time I come here) I am able to go to shops close by and do a little retail therapy.  Note for people who like things salty and super sweet, you wont like it here. Their food is actually healthy and lacks all the nasty sodium!

We moved to Arizona from Portland and when we miss the Portland vibe we go here. It's Portland "disneyfied". Clean, friendly, organized with all the hipster musts. The food is wonderful. My favorite is the spicy panang curry, nice heat yet fresh and light. Also the honey lemonade is great, as are there speciality beverages. I've always had good customer service, but it's very busy most of the time so I recommend making reservations.
I have had meals in 4 or five True Food locations and remain amazed at the consistently great food and service at these restos!  Get some!!

This place really hits the spot when I'm looking for something on the lighter, healthier side.  The chicken chopped salad is an item I CRAVE at least every couple of weeks.  I go frequently with my husband and we used to split a salad and entree (some notables are the Panang Curry, Teriyaki bowl, Street Tacos, Shaved Turkey Pita, and the Caramelized Onion tart) - UNTIL we found out you can order half portions of most of the salads and entrees!  It's fabulous!  I am usually there to try to get my week off to a healthy start, but occasionally we have gone on Saturdays during the day after shopping at the Biltmore.  Nothing beats their patio and the Skinny Cucumber Citrus Margarita!  Beyond the food, the service is always excellent- the waiters are friendly and knowledgable.  Just a great experience all the way around.

I've been here a few times with my friends and personally I feel it's only okay, not wow.  Yes, I know it has a lot of positive reviews but for me I felt the food was kind of bland each time I went.  There weren't enough flavors popping in my mouth.  I felt I needed spices or something to give it a kick.  It was like eating with dulled tastebuds each time I went.  Although for others they may like that, but for me I love spices, I love flavor and fire, food with passion and heat, not boring.  Their drinks I wish my taste buds were dulled, because they were just icky for their alcoholic beverages.  Their non-alcoholic beverages were fine but a mixed drink I wouldn't recommend.  But I'm not one to complain at the restaurant so I decided to keep my beverage and drink it anyway when a friend called the waiter over herself and let them know I wasn't happy with my drink, they quickly removed it from the bill which was nice.  But then the bill arrived, over $100 for two people.  Each time I've been there I haven't seen that bill be below $50 and it's not like two people can eat that much.  For $100 I'd expect a mouth watering meal that blows my mind, not something so boring and bland I feel like I purchased it from a QT gas station.  Like I said it's not the same for everyone. I still have coworkers that go here often and just rave about the place.  Unfortunately I'm not one of them.  It's okay, but not for me.

My wife loved it. I thought it was mediocre but I don't care for these kinds of eateries. Not into organic, vegan, gluten free chow.  If you like what is apparently uber healthy, tasty chow, then this place is probably for you.

Hip. Romantic. Cool.  I've been to True Foods in SoCal, but coming to this location has been the best experience so far. My date and I came in around 7:30PM during the week and it was filled up pretty nicely. We were greeted at the door by the hostess and she was very sweet and cheerful. We asked to be seated outside and were seated immediately. Only a few minutes go by and we're already being greeted by our server who was so nice and upbeat, and funny! He got us water and asked us if we had ever been there before and recommended some of his faves.  I ordered the Kale & Avocado Dip that has pink grapefruit in it and the Medicine Man Refresher. My date ordered the Seared Tuna Wrap and the Hangover Rx (except he wasn't hungover)(I don't think...). When the server was telling us about the Seared Tuna Wrap, he was going over the Seared Fish and ended up getting his words backwards and called my date Seared... instead of Sir :) So for the rest of the night my date was Seared, instead of Sir. He was fun!  We got our meals out pretty quickly, and everything was so delicious! His (my date's) dish came with Quinoa that wasn't too saucy or over-abundant, it was JUST right. The tuna tasted fresh. I highly recommend trying out the Kale & Avocado dip though, it comes with chips but you can eat this dish with or without them and it's still great! (Although with the chips it makes it that much more wonderful.) The ambiance of the restaurant was very chill and hip, and the patio was a great place to relax and enjoy the weather - well, since it wasn't hot out!  We will return again, healthy fooood!

Love the decor and the focus on fresh and mostly organic foods. I so appreciate a restaurant that adjusts its menu with the seasons. I'm vegan so those are the only dishes I've tried. The cauliflower appetizer is my absolute favorite. I've just ordered two of those as my meal on several occasions. The vegan pizzas are really yummy and filling. Really enjoy the vegan almond ricotta. The drinks and tonics are very tasty and refreshing. The hummus is great but not your average hummus- I'm guessing they don't use much tahini. The only reason I'm holding out on that fifth star is because of the consistent inconsistency of the food and service- but mainly the food. On more than a handful of visits the cauliflower appetizer is a different size or lacking a staple ingredient like dates or sauce. Still I do love this place so we'll be back!
We eat here very I me we are in Scottsdale. Something yummy and healthy for everyone n the menu!

If you are on a diet, looking for healthy food, or just want some great food True Food Kitchen is the spot.  Everything there is scratch made and fresh.  The restaurant its self is very modern and open which I love.  Their menu constantly changes which is good because that means there menu is changing with the seasons of the food so the food is fresh.  When I go there I always start of with a Kale Aid drink.  The Kale Aid is kale, ginger, apple, celery, cucumber, lemon, tastes very refreshing.  Then the must go to is Ancient Grains Bowl with Chicken.  The bowl consists of miso glazed sweet potato, turmeric, charred onion, snow pea, grilled portobello, avocado, hemp seed.  This bowl is packed with flavor and it doesnt look much but it will fill you up (That is the hemp seed).  With the Anchient Grains Bowl I recommend getting the Charred Cauliflower which consists of harissa tahini, medjool date, dill, mint, pistachio.  It really is a great pairing to the Ancient Grains Bowl.  This place has it all for everyone unless you are just looking for a dirty cheat meal then this is not the place  but still a great place to have a healthy hearty meal.  The restaurant is very pricey though so watch out the bill will shot up quick.  The food is always fresh and made from scratch so that is why it is expensive.  Good clean food is always pricey.  So, all in all this is not a False Kitchen everything you hear about this place is TRUE!  BrandonFitFoodie

Definitely my kind a restaurant. Very fresh organic  food. The veggies are just full of nutrients and taste wonderful. Everything is made fresh. The juices are squeezed right there. You feel so good when you leave and all the food taste wonderful. All the employees just go out of their way to make sure your experience is wonderful.

WOW a place where I can eat what I've been putting on my face all this time.  Dr. Weil's magic potions.  His anti-flammatory diet is great if you're inflamed...I'm not, but I like the hummus and veggies for 8 bucks.  The sweet lady that calls me sweetie when I come in is surprising but I love someone that can be THAT happy at work...brings me back to an episode of Spongebob where Squidword was afraid to NOT smile or human resource aka a big fish that beat the crap out of you...would take you in the back and 'chat'.  I hope that's not the case here but you get what I mean about the creepy happiness.  I recommend this place when guests ask me where to go  because it feels local but it's not. I like that I can say it's locally inspired.  You definitely won't feel bad eating here, but you may just run into MoJo next door to balance it out.

About a week ago, my office team and I went for dinner to enjoy some out of office, get to know each other dinner conversation. I had never been to TFK and wasn't sure what to expect. When we decided on appetizers, we did: lettuce wraps, hummus, and the onion tart. They were ALL fantastic.  For my entrees. I ordered seared ahi sliders with my sides being: sweet potato hash and kale salad. It was all very fresh and the kale salad was the best I have ever had.  The atmosphere is a bit loud, but the fun thing is being able to see the farm fresh produce and herb stations being worked in front of you and that they have the best selection of foods from Vegan, Organic. Vegetarian, and carnivores.   All in all, we had a great time, great food, great drinks, and I will be back!

Love the decor, love the healthy-food concept.   I had a pizza and my friend had ravioli. We split the shrimp dumplings. (see attached photos). Dinner tasted fresh.   Prices were a little high for the portion size. I wouldn't put it on my favorites list, but I would gladly go with friends again.

I came in here for a quick bite the other day. The food is good, but the prices are just too ridiculous. A cup of vegan lentil soup is $7. That's just crazy. The entire bowl probably cost a little bit of change to make, and the bowl size was small and not even filled completely. As much as I like the food, and even though I have the money, I just can't justify spending $7 on a small portion of lentil soup. It didn't even come with a piece of bread or some other like carb. I finished it in less than 5 minutes.  Whatevs.  I could understand if it was mind blowing food, but I can cook food that is comparable.

Good, quality and healthy food. Portions are small so if you're a big eater, eat something before or plan on ordering more than one item. Decent amount of vegetarian and vegan options if that's your thing. This location is smack dab in the middle of Scottsdale Quarter and it sits in a visibly pleasing location. would consider returning in the future.

100 times better than the True Foods here in Fashion Valley. Service went ABOVE and beyond, I wish I knew the name of our server for a shout out... she was AMAZING! She was such a great help she really knew her stuff and made great recommendations (a healthy brunette with beautiful blue eyes) and way on top of her game. The drinks came out slow but I am sure that was not her fault.   I had the scallops and they were SO DAMN GOOD and cooked to perfection. I highly recommend this dish! All of our party of 12 seemed very happy with their meals. I tasted the curry and it was very good. We had a great crudette appetizer with a beautiful and delicious variety of veggies and hummus and pita. Everything was fantastic. I have to say I was not very excited when the boss wanted to go here because I have been to the fashion valley one a couple of times and was not impressed with any meal or beverage.   This location changed my mind about True Foods. It's just the fashion valley one that sucks.

Love this place, love the concept. Great food.  I go to this place at least two or three times a month, usually if not for any other reason then to get a Medicine Man, they make me feel good.  Was recently there with a few buddies, and we enjoyed the Shrimp Dumplings the Curry Bowl tofu and the turkey Pita, everything here is always delicious and the service is top notch, the staff is very friendly and very informative.  I highly suggest if you like healthy food to try this place out it is definitely worth it. The only reason this place does not get 5 stars is because I do feel it is a bit pricey. But I guess you get what you pay for more like 4 & half stars.

Stopped in for a quick lunch before a movie at the iPic this weekend.  They were pretty busy, but we were able to get a table outside immediately.  I had peeked at the menu ahead of time and was glad to see a number of vegan options in addition to gluten free and vegetarian.  The restaurant boasts an open kitchen where you see a dozen prep cooks working hard on a ton a fresh produce.  The brunch menu (wknds 10am - 4pm) has an awesome variety of breakfast, salads, sandwiches, entrees, pizzas, sides and starters.  They have fresh juice and lemonade concoctions in addition to a healthy cocktail and wine list. (I took a few pics of the menu for drink ideas at home!)  I ordered the Mediterranean chopped salad, sans cheese to make it vegan. My taste buds were delighted with my selection!
