I forgot to ask the server what the greens were in my salad... they were the tops/greens of something, but I couldn't figure it out by taste. Whatever it was, it perfectly complimented the almonds, quinoa, cucumbers, grape tomatoes, kalamata olives, green beans and tomato-herb vinaigrette.  I do lots of quinoa salads and this was a great one.   My boyfriend was a big fan of the chicken sausage pizza with fennel and fontina. Neither of us had room (or time) for dessert... Next time I go, I'm aiming to have their Kale-Aid juice as a dessert: Juiced kale, apple, cucumber, celery, lemon and ginger. Sounds so refreshing!!

So after being told they do not serve soda, I did not even think about asking for katchup ;)  Ok I will be honest I am not the healthiest eater so this would not have been my 1st choice but I had the grass fed burger and it was realy good, I did switch the carmelized onions with raw, just a person preference.  This is our last day in Phoenix for this vist, I can truly say that I have not had a bad dinning experience, love being able to eat out side in April, can't do this in Milwaukee until June or July.

True Food Kitchen indeed serves the most true and delicious foods in their beautiful open kitchen.   The restaurant is simply picturesque and is how I would love my future kitchen to look like. It's new country chic, first page worthy of a true food recipe book, and perfectly complements their healthy menu items.   We started off with a couple of cocktails: "Acai & Apricot" and "Cherry Bourbon Sour". The thing about their fresh juices and cocktails is that you won't regret it with whatever you decide on. They're all amazing! However, this time we visited, the Cherry Bourbon Sour was a bit too sour without any tint of cherry bourbon so we told the server and the restaurant manager personally remade the drink himself and also brought the "Ginger Margarita" for us to try as if he read my mind! Needless to say, their service is excellent and they try their utmost best to serve high quality food and drinks.   My husband ordered the "Grass-Fed Bison Burger", which was the size of the moon and very tasty. It comes with a side of kale or sweet potatoes or you could ask for a little bit of both! Then I ordered the Panang Curry with chicken and I must say, ever since I tried their Panang Curry, I can't get it anywhere else. Their Panang Curry is very well-balanced with fresh vegetables and filled with so much flavor that will rock. your. world.   I haven't tried their brunch so I'll be visiting again soon for that!!

I was kinda hesitant about going to a vegan restaurant but was VERY pleasantly surprised. The food is amazing. The turkey wrap was tasty. The vegetables before dinner were very tasty and really enjoyable. The atmosphere rocks and the staff are very attentive. I wanted a light lunch and got exactly that. Tasty and filling (and I'm a big guy and like food). They even have some beer if you're up for one. Drop in and enjoy an apple soda too. This is place is definitely worth a visit

Damn. Why can't something this organic and upscale-casual with cheap prices exist in LA?   Whoever invented this place is an ambiance genius. The place has natural lighting, a natural menu, and a full bar with natural juices.   The bison burger was $16 and succulent, delicious, and all those other nice verbs. It came with a hefty side of kale salad. (They give you the option of kale, sweet potato hash, or a little bit of both!) The manager came over to my table and even brought organic ketchup.   My friend ordered the salad with squash, brocolli, cauliflower, etc....It was filling and everything else good with the world.   LETS ADDRESS THE DESSERTS:  The banana pudding with chia seeds and coconut flakes was something else.... a little like a bite of heaven.   If they brought a franchise like this to LA, there is no way they would fail!

It's so refreshing to see a local restauranteur give Phoenicians more vegetarian and vegan options when dining out, and thanks to Sam Fox of Fox Restaurant Concepts, True Food Kitchen hooks veggies like me up in a trendy setting. Everything on the menu is clearly outlined if it's vegetarian or vegan, so people with all types of diets will be happy.  The Biltmore Fashion Park restaurant even looks healthy, with a bright green motif and servers donning bright green capri pants-not the most fashionable get-up, but it mos def drives the point home that the eatery is going for a healthy, green vibe.  And, like Fox's others restaurants, this one has an open kitchen, though here, the kitchen/prep area seemed to take up more than half the restaurant, which I thought was pretty odd.  The crowd of diners was varied. There were plenty of 20-somethings, a ton of middle-aged folks and even families with babies mixed in.  While the atmosphere was slightly above average, the food was excellent. I started with a bowl of mushroom-filled miso soup ($6), which was vegan and chock full of shrooms, scallions and tofu. I loved it!  I paired my meal with a Cucumber Refresher ($4), a cucumber-infused honey lemonade. It was sweet, refreshing and didn't make me feel guilty about drinking it.  For my entree, I ordered a ricotta ravioli ($13), which was covered in a pesto sauce, more mushrooms and red peppers. It was an interesting twist on traditional tomato sauce-covered pasta, and it really filled me up.  For me, I'll definitely be going back to try more tasty meat-free bites.

I'd give the seabass entree a 3.5 stars based on the fact that I am used to living in cities with fresh seafood.  For Scottsdale standards, rating may be higher.  If you really love fresh seabass, you won't get satisfaction here but it's a decent plate.  The pom pom pop smoothie was very good.  I would give it 4 stars.  It's slightly sweet which is perfect for me.  Places like jamba juice make everything super sweet and I can never drink any of their stuff.  This place has a nice ambiance and outdoor seating is very nice when the weather is beautiful.  Update: I got a bad headache after eating the fish.  I felt good prior to coming here.  I remembered that the fish smelled a little fishy.  I should have returned it.

I don't know what has happened to their customer service.. yes the food is healthy and tastes amazing. not sure anymore that it's worth it tho. For thanksgiving i pre preordered a pie which they took mu credit card over the phone to charge.. well long story short it was a huge huge headache. They ended up having me pay also when I picked it up, should have checked my account that I had already been charged even tho they said I hadn't, when I called to get it corrected I noticed I had a third charge for which hey explained to me as an accidental charge of a slice of pie. Seriously?! Three charges for one purchase? I contacted customer service at their main office and never heard back, can't say I will continue supporting them after this whole ordeal and lack of service to make up for their mistakes.
Amazing food! So healthy and great service. Wish AZ would have more places like this.

overpriced fusion food and i know we are all just paying for their rent.  It was obviously a nice place to go on dates because when we were there that one night, there were about 6 couples around us.  So it's a nice place to go to for a clean, quiet meal. Since the portions arent big, there's plenty of room for dessert.  The drinks are nice and refreshing though.

This restaurant lives up to its name. They are really true to their concept here. I've dined at the Camelback True Food several times and so when I learned that the new True Food Kitchen was opening at Scottsdale Quarter, I couldn't wait to check it out! A couple visits later and I can rightfully say...Fox, you've done it again!   Believe it or not, I actually like this True Food better than the original location. The vibe is a lot cooler and more "natural." I really feel healthier when I walk in. With the garden out back (or is it the front?) and the airiness and open feel, for a brief moment I feel like I'm on the countryside near a stream rather than in the middle of fashionista central.   Yes, it's the same exact menu as the other location and maybe because newer always tastes better, but I taste a different for the better in this menu! Everything has a bit more flavor and that's saying a lot because the flavor at the original location is pretty darn good! The hummus here is my favorite starter dish. They add olives and the pita bread is soft and chewy. One of my favorite go-to lunch items here is the Turkey pita sandwich. YUM. It's just as good if not better as I expected. In the past, I haven't been a huge fan of either the hash or the kale salad. The hash has also been kind of blah and the kale salad tasted like I was eating a leaf. But, here...I like both! I don't know what they did, but the hash has much more seasoning and taste. I had the sweet potato hash so that might have something to do with it. And the Kale salad wasn't quite so leafy.   As for the sides aka drinks and dessert, my favorite drink there is the Medicine Man. It takes a pretty spectacular non-alcoholic drink for me to pay $6, but if there's any drink that lives up to par, it's the Medicine Man. I could probably drink 11 of them, but I hold back. As for dessert, I normally don't opt for dessert at True Food because there's something anti-climatic about it there, but when I do splurge, the Carmel brownie is the way to go.   So welcome to the corridor True Food! You've made it just a little tastier here!

I love coming here-the food, atmosphere, drinks...they also have a juice/smoothie bar on the north side of the building.  I'd recommend a kale side salad that they have, that was my favorite.   The restaurant is very open and bright in the daytime; I am unsure if they have misters or close the windows in the summer because of the heat.  Out service has been good the few times we've gone here.  Kid friendly.

Spaghetti squash casserole. So delicious! I've never had anything like it. It was the whole reason I went! The drinks my friend and I ordered were great too. Such great flavors. We did have to wait almost an hour for our food because I think our ticket got lost but the manager was nice about it. Service was great too and took his time explaining the menu. The place was packed and that's also a sign you know it's bomb!
Always enjoy the time spent there. Foods great and everyone is very friendly. Very good value for money.
Carry out order.  Quick service and polite staff. Ordered salmon; quinoa and arugula & beet salad.  Delicious.

My niece absolutely LOVES the restaurant. We sent here for her 18th bday. I had the Sangria which was oh so delish. And the street tacos. We ordered the steak and bass. Both were good but the bass (fish) we the BEST!!!!so yummy.

I was visiting from out of town with a party of 3, vegan, gluten-free, and standard American diet. True Foods has an innovative menu that had all of us happy with our food choices. The service and cleanliness of the restaurant was also 5 star! It was so delicious we ate here two nights in a row. I'm so happy they have another location in Boca Raton Florida, only 45 minuets from me. I cannot wait to eat here again!!!

Been here a few times, love this place because everything is so healthy and natural, their freshly squeezed kale juice is amazing, and really love their quinoa salad, this place is a bit too loud and pricy but quality is really good, oh and their fish tacos are really good too!
This restaurant is the truth !! We need a restaurant in every part of the valley delicious, fresh just a great relaxig atmosphere with reasonable prices... Ican'twaittoreturn#
One of my favorite places to eat in the valley! There pizzas are amazing as well as their bowls, apps and drinks. They change they're menu seasonally to give the freshest ingredients!

This place was awesome. We got the raw veggie crudité and charred cauliflower to start. So delicious, I could have been satisfied with just this as a meal. Then we shared a ancient grain bowl with steak. It was really really good and just hit the spot. Chia seed coconut flan for dessert was pretty good and was a good finish to the meal. This is now one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix, we will definitely be back with friends.
Just as great at the first time!  We had the tofu lettuce wraps and the chicken terriyaki rice bowl.    Everything was super good and they even gave me a refill on my Arnold Palmer to go!

The food was great but the service was sub par. Took forever to get our drinks & I think they had to go pick the veggies before we got our app. Clean atmosphere and great location. I will go back and give them another shot.

Gawd I love this place. I always have such good service and enjoy the seasonal menus they put out. The atmosphere is beautiful and comfortable. I take health conscious doctors (since some don't care about their health) and speakers out to this place and it's always been well received. I don't do grains so when I requested their teriyaki bowl to be made with spaghetti squash, they were happy to accommodate. As much as I wanted dessert, I had to pass... but next time, it's on!

If you're looking for "clean" & fresh food, you should check this place out. This visit was my first time at True Food Kitchen. TFK is on a whole different playing field when it comes to dining out.  I had the sesame noodle dish, don't expect it to be like panda express' chow mein. The noodle dish was not greasy and I didn't feel guilty/ heavy after eating it.   The BF ordered the turkey sandwich with 1/2 & 1/2 of the offered sides, sweet potato & kale salad. I had a taste of each of the three items and they were all delicious. Next time, I'm ordering something from the sandwich column.  We also got their flour-less chocolate cake togo & ate it for breakfast the next morning w/our coffee. Yum.  I wish they had more options for fresh squeezed juices, but you'll see us back again at True Food's!  Hopefully they open one in San Francisco-CA or better yet, San Jose-CA.

Fantastic food, but the portions are kind of small. I had the ricotta ravioli and it was great. Really, tastefully fresh ingredients. I thought there was slightly excessive use of oil in the dish, but I am not a big fan of oil so I can't fault them for it. Overall a great experience! Sitting outside is lovely in October!

first time here and i was impressed! my friend and i were promptly greeted and seated and given a run-down of the menu items and how each item was selected by Dr. Weil (i'm a huge fan of the anti-inflammatory diet).   we started with the hummus and were even brought a few pieces of extra pita since my friend is twice my size. the hummus was smooth and creamy and came topped with a little salad of cucumber, tomato, and olives.   i ordered the red chili shrimp. was told it was hot, but it wasn't too bad, so i asked for a side of their homemade "siracha" sauce. the noodles were soft but not soggy. the tidbits of greens and the shrimp were a delicious combination. i couldn't help but to wolf the whole thing down in a matter of minutes. my friend said his curry dish was fantastic and even placed a to-go order of the same for his wife.   very reasonably priced for middle class budget. friendly service and a beautiful dining area.

I was estatic  to try this place out. A new organic/vegetarin/vegan/ HEALTHY restaurant in Phoenix is this girls dream come true!  First of all, I loved the decor and ambiance. Put wheat grass plants in any restaurant and I love it!  I had the harvest salad to start and I must say I want to go back every day just for this. Goat cheese, apples, walnuts, butternut squash and pomegrant-lious! I had the teriayki tofu for my main course. I wasn't as impressed. Teriyaki sauce is not my favorite but I was really craving the tofu, which was good tofu. You can actually substitute tofu for the meat in alot of the dishes, so I really liked that. The drinks are definitely not the focal point of this place, as I did not care for the rye vodka they had (their only vodka).  I will definitely be back again and again....

This is a chain restaurant with admirable aspirations that fail due to the mass marketing mentality inherent in chain organizations.  ANTI-INFLAMMATORY food.  It's a bold claim and untrue.  It's the main reason for the two-star rating.  When you walk in, the receptionist greets you with the corporate tag line that the menu is anti-inflammatory.  It's also stated on the menu and on the chain's main website.  This is just branding and what they'd like you to think they're doing, even though it's untrue.  What is anti-inflammatory?  With all of the celiac, crohn's, ibs, sibo, MS, ALS, ADD and "spectrum" disorders on the rise, it's imperative for some to eat this way to function.  Generally, an anti-inflammatory diet is grain, dairy, sugar, additive and soy free.  But it's also BEAN free.  You can call it Atkins, paleo, GAPS, fodmaps, SCD, Whole 30 diet... Many names for essentially the same thing.  But you won't get it here.  Where True Food fails: uh most of the above.  The menu is filed with grains, dairy, sugar and beans.  My salad, the Summer Ingredient Salad, which costs $13, had a full CUP of garbanzo beans and raisins on it.  Check the menu.  These two ingredients weren't listed on this salad.  I happen to be on an actual anti-inflammatory diet and had to pick them out as I ate.  Missing was the broccolini, mint and there were maybe 6 pistachios on it and those three things *were* listed on the menu.  The other reason I knocked this down to a 2 was the tap water they serve at the table, which has a taste of mold in it.  I have a very sensitive sense of taste and the water in our carafe definitely tasted like mold.  I've never been wrong when I've, for example, tasted things like mold, msg, rogue ingredients in food and water.  It's sometimes a curse to have such an acute sense of taste, but mostly a blessing.  I've always ended up being right.  Anyway, True Food Kitchen needs to install reverse osmosis or clean whatever filtration system they do have so they don't serve up any more inflammatory agents like mold in their restaurant than they already are.

Loved this place! Instead of getting a table, my girl and I sat at the bar, tried all the special drinks the bartenders suggested to us, and had some amazingly delicious food to boot! Can't wait to try the Chicago location.

If you want quality food and atmosphere, this is the place. I love the one in Scottsdale quarter. It looks like heaven specially at night when all the lights are shining in the fountain area. I feel like home in true food.

First time going in and the food was amazing! The hostesses were so sweet. Our server, Dylan, was so sweet and knowledgeable of the menu. Rory, who ran food to us, made it a point to ensure that all our food was to our liking. There was so many yummy vegetarian and vegan options. I could live off of the edamame dumplings! Can't wait to go back!
Food is amazing!! The house chicken sausage pizza  is possibly the best pizza I've ever eaten! Also, the manager, Arianna was very accommodating. Great service great food! Highly recommend!

The restaurant was packed until around 8:30 but was definitely worth the wait. The food was wonderful, I had the pad Thai. The appetizers are definitely worth a try. The edamame dumplings were great. Definitely wish there were more restaurants around like this, also the atmosphere was incredible, we sat outside and just really enjoyed ourselves!

Great food and atmosphere!  You will feel so healthy after you have eaten here. Lots of vegan and gluten-free items on the menu, if you're into that sort of thing. My family isn't vegetarian, but they have organic meats too... win, win for all!  Awesome fresh squeezed juices.  GREAT sweet potato hash and kale salad. Yum. Loved the vinegar dressing on that salad.  We all tried some new things and liked it.   Waitress was very upbeat and friendly, putting up with my 9-year old daughter's incessant questions and conversation. :)  She gave us info about travel to Sedona or the Grand Canyon and welcomed us spring breakers to her town warmly.  We would definitely recommend this restaurant and go back next time we are in town. Had about a 30 minute wait, so we ventured into the Nike store across from it, and the Buckle for some good shopping. Great shopping area too and good people watching. Sat outside in the open air... lovely!

This is a great healthy option that is so very tasty you won't miss eating like a greasy glutton (which is what I usually do). A highlight was the hangover drink. It was so very good. We had the edamame dumplings with had a smooth texture on the inside and was in a nice broth with some savory smoky flavors. I recommend them for sure to start. We also had the kale guacamole which was delicious and will satisfy even those who hate kale. The chips they come with are nice and crunchy with a good sturdiness to pick up a lot of guacamole in one go. For entree, we got the grilled chicken salad and the pan roasted chicken, both were excellent! I plan on becoming a regular here.

This place is wonderful for two reasons, they have a good menu selection and it's super close to where I live! The prices are a little steep, but sometimes it's worth it ... depending on the wait staff and how well they make the food. It's a hit or miss on the service and/or the food. There's one manager there who is awesome and responsive should there ever be an issue. And for the most part the server is friendly. The food is about 50% correct and delicious. It's still worth coming here and gambling it though, because when the food is done correctly it's DELICIOUS and when you get a good server, it makes for an excellent experience. I don't recommend take-out ... that's the worse service EVER.

I made special arrangements for my better half's birthday celebration. Since his work was taking place in the Scottsdale area for the birthday week, I decided to have a bunch of friends come up for dinner. True Foods had been recommended and I'd even tasted the homemade version of the infamous kale salad. Also if you haven't heard of Dr. Weil, miracle worker and life guru to many humans, but he sadly no longer feeds my pets (his kind of petfood is now extinct), you just have, now go subscribe to his hourly email list. (Ok, don't do that)  We arrived, table was procured successfully, drinks were ordered. In our tradition of sharing when the drinks arrived everyone got a sip or so going clock wise around the table.  We received starter plates, two of which had a bit of Schmutz on them. Yikes, that was fixed. Then drinks Me: Thai grapefruit martini - first glass dirty...We alerted the manager to now the third unclean dish and they immediately remade it. This drink goes down way easy and received the table's favorite award. Lady friend: Cucumber-citrus skinny margarita Lady friend's other half: Ginger margarita Birthday boy: Spontaneous happiness  The drinks were excellent, the starters were the crudite and the salmon dip and more than enough for four hungry eaters. My lady friend ordered the miso soup, which is not the traditional pale sushi restaurant variety, but instead a shiitake mushroom based clear nut bown broth with a very different flavor profile. Very enjoyable.  Salads: Kale, which is amazing so straightforwardly simple, but quite complex in flavors.  Watermelon and tomato salad, also simple, but very well done.  Entrees: 2 Miso glazed black cod, 1 Seabass and 1 Panang curry, which had a nice creamy coconut curry with quite a bit of spice/heat to it.  The black cod made me most happy, which was fortunate since it was on my plate.  Dessert was comped because a birthday celebration and one of my drinks was also comped due to the initial dirty dishes.  Overall it was fantastic and the people were really looking out for us.
I had the Ginger Margarita... Strong flavor and good palate cleanser. The edamame dumplings with truffle oil, and the Poki bowl for the main course. I enjoy the meal and the atmosphere a lot.

I had the beef tacos that were 3 inches in diameter which made eating in hand impossible.  The $14 veggie bowl had no more than $2 worth of edibles.   A glass of wine was underpoured.   Service was good but there's not much on the menu for me to return.  Overpriced and interior noise was annoying.

This was the best food I've ever had. Ever. I save my five stars for stellar restaurants only and this one? IS the definition of stellar.   I'm vegan and often eat with my boyfriend who is not vegan nor vegetarian. This place allowed us to both eat straight off the menu with no modification which is AWESOME.   Our waiter, Adam, was helpful, knowledgeable, and absolutely a valuable resource when it came for my boyfriend to choose between the steak tacos or the lasagna.   I got the ancient grains bowl and couldn't be more happy. I am so full and so happy. This place has a CUTE earthy vibe and reminds me a lot of Nashville. I adore it, and will definitely be back often.

Here is a rare but deserving compliment for an establishment....FIVE STARS....that's right this establishment at the Scottsdale Quarters is top notch. I decided to go there and have lunch today....and I have to tell you it was fantastic. I had the Turkey Burger....which may be the best I have ever had.....was fired grilled with lettuce....tomato...provolone cheese...avocado...on a Flax seed Bun. I had a Kale salad and sweet potato hash as my side dishes....no French Fries people....not that kind of restaurant....LOL....(sorry).   Now True Food simply means they use locally organic and locally grown products....everything is light but doesn't lack any flavor....and trust me it DOESN'T....everything taste great. The have tons of gluten-free items on the menu....and the honey lemonade I had was simply delicious and refreshing. You get one free refill on that and unlimited refills on Black and Green Tea....if your a Tea fan. If you decide to visit this locale ask for Brock...he was outstanding....and I made sure his manger who's name is Kelli (hope I am not spelling it wrong) knew that he did a great job.   My water glass never got empty....he refilled my lemonade without me even asking....and he checked on us frequently to make sure we didn't want for anything....needless to say he got a nice tip. I could go on and on...but just go for yourself and remember to Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!

NOMNOMNOM.  I have been here about 4 or 5 times and it never disappoints.  Yes it is a bit pricey, because, sadly, you do pay more n this country to eat healthy food.  But this place does it right with local fresh ingredients and sustainable items.  Their menu changes seasonally and I am happy to say that the summer menu is as good as the winter one was.    We started with a glass of Tangent Pinot Grigio, which was perfect and was served in an ice bucket at our table side.  My buddy and I shared the watermelon and heirloom tomato salad and WOW.  Best and most interesting salad I have had in Phoenix, and I go out every night I am in Phoenix, which means three nights a week for the last year and a half.  My bud ordered the salmon, which she liked alot but still prefers the preparation they do in the winter months.  That didn't stop her from scarfing the whole thing down, though.  I had the halibut with Asian mushroom and eggplant.  The halibut was perfectly prepared and worth the $26 price tag (I told you it is pricey).  I loved the eggplant, the squash, and the sauce, but am not a fan of the mushrooms, which were too tough to cut and a bit of a disappointment.  I am still a bigger fan of the pan seared trout that I had last time I was here, and that is what I will get next time.  I am usually not a fresh water fish eater, but the preparation here is divine and I still dream about that darn fish.    My partner in crime insisted on ordering the flourless chocolate cake for dessert and the one bite I allowed myself was to die for.  It was swimming in warm caramel and topped with very rich vanilla ice cream.  DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE.  Truly fabulous.

Pleasant surprise, I had to dragged to a "healthy" eating experience by my boss.  All I could picture was tofu and bean sprouts, was I mistaken.  There was such a wide selection of dishes and they have real taste.  I would recommend this place to those "meat & french fry" types.  The staff can get a little carried awayed explaining the dishes but I is nice to know what you are eating.

My sister and I finally got to get some quality time here when we were on our recent "where won't the carnivore go eat out week".  We went early on a Tuesday and were glad we did because before we left it was full to the brim.  Although the space is wide open, sound is kept to a minimum so even when they are overflowing you can still have a conversation.  The food is has been covered but let me add in my vote for the inside out burger, which is a flavor explosion of tangy, tart, spicy, and sweet in one crunchy bite.  Because the "bun" is actually the quinoa patties, it is a fork and knife event and pure bliss.  Dinner ended with a shared portion of the squash pie which comes with a side of the cocunut whipped cream and let's just say they should just sell big bowls of that cream.  It is light and airy just like the fatty traditional whipped cream but it has a delicacy that is not in it's heavy counterpart and the subtle infusion of the cococnut... well let's just say I could eat my way out of a bathtub full of the stuff.  I completely agree with Matthew K on his callout on the liquor. It seems very odd to me that you can shot up your smoothies considering their "healthy style" but who am I to argue with the anti-inflamatory king, Dr. W?  But that said, the wait staff was so extraordinarily friendly and attentive in a non-creepy (i.e., please go away) sort of way that I quickly lost traction on that rant.  Luckily after giving the menu a full once over, we decided the carnivore would be satisfied with the choices, so we will definately be back for some more of the kale salad goodness. :)

5 stars, no question! The quality was incredible. Ever bite you are reminded of what food should taste like - natural and healthy, leaving you energized and feeling great. I had the grass fed burger with sweet potatoes and kale salad. I usually hate Kale, but the lemon juices and seasonings made it super tasty! The rest of the day I felt good and wasn't tired.   I walked through the kitchen and they have people peeling carrots, washing lettuce, cutting squash, etc.   I'll definitely be back and sharing this with my friends and family.

This is my most favorite restaurant to go to! So many gluten free and dairy free options. Their salmon is cooked to perfection and their charred cauliflower is to die for... not to mention their desserts... the squash pie is to die for...would never know it's gluten free and dairy free!! Sadly it's only seasonal...but I look forward to it every season :)

This place is healthy and very tasty.  However, the menu is spotty which is why I'm only giving 3 stars.  Sometimes the words, healthy and tasty do not go together.  However, True Food has figured out the secret ingredients to a few entrees!  (They just need to work on a few others).  They have many entrees that are good for you, along with gluten free items.  We have friends that visit us from out of town that are "health nuts", and this is the only place they want to dine.  I'm healthy, but not on their level so I guess this says a lot.  I really like the grass-fed bison burger.  (Gluten-free bun upon request).  They also have a # of salads, fish, and chicken dishes.  The only reason I don't give it 4-5 stars is that the salads are mainly lettuce/greens with little other ingredients described on the menu description.  Also, their teriyaki brown rice bowl didn't taste very good.  I see a lot of potential at True Food Kitchen.  Hopefully, they can make a few changes to their menu to be even better.
Good food, but not much of it for the price.  Trendy Scottsdale restaurant.  Service was good.

Service is excellent, quick, and efficient. The noise level precludes serious business discussions. The food is good and they present a unique variety of unusual choices; however, I am allergic to MSG and I reacted to something in the Herb Spiced Hummus - why do restaurants still use that . . . ?

I have been here 10+ times and have been satisfied each time.  I love, love the alcohol free drinks and am anxiously waiting for the blood red oranges to come back into season!  I especially like the salads, particularly the Mediterranean with grilled chicken.

Always a hit, my bad experiences here have been very limited, almost always leave a happy customer. So I returned to True Foods a couple days ago after having not dined there in about a year or two and I think this last visit was my favorite! There is so much variety here, healthy food and the vegetarian options are bountiful. I noticed that the menu was a little different since the last time I'd been there, but they still had my faves so I was happy! It was pretty busy for a Tuesday night, but luckily I was able to get a seat right away. The server there was super nice and attentive to us. I absolutely love pizza, and I get the mushroom pizza almost every time I come here. However, I decided to change things up this time and went for the butternut squash pizza, and I am sure glad I did. I love both of the pizzas, but I think I prefer the butternut squash pizza. The walnuts definitely make it infinitely better, so good! Plus the fresh arugula on top is a nice touch. The spaghetti squash here it good too, but a bit pricier. I still have yet to try a Juby true juice, for sure on my list of things to try. Gives me reason to come back!

Finally had a chance to come here while in toqn for business.   It's so refreshing to find a restaurant catered to vegetarian and gluten free patrons and taste like home style meals.  The kale salad was tasty as was the turkey lasagna...but beware of the garlic use. I'm sensitive to garlic and both my plates were loaded.   The service waa great and our waiter (his name was either Todd or Tyler) knew the menu and sold my significant other on meals to dessert...and he was right on.    The ambiance is relaxing and inviting,  and you can watch the staff take good care at making sure all plates and silerware are clean.  I can't wait to come back on my next visit to try the inside out quinoa burger.

Loved it!  I had the Farmers salad and they were very accommodating to my requests to change the salad a bit.  Nice choices of organic wines as well.  I had the Chardonnay and it was yummy.  I went by myself to read a book and the server was respectful of the alone time I was there for.  I will definitely go back again to try something else.

A guilt free go-to spot.   Relaxed atmosphere and food thats filling but doesnt weigh u down.    Edamame dumplings are awesome.  The roasted turkey wrap, T.L.T., Margherita pizza, House made chicken sausage pizza, and teriyaki quinoa bowl are ones i know wont disappoint.

Salty salty salty. But almost vegan. We walked in at 5pm on a Sunday which was today and we're seated immediately. Those who came at 515pm had a half hour wait. The whole world walked in! We got our drinks at 515pm but our food took forever. The manager came over and apologized for the long wait. By then, I was more concerned about the other customers as they started to look around the room and were getting impatient....like on the edge. We had the bruschetta, chicken sausage pizza and kale salad. All average and salty. Btw, this restaurant is supposed carry the Dr Weil brand who is a health food guru.

Updating my review only to say that the crudite is amazing.  For 11 dollars I know some people will gripe that you are getting raw vegetables, but you have to understand it is a giant, artfully constructed ice cold bowl of fresh, organic vegetables served with tzatziki and olive tapenade for dipping.  Even as cheap as I am, I will lovingly order the crudite appetizer now.  Oh and top it off with some edamame dumplings if you are feeling indulgent.

Great food great people!  I walked in and was immediately greeted and seated where Adam told me about True Food Kitchen and it was nice to hear about what they had to offer. Adam explained that their menu changes every couple months depending on what the local farmers had in season. He gave me a few minutes to look over the menu while he brought me my water. I tried the hangover RX (I wasn't hungover but it had coconut water my favorite) it was delicious and refreshing. For my entree I ordered the squash casserole which was delicious! I did not know what to expect or if I would get full with just veggies, but let me tell you I did not want it to end. The cheese the sauce the squash everything had a perfect taste. For dessert I had the flourless chocolate caramel cake which was amazing as well! It came with ice cream and that was just as delicious.   I can't wait to return to continue trying their many foods :)

What a great restaurant. Lovely ambiance and classy restaurant. Had the most amazing food. The menu was great and it included gluten free dishes. I had the most yummy gluten free squash spaghetti w shrimp. Highly recommend this place.

The menu has a little something for everyone and the kitchen is amenable to customization. I enjoy the fresh, local ingredients and the seasonal changes.  A nice selection of wines, coupled with organic cocktails and fresh juices are available.  Of course, the biggest draw is Dr. Weil's partnership, although if you've read his books there are some selections counter to his recommendations.  The inside is loud (and dark at night), but there is also outdoor seating that is much calmer.
Overpriced, tiny portions. Whiskey sour was good and the lasagne was alright. Decent atmosphere. I'm pretty sure the waiter had a fake accent.

Fresh, wonderful, sustainable food sourced. The menu changes from spring to fall. The wait staff was wonderful and attentive.  The chicken sausage pizza is a must, and the bison burger is one of the best burgers I have ever eaten in my life! I ordered it medium rare which most people would order medium, but I am a bison lover and eat carpaccio very often, so a little pink doesn't scare me. It was melting in my mouth.  We had the flourless chocolate cake for dessert and I must say, delish!!!! We will be back.

Loved the healthy fare but CUM-BUY-AH!  This place is uber-spendy for what you get.  We fed three people lunch for about $90.  Food and service is great and you should expect to pay when you eat in the Scottsdale Quarter, but for that kind of $$$ I'd rather eat elsewhere.

Eating out, does not get any better than this. Coming here, feels as good as doing yoga. Love so many delightful items on the menu. All food cooked with love and bliss. Colorful fresh in season garden veggies... a must try fav place, that also serves up a very tasty burger. Andrew W. Author of 5 weeks to optimal health, along with many other health books opened this I think. Huge fan of his works, so yes, I love this place!!!

I have been a great fan of this place for some time now. Until my last experience earlier this evening I would have given them 4 stars. However, based on my carryout experience today it is obvious that their hubris is based on in store dining.  45 minutes to fulfill a 2 item order is unacceptable anywhere in the planet. And for the attitude of the staff: OMG hubris at its best.  This is a great place for good food but service is deplorable.

We stopped in for a light, quick lunch and clink of glasses to celebrate closing on our new home. We clearly made it after any lunch rush - if they had one. Very sparsely occupied with patrons. It took longer than acceptable to get water and then even longer to get our celebratory glass of white wine. Was wondering if it would be time for dinner before we got our lunch. The food we ordered was very good and our server was delightful - just too much waiting.

My husband and I both loved this restaurant. I am vegan, he eats everything, and we both found dishes that we loved. In addition, we found out that there was a TFK in Chicago where we live...so we will be adding that to our rotation. We got the Quinoa Inside Out "Burger", the Chicken Sausage and Fennel Pizza and the Teriyaki Quinoa Bowl. Each one was perfect. We also got the iced black and iced green tea. I highly recommend this restaurant in whatever city you are close to.

Friendly and helpful server.  Really tasty food. Tonight we shared ( they split it all willingly and no up charge). Miso soup, bison burger And vegetable salad. Perfect texture, flavor a and attentive service

True, it is food.  What kind and how it taste?  Well let's break it.  We ordered the Shrimp Spring Rolls to start.  It was bland, but with the sauce it had some kick. Next up, the Kale salad...mmmm kale with a splash of lemon - the fairest of them all!  I'll pass on the poison apples - it's not good for my health. Finally, we ordered the Turkey Bolognese. It was undercooked pasta with ground turkey....huh. Overall, I thought I could have made all this at home and probably taste the same, and I'm no Chef.  Service was good, everyone seemed relaxed and I wasn't sure if I should have busted out my Yoga mat with this crowd (Namaste) - Ambience was loud and very green. Almost too pretentious - "We're green and healthy, eat this food, it's like hugging a polar bear." Don't get me wrong I'm all for the environment, but I like Pandas better haha - Enjoy!
So delicious! I love when I find a place that is vegan friendly but still has non-vegan items. I 100% recommend True Food to everybody.

Not starting out so well, I told the hostess how many in our party and she didn't bother to write it down. Thank goodness I waited around because a man came in right after that and she put him in the computer before us. I pointed it out and she just gave me a snooty little smile and didn't acknowledge that we would be going first. One gets towed so tired of "Scottsdale " people who work at restaurants and give their customers an attitude. Hopefully the evening gets better.

True Food Kitchen did not live up to the hype I was expecting after ready so many good Yelp reviews...  It was A-OK at best for this Fox Restaurant.     We arrived for lunch and the True Food Kitchen was very busy so we opted to sit on the patio in 109 degree weather.  We were shaded and they have misters, so we were relatively comfortable.    Restaurant ~ there has plenty said already about this place on Yelp and the pics are a slide show for you to enjoy.  It's a nice looking restaurant both inside and out.  The decor and color schemes are nicely done.  I did not care for the flow since there are really two main entrances, one on the north side and one of the south side.  We entered the north side and stood in front of the bar area for a while until one of the bartenders informed us we had to go to the other side of the bar to see a hostess for seating.  Service ~ This was one of the more disappointments during our lunch. We were off to a bit of a rough start but that really didn't matter, it was the service we received throughout our dinning experience.  It started off great with placing our order and receiving our drinks but after we received our meal... our server must have checked out.  We tried to stop a few other passing by servers however they they too seemed disinterested in their customers as if they were all having a bad day.   We did not see our server again until we were ready for our bill.    Food ~ I ordered the grass fed Bison burger, which had shiitake mushrooms and onions, mayo, parmesan cheese on a flax bun. It was supposed to be an Unami burger but it was more of a Tsunami burger.  The parmesan cheese was too much for this well cooked and seasoned bison burger.  It over powered the taste so I had to remove it.  I ordered the sweet potato hash as my side, which was good for the first few bites but then it became somewhat blah...  We also order the shaved turkey sandwich but they were out of shaved turkey.  It was 11:30am...   So we opted for the turkey burger with a side of kale salad.  The turkey burger came with lettuce, tomato, avocado, provolone cheese, and mayo on a flax bun.  The burger was cooked very well but could have assembled better.  They placed the tomato's on top of the not so ripe avocados which were on top of the lettuce.  This made the burger like a pin ball machine, with every bite out shoots a chunk of avocado.  Bite  ~ ping, out shoots a chunk onto her blouse.  Another bite ~ pang, out shoots another chunk and it bounces onto the table.  They should consider making an avocado aioli spread for this burger.  The kale salad was also good for the first few bites then it tasted blah.  Since this was our first visit to the True Food Kitchen I raised this review up to 3 stars.  I am hesitant but will consider going back for another try in hope the service and quality of food is better.  I will be sure to select something different on my next visit.

I had an unbelievably delicious AND healthy meal tonight at True Food Kitchen: SUSTAINABLE STEELHEAD* Smoked Onion Tabbouleh, Arugula, Golden Beet & Cilantro Pumpkin Seed Pesto. I'm new to eating healthy and cooking healthy. I'd love to get the recipe for this meal...are you listening True Foods?   I like scrumptious or spicy food over bland. The lemon whatever they tossed the arugula in was unexpectedly yummy and addicting. The trout was moist, delicious and pretty! :-) The tabbouleh was plentiful and made me full by the time I finished scooping up every morsel. I'm now officially glad there's a True Foods closer by at the Biltmore.   The first time I went to a True Foods, I had a salad that looked like they just arranged all the prettiest raw veggies from the farmer's market they could find and crammed them into a bowl. It looked like art but it also felt like I was just eating from the produce section. It was boring. It had no taste. But I care more about healthy eating now than I did that first visit.   If other items on their menu are this tasty, True Foods and I are going to become close.   I recommend restaurants to my high end matchmaking clients all the time. I like that you can go for a walk after dinner and hold hands window shopping or go for an after dinner drink at one of the many nice places at both TF locales... Biltmore Fashion Park and Scottsdale Quarter.

Like most of Sam Fox's establishments True Food is consistent. I came here a few days ago to meet some friends for a late lunch and it was surprisingly busy for the time of day. We waited about 20 minutes of the 30 we were quoted. Nice. Service was quick and friendly, I ordered the Scratch Bloody Mary and it was just ok. Pretty basic garnish and didn't have much flavor. For food I ended up with the Garden Scramble with sausage and avocado. The added avocado portion was pretty small with just a couple pieces. I'm glad I also added the sausage because it was kind of bland otherwise. I found myself breaking up the sausage to get some on each bite. There was supposed to be smoked gouda but that was nowhere to be seen (or tasted). I got a cup of chicken noodle soup and it was pretty forgettable. These types of places appeal to the masses but if you want top notch, unique food then this isn't your place.

We go there with the family quite often. The food is good and healthy but not outstanding. In AZ you can not BYO wine, so many of the restaurants that do serve wine will be dinged.  Food: 3 Service: 4 Atmosphere: 4 Wine: 3 Parking: 3 Value: 3

Yes. Yes, yes, yes.   So fresh and flavorful and delicious and modern and healthy (mostly) and varied and spicy, sweet, crunchy... Seriously. So good.   We sat at the bar. Always sit at the bar.   It's not on the menu, but one of the bartenders (I wish I remembered his name!) makes a damn good spicy Bloody Mary. And it's not Sunday Brunch without a Bloody Mary.   I had the Spicy Shrimp noodle something or other. It was awesome. The broth was spicy, there were a lot of shrimp and vegetables and the noodles were the perfect texture.   I had the hardest time picking what I wanted because everything on the menu sounds and looks awesome. I can't wait to go back!

Came here with my girlfriend and really loved everything about this place.  Great location in Scottsdale for shopping and dining. Nice ambiance, casual and clean. Friendly servers, and most of all really good food and drink.  We arrived around 11:30am hoping to beat some lunch crowds but they were almost full. We took a patio seat, and was just perfect. Warm Friday in January. By the time we left, this place was totally packed.  I started my lunch with hangover drink. No, I didn't have hangover, I was just tired from work related stress and my friend suggested to have this coconut drink with pineapple and vanilla. It was in fact refreshing, my body really needed to be hydrated.  We shared caramelized onion tart. Really enjoyed the garlic and black figs. It was light, crisp, right amount of portion size to split as a lunch appetizer.  I ordered butternut squash pizza for my lunch. They use fresh ingredients and butternut squash and arugula went together really well. I actually like butternut squash, and this was the first thing that jumped into my eyes. Although I saw something else I thought I might enjoy, but I had to try... I ate a half of it and took the rest home to save a room for desert.  Flourless chocolate cake with caramel. Caramel is at the bottom of the chocolate cake. Be sure to dig all the way and enjoy ice cream, chocolate cake and caramel all together. Espresso was the perfect compliment to the chocolate cake.   I enjoyed leisurely lunch that afternoon, all vegetable lunch was so light, it was just perfect.

The concept of this place is perfect- eating healthy food designed by Dr Weil, a foremost physician dealing in true Hippocratic medicine (food). The dishes are indeed healthy and very delicious most of the time. This particular location had some inconsistencies with their food preparation that left me unimpressed. The server was strange and intense which didn't help. My five star review is for how the manager handled our gripes. Ryan, the manager, took care of us very well and was able to assure us of fantastic future visits. My husband and I love this restaurant and hope the next time we're out in Arizona, they live up to their usual reputation of great healthy food. Thanks Ryan!!

Went there for a light dinner the other evening.   I had the smoked turkey wrap and the daily soup.   My companion had the poke bowl.   I must admit, when I go out, I don't usually aim for the "healthy" type of food but once in a while, it's a good idea.     The wrap has an assortment of items:   cucumber, avocado, tomato, hummus.   The smoked turkey was tasty, not that rolled turkey sort of disgusting item.   Adding the crunch of the cucumber gave it a delightful texture.   I love avocado; therefore, can't go wrong with that; the tomato gave it color, and there was just enough hummus to give it a "dressing" sort of taste and flavor.  Very tasty.   I'd get it again.  I can't remember the soup of the day.  It was a cream sort of soup with a bit of spice to give it a pop.    It would be good just as a meal if it was larger.     My companion had the poke bowl.   I didn't taste it but was told it was good.  I would go again if I was in the mood to eat healthy.   Since I try to eat healthy at home, going out I want something I don't normally cook.  Sarah was our server.   Quite pleasant, professional and competent.

I have been here many times with friends and family, and the food is always amazing. They have great seasonal selections, as well as a variety of dishes for vegetarians, as I am one. My boyfriend who is the complete opposite has also found meals here that he loves, and he's always wanting to go back for more. The atmosphere is fantastic as well as the servers. You can tell they really want to be there and they truly care about their customers' experiences. I applaud the management at this restaurant because it does not look like an easy place to manage. Keep up the fantastic work guys, it is definitely paying off!
Bison burger and kale were amazing.  Parking a bit difficult.  Service excellent.

Tonight I had the Apple, Carrot Ginger Tonic, Andy's Favorite TLT (tempeh, lettuce and tomato) and the Banana Chocolate Tart. Everything was great but oh wow that Banana Chocolate Tart from True Food Kitchen is pure bliss the flavor profile is simply divine.
Too expensive for what you get. I would way rather go to Pita Jungle, or Federal, or pretty much anywhere...

Beautifully located in Scottsdale Quarters. Great for a mom lunch right by the splash pad or date nights. Food and drinks were amazing. Relaxing outside dining and service always very personable.   Have ordered sandwiches, pizza, and spaghetti squash. All entrees were delicious and the best part HEALTHY! Kids menu had a good selection but portions are limited. Highly recommend True Food especially for gluten free eaters.
Always delicious and healthy! Hummus is topped with fresh cherry tomatoes and olives. I get the sweet chili shrimp with shirataki noodles and it is mouthwatering. One of my favorite places!

It's ok. But i can eat like this at home...or no, i can eat better at home and i won't be out 100$, feel like a cool people fad with the obvious healthy edge. Overpriced as hell and overrated. We had been before and had the same feeling, but wanted to give it another go before officially crossing it off the list, since you can hardly make an informed opinion off of 4 food items. Well now we have had 8, and it's consistently underwhelming and overpriced.
good food in tiny proportions and pricey as hell. god forbid you get refills on your drinks and get charged extra each time? side salads are like saucer cups! when did the price of lettuce go up?

Love this place. Been here 3 times now - will make the drive on my next trip in. If you're into eating quality healthy foods, I'm putting this up there in my fav 5 for places to go in the country.   Only thing holding me back from claiming more love is the drink prices (they will get you) on their bar drinks..  Not too far off what you'll pay at many other places in Scottsdale but it's not the wallets best friend from that perspective.  Get their Bison burger, Kail-aid drink and soak up the delisc!

I had lunch with a colleague here recently. I like that they have healthy food and adequate - but not overwhelming portion sizes. I order the teriyaki bowl and asked for chickpeas instead of one of the protein options listed in the menu - and they had no problem with that. It was delicious.   I appreciate some of the little touches at this place, like when you order water, they give you your own carafe and if you wear dark pants, skirt, or dress, they give you a black napkin to replace the white one that is part of their standard place setting.    The only thing I would change is make it a bit less noisy. Sometimes it was hard to hear my dining companion.

This place deserves 10 stars. The food is amazing and the best service in town. Chris and Nate are always very friendly and they even know what I am ordering most of the time. The managers always come by to say hello. All around great atmosphere!

This place is quite cool.  They make a note that their menu is prepared in accordance with Dr. Andrew Weil (a well known physician-author) health guidelines.  However, don't think that this is a veggie only operation. I had a bison chili to start and it was quite delicious. Then, a tasty chicken sausage thin crust pizza. Try out their site-created sodas. The seasonal one was a grape concoction but tasted more like a crème soda.  Not only was the server extremely nice but they also have a lovely outdoor seating area that's shaded.
I love this place. The food is fresh and made with quality ingredients.  I love the variety of dshes too. I had a Thai curry dish and it was great! I'll go back here every chance I get.

This place has a great atmosphere and I like the healthy living menu theme - especially the fresh made drinks.  The food was enjoyable - though, nothing that can't be easily replicated at home after a quick stop at Whole Foods.  My biggest issue is that True Foods is way, way, way OVERRPRICED for what you are getting.  There is nothing truly special here to merit the cost of the meal - you'll likely enjoy whatever you order, but you will also leave with a nagging feeling that you got fleeced...

I'm kinda stingy about giving up 5 stars but this place is the real deal.  I've been to the Biltmore True Food location and it was OK but I like this new place better.  The building has plenty of light and high ceilings.  The service is very friendly and efficient.  Lots of Scottsdale pretty people dining here to observe as entertainment.  I ordered the shrimp dumplings to start.  Not only did they taste great but the presentation was beautiful with the dumplings and broccoli.  I also ordered the shaved turkey pita.  This was enormous and every bite was delicious.  I had a nice combination of squash and kale on the side.  I like this place a lot and will be back soon.

Stopped in here Saturday night.  Don't like this location as much as Scottsdale but the food and service were solid.  My friend raved about his New Planet gluten free beer.  He said it was the best gf beer he's ever tasted.

Have been eating here for years...one of the best healthy options in all of Scottsdale. From drinks to appetizers to entrees to dessert, everything is flavorful. The Avocado & Kale dip is a great starter. Eaten here dozens of times over the last 4-5 years and look forward to many more meals!!!
I ordered  Minestrone   Soup And I was very disappointed to realize it's a can soup not made fresh. 2 stars for that. Sorry true food you can't fool me.
Great restaurant with healthy food, if you like healthy pizza this place make nice pizza..

I was staying nearby for a work conference, but didn't check out this restaurant until my last day - if I had, I would have been here everyday! The food was so flavourful and deeeelish!  I had the spaghetti squash dish, which prompted me to buy some spaghetti squash to recreate at home.  The beverages were also so much fun and so refreshing.  Super busy for a Friday at lunch, so plan in advance! We got a seat at the bar, so it worked out for my lunch date and I.

If you are looking for healthy and fresh food, this is a great place. We got the inside out quinoa burger and the red chili shrimp. Both were really great. I loved the kale salad that came on the side of the inside out quinoa burger. I have no complaints about the food. I thought the food and especially the drinks were over priced. I paid 6 dollars for a small lemonade. Definitely go for just water if you go!

Disclaimer: I can't be objective with this place since I harbor deep resentment for the loss of Coffee Plantation (the former tenant in this space).  So if you want an objective review, skip to another yelper.  As a Biltmore resident, the last thing I needed walking distance to my house was a new restaurant.  The Biltmore and Esplanade already had plenty of restaurants.  Coffee Plantation was a community hangout and the neighborhood just does not feel the same without it.  The blue grass jams on Sunday are no more, the college kids studying are gone, and no longer do I see my neighbors grabbing coffee in the morning.  Paradise Bakery is no substitute.  As for True Food itself, the food is inconsistent so order with care.  The tuna appetizer has been pushed on me more than once and I have always been very disappointed in the quality of the fish.  Call it what you like, it's just plain tuna sashimi floating in some kind of sauce.  Some items I do like are the Teriyaki Tofu and the Curry Chicken (substituting with Tofu), but I question their logic.  With the Curry you get noodles and with the Teriyaki, you get rice.  It seems like it should be the other way around for me, or at least give the option of rice with the curry.    I do like their juices but could do without the waiters giving you the canned speeches.  Try asking what Olivello juice is and you will get a scripted response about sea buckthorn berries.  Say what?  Olivello is a trademarked name apparently.  The sea buckthorn berry exists, but still you can't help but feel like a sucker for ordering something with so many names.  Have you ever seen a seabuckthorn berry?  Me neither.  Another yelper had to point me to a website describing the plant (thanks Chad H.).  Surprise surprise, it also doesn't taste all that great.  My advice, add the $3.00 shot of vodka and let your questions fade away to the back of your mind.  And while I do agree with many of the health ideas behind the menu in general, they could make it a little more subtle.  When people put forth their views so strongly you can't help but question their sincerity.  The food should not need trademarked names, a celebrity endorsement, or other affirmations of healthiness if it really does the good things they say.  The results should speak for themselves.    Overall though, I keep going back to this place and have not had any bad experiences.  Mostly it's just a great location, good atmosphere, and decent food that you can feel good about consuming.  It's also great for groups.
there with out of town visitors a few weeks ago. specialty drinks are good. The menu has gone through several changes...not always good changes. Appetizers always good. fair value for the price.

Went for dinner last night, food was awesome, especially the onion tart we got for starters.  Drinks were good too, but I got a cranberry lemonade with vodka and it was kind of weak.   For my entree I had the Mediterranean salad and split a mushroom pizza, both of which were very good.  The only negative was the length of time to get our food.  We had a 7 year old boy with us and he was very hungry

Great place for a quick lunch with the girls! The place gets packed for lunch so there may be a wait (not one when we went) but it is definitely worthwhile. The cucumber refresher non-alcoholic drink was exactly that... refreshing! Visiting from New Jersey, I'm not used to this dry heat so it was an excellent start to a great meal. The salad with goat cheese and pistachios was amazing. I nearly licked my bowl afterwards since the vinegrette was so delicious! I added chicken to it and it was perfect. My girlfriends got the chicken chop salad and the Mediterranean salad and there were smiles all around the table so I would definitely recommend this place to the locals who haven't been there yet!

Great food, but the portions are a bit small for the prices. I love the idea of eating locally and I realize it is a bit more costly to do things that way, but after a $60 dinner (2 drinks, 2 meals, 1 dessert), hubby and I shouldn't both still be hungry. The food we DID get was awesome- I had a chicken sausage pizza and hubby had some sort of seafood soup. The dessert was flourless chocolate cake and it was delicious, but $7 was a bit much for a round cake that was quite a bit smaller than your average cupcake and a golf-ball sized scoop of vanilla-caramel ice cream.  The service here was awesome and they happily accommodated our group of 18. It was pretty empty when we came in, but crowded by the time we left. The decor of fresh fruits and veggies, clean lines and Asian influences was great except that one of my friends ended up with a fruit fly in her drink.
This place is ALWAYS hopping. Even so their staff are super friendly, service  has always been great and the food is top notch. Highly recommended.
Great food & service!  Clean & relaxing atmosphere!  Food was fresh & amazing!

Always try something new here. Had summer pizza and delicious crispy crust with cheese, asparagus and summer squash. I ate the WHOLE thing!!  True Food always has delicious food but my absolute favorite is the spaghetti squash casserole. LOVE IT!

True Foods is our goto place given all their great vegan and vegetarian choices. The Crudités is our goto starter as a giant bowl of fresh vegetables. The menu is nearly flawless. Run, don't walk, to True Foods!

I am plant-based and my boyfriend is a meat-eater, but we can both agree that this is our FAVORITE place to eat in Scottsdale. Everything on the menu is just amazing. They pay extra spacial attention to people with allergies or diet restrictions - which I appreciate very much.   You really must try this one :)

Love this restaurant!  Food is fresh and prepared well. Wonderful flavor combinations for healthy eating. I also love that you serve Kombucha!  It's not common here in AZ.  Service has always been good here as well.

The best part of our experience was our amazing Server. She was super considerate of my daughters peanut allergy and even looked up the ingredients for the bison burger, including sauce to make sure it was something she could eat. Who knew bison might be an issue?! We started with the edamame dumplings. They were interesting. Daughter liked them but they weren't my favorite...pass. I ordered the Mediterranean chopped saled and it looked really awesome! Sadly, it tasted like dandelions. Seriously. I feel bad because I'm sure that's all healthy and wonderful and blah blah blah but it was just yucky. Yes, yucky is absolutely a technical culinary term. Anywho, not my thing, two thumbs down... It was super busy at lunch time and people obviously love it...just wasn't my thing. If you're looking for overpriced 'healthy' fare, check it out! I'll be at happy hour down the street ;)

Everything I have ever had here has been delicious. If I could drink the Kale-Aid every day I would. Have them put some jalapeño in it to elevate it that extra bit... yum! Service is very responsive, bringing extra silverware, filling water glasses, splitting checks and validating parking tokens. The only down side is that the restaurant is very open and it can get a bit loud during peak hours.

True Food Kitchen was definitely one of the best restaurants ever for me and my family!  The workers are so friendly and happy to help! They have a great amount of gluten free options for us and the organic all natural food makes it even better!  I personally love that the kitchen is open for everyone to see in the restaurant! Everyone needs to go to this location! The little plaza with the fountain is an amazing view!

Used to be a great place for dinner. Last two times not so good. Ate there last night and it was poor from start to finish. Our waiter could get nothing right. It was as if we spoke a foreign language Some of our . My wife and our friend had sea bass which had absolutely no taste. My wife got her sea bass  almost 10 minutes after our friend did. I feel as if Fox Group, the owner of True Food has expanded to fast and have taken their eye off the ball.
Love love love their Mediterranean salad, with or without a side of salmon - absolutely delicious!   Service is always prompt and attentive.   One of my favorite places for lunch or dinner.

I love it. We come at a busy night but the staff still enough for us not to wait long. We are seated and given a couple of water. The waitress is really nice. Since it is my first time, my friend order foods for us. Yes, the idea of organic food kind of but me in a mood "Healthy food - not taste good." But it amazing how the food taste. You can taste the texture and sweetness of the veges. I like the pizza the best. Taste different than normal pizza but still have the flavor in it. I definitely come back for this. (Already ask for few business card)

We have been to TFK several times. Service was excellent, we had the same waitress a couple of times, she was very nice and prompt.  I like the restaurant design, it's clean and simple.   Now, the food. There are some hit and misses. The onion tart, kale salad, hummus and farro are delicious. The honey lemonade is great, but with no refills it can get expensive.  The chicken, curry plate, spaghetti squash casserole were....ehhhh. Like they forgot to put flavor in them. It tasted like, well, chicken, curry, spaghetti squash. The plate looks great and you expect this explosion of flavors in your mouth. Once you taste it is like a firecracker that fizzles, disappointing.   Also, we had our son with us and ordered his vegetables to be cooked soft and in none of our visits they manage to do it right.  They tried, but for some reason they couldn't?  I had dessert once, I think it was a banana chocolate tart. I know it had chocolate in it. It was good but nothing to write home about.  I guess I like to go to eat to TFK when we are out, it makes me feel healthy. Not satisfied but healthy nonetheless.  *3.5 stars*

I've been here a few times. Lovely atmosphere.  Last time there, I ordered the curry bowl and it was not what I expected. I love curry but could not bring myself to eat their dish. I had to send it back and ended up going with my usual mushroom pizza, which is great.   A little pricey, with rather small portions.   All in all, they're worth visiting.

Quite a unique place.  Fresh and organic is the theme.  Young, hip, trendy,  and friendly flows everywhere.  Jessica our barkeep directed us to a fee dishes that were exactly what the theme of the restaurant is, fresh and tasty!  Of course, it is not just regular carrots in the crudités, but red and yellow so your eyes are just as pleased as your taste buds are.  The side sauces are a perfect compliment to the array of vegetables provided.  You will be asking for more as they take on a presence of their own.  The Edamame dumplings were delicious as well.  A light broth with just a hint of white truffle accompanies the pillowy soft dumplings.  A sprinkle of chopped scallions give it the pop of flavor that makes this dish sing.  Saw numerous 'organic' vodka drinks, but didn't try.  Maybe next time.....but it did make me ponder just what an 'organic' hangover would feel like?!?

Thank you, TFK for existing! I wanted to try everything on the menu but it just wasn't possible tonight! This is a place I could go back to every day until I try the entire menu.  I was pleasantly surprised. The food is so fresh and the flavors are great, not too salty, not overseasoned, just right. We started with the thai shrimp dumplings- small portion.  I considered ordering another.  I had the teriyaki chicken bowl and loved it.  My husband had the chicken sausage pizza.  He loved it.  We were pretty content after the entree but I just had to taste their desserts.  The almond oilve oil cake was so delish.  Light, fluffy.  A great summer dessert.  Now if they would only post that recipe.  The portions are perfect, service is great, staff is friendly and the kitchen coordinator was on top of his s*@t!  See you tomorrow, TFK :)

Love this place! We ate here twice in two days, and it was as good as I remember it from my last trips to AZ years ago at another True Food location. The sea bass we had the first day was pretty standard, but everything else we had was very delicious, including drinks/smoothies/appetizers. Our guests requested to eat here a second time so we came for brunch the next day and were equally satisfied.
Really fun ambiance and a great place to go with your vegetarian and vegan friends. Service was good and the sweet potato soup with with Moroccan spices was my favorite.
Love this spot even though it is a chain. Location and ambiance cannot be beat. Great food and lots of good drink options.

I wanted to love this place.. The only dish I truly enjoyed was the Avocado/Spinach dip and gluten free pitas. I think our waiter's pretentious attitude ruined the food, and atmosphere. When I asked Andrew about a dish, his response was in an I am much better than you because I am a vegan tone... "I don't know, because I don't eat that." Is really not the response you are looking for, I usually am one to chuck it up to ok maybe he is having a bad day... But It was like everything about him was sour, which I think soured the experience. My friend ordered the spaghetti squash without cheese, and Andrew rolled his eyes... I would of thought he would of clapped, since it now would be vegan... He sulked away...  The food came, and My friends dish tasted of Lighter fluid, when we brought it to Andrew's attention... he just took it away, he was unapologetic, he did not state whether he would get a new one or offer her another option. We watched as he spoke with the manager and pointed at our table... The manager  however was very friendly, and apologetic. He brought the new dish out, which tasted and smelled great.  If only that could of saved the evening from Andrew's attitude. We did not see Andrew again,  another server brought us our check, and took it to process the cards. It was not until it was time to pick up our check, did Andrew Return..  I was over his pretensions hipster attitude at this point. It ruined my evening as well as my chance to enjoy a new place I had once look forward to trying...

I just went here for the first time AND it was for Valentines Day.  I was a little skeptical because I am not a vegetarian, don't really care for many gluten free foods, etc.  But, I will say this, no flavor was lost on ANY dish I tried, everything was amazing and my eyes were opened up to how awesome the food at this restaurant is.    We got the hummus for appetizer, roasted chicken entrée and steak taco entrée and the dessert trio to try things out (flowerless chocolate cake, Pomegranate yuzu sorbet and squash pie).    Hummus - I have never found a hummus I enjoy, this was had a little spice to it and was amazing.  Roasted chicken - the amount of flavor in this dish is amazing.  I am not a squash fan so I substituted in some broccoli, mixed with the faro, spinach and puree I downed the entire entrée and was in heaven.  Steak Tacos - My girlfriend is very picky, but gobbled up every bite of her tacos.    Dessert: Flowerless chocolate cake - amazing again, flowerless..? I don't even know what that means after eating this cake, every cake should be made this way. Sorbet - Amazing, sweet with a little tang very good. Squash Pie - very similar to pumpkin pie but better.  Very, very good dish.  Assistant General Manager Ryan and our server were both so good and meeting everybody's needs during a busy Valentine's Day evening.  Thanks guys!!

First time here and very impressed. The server was kind and helpful. Explained a lot of the dishes and helped me choose. Had the medicine man drink. Really tasty!!! Then had the day's soup which had a nice tasting chicken fennel sausage. Followed it up with a half salad.  I noticed that colors and textures are a key to this restaurant. I had room for dessert so I had the strawberry rhubarb crisp and a well made latte. All in all, great flavors, textures, colors and service. I'll be back!!

One of my favorite restaurants! The patio is perfect for winter because their heaters are the best! They really project the heat and work well. The soup of the day choice is always special and yummy! We always start with soup and the vegetable crudités. My boyfriend begs me to figure out the recipe for their olive tapenade... SO GOOD! I always get the inside out quinoa burger with half kale salad half sweet potato hash. Sides of ketchup and chili paste. You will not regret it!!! They also have an amazing wine selection if you enjoy a glass or two with dinner.

Decided to try out True Food Kitchen because #1 it was close to the hotel and #2 we had a veggie in the group.  They have a nice selection of wine by the glass and bottle.  Some off beat varietals, like malbec and monastrell.  Our waiter, Andrew was amazingly knowledgeable about wine for his mere 26 years!  I ordered a veggie salad with beets, turnip, and some other crunchy root vegetables.  It was supposed to have manchego cheese but I realized half way through that it was missing!  The salad was tasty otherwise - perfect for a lite dinner on an extremely hot evening.  The patio seating was lovely and the misters were a life saver!

I loved my first True Foods experience. All of the food is local, seasonal and fresh! There are not many places to go these days that offers nothing but "true foods", so I will be a loyal patron. I had the Kale Tuscan Salad with Cucumber Honey Lemonade. The salad was perfect and large and the lemonade was out of this world. The staff was very friendly and helpful!

Healthy food that tastes amazing.  All the wait staff have always been helpful in suggestions and quick service.    I will warn you that this place is quite busy throughout the week and even busier on weekends. Business lunches during the day and meet ups after work. So plan accordingly.  Highly recommend the Steak Tacos and the Honey lemonade.

Another great option for dining! This one far healthier than any of the others posted.  The Edamame dumplings are like nothing you have ever tried.  They put grapefruit in their guacamole, which is bizarre, but yum yum yum.   We had a variety of meals, from vegetarian to Moroccan, to a steak bowl, and all of us were quite satisfied & very full.  And caution, It does get a bit pricey when you start adding beverages or meat To the meals.

This place is my go to for vegan options. I've been on a real vegan kick lately to see how long I could stick with it, this place has made that a lot easier. The appetizers I've tried here, the guacamole and the squash toast, both amazing. The tea selection is awesome. I've had the sweet potato bowl here twice now, really really tasty. The vanilla dairy free ice cream will leave you wondering a. How did they get it to taste so good, b. Why haven't I tried dairy free ice cream before? A soy cappuccino with the vegan ice cream is stupid delicious. Trust me. The ambiance of this place is also nice with an earthy feel that is interesting considering the actual steel and glass landscape that awaits just outside.

Good for what it is.....organic healthy blah blah blah....my gf is a vegetarian  We ordered humus....twas amazing to her...I enjoyed it.   She had a turkey burger and it surprisingly tasted good.     I had a Bison Burger and it was...interesting.....good...different....  We both ordered a drink and they were fresh and flavorful.   For an app, 2 drinks, and 2 entrees it was over $60. For the interesting taste and the feeling of not being satisfied in your belly.....not worth it. Granted, some people who enjoy this kind of food will love it. Not hating, just not my kind of food choice =)

On Saturday wanted to hear the scheduled band at the Quad so I made a rez for outdoors. We were seated at a perfect location. The waiter was adorable and charming. I later told him he reminded me of Ed Norton but cuter. Sadly though he didn't introduce himself.   We ordered and the food arrived pretty quickly. My sea bass was delicious with a light tasty sauce alongside wonderful mushrooms and green veggies. Great size and cacophony of flavors and textures. I will repeat this dish on my next visit. Hubby was happy with his steak tacos and my friend really enjoyed her salad cause she was humming as she ate.  Returned for lunch with a friend today and again the waitress was adorable but No name.
