I've been to this TFK more times than I can count, so I can't believe I haven't reviewed it until now.  (I have reviewed the Biltmore location).  I've been here alone, in small groups of 2-4, in larger groups of 5+, with and without my toddler.  I've never had a bad experience.  That says a lot.  The food is consistent, healthy, and delicious.  The service is attentive.  The atmosphere is lively.  The bathrooms are clean.  This has become a go-to place for us to meet friends that live in North Scottsdale as it's kind of half-way...  Standout items on the brunch menu in my opinion are the johnnycakes and the open faced egg white omelette.  I enjoy the "bright eyes" drink as well.  For lunch/dinner, you really can't go wrong but some of my faves are the vegetable crudite appetizer, the kale salad with salmon, the pan seared sea bass, teriyaki brown rice bowl.  You can't go wrong with their turkey burger either, and their pizzas are great for kids!  On the FRC website, they say that "At True Food Kitchen, we want you to feel better, live longer, and make your mouth happy in the process."  I'd say they are making good on their mission - one meal at a time!  ****It's worth noting that the parking situation at Scottsdale Quarter is either in the big lot or valet unless you have really good parkma and score a spot on the street nearby.

Smoothies and Omelets and Johnny Cakes Oh My!  True Food Kitchen is by far one of my favorite spots in the Valley, and definitely my favorite Fox concept.  I was a huge fan before, but now with the addition of breakfast on the menu, I could eat at TFK for every meal and never get bored...   While I have my favorite menu items for each meal, I do mix it up now and again.  However,  do not - I repeat, do not go to TFK for breakfast unless you are going to get at least one order of the Quinoa Blueberry Johnny Cakes for the table.  Served with pure maple syrup and Greek yogurt, this dish is a godsend from heaven!    And while I'm here updating my original TFK review, I have to add that service is always fabulous.  Damon has a special place in my heart as he was my first ever server, and continues to be friendly and attentive when I get seated in his section, but I've had numerous other servers, and they've all been awesome.  I hope that the new Scottsdale Quarter location will be just as successful as this one.  Until next time, TFK - see you soon!

Note: I've only been here once, but I'll update my review if/as I go more and further inform my opinion.  This place was perfectly enjoyable. The food and juice selections are on point and just what you would expect from an establishment branded as "True Food Kitchen." A cautionary note to the juices would be that if you're ordering one that incorporates lemonade, you might ask them to go light on it if you want to avoid a lot of sugar. But I want to focus on what makes this place exceptional.  The floorplan of the restaurant is really lovely and engaging. You come in and you can see the cooks prepping for a lot of the dishes you read about on the menu. I've never seen anything like this before, and I really loved it. Secondly, this place is probably one of the best places to split a meal. I don't recall if there was a split plate charge, but it would be worth it regardless. My co-worker and I decided to split the Quinoa Burger and a salad, and we received separately plated mini-burgers with our portion of the sides, and our salad portions were served to us in our own bowls. Maybe I'm eating at the wrong places, but I felt like that was truly exceptional service. Lastly, the menu was really varied and had lots of options for vegetarian and gluten free fare.   tl;dr This restaurant trafficked in pretty standard "heatlhy" fare and did a fine job. What sets it apart is the experience provided by the friendly, knowledgeable staff and the overall setting, which is greatly enhanced by the integration of prep space into the floor plan of the dining area.  UPDATE: There is no split plate fee at True Food, as verified by the owner in the below comment. Further awesome, verified.

Very nice restaurant that is special - there is no wall separating diners from the kitchen so you can view the food preparers & the food itself as it is being prepared. There are also a variety of seating options - inside, outside, small tables, long tables, by the far. My wife & I had the Kale & Avocado Dip, Onion Tart,  Steak Tacos (minus meat), Apple Goji Crisp, Hangover RX, Cold Matcha Horchat, Sparkling Tea & Jasmine Pearl. Unique food items. Good variety of vegetarian & vegan items. Good service.

True Food has very delicious food. True Food has some really healthy options. True Food has very delicious healthy options that just aren't worth the prices. There's a good chance you might leave True Food still hungry.  Still, totally worth checking out, if for no other reason to taste something that you can later make yourself at home! (And hey, maybe that's the point-- encourage healthier eating at home by showing visitors how delicious it can be!)

Went for weekday lunch on a Friday and there was a small wait so we opted for the communal tables. Slight snafu when our waitress didn't realize our party was three and not the five that all sat down around the same time, and she started taking someone else's order with ours, but it was easily sorted out. The communal tables are a bit too wide across so you have to speak up to talk across them, but I'd sit there again.   Overall I was impressed with the look and feel of the place - there's a very "natural" vibe carried through the decor and open air/sunlight that enhances the food.   The food was on the pricey side but the quality was apparent. To drink we all got the honey lemonade which was so simple but really excellent and comes with a free refill. I'd go back just for that! My companions enjoyed their open-faced salmon and the shaved turkey pita which each came with a side of mixed kale/sweet potato hash. I had the chicken panang curry which was tasty with fresh ingredients and well cooked, but I agree with the other reviewer that the ratio of sauce to rice seems off and too soupy.   My companions had tried the salads on previous visits and thought they were much too small for the money. For the price, I thought we got our money's worth.

This place is ridiculous.  I'm all about eating healthy and organic and what not (I frequent Whole Foods multiple times a week).  But this place is for suckers.  I already gave up eating here long ago, because their food is severely overpriced and bland - not to mention the seriously small portions.  However, this afternoon, while doing some shopping in Scottsdale Quarter, I stopped by their semi-new Juice Bar (Juby True?) and ordered an iced green tea.  No big deal right?  I didn't even look at the menu, because I would assume that an Iced tea would be a negligible expense.  Well, to my surprise, after they had poured it and rang it up - it was just under FIVE DOLLARS!!!  For an Iced tea?!! Are you freaking kidding me?!  On what planet is it okay to charge $5 for an Iced tea?  Seriously!  And it wasn't even that good.  I definitely should have gone across the street to Starbucks, or down the road to AJ's, where I could have gotten 3 way better ones for the same price.  You people are scammers.  I feel like I should also add that I lived in Manhattan for 3 years (which is by far one of the most expensive places in the country), and I was never charged this much for an Iced tea while I lived there.  Maybe I'm just having a fit, but this place needs to get over themselves.  I honestly don't understand how they're still in business.

I am not convinced I've never reviewed True Food before. I'm convinced my review must have been lost in some update or something.  Oh, where to start? So, the bigger chains usually turn me off and this is a Fox Restaurant Concept although they've stepped up their game and have some pretty decent places these days. This is definitely one of them.   It is a bit pricey if you're like me and want one of everything, even though you know a simple meal will suffice especially when it's nutrient dense like the ones at True Food. Dr. Andrew Weil helped design the menu here with health and taste in mind. Some of the items are very simple making them delicious, like the turkey sandwich, with grapes (if my memory serves me correctly) and a half and half side of Tuscan kale salad and sweet potato hash. All very simple yet packed full of flavour and well, you just feel healthy afterwards.   The bison burger will keep any meat eater pleased and is a bit more complex, with an umami sauce and a medley of roasted mushrooms and caramelized onions. Even for those such as myself who aren't huge proponents of meat, I have no guilt in indulging in one of these burgers.  The crudités blew my mind the first time I ordered it and the hummus is a personal favorite of mine, I make the same recipe at home and have never had one that tastes better. Okay, maybe once but it was out of state, therefore, out of mind.   These days, I typically order whatever seasonal salad they may have and am always impressed at random goji berries or boysenberries that maybe paired with whatever seasonal vegetables at the time of my visit.  Though their dessert selection is rather minimal, I still love the matcha ice cream. Not to mention the beverages, both alcoholic and non. I personally like the spontaneous happiness drink if I am in the mood to drink and I do spontaneously feel happiness at those times. I also really enjoy their elixir, maybe they have more than one and I'm sure they're equally deserving of a mention but I've only had one.  I've tried a rice noodle mushroom dish that was divine as well.   The kiddo loved the crispness of the veggies in the kids teriyaki bowl which was surprising because she is rather picky and I believe it came with black rice.   I personally don't think one can go wrong at this place. I wasn't stoked on the tuna started we had last time but think it was just the sauce for me. The only other complaint I have is that there isn't one out by me in Gilbert yet, especially with all of the new development in the area.   Fingers crossed.

The food is good and healthy, but I just wish they were a bit nicer when seating people. They totally discriminate against people who what to go there by themselves for lunch and make you wait until the restaurant is virtually half empty before giving you a table.  No classy restaurant does this, if there is a table for two available, they will seat a party of one or two in order, but with these guys, I guess its all about maximizing profits. They'll seat you immediately if there is two of you but tell you there is a 30 to 45 minute wait if you're just one person.   For a place that typically costs $20 to $30 for a simple sandwich and a healthy drink, you would think they wouldn't act so cheap.

You have to give it FRC.  You're going to get a good meal at any of his restaurants, but True Food is one of the best.  I have dreams about the edamame dumplings, and have been known to have 3 orders as an entree-don't miss out on these.  Although I usually go salad, today I had the Tuna sliders with a small kale salad and of course, the dumplings.  The dumplings were great as usual.  The Tuna sliders didn't blow me away, but they were solid.  I'd like for them to have a little more of a spicy kick, but that's just me- they were still very good.  Also, don't forget their drinks-you'll love the selection.    Chow away!

This place was recommended to us by some friends, so we decided to try it on a whim one night.  The decor was very modern and earthy.  Our server was very knowledgable about the items on the menu, and gave my husband the advice of trying to "half portions" of the asian dishes he was debating between.  Turns out the half portions are HUGE.  He took almost a whole one home.  The teriyaki was a little bit too salty for my taste, but I thought the curry dish was excellent.  I had the steak tacos adn I thought they were also very well done.  The men at the table next to us ordered some hot sauce to go along with theirs, and I think I'll do that next time too.  I'll definitely be coming back here, especially when my sister is in town because they have a variety of gluten free menu items.

Dean was a fabulous server! We started with the guacamole and butternut squash soup both were fabulous but I would highly recommend the soup since it is a more unique dish. Next we had the butternut squash pizza with vegan almond ricotta. Yum and thank goodness for this pizza it was delicious next we had the squash pie yum yum yum! Keep in mind this is all vegan and healthy!

I absolutely adore True Foods Kitchen! We had the vegan chorizo burrito and a pizza( not the butternut squash pizza) both were filling and fantastic. The vegan chorizo burrito is a bunch item so if you want to try it you must go on the weekend.  The patio was amazing to sit on chat and eat. I parked in the covered parking on the other side of the mall to save it from the sun and heat. There is parking in front of the restaurant. Thank you True Foods Kitchen for offering vegan options

I am a huge fan of cooking. I also love places that sell fresh food. After days of hanging by the pool, I decided to get out and venture over to the Biltmore Fashion Park. I checked the photos and figured that the True Food Kitchen was the place for me.   I sat at the bar and had a little trouble figuring out what to eat, it all looked great but I was craving fish. I ordered the fish tacos and decided on the Skinny Margarita. It's called a skinny margarita because it's made with fresh juices and not because it's made with that low-calorie margarita mixer. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/XMMLRvV4IMxIGyc4H37LxA#QnIja5A6SwqeJcFfPfZRqA  The margarita was refreshing and my tacos were great. Very light, freshly made and my server Jake brought me two different types of hot sauce. I like it spicy and appreciated it very much. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/XMMLRvV4IMxIGyc4H37LxA#kVbK8jNzkNTAeL2ReBCpMQ  The lunch was light and tasty, which was perfect and tasted like something I would make at home. It's very refreshing to find places that are not chain restaurants and serve fresh food you can watch them preparing. That's why I truly enjoyed the True Food Kitchen.

Unfortunately their pen ang curry comes with a Shrimp broth which somehow cannot be substituted. Upon finding this out our entire party had to leave.  Please fibd a way to make vegetarian Asian food if only because Asian food can be vegetarian by its very nature. To zin burger and sol we went.

I came in craving a fresh and healthy drink and had a great experience. I ended up getting a simple kale salad and opted for a sparking tea. As my server and I were talking I mentioned I didn't like drinks that were too sweet. She noticed I wasn't drinking my tea and asked if it was too sweet... it was for me so she brought me a flight of different drinks based on my preferred flavors! AwEsOmE service! I ended up liking a drink i otherwise wouldn't have tried. I had a great time trying all the different drinks. :) Kombucha, cranberry pomegranate, ginger honey lemon (the natural)... the Kombucha and the natural were my favorites. The best part is that you could always customize the sweetness.. light or sans honey :)
Very healthy and fresh food! I love going here and always leave happy and full. The have a great salad selection with a wide variety of proteins you can add.

What an amazing experience at True Food. The food was exceptional. The red curry shrimp...OMG to die for. It was my husband's birthday and I couldn't of been happier with  the service. Our waitress was so nice and so component at explaining the menu to us. The avocado and kale dip appetizer was superb. We couldn't  wait for dessert .... Of course they out did themselves with the chocolate flourless cake which was amazing.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to add a few healthy options to their palette.

Met a friend here for a light lunch and we both ordered salads. They were delicious and surprisingly filling! I ordered the seared ahi salad and it, along with the greens were so fresh and delicious.   This place is one of those restaurants for those into health kicks and pressed juices, which isn't really my scene but I did enjoy my salad and actually crave it sometimes! The prices are a bit higher but it's to be expected from this kind of place.

After nine years of lengthy visits and six months of living here, I have finally found the best food in Phoenix. It's HERE at True Foods, on Scottsdale.   I am so grateful to have savored the astonishing flavor medley of the steelhead plate yesterday, as well as -- quite simply -- the best hummus I have ever tasted. Smoked onion tabouli made with farro and red quinoa! Yellow beet arugula salad with cilantro pesto dressing! accompanied the fish.   The miso soup was outstanding, if rather non-traditional. (Mine is still better, however :)  The onion tart (got some takeout to keep the food-high going) was rather disappointing. And I confess I added squeezed lemon to the tabouli, because... lemon.   The prices weren't bad, considering the wealth of fresh raw ingredients that were cooked into or made into every bite, and the coffee kept coming. At tables all around me people were raving after a couple of bites, and we all kept exclaiming to the wait staff "OMG what's in THAT!?  And my server was perfect. She was attentive, positive, informative, helpful and friendly. AND unabashedly in awe of the dedication and skills of the kitchen staff. Now that's not something you run into every day!  It is so extraordinary to witness a restaurant exceeding our expectations over and over again. Heartfelt foodie thanks, I will be back. Often. Actually, might as well put a plaque on a table with my name on it...

It's true. The True Food Kitchen on Scottsdale is MUCH better than this one on Camelback. I had read that somewhere, should have paid attention. Good service Thursday night, as usual so far. But. The miso soup was barely warm and too salty to eat. I sent it back. The coffee was luke warm and bitter, the cream had clots from souring, and I was never offered a refill (just as well really).  Should have sent it back too. Bison burger was good, but the sweet potato hash cubes were all burned black on one side. *sigh. Truly disappointing after my awesome first meal at the other location. Won't be back to this one.
Amazing! Fresh, healthy and delicious! Loved everything!!! The bowls are in incredible. So happy to have found a place like this!

I'm giving TF 3 because of the consistently slow service at the Kierland location.  We had reservations so the wait for our table to clear was not long but while we wait, the young ladies  ask us 3 times if we need a table.  Please girls, communicate, share info.   Mimosas took forever, water was never refilled and food took 30 minutes to arrive.  I like eating at TF because of the delicious food but I always dread the lame service.

Long wait for lunch on a Saturday, place clearly very popular.  Best to eat here on a weekday and early, preferably start your lunch at 11:30.; However, we think it is always in high demand.  The interior decor has a cold industrial feel.  Acoustics are terrible so uninviting for conversation, a feel somewhat like Horn and Hardart in New York City way back when.  House water delicious and much appreciated.  $6 Haras Chardonnay a good price for the quality.   Had kale with salmon.  Both absolutely delicious, but salmon had bones in it.  No charge.  Turkey lasagna arrived too cold which they happily replaced.  Dr. Weil seems to have less concern for fat, even good fat than we do considering ample oil and grated cheese in kale and plentiful cheese in lasagna etc.; however, popular opinion on heart disease risk seems to be changing on this issue.  Lets take the salt off the table.   Service cheerful and prompt.  General  Manager Shane an absolute delight.  Normally we eat better at home than most restaurants, but this restaurant competes with high quality healthy home fare.  We live in Tucson, belong to a CSA and get supplemental produce from the Farmer's Market.  So wish we had TFK in Tucson.

I really wasn't sure what to expect during my first True Food experience. I had read the reviews and they made me a little wary of the service at this location. The menu also didn't sound that great to me.   I have to say that I pleasantly surprised with my overall experience. Our service was excellent and that's saying something since one of my dining partners is a bit picky and not afraid to speak his mind. He's not the easiest to please and even he seemed happy with his experience. I ordered the acai mojito to start and it was pretty decent for a mojito. My husband had one of their non alcoholic drinks (I think a lemonade of some kind) and thought it was okay, but nothing too thrilling.   I was really unsure of what food to try and kept changing my mind. When our server gave us his suggestions I thought it was pretty entertaining that he chose the sea bass and the salmon...the two most expensive items on the menu. Uhhh...no thanks. I decided to go for organic tomato and roasted kale pizza. Luckily, our server informed me right away that it didn't have cheese on it. Shouldn't it say that on the menu? I'll pass on a pizza without cheese...isn't that the whole point anyway? I decided to go with the ricotta cheese ravioli (another expensive menu item). My fellow diners ordered the miso soup (he sent it back because it wasn't hot enough...but keep in mind he's not the easiest to please), the turkey bolognese, and the teriyaki brown rice bowl with tofu. Everyone seemed to really enjoy their food.   So I know what you're wondering...why the three stars if you had good service and good food? After eating my meal, I really felt like I had been a little jipped. I received a very small amount of ravioli in my dish and I am not a big eater. I know they're using a high quality of food and that comes at a higher price, but the price just didn't match the meal. I've been to plenty of restaurants around town that use fresh, local ingredients and their prices just aren't as steep. Even though the food was tasty, the service was great, and the decor was lovely, I won't be rushing back.

Great ambience, always friendly staff and above all I get pretty consistent vegan options. They even have at least 2 to 3 different vegan desserts on the menu at all times which are really tasty. I love their vegan pizza and caramelized cauliflower.  Only negative is the high pricing, it's gets too expensive when you order a beverage, appetizer and an entree.
Ran into this restaurant for a grab and go juice! I bought the little miss sunshine & it was just what I needed! I will definitely be back for more juice & the food as well!!!

JACOB WAS AMAZING!!! And he needs to know that he made our experience here a 10/10! He was so engaging, knew the menu, was knowledgable about your brand and expressed his desire to move up in the company. It truly is a treat with you are served by an individual who genuinely loves their job the way we could tell Jacob does.   This was the last stop to our little 'restaurant crawl' in Kierland Commons, and I'm glad we stopped in. My night cap was a Thai Grapefruit martini. I loved how fresh it tasted, and the basil garnish was a beautiful touch. We snacked on an order of charred cauliflower. Again, this was delicious! On my next visit, I'll definitely come in on an empty stomach so I can try one of their mouthwatering menu items. And I'll definitely be asking for Jacob!

Come during off-peak hours! Great for vegetarians!  I've had mixed experiences at True Foods, which is why it was downgraded from a 4 to a 3.  We came for Sunday brunch a couple of times - the food was great and the environment was nice.  We had dinner one Saturday night around 8 or 9 - the service was horrible and the food wasn't cooked well.  As in, the fish was completely dry and we were very disappointed in the experience.  We just went back yesterday for a late lunch/early dinner (4pm).  We were immediately seated.  We requested outdoor seating, which I immediately regretted when I realized it was still HOT in the shade even.    As an appetizer, we had the vegetable crudites - I highly recommend this appetizer.  You can get the small or large.  The small feeds two pretty perfectly.  It comes with a house-made ranch and a house-made kalamata olive dip.  Both are great!  As main courses, my boyfriend had the brown rice/tofu bowl and I had the TLT (tempeh, lettuce, and tomato).  His was okay - had a bit too much orange flavor for our liking.  The tofu was very chewy and seemed fried, even though our waitress assured us before ordering that it wasn't.  The TLT was good - lots of tempeh.  It appeared to be store bought (like fakin bacon), but may have been house made.  The sandwich had lots of avocado, tempeh and tomato.  It also came with a side order - half kale salad and half sweet potato hash.  Both sides were okay.  The sweet potatoes were under seasoned.  The kale salad tasted a lot like coconut oil, which they must use as their rub.  I mixed the two together.  Overall, the food was good.  If I was feeling less lazy (which I obviously wasn't when I was going out to eat), I could make it all at home, but the meal was quick and easy and so I give my kudos to True Foods for redeeming themselves.  Maybe we'll be back.

Same as my review of their Biltmore location (yum). Last weekend I went for brunch after yoga on the fountains. I ordered the egg & sweet potato hash which was a ton of food. I also ordered the kale smoothie which wasn't fabulous, but healthy, which was what I was going for.

Three words: Chicken Chopped Salad.  I could eat this salad everyday for the rest of my life. Absolutely delicious. The turkey burger is also just as great.  I can't wait to come back & try more dishes as well as the juices!

I do not understand the hype. Our server was nice, but the meal for 3 took over 30 minutes to come out and our side was cold. The turkey burger was bland. We paid $80 with tip for 3 people (no alcohol or dessert) and I'm still hungry. Will not return.

BACKGROUND   True Food Kitchen is one of the greatest success stories in the history of the food and restaurant industry.  TRUE FOOD KITCHEN: THE HISTORY   The history of True Food Kitchen started in Tucson in the late 1990's, when Dr. Andrew Weil met with Phoenix restaurateur Sam Fox. Dr. Weil was adamant about making restaurants available that not only adhered to his anti-inflammatory diet, but would demonstrate how delicious healthy food can be, as well as having an environmental awareness, all in an inviting atmosphere.  Dr. Weil's anti-inflammatory diet is not a "diet" per se, but is based on the staggering evidence that chronic inflammation is the root cause of many chronic illnesses, including heart disease, many cancers and Alzheimer's disease. This is also the concept behind anti-aging medicine.  If you are unfamiliar with this concept, definitely check out drweil.com for more information, and for the anti-inflammatory diet specifically:  http://www.drweil.com/drw/u/ART02012/anti-inflammatory-diet   True Food is currently in 9 states: AZ, CA, CO, GA, IL, NY, TN, TX, VA  There are two locations in Phoenix: Biltmore  Kierland Commons  Although there are now many locations, True Food Kitchen has a commitment to the community and will never become a "chain" type restaurant.   THE MENU  The menu is a work of art. Dishes are influenced by Mediterranean, Asian, and Californian cuisine, and include breakfast, soups, appetizers, salads, pastas, rice and noodle dishes, wood grilled dishes, sandwiches, burgers, brick oven pizzas and desserts.  CONCLUSION   I recently ate at the Biltmore location for brunch. I had the huevos rancheros with fresh corn tortillas and bottomless mimosas. The food was scrumptious and the staff was delightful. (see pic)  5/5 RECOMMEND   OF NOTE  *True Food Kitchen always uses local, organic sources when possible.  *True Food Kitchen is also decidedly "green" with many environmentally friendly accoutrements.   *Hours: Mon - Thurs: 11am - 9pm Fri: 11am - 10pm Sat: 10am - 10pm Sun: 10am - 9pm  *Valet parking is available. If you self park, be sure to ask for ticket validation.  *For more information: http://www.truefoodkitchen.com

Started off frustrated but ended up happy.  Friends visiting the area requested to try True Food Kitchen, so I called earlier in the day to make a reservation. I was told they don't reserve tables for parties of less than 8 (there were 4 of us). So I asked how long it would take to be seated if we arrived around 7.30pm that evening. I was told likely straight away, or within 15 minutes for sure. We set out on the 30 min drive and arrived to be told there would be a 35 min wait for an inside table or 45 mins for outside... though if an area at the (busy) bar opened up we could get drinks and appetizers there and wait. The restaurant didn't seem slammed (several empty tables) so it seemed odd there was such a long wait.  We decided to wait for outside, and a little miffed went for a short stroll.  One of our party saw a spot at the bar opening up and we jumped on it, and enjoyed some fantastic cocktails (I had Spontaneous Happiness, it was one of the best cocktails I've ever had). Our buzzer actually rang in something closer to 15 minutes and we were seated outside. I know it's not an exact science, but normally being told a 45 min wait with no bar to wait at (after being told we would be seated immediately/in 15 mins) would have made me eat elsewhere - we only waited since our guests were visiting and so couldn't have returned another time. The menu had lots of delicious looking foods to choose from. I started with the hummous (wonderfully spicy/garlicy) and had the amazing butternut squash pizza for my main and a really light, delicate lemon sorbet for dessert. Service was excellent from all parties - 2 waitresses plus the bartended. The restaurant itself is gorgeous, lots of wood, metal and greenery and very open. It was still a cool evening and perfect to sit outside, though the waitress said they have misters in the summer. I also had a fish taco and it was very good.  My husband had the bison burger and wasn't a huge fan, though that may have been more down to the gamey-ness of the meat. He enjoyed the sweet potato hash side.  I would definitely return to try out next seasons menu. It's pricey, but the food, service and location are excellent.

Love love love the new spring menu! The Asparagus Toast is to die for!! Very sad to hear this chain is no longer a part of FRC. I had an FRC gift card, and hadn't heard about the switch so they couldn't accept it. But I will continue to come back and hope great things come for the restaurant in the future! Also tried the Sparkling Honeydew this last visit and I really liked it, it wasn't what I was expecting but definitely worth trying if you are in the mood for a fun drink! Side note: I don't usually come to this location, just because I prefer the atmosphere of the one in Scottsdale Quarter. However I have experienced better service at this location.

You have to appreciate the restaurants that serve healthy but delicious food and True Food Kitchen is one of those places. I've been coming here for years and I intend to keep coming here for years to come. With a wide variety of fresh food options, eating healthy is made easier than ever. They change their menu seasonally which is a plus because there is always new things to try! One of my favorite things on the menu is the the Tofu Lettuce Wraps. They are so yummy and filling but still light! I also enjoy all of their pizzas so that's an option for anyone who strays away from veggies! I always get the Kale Ade to drink it is so refreshing and the perfect accompaniment to any meal!

I've never been here before or even heard of it but I decided to dive in. The food is delicious and the service is better than that! My server, Brandon, made sure my glass was never empty and they serve you fast. The vegan artichoke pizza is a nest have and the kale guac is so flavorful I crave it often now.

My favourite dinner in the last week. Lovely atmosphere. Enjoyed sitting outside finally! I had the edamame dumplings followed by grass fed steak tacos. Simply delicious.no good meal could be complete without dessert. The flourless chocolate cake stole the show!  The waitress had wonderful humour. And we were even treated to a second flourless chocolate cake as I had left my parking jeton in the car and joked I would burn off the calories walking to the car and back! Great great place and service

One of my all time favorite places. Every Time I am back in Scottsdale I have to go visit, despite there is one not too far from me in Santa Monica. Not only is the location in a prime spot the food is always on point. No matter the time of day there is always a wait for this heavenly array of super foods. Truly encompassing an anti-inflammatory diet, the menu is filled with flavorful choices. Unfortunately, due to my current diet restrictions my limitations hindered me from anything that I would have loved to indulge in, however my group sure did enjoy the steelhead salmon and spicy shrimp dish. For me on the other hand they were extremely accommodating. Which is always a battle when you are traveling. I would love to see more vegetarian options in the future. Other than that the service was stellar and the food well worth the wait.

Well.... only the 11th review???? Even though this is a new place I'm a little shocked!  I'm always the last one to hear about the new "cool" places and I guess I got a jump start on this one!  True Food is soooo NYC chic to me and the food is great - and healthy!  Our entire sales staff went and we're a picky bunch.  Some how we all found something we enjoyed!  I have the steak tacos which were awesome!  I also had the Green Arnie, which carries a much prettier name than taste.  I was expecting green tea and lemonade, but I got it with a grainy mix I wasn't too fond of!  I would totally give thsi place 5 stars, but I'm a drinking gal and all they had was wine and organic vodka. ehhh..... I enjoy eating healthy, but organic vodka doesn't cut it for me.  But to each his or her own.....

Well, let's say that I love it. I mean, I am being patient while they work the kinks out, but for a chain (or shall I say potential chain) I think it is a fresh change in the sea of steak houses and Asian fusion joints.  The decor is fresh and sunny although the hard surfaces lend to poor acoustics. You may have to scream at you dinner date on a busy night. The staff is young and ridiculously healthy looking. I can't help but wonder if a pre-employment requirement is a complete body loofah scrubbing and two weeks of colon cleansing. Even some of the older management and staff appear to have just had micro-dermabrasion.  But hey, in at new take on a health food joint, maybe it's just good marketing. The staff is the problem however. They all seem so young that they have no experiance. They are kind of wondering aroung while your food is stuck who knows where. On my last visit a nice young man named Steve was my server and he was beyound good. I complimented management on him and will ask for him from now on. To the food. I am a very healthy eater so it is right up my allie. I can't get enough of the kale salad. I ask for it with chicken. The Miso soup is simple but full of flavor. The deserts are good as well. You don't have to take home you heavy guilt with your full tummy. I have had all of the salads and you just can't go wrong, perfectly dressed to show of the perfectly ripened seasonal veggies.  The wine list is interesting and fairly priced, chalked full of sustainable and organically produced wines that also taste great. You can even have organic vodka with you veggie refresher drinks. Who knew? Look, if fast food is your bag and you are looking to commit suicide via coronary disease... skip this place. If you are looking to experience truly healthy eating in a modern new spot, take your patience and give this a try.

I have to say that I am underwhelmed.    First - the good.  I went with a group of 7 and we were able to sit in the private room in the back.  It was great to have the noise of the restaurant shut out and we loved the room's decor.  Second - the bad.  OK, it wasn't that anything was bad, it was all just sort of fine.  It tasted like dinner you would have at someone's house.  It was all more than edible, some things very different, but a little blander or a little less fantastic than i expect from a restaurant.  The chopped salad and onion tart with figs were both good, but anyone can do a chopped salad.  I thought the shrimp dumplings were just OK and the kale salad was underdressed and basically just tasted like you were eating raw kale.  The butternut squash ravioli were too sweet and the sauce was a little flavorless.  For desert, the chocolate cake was good but I've had better and while the bananas on the banana chocolate tart were good, the tart itself was like a stale piece of pita.  One highlight was the beans that came with the steak tacos - they were very flavorful and tasty.  My final thought is that to serve good, honest, healthy, sustainable food doesn't mean you have to be quite so crunchy.  I think some in our party were turned off by the granola-feel of the menu.  It would be great to see a few more common dishes done in a healthy way and prove that healthy doesn't have to mean low-flavor.

I forgot to update the review. After posting how I got sick from the food, I was called by a manager. His first concern was if I was feeling better. I was invited back, and was told to personally ask for him so he could ensure that my next visit was nothing less than perfect.   I do think the food is overpriced, and I didn't like that I had to pay for extra quinoa to have enough in my yellow curry, but anyone who reaches out like they did gets 4 stars in my book!
Excellent concept and excellent tasting food. On the pricier side, but totally worth it!

Absolutely blown away by the amazing customer service here! Scott is an amazing manager and this business truly has a business model that all businesses should take after!  I've eaten many different food items from here and have loved each bite! Excellent, healthy ingredients and excellent cooks!

I love the one at the Biltmore location so I expect the same there.  Loved the macha green tea lemonade...  SO refreshing!  For food I got the:  EDAMAME DUMPLINGS:  Daikon Radish & White Truffle Oil - I am a super fan of this.   HOUSE-MADE CHICKEN SAUSAGE PIZZA:  Tomato, Fennel & Fontina - My favie of the pizzas  Sat on the patio and love the atmosphere.  The staff was super friendly and very tentative.

I have been to this location several time and I still love it!  Lots of healthly selections and just love the atmosphere in the outdoor and indoor seating.  My favies:  the matcha lemonade (it is off the menu, but they can still make it for you), edamame dumplings, herb hummus, house-made chicken sausage pizza, flourless chocolate cake, and ice creams.  The service is always on par and quick.  Also nice and relaxing here.  This is one of my go to places!

Love the atmosphere and the food was amazing. Had the spaghetti squash with chicken. It was a pretty big portion and had tons of flavor. The manager came to make sure everything was okay and our waiter was on it with recommendations. Will definitely be returning.
I had the shaved turkey pita and it was delicious. Our waiter was nice, we got our food relatively quickly and I liked the high celings and simple, but sophisticated decor.
Still one of my absolute favorites for clean healthy eating. I love the assortment of different veggies that I always get.  #eattherainbow
Creative menu, price was right, service was prompt and polite. What more could you ask?

True Food Biltmore what has happened to you?   Let's start with the super unfriendly, uncaring hostess who doesn't smile or wishes one a pleasant meal.  Then the waiter Adam who after taking the order is missing through out the dinner only to pop up at the end with the check. Never came back to ask if we needed change or a thank you or a goodbye even though he was standing 3 feet from us.   What a disappointment. This place has really gone down hill.  We use to frequent it often but haven't been in almost a year. We were overdue for a visit.  Won't find any of the regular folks who use to work there. It seems like a Temp Agency has taken over staffing and its just a bunch of temps running it. Just a real disappointment. Plus the food simply isn't up to par anymore. And what's with the "spring menu"??... it's almost August!    Treated our friends to a birthday dinner and now wish we had gone elsewhere. We feel awful. We stopped going to the Scottsdale location a couple of years ago. We are now done with the Biltmore location and probably done with them period.  Ps - Wish we had read all the current bad reviews

Arrived 9:30 on a Sat. nite no wait plenty of tables but was seated far from the kitchen and staff. Took a bit for server to make initial contact. Placed order....appetizer, salad, entree.   Appetizer arrived quick and was tasty. Entree came out next before salad.  What amazed us was how super hot the plate and entree was radiating quite amount of heat.   Could not touch entree till salad came out 10 mins later.    The entree...spaghetti squash....simply awful.  It lacked any flavor or nutritional vibe. The sauce was watery with zero taste.  We consumed it due to hunger. We ordered their market salad but what arrived was an overly green leafy very lemony mayo type tasting dressing smothered on top. There were no blueberries, avocado, goat cheese, etc. but still told by staff and by the primary server it was the market salad.  They offered a Mediterranean salad as replacement and we consumed it.  Due to the lack of a satisfied stomach we shared a very tasty lemon tart.  Service lacked any genuine hospitality.   Atmosphere could be pretty amazing if a change in personality took place. Did play cool music.   Did not get out till 11pm.  The bill was $48 bucks we left three 20's didn't wait for change and ran!

I love True Foods!  Whether we are having an appetizer with drinks or enjoying a meal, the experience is always wonderful.  The organic tomato and kale pizza is SO yummy!  I love to sit on the patio next to the fountains on a nice night.
Every time I come here I leave happy . Excellent food , and lighting fast service !   Miso soup is delish and you can also order half salads If you have a small appetite.

What a gem of a restaurant! Everyone smiles at you with consideration and a desire to please. I was her for lunch and had the street tacos with Seabass, plus a green drink and some veggies. Everything was quite delightful and we had the choice of outside seating which was right next to the splash pad!! The atmosphere at this place is my style, very modern and simplistic with lots of shady trees and comfy chairs. Just an overall awesome place and experience. If you love healthy food then this is the place for you, complete with their own outdoor garden!!

Didn't know about Dr. Weil before coming here and can't validate the anti-inflammatory claims based on what I was served all I know is that it was hella delicious. It tasted healthy and fresh. Our visit was during restaurant week. I had the shiitake tofu cup for starters and that was the best and my friend had the grilled avocado which was also yummy. I think the best part of the meal was the whipped coconut cream that come with the chia seed dessert..... WOW, completely mind blown. I asked if they sold it in cans or something! that was delicious. Service was excellent and I would definitely recommend to friends. I left with a happy full belly!

Have only been here once. Was a Saturday and busy. We (two and a baby) got seating within about ten minutes. Our waitress was super nice and informative. We got almond and date smoothies, the inside-out quinoa burger, and the ancient grains bowl. All of it was super delicious and much more food than we were expecting. We shared so they split the dishes up for us. A little pricey, but would definitely go back.

My aunt is trying this new organic, wholistic living thing, so I wasn't all too surprised when she suggested that my family meet her and my uncle at True Food. There were some highs and some lows...  Let's start with the drinks. I looked at their fresh drink menu and had an impossibly difficult time deciding. I ended up with the Medicine Man, because an antioxidant blast sounded like the perfect remedy for several days of imbibing over the holidays. Other people at the table ordered the Apple Carrot Ginger Tonic and the Red Moon, and everyone raved about them - definitiely a high. I would go back just for the drinks. The meal (lunch) was good, but different. Not different in a bad way, just in a way that means "I am willing to try new things but sometimes I have ideas about how things should be." So I just surprised with the texture of my Mediterranean Chopped salad, mostly because of the quinoa. It was tasty, just took some getting used to - another high.  Unfortunately, the low was that all six of us were pretty uncomfortable throughout the whole meal because we were seated close to one of the sides, right by the door where the waiters and waitresses would enter and exit to take care of the customers outside. Sometimes they would stop and close the door, but most of the time it stayed propped open just long enough to let a chilly blast of air wash over our table. The design of the restaurant isn't particularly easy to understand, specifically because you have to go outside to go to the bathroom and also because it isn't easy to tell where the hostess station is, especially if you come in from the opposite side (by LuLuLemon).  Despite the negatives, I'd go back...I'd probably just make sure it was on a sunny, warm day!

I love this place. I eat here regularly. I usually get the Kale Crunch salad but I arrived today and it's off the menu. Bring it back!!  Other favorites are the hummus, edamame dumplings, spaghetti squash casserole, turkey burger and bison burger. But, I have to say that everything I've had here has been exceptional. Nice wine selection, too!
One of my favorites. Love, love the dumplings, Asian bowls, salads, pizza, and desserts! Very fresh and healthy. Kind of pricey but worth it.

This place has been on my list for awhile now and today I finally decided to check it out - I'm glad I did! I was craving a burger but I didn't want fast food and I didn't want to cook anything myself so I placed a take-out order for their grass-fed beef burger with a side of kale salad. The burger was amazing! Definitely one of the best I've had, especially considering the wholesome ingredients. My only complaint would be that it was a little overdone - I asked for it medium-rare and it was definitely medium-well (overcooked burgers are a pet peeve of mine). The kale salad was tasty as well. I'll definitely be back!

Four of us stopped here for a late lunch on 3/19. We were all starving and our first choice, Zinburger in the same shopping mall, was closed for some reason. For a second choice, True Food was pretty good.   It's like all the Fox Restaurants I've been to - open kitchen concept, young staff, loud music with a modern-industrial feel. The first thing the waiter told us while handing us menus was that one of the restaurant co-owners is Dr. Andrew Weil. He went on to explain how healthy and organic their menu selections are. Apparently this is their standard opening line to every customer since I heard it mentioned to other diners around us.   My daughter and I had the raw fish special which was served sliced sashimi-style topped with a sesame-miso sauce alongside thinly shredded carrots and cukes. It was very good with an appetizing presentation. I had the wild ahi sliders. The waiter warns that it's cooked raw. It came with sweet potato hash. The sliders were delicious, slightly warm and very flavorful. The sweet potato hash was tough and cold and had probably been sitting around for too long.   The shrimp dumplings appetizer (you get 6) were also very tasty as was the chicken pizza that our guests had. Hubby decided to go vegetarian and had the Miso Soup and Vegetable Caeser Salad, both of which were filling enough for him.   They also have specialty drinks that weren't really worth the cost. Hubby's Cucumber Refresher was pretty tasteless and my Green Arnie was weak.   The atmosphere was loud and energetic. The kitchen is right there and they don't care if they're banging pots, pans and dishes everywhere. We were there at the end of the busy lunch hour when the restaurant had emptied out and it was still pretty loud.   Service was quick. Our food arrived within 15 minutes of ordering them and they all arrived at the same time. Our waiter was helpful and friendly and he did check on us a couple of times but took care not to hover. It's a good place to eat if you want "healthy" choices and don't want to think too hard about it. I don't know that I'd come back here again, especially if Zinburber was open!

Will you like True Food? Well, it's great for people who are looking for "clean eating", whatever the hell that means to you. That is, it's great for posers who don't really want to do the work to eat well or stay fit, but want to feel better about eating out or eating junk at home (loading up on sweet potato chips, antibiotic-free fried chicken and frozen greek yogurt).   Ultimately, True Food is wildly overpriced and not very good. I've joined friends here for lunches and dinners, not by choice. I've had the pizza (hurray for me, it's "veggie"), entree salads (hurray for me, I'm eating salad), tacos (hurray for me, it has organic beef) and rice bowls (hurray for me, nothing's fried). I've yet to have a good dish here that was filling and/or worth even 1/2 what they charge. Best thing on the menu is the hummus appetizer, and there are dozens of places in town who do it better.  If you want to eat healthy, prepare yourself healthy and great tasting food at home. If you want low-cal food that tastes great, walk over to Seasons 52. If you want food that tastes great and don't care about "appearing" healthy, there are a million places in Phoenix/Scottsdale I recommend -- read my reviews if you care to.

Sooo disappointed. Arrived here yesterday with a friend at about 4:15pm. Seated promptly. An over bubbly petite girl approached our table.. (you know the kind.. TGI Fridays "flare" type) speaking in cheerleading tones, we'll call her "bubbles" letting us know our server would be with us in a minute.. right as our server arrived.  There were maybe 5 tables sat including ours in all areas of the restaurant and Ill be damned if our poor server wasnt waiting on every single one of them.. which explains why she wasnt very attentive. Not really her fault..Our food did arrive in a timely fashion delivered by "Bubbles". My friend had ordered the squash casserole and had asked if bread was available for her to order and the attitude and outright snottiness of bubbles next comment decided the gratuity and the fact we will never go back. She said " we dont have bread.. this isnt the Outback." You should have seen the looks on our faces.  She then catches herself and says we have pita and my friend staes "nevermind, that's not what I was looking for". Bubbles goes away and comes back with an order of pita anyway. We sat in silence for a good 5 minutes.. apalled at that little bitch's outburst. As a manager I would have fired her on the spot for speaking to a patron in that manner.   After the "incident" and our meal was finished, the plates were cleared and we sat...and sat while our server tended to the rest of her tables. Meanwhile there are 5 servers doing sidework right in front of us.. including Bubbles (who mind you was leaning over the sidework table laughing and not helping her coworkers at all). We made eye contact with several of them hoping they would notice we were looking for our server and nothing. We had actually wanted dessert but by the time our server finally showed we just wanted to leave. Im sure our server would have been great had she had any form of assistance from her coworkers. But the snottiness of the self righteous self entitled Bubbles was inexcusable.  Im sure you're wondering about the food.. it's decent but not anything amazing..too many restaurants in Phoenix to come back here for their food, let alone to be talked down to by the staff.  Oh and also, we were told their tomatoes are flown in from tuscany.. Seriously? In this economy you're flying tomatoes in from Italy and not supporting your local markets..FAIL

I have to admit it, I'm a huge fan of True Food Kitchen and Dr. Weil! I have all the cookbooks and have been going to True Food Kitchen for years now.   True Food Kitchen is exactly how I wish all restaurants were - tasty, fresh, and healthy. It's easy to get a meal out with lots of empty calories, that have little to do with eating to live! Although I am not a true vegetarian or vegan, I do enjoy vegan and vegetarian meals and good ones can be pretty tough to find here in Arizona.   This was actually my first time visiting the Scottsdale location, I usually go to the one on Camelback in Phoenix. I had actually been very hesitant to visit this one, because I didn't want to "fix what wasn't broken". I am incredibly happy I decided to check out the Scottsdale location because it is equally nice, but in different ways. The location and ambiance was gorgeous and seating very nice out on the patio.  My date and I shared several plates, because it's a lot more fun being able to try many things off the menu. We started with a Torched Avocado, which was better than it sounded! The cucumber noodles were perfect, and the mushrooms gave the dish a strong mushroom essence. If you do not like mushrooms, this might not be the dish for you - but thankfully I do.   The Chioggia Beet Bruschetta was delicious; however I would have loved to have seen it on something other than a sliced bread. The bread reminded me of Ezekiel sprouted bread, which I have nothing against, I just would have expected something more special during a restaurant experience. The flavors were perfect and the vegan ricotta was every bit as good as the dairy version (coming from someone who loves cheese).   We shared a Roasted Artichoke Pizza which was delicious, though I found the other flavors overpowered the Artichoke (unfortunate due to the name). The pizza used the delicious dairy free almond ricotta, sugar snap peas, smoked onion, garlic, black truffles, and apparently artichokes!   I had the Health-Ade Kombucha with pomegranate and cranberry - which was to die for. I've been on the fence with Kombucha wanting to love it for it's health benefits, but never fully accepting it. True Food Kitchen has finally found the perfect mix to make Kombucha absolutely delicious. I've started buying the Health-Ade Kombucha for home, which can be found at Trader Joe's, Sprouts or Whole Foods (Whole Foods also carries the huge jugs!).   Dessert was delicious - I ordered the Key Lime Pie which was the best I've had in years. Only slightly creamy and incredibly rich and tangy! I hope the pie is on the menu next time I visit. I did get to sample the Flourless Chocolate Cake, which is every chocolate lovers dream! I still enjoyed the pie the best, but I think I'm biased.

This is by far my favorite True Food Kitchen location and I've been to it several times - each time nearly as awesome as the one that came before it.   I love to visit True Food Kitchen on a seasonal basis to try something new each season. I wasn't planning on visiting True Food Kitchen, until they twisted my arm with an offer I couldn't resist.. their Trick or Treat Yourself promotion. Seriously, the best thing I've received for Halloween since I was a kid and dressed up going door to door! I strongly recommend signing up for their e-mails so you don't miss out on future treats.  We sat outside which was lovely, but a little chillier than I had anticipated, which unfortunately impeded my ability to order their Sea Buckthorn Sorbet (though our waitress was kind enough to provide us with a mini taste and its amazing.. but I'm going to have to come back during the day for this one).   For beverages, my husband got the Prosecco, and I ordered the Medicine Man. If you like cranberry juice, this one will be a hit, the pomegranate seeds are a nice touch, but sometimes get lodged in the straw.   We shared the Kale Guacamole and I've had my fill of guacamole of every variety and variant, but this one was new with the pink grapefruit, cilantro, roasted poblano, sunflower seeds and of course kale. Wow! This is a keeper and I would definitely order it again, even my husband who hates grapefruit and kale was incredibly surprised how delicious it was. There is tons of guacamole to share, the lavash crackers it is served with is delicious, but you will probably need to ask for extra.   We then were tied on what pizza to order, our waitress recommended we order half and half. Great suggestion, but one teensy complaint.. they charge you for the most expensive pizza and our waitress unfortunately did not communicate this. We ordered the Butternut Squash pizza $15 with their absolutely delicious vegan almond ricotta and the classic Margherita $12. I would love to see True Food Kitchen either average the amount to $13 or go with the lowest, or even just tell the customer up front how it will be billed!   We shared the T.L.T. sandwich.. which I was very apprehensive about, but curious. Our waitress reminded us that if there was something we didn't like, they would be happy to replace it with something else. I've never had a good relationship with tempeh, in fact I've gone over a decade avoiding it because my experience has never been great. I kept hearing people rave about the T.L.T. and came to two conclusions: 1) everyone has lost their mind 2) True Food Kitchen actually knows the secret to making tempeh taste great.   I decided to live dangerously and pulled out a piece of the tempeh bacon from the sandwich when it arrived. It wasn't quite bacon, but it was still delicious - it was almost like a smoked piece of chicken breast? So there it was, the correct conclusion was 2) True Food Kitchen actually knows the secret to making tempeh taste great. I am happy to announce I would even order the T.L.T. again, it's healthy, nutritious, and best of all vegan - the portion size is great!   I ended up ordering a tried and true favorite for dessert, the Squash Pie, which did not disappoint. You will not believe it's vegan AND gluten free. Yum! Certainly enough for two to share!   Overall service was good, my waitress Danielle was great with a fantastic attitude. My only other critique regarding service was it started up exceptionally well timed and fantastic, and became very slow as more tables were added to her responsibility.   Everything was running smoothly, we sat down around 5:40pm, we breezed through beverages, appetizers, and entrees without a hitch. The entrees came around 6:10pm and we finished about 15 minutes later and waited and waited. Ordered dessert at 6:45pm and about 7:00pm our box for the pizza and dessert came, along with the receipt.   Our waitress forgot to punch in the discount, and I provided her with the gift card I had, she adjusted the amount when the transaction which was put through which was good. It took another 15 minutes before we got the receipt back and I opted to tip in cash because I didn't really want to wait another 15 minutes.   This visit was so close to being a 5 star, minus the points I've addressed here! Darn! Maybe next time.  P.S. Sorry the photos are a little dark, but the lighting was not great outside!
good food, high prices.  love the modern atmosphere and patio is very cool but i think there are much better places to get tastier food and less expensive drinks in central phoenix.

Took a VIP customer out tonight from Taiwan, who is a vegetarian. True Foods Kitchen was a great selection for this. Innovative vegetarian (and non-vegetarian) dishes.  Torched avocado appetizer was excellent. Can't go wrong with their pizzas. We ate outdoors on the patio. Great atmosphere and lively crowd.  Friendly service and overall a good value.  I've been pleased at all the Fox Concept restaurants for delivering a solid and consistent experience. True Foods Kitchen is no exception.

I have eaten here many times and the food is outstanding. However, today was a whole different outstanding experience. I was picking up lunch for my very busy boss. They accidentally tossed the dressing when i asked for it on the side. I told the gentlemen that was helping me, I only had 3 minutes to wait. Not only did he get my order out in 3 minutes, he also brought me two juices and a juice boost. Time and time again this restaurant company amazes me. Their service is incredible and there food matches that services.

I get it, super fresh, organic veggies, farm raised animals blah blah blah. But let's just get one thing clear, there's never an excuse to charge $19+ for a lunch sized salad. The salad itself was listed at $12 on the menu, but rang up for $12.50. Ok, Fine. But $5.50 to add chicken?!? It's not like you get a whole breast. It's 4 small slices. I was literally speechless when the teller told me the total. Did you raise that chicken from the nest? Did you cut of it's head and clean it out back? No. Nope. Not cool. Additionally, most of the baby kale was still on the stalk to the point where I had to get out a kitchen knife, dump the salad out, and cut it up in to pieces I could actually make sensible bites out of. If you're going to charge that kind of money for a salad, at least take some pride in the preparation and presentation, even if it is to go! So annoyed. The Marcona almonds were good at least. Small victories.

What a great concept! Delicious food and great service. Although the place was busy,  we were served rather quickly.  Crudite was beautifully arranged! My quinoa burger went down really fast. I *need* to learn how they make the sweet potato hash. I'm jealous of the states that have a True Food Kitchen....I'm ready to petition to get one up here in the northeast

This place is incredible. Love it so much. Anything you get on the menu is going to be delicious. I'm convinced. Haven't had a bad meal here.   I highly recommend the edamame dumplings for a starter. Incredible.   Red chili noodles dish is amazing as well!!
Had the red chili noodles with chicken today. Very tasty. Just enough heat. Plenty of vegetables and just enough to feel full but not stuffed. Definitely worth a try.

True Food Kitchen is one of those restaurants that becomes an instant smash hit. They are legendary for their healthy but still delicious menu, which is a feat many restaurants try but fail. As healthy as TFK is, rest assured that the his place doesn't come across as a pretentious eatery.   The menu changes from season to season but maintains several consistent items. Most items come with a choice of sweet potato hash or a kale salad.   My personal go to favorite is the quinoa inside out burger with both sweet potato and kale with a beet juice blend.   There are now several True Foods around the country. The location at Scottsdale Quarter is our closest location. The Quarter has ample parking including a few valet parking options, Tesla electric chargers, standard EV chargers, street parking and garage deck parking.   Show up early during the busy times of the day, as you can expect a decent wait. The juice is worth the squeeze both literally and figuratively.

True Foods is the real deal!  True Food Kitchen is a consistent winner.  They offer great, clean and healthy food without the typical healthy food vs good food trade off.  I enjoy the consistency they offer from restaurant to restaurant.    True Food Kitchen offers fresh cold pressed juice drinks, as well as some very unique "adult" version cocktails.  They refresh the menu several times throughout the year.  They do keep several of the mainstays throughout the year.    Their wait staff are always amazing and super friendly.  Easily located at the front of Biltmore on Camelback Rd.  The icing on the cake is that they offer free validated parking at their Biltmore location.

Hey, the food wasn't bad. Like a lot of people here, definitely felt like we paid a lot for what we got (but maybe that's the "natural" or "true" food mentality). Our server Tyler didn't really pay attention to us (lots of awkward eye contact, like oh shit I forgot about you guys), and no offers to refill drinks. The close proximity of tables can make one feel claustrophobic. My girl friend ordered the curry and commented that she felt something was missing afterwards. Come to find the rice was missing. When we informed our waiter, his reply was simply "sorry about that I will let the kitchen know." $14 for an incomplete meal!!!! Not to mention the vegetables were semi-raw still (but maybe that's a "true" thing).
Great place for the healthy individual. It is a bit on the pricey side, however the food was terrific as well as the service attentive.

Who knew eating right could be such an amazingly tasty experience! This place is such a welcomed find and I cannot wait for the Chicago location to open up at State & Erie next year. I enjoyed it so much that I dined here twice in 24 hours.    The menu is balanced and offers something for every palate including, vegans, individuals with gluten allergies and carnivores.   Value for the money -  4 stars   Location - 5 stars   Service - 4 stars  Herb Hummus - 5 stars   Red Chili Shrimp - 5 stars   Kale and Spinach dip - 4 stars   Vegetable Crudités - 4 stars  Squash pie - 5 stars ***** absolute favorite   Spaghetti Squash Casserole - 5 stars ; you can add a protein like mushrooms or chicken   Almond cake dessert - 2 stars

This review is way overdue but better late than never. So True Foods is one of my favorite restaurants in the Valley and that's a given as the food is flavorful, fresh, non gmo and organic 80+% of the time and just plain amazing. I am a regular every-time I choose to eat out. Besides the food this review is for the above and beyond service. I ordered to go which is something I never do and ordered the soup of the day. I ordered the soup of the day only asking about one allergy and not another since wheat is uncommon in soup. Turn out I devoured the soup and felt horrible. I called the next day wondering what the ingredients were since I know their food and their had to be something I am allergic to in there. I called and spoke to Lauren who is a ALLERY SPECIALIST and went above and beyond to help and apologize. I am so grateful and absolutely fell in love with True Foods even more which I didn't think was possible. I just called to find out ingredients and as soon as I heard my allergy I was just going to hang up and make sure I ask about wheat and dairy in everything next time. Thank you for leading the food restaurant industry in higher standards and staying true to appreciating the customer and serving real food.

True Foods you are going downhill. In particular this location. I am a regular on average 5-10X per month depending on what I am feeling. To give an example of how service and food quality is declining. I show up me and my book tell the server I just want something light and quick. We discuss soup and 1/2 sandwich is possible and a drink done  awesome. Soup is good, then comes out a pizza- I tell food sever I didn't order a pizza she/ probably manager looks at me confused and says what did you order. I ordered the tempeh sandwich. Ok cool I go back to reading my book. Out comes my original sever asking me why I didn't want the pizza. And I get slightly annoyed as I know what is going on. He forgot I I'm sure to just place the order for the Sandwich and long story short looks at my crazy as if I changed my mind. Ok whatever no biggie I get it and I move on... I don't take it personal perhaps it's he is new and his manager bugging him about it. Out comes my tempeh sandwich with tofu instead of tempeh. I ask what is this? Thinking they changed the menu and I missed it... ummm her reply is it's still vegan and it's tofu and we don't have tempeh right now. Really?!?! 1. I'm not 100% vegan and 2. I know what tofu is but whatever. 3. In my head why didn't he tell me this when he placed order 4. Whatever in my head I am saying and I am  moving on again. I take 1 bite of sandwhich and it tastes like crap. Literally I make tofu soup, stirfrys etc at home and this was no bueno. Here is the annoying part... no one said we messed up ever. She apologized but after the fact I had to get up and ask why is there tofu instead of tempeh. Waste of $ and time is what this equated to. True foods better step up their game as other restaurants are popping up that offer better food and they will loose customers. Probably will not be coming to this location again for a minute just based of service. Food is whatever s*** happens. I'm no-self entitled jerk but with my kindness and humility they still treated me like crap. Try True Foods but if the service is sub par don't say I didn't warn you

I just want to tell about my experience here this is not a place I would normally go cause I eat food cause I like the flavor not cause its healthy. I can appreciate the idea behind this place but holy shit this place is over priced for what you get. Everything needed salt and I kind of expected that. I will say that the pizza we tried was good. We tried the shrimp, roasted red peppers, and goat cheese pizza and it was suprisingly good. I did not think I would care for shrimp on a pizza but dam it, it was a good combo for sure. I also got the turkey pita. It had a great dresing on it just did not have enough of it. The pita bread was so dry i drank two glasses of water just to get it down.  When you eat this you know your eating healty so its just blah. They use all local products which  I like and the menue changes with the season wich I like but everything we tried was lacking flavor . I went with 6 people and everybody shared so we could all try everything. Betweeen all of us we tried 6 different dishes and two apps. They have an outside patio and the inside decor is nice. We got the private table in the back wich was cool. The restrooms sinks are very cool and they have the best hand driers ever in the restrooms as well, not really important just thought I would mention that. Anyways If your a healthy eater than this place is worth a try. For me if I'm going to spend $15-20 for myself I would choose so many other places.

So we went again, we love the patio. This time for drinks and appetizers.  The service was horrible. The drinks good. The hummus a little weird in flavor. Not really Persian and creamy. Lumpy and brownish with too little bread. The pizza was horrible, tiny no flavor, digiorno is better. The lettuce cups were so so, the restaurant seems committed to using something sweet and stcky in everything. I don't know the name of the spice but it smells like potpourri and tastes like room freshner

Have been here several times and really like it. The wait is usually insane and not worth the food though. If you can grab a seat at the bar or the community tables it's best. Avoid the street tacos. Terrible. I was able to try both the fish and the steak because they brought me the wrong order and I had tried the steak before realizing it wasn't what I had ordered. Steak was dry and the fish (my original order) was non existent. Very disappointing for the $16 price tag. Kale salad and Quinoa Berger the way to go.

We eat here all the time. So far in Phoenix it has our favorite Turkey Burgers. I love the way everyone is in same color uniform, super clean and excellent food. Amazingly well-run restaurant. They also have muffins that make you wanna slap your mamma.

I came in around 7 pm and had a 20 minute wait, but felt like less. The atmosphere was aesthetically pleasing, but a bit louder than I prefer. No biggie. We ordered a few starters, a caramelized onion tart (which was pretty good) and an absolutely beautiful bowl of crudités vegetables that were just delicious. I got the Kale-aid to drink and it was wonderful. Fresh juice, yum! My entree was a lovely vegetarian TLT (tempeh, lettuce, tomato) sandwhich which also included avocado and veganese. The meat eaters in our group tried the grass fed bison burgers and we're very pleased. Each entree offered a side of kale salad, or sweet potato hash, or the option of "a little bit of both", which we all happened to choose and enjoyed. I love that they try and use the freshest, most local, organic ingredients. They have something for everyone. It's a bit pricey, but it's a nice treat every now and then. I will happily go back again.

So I am here a lot. Like twice a week as my boss is obsessed with place. The food is so yummy, healthy and fresh. The employees here are so friendly and professional. They work so hard to make right. Sometimes when I coming in I can tell they are slammed, every table full and 10 to go orders up and yet they all are so positive and each team member is working so hard. It is like watching a dance. Everyone knows there part and does it flawlessly. I have a few issues over the years but every time the manager handles it so well. This place is truly the best and it all because of the amazing team and yummy food!!

Great food and service. We had and loved the  shiitake tofu lettuce cups, Panang curry shrimp , the daily market soup (chicken noodle), sustainable seafood special (scallops). The cocktails were also excellent.  We had the ginger margarita and thai grapefruit martini. For desert we had the rhubarb crisp. Our server Danielle was great.

So I have to start out with a complaint. Why the heck do we not have one of these restaurants in the Chandler, Gilbert, or Tempe area? This place was an awesome treat for our dinner. My wife and I primarily eat vegan and vegetarian at home  so it was nice to find a really awesome restaurant out there with these options but even better. We had a couple of the skinny margaritas each which were delicious. We started off with the kale guacamole and shared the artichoke pesto pizza. Both of these options were beautiful and delicious. This also made us order the true food kitchen cook book. Do try this place and I promise if your open to this kind of healthy eating you'll love it.

Usually love True Foods but today the service was very poor and very slow.  It took 45 minutes to place our order.  Waiter took drink order and did not come back for 45 min to get food order.  Then took another  1 hour to get our food.  I ordered a salad and my salad came 30 minutes before everyone else's food.  I was well finished before the others even received their food.   The waiter came by twice and said food would be right up, but was another 30 min before it arrived.   My boys were still extremely hungry after they ate(portions very small) so they ordered dessert.  Took 15 min to even get our ordered placed for dessert, and then the waiter came back 15 min later and stated that they ran out of what we ordered.  Very disappointed.  Left to go get ice cream across the street.   Was at true foods for over 2 hours waiting for service.  Not sure will go back.  Definitely not with hungry boys!

Loved eating lunch at true food kitchen! I had the roasted turkey wrap with kale salad and it was amazing. The wrap was very fresh and the turkey was wonderful. I really enjoyed it. The atmosphere was very relaxing and the misters made the outside seating extra comfortable and not too hot. The honey lemonade was a great and refreshing drink starter, and we had the kale guacamole dip as an appetizer which was great! Also pictured is the teriyaki quinoa bowl (with added chicken) and the turkey burger with hash which were equally as delicious. We loved true food kitchen and we will be back!! Food and service was quick as well. Loved being right in the center of kierland commons!

Great food and service! Outdoor seating has misters! Food arrived promptly! I eat lunch at this place often and order the turkey wrap. They got rid of it so some silly reason. Should bring it back! Kale salad is delicious!

The food here is so good and so fresh!! The ancient grains bowl blew my mind!! The glazed sweet potatoes in it were divine! I also love the cocktails! Thai basil grapefruit drink was the perfect amount of strong and citrus. I could eat here everyday!

Great staff, great food, lovely location. Visiting from the east coast where organic is now becoming a mainstay at most high end restaurants,  I must say I was impressed with the quality of organic, vegetarian and vegan options. The food was interesting too...well presented and very tasty.  Wish we had franchise in the NY/NJ area.
Best food in Htown hands down! Their taking is insanely good and I loveeeed the salmon!
Outstanding food, great atmosphere, simply a great place

The service and food was great as usual, it wasn't until me and my girlfriend split the bill that things got weird...Long story short I was charged the whole bill and immediately informed it would be cleared and changed to the correct price (in my account) in 15minutes. Then after finishing up our drinks I checked my online banking, not cleared. Then she told me by midnight. Still nothing in the morning so I called the manager and asked when it would be corrected. He tells me 3-5 business days...A 15 minute correction (originally what I was told) turning into a week thing is frustrating and to top it off there was absolutely no offers or compensations of how they could make up for such a huge inconvenience:/ Won't be going to that location again.

This is my second time to True Food Kitchen (first time to this location).  It was great!   Nice atmosphere, great service and the food is wonderful!  If you can't appreciate local, organic, fresh good- stay away, this place is not for you.

I like the healthy-focused menu, but execution was not as great as I expected. We still had a good meal, thought. The kale salad as everyone has stated is quite delicious. I also had some type of fish. The foo is reasonable and the service was fine. Maybe it being a tad cheaper would make it a little better but I would definitely go back.

A trip to Scottsdale is not complete without dining at True Food. Here are my top items: - Onion tart - Butternut squash pizza - Vegetable crudites - Medicine man-- at least 2 glasses! - Teriyaki bowl - spicy shrimp - Bison burger Can't wait for them to open in Palo alto soon!

My family and I were visiting my sister over Thanksgiving, and we tried out this place for brunch.  I was impressed with everything about this place.  The food is delicious, but is uniquely creative and healthy.  The menu is filled with wholesome entrees, ranging from meaty to vegan, and all the options are tasty.
