We Ordered ~Medicine Man (Pomegranate, Cranberry,Honey, Black Tea & Soda) $6 ~Root & Remedy (Beet, Carrot, Ginger, Turmeric & Honey Lemonade) $6 ~Edamame Dumplings (Daikon Radish & White Truffle Oil) $9 ~Spaghetti squash casserole (Fresh Mozzarella, Organic Tomato & Zucchini) $13 ~Flourless Chocolate cake (Cocoa, Vanilla Ice Cream, Almond Butter & Caramel) $7  Let me start by saying how beautiful the drinks looked when they arrived,very appetizing.The Medicine Man has a dominant taste of black tea with hints of other ingredients while Root & Remedy is more like a ginger and honey lemonade.It is impossible to guess what goes into the drinks unless you read the ingredients which i think is great.I technically did drink a lot of vegetables and healthy stuff compared to a regular Soda.The Edamame dumplings were great i wish they would serve more than four.My spaghetti squash casserole was delish, again i would have never guessed it had zucchini (which i isolate from my dishes). The only thing i wasn't a fan of was the flourless Chocolate cake, not that it tasted bad but it there was more caramel than chocolate.  Our server Jessica was wonderful and friendly.The food got to the table pretty fast.A lot of the items on their menu are gluten free.In the End my taste buds were happy and i will definitely be back for some more of that Healthy Delicious Experience.  Don't forget to validate your Parking.  Cheers!

After a huge disappointment at a Thai restaurant - our party went to a place called "True Foods". I had been to the one in Scottsdale and liked it and this one in Phoenix proved to be on par with the other.  My wife and I both had the Tuscan Kale salad with grilled chicken, son had Street Tacos and DIL had Asian Noodles - ALL of the meals were purdy darn good - except my wife's Chicken was a bit dry - mine was nice and juicy, but it came late - a small issue! We also decided to share two deserts among the four of us - a Chi Pudding with Banana and Coconut and a Strawberry and Rhubarb Crisp with Vanilla Ice Cream - ending our trip to True Foods was VERY GOOD!  The restrooms were clean, the rest of the place was showroom and the food that you are going to receive is right our on display. They validate your parking so you get two hours for free.   Credit cards are accepted and you won't be disappointed. We each tried something different and were very happy with our choices - I'd still like to try their pizzas because they looked incredible on their way to other tables. The place was buzzing - a true sign that you were getting true GOOD food!

I love this place, I have been coming here for a year, probably at least once a week. The menu changes with the season which is awesome, the food is always fresh and delicious, the service is always on point. The juices are amazing...no complaints.

I went here for a group lunch, and it was a good space to meet since there was a wide variety of food, with options for people with all sorts of dietary restrictions. Everyone seemed happy with their selection. I ordered the grass fed steak tacos, which were pretty tasty with lots of toppings--avocado, greek yogurt, cilantro, pickled onion, anasazi bean, cotija cheese for an explosion of flavors. I ordered tulsi tea for my beverage and was surprised that it cost four dollars for a tea bag in a mug, so I'll go for the apple soda next time instead--it was a real hit!
Great food and service for casual dining, date night, or take out!
My favorite dish is the kale salad with chicken. Everything taste delish and fresh. Centrally located and a great date spot. Excellent service every single visit.

Have gone here many times, and quality SEEMS OK. Expensive for what you get, and the "grass fed beef" one night I was there was not beef at all. I know as a fact that it had moose meat in it. I will not go into how I know, other than to say it was tested by a third party using specialized test equipment.  I don't know if their supplier did this to them or what, but they need to be a bit more on top of things esp. since many food-conscious people, some extremely so, go here.

This place has an amazing menu of creative dishes. You can add different meat or fish options or keep it vegetarian. There are also plenty of vegan dishes and they accommodate any special need. The service is super friendly. The prices are elevated but the quality if the food is extremely good. Additionally the location is great, we loved the outside seating area.

Just had to update my review after another great lunch. The service was amazing as always and the pizza was out of this world.   You should also try the spicy chicken soup if it's on the menu and order the kale dip for an appetizer.

This place has been on my 'must eat list' for a while. I finally stopped by after a walking around Kierland Commons and Scottsdale Quarter. I plopped myself by the bar and after debating between a salad (my coworker raves about their kale salad), decided on the quinoa burger. I was so excited to find out that a kale salad came with it! I forgot to order dressing on the side, but to my surprise, they did not drench the salad with dressing and it was delicious! The quinoa burger was just as amazing.  Being a hummus snob, I had to order one to go for dinner. Wow. It's a little Americanized but was still really good.   FYI you can mix and match your salad! If you see a salad that you like, you can ask them to switch the greens base (ie kale instead of lettuce). They make their food on the spot, with organic ingredients, and no preservatives. Definitely worth the price!

My wife and I discovered True Food Kitchen a few years ago on a trip to Phoenix. Since our hometown of St. Louis doesn't have one, we always try to have a meal at one of their locations when we are traveling. Since this is the original TFK, they definitely get everything right. Our server was very friendly and all of our food was excellent. Definitely a fan of the health food focus, but there is something on the menu for everyone. For drinks, you can't go wrong with the kale-aid or the chia pomegranate lemonade.

True Food rates as a 3.5 for me.  It's a good choice for those that are wanting to eat some healthier, lighter fare.  It's also a good choice for vegetarians, as there are many items on the menu that, while lacking meat, are so flavorful that you don't really need the meat in it.  I've had the hummus and the edamame dumplings, and both have been quite good.  I've also tried the banh-mi wrap and the TLT, and although both are very tasty, I liked the TLT a little more (perhaps due to the smoky bacon-like taste of the tempeh).  Drinks, while expensive, are freshly made, and the Red moon I tried was delicious.    The sides I had with the sandwich were just OK.  The sweet potato hash was overcooked so there were a lot of burnt bits on my plate, and the kale salad tasted too sour to me.  In general, prices are a bit high, but that's probably to be expected for this area.

We have tried this place three different times, and have ordered different items each time, only to be completely disappointed.  I love Dr. Weil, and WISH I could give this place a good review, but the food is flavorless, boring, unseasoned, and DULL.  I am about worthless in the kitchen myself, and the dishes are about as imaginative as my own awful cooking, but with less flavor.  We give up.

To preface this review, I will mention that the day we visited True Food was the day after Christmas. I don't know what possessed my mom and I to brave the insanity that is the day after Christmas shopping in Scottsdale. We must have just been really craving "True Food" after gorging ourselves on cheese, wine, and cookies for a week (or two).   So--the place was super packed. My biggest gripe was getting seated. You walk in (there's 2 entrances) and then you're kind of just standing there wondering what to do. Apparently we were supposed to check in to be put on the list outside, but we didn't know know that. There are 2 hostesses, who honestly just seemed like they were twiddling their thumbs, staring off into space. After about 10 minutes, they finally acknowledged us, and told us it would be an almost 2 hour wait.. Luckily, there is a long communal bar/dining area that's first come, first serve. We snagged a pair of seats and our waiter was with us soon after.   To drink, my mom had the ginger Tulsi tea, which is "adaptogenic"...which apparently means that it's some magical voodoo tea that can figure our what's wrong inside of you--and fix it. Sounds good to me! And it was actually super delicious. I should have ordered one as well, but my wino instincts ordered the Chenin Blanc from India--- so good!! Highly recommend.   To eat, we ordered the seasonal vegetable salad, and the red chili noodles. The waiter offered to split the dishes so we could share, which was really nice. Despite how busy they were, the service was relatively quick, no frills, and the food came out surprisingly quick. Everything was tasty- not mind blowing- and we didn't feel fat and sluggish after (+1 star). I scoped out some of my neighbors dishes, and they all looked fantastic as well.  Since we were dining at the community table, we sat across from a lovely couple from Sedona, and ended up having great conversation. My mom and I both enjoyed this aspect of the meal, but if you are one to not exactly enjoy the company of strangers while you're eating, I'd recommend making a reservation/waiting for an actual table.   All in all, I think this is a great healthy option for when you're out and about shopping in Scottsdale. I would avoid during lunch rush, and definitely consider making a reservation. The seating process was confusing, but I can overlook that. I will definitely return the next time I make my way through the desert...

Promoting themselves as healthy dinner options we had some pretty tasty food.  The vegetable dip appetizer with ranch and an olive did were good.  The sea bass I had was excellent as was my wife's pasta.    One area to improve. How about some ice in the water.  Luke warm served water was just horrible.  Is there a health advantage to serving warm water (maybe there is).    Service was good with them being crowded.

Had AMAZING SERVICE tonight at true foods! It's one of my favorite restaurants my family and I go to all the time. Ask for Caitlin! She was very attentive, sweet, and very knowledgable of the menu. Shout out to you girl! Thanks for taking care of us tonight.
Best salad I have ever had in my life!!!  It was the chicken cranberry one.  OMG!!!    Customer service could be better.....................

Wonderful place, the food is healthy and presented so well, my only gripe is that's is expensive and portions are small. I'm the kind of person that if I'm eating an appetizer and an entree I will likely take some home to go, here I eat everything and I maybe hungry still.   The menu is has juices, and other health foods. Perfect place for health nuts or those who want a nutritious meal.  Unfortunately this place does attract hipster douchebags and people who like to show off their money.  Overall it's a well made restaurant.

One of my favorites. I love that I can enjoy delicious food at Truefood that's actually nutritious. Great selections for vegans, like myself. I recommend the TLT with kale salad and the medicine man elixir! The patio is wonderful, even in the hot summer months, thanks to their fans and misters. Very friendly and knowledgeable servers. Great lunch date spot.

I had been dying to try True Food Kitchen for a while now, after seeing reviews on it on various people's "Vegetarian" lists. I was even more psyched to see that it not only is close to where I live, but also took the place of that awful Coffee Plantation spot in the Biltmore! Yay!  I went with my somewhat reluctant meat-eating boyfriend, but he was quickly won over with their expansive alcohol menu and their plethora of meat dishes- all either local or organic. A place we can both agree on!  I ordered the honey lemonade ($3) which was the perfect balance between tart and sweet-- honey is a great sweetener! I was brought a refill just when my glass became less than half full-- bonus!  We also ordered the hummus appetizer (~$8), which we both enjoyed immensely. My boyfriend liked the tart olives and feta cheese, whereas I loved the cucumbers! There was more hummus left over as our pita bread slices dwindled, but that just means we loaded up our pieces!  For my main course, I had the TLT (Tempeh, Lettuce, and Tomato) ($9), which I really enjoyed. The tempeh was pretty crunchy, but it was balanced by the smooth avocado slices. The boyfriend ordered the Organic Ravioli with Ricotta cheese and kale pesto (~$13), which was super good! It came with 6 pieces of ravioli, which he thought was not enough at first, but after he cleaned his plate he said he was "stuffed." Good sign!! The plate also comes with a ton of meaty mushrooms, which made it even better in my opinion.   We definitely did not have room for dessert, but I've heard mixed reviews of the desserts so I'm not sure if that's something we'll end up trying. Our server was extremely attentive to us, did not pressure us into ordering anything extra, and was prompt in refilling water glasses, answering questions, and bringing the check.  The atmosphere is interesting- a mix of well-dressed business and retired people (think: khaki pants, button up shirts, sweater vests (in the winter); nurses just off work; people coming in for happy hour (jeans and nice shirts); and people just in off the street (shorts, casual shirts, even hats). I really liked this ambiance, because it doesn't make it too stuffy and turn people "off" of this locally grown, organic restaurant concept.  We would definitely be back in a heartbeat, but the only reason I marked it down was because we were sitting underneath their funky lights, and a spider fell out of the light on to my boyfriend's arm. He wasn't terribly bothered by it (other than 'wtf, why is there a spider on my arm?') but I would have freaked out. So... don't sit under the lights, if you can help it!

A couple of things about my recent visit.  First of all, I had the Teriyaki Brown Rice, Local Vegetables, Sesame & Avocado with Tofu.  Since I'm vegan, it was one of the options conveniently marked as such.  And it was delicious!  Flavorful and hearty, I truly enjoyed it.  I took my mother here for her birthday, and both my mother and brother enjoyed it.  I've been a couple of times for lunch, and I have enjoyed it, but neither my mom nor brother eat a lot of food that follows this concept.  My brother, a near carnivore, liked the steak tacos, but thought that the tortilla was bland.  We ordered a bottle of delicious wine, and thoroughly enjoyed the strawberry hemp-milk ice cream.  That should definitely become a permanent selection, because I am vegan and I did not see another vegan dessert option.  And finally, the waiters and staff were awesome.  Our waiter was friendly, polite, and incredibly helpful.  I definitely recommend this for anyone looking for some local selections, a unique mix of (mostly) healthier food, and anyone wanting to enjoy a good meal.

Let me just begin by saying that I am a huge fan of Fox Restaurant Concepts.  I had heard so much about True Food Kitchen, so I decided to grab a quick bite to eat.  While previously on their website, I was drooling over their Ahi Tuna Sliders; as a result, I ordered them.  I must add that I believe that wasabi (a prominent flavor) BELONGS with anything ahi related.  These sliders came with a wasabi aioli, but it was very bland, and you could not even identify that wasabi was involved.  I asked if there was another wasabi sauce available that was stronger, but instead, the chef gave me a Sriracha aioli which was more mayonnaise (again) than anything else.  The server saw that I was still not enjoying the sandwich (it all lacked flavor, even the fish), so she had the chef make a stronger aioli.  It was ALMOST there.  It was not even hot, only a hit of wasabi.    I know that everyone has a different heat preference, but all I was asking was to TASTE the wasabi.  I needed lunch and needed to jet so I finished the meal with the last wasabi aioli attempt.  I was ready to pay, and to my surprise, the server comped my meal!  It was a pleasant surprise.  I was not impressed at all by my first experience with the food, but because of the nice gesture by the server, I will return again.    True Food Kitchen has a great atmosphere and a friendly and attentive staff.  Try it for yourself. :)

Sadly I have to update my review :(  We eat at this location 3x a week since it's walking distance from our place. The past month we have been visiting we get our usual dishes. My husband orders the red chili noodles with steak and the first time he ordered this was a month ago for lunch. Wow was it good!! The steak was cooked perfect and the natural juices from the steak gave the noodles a lovely sauce.  The next week we went back for dinner, and we both orders the noodles.. we were so disappointed this time. The steak was over cooked and something in the noodles got burnt because all you could taste was charred burnt pieces. I hate to complain but I did tell the bartender and he said that's the way it's prepared. I left it at that.  Today I ordered the noodles again for lunch thinking maybe the same chef from the first lunch visit would be possibly be there... another disappointment. My noodles were so gummy and overcooked, the steak overcooked and no flavor.  Anytime I leave feedback to the manager or waiter, nothing happens, so I'm not sure what's going on with this location but I'm so sad because it use to be our favorite.
Really well prepared & tasty dishes. I love that I can go here as a vegetarian & pretty much eat anything, but that it also has options for meat eaters.

As a vegan visiting the Phoenix area, I patronized True Food because a family member chose it. I liked the outdoor seating and the "freshness" of all of the menu items. There are not very many choices for vegans. The things I was able to order, were good, my favorite being an appetizer of roast root veggies and dips. That seemed to be a hit with everyone at my table. It was a nice portion for the price. I ordered a salad for my main course, which I hate to do. It was just ok. I'm not a big fan of salad dressings, but I think I only had one other option for a meal.   I think I'd like True Food for a pricey cocktail and appetizer, but not again for a meal.  As a final note, I do not know anything about the anti-inflammatory diet, but I find the whole "grass fed beef" thing disturbing. Beef does not eat grass, a cow does. Sustainable fish is as impossible as the idea of "humane meat".
This place is great, good food and great selection that always changes. If eat here all the time if I was closer. An experience is love to have more often.

True food is a definite staple if you live in the north Scottsdale area. I can't say enough good things about this restaurant. All of the servers are so nice and helpful and the menu options are not only healthy, but so delicious. True has become one of my favorite restaurants. I love coming here and sitting outside & it's such a bonus that they have pressed juices! From the salads to the homemade guacamole you can't go wrong. If you haven't been you should def go!

I didn't expect to find such a great natural/organic food place in Scottsdale Arizona.    My wife and I were really happy with it - If you go and are vegetarian, especially try the Tofu wrap and the quinoa pancakes.
The best, healthiest food around. Every city needs at least one of these!!! Hands down my favorite restaurant. Fresh food, organic, you just feel good after eating here. Love love love it!
I'm a 30 year vegetarian and I loved it! So did my carnivorous friends. I had the Brussels sprouts, herb hummus, Thai basil martini, and teriyaki quinoa with tofu. I would recommend all if it! Yum.

True foods is the best gluten free restaurant ever. Everything is made in house and fresh. I can be certain when I eat there that I will not feel sick! I love the pizza on the gluten free pita, the Farmers Market Crudités is also amazing with the olive tapenade, and the bowls. The service is always friendly and delicious. The only thing I have gotten that I didn't like was the spaghetti squash because it was rather bland. The chocolate cake is amazing! It's gluten free and the ice cream is vegan and made in house. The best thing is that you would never know the ice cream was not dairy and that the cake is gluten free. It is the best gluten free chocolate cake I have ever had.

Ended up here on a whim. We needed a dog friendly patio. The staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. I had the street tacos with sea bass. Amazing! My husband had the bison burger with the kale salad. He loved it. The cocktails were fantastic. I wish Fox would open one here in Tucson.

This place is a five star! Love the food! Love their drinks! My favorite drink is the red moon and i heard if you add vodka it tastes great! There's inside and outside seating. A great atmosphere and the food is just awesome and if you want healthy but tastes awesome then go here!

I have eaten at this restaurant over 25 times and it use to be a favorite.  The quality and the service have been going downhill.  In June when my friends treated me here to my birthday, we all commented how lousy the service and food were becoming.  Last night was my last night ever going to this place.  My daughter was in from out of town and requested we go here because I would not have chosen True Food again.  We were seated at a table with food all over the floor underneath and a menu laying there as well.  We waited 10 min and many server walked by us but no one acknowledged us.  I finally got up and went to the receptionist to ask if our table could be cleaned and if we could see a server.  Our server let us know he was eating his dinner....really?  My daughter ordered the tacos vegetarian with tofu, I ordered a salad.  My daughter began with a field green salad for $4.  This salad is only lettuce, like TF dumped out a cup of mixed field green out of a bag.  I had to continually stop other servers for more ice or more ice tea.  When our server would approach the table he was still chewing from eating his dinner.   When our entrees were served they did not bring my daughters.  I had to flag down several servers to check on her order.  Our server was nowhere in site since he was enjoying his dinner.  My daughters tacos had only a cabbage mix, no tofu, nothing else.  I wanted to have them redone but we were both so over this place and the quality.  This restaurant use to be trendy and the service spot on but the menu is tired and needs to be revamped, the servers no longer even look hip and trendy.  I am over this place.

True Food Kitchen is somewhere I'd go if I really enjoying over paying for generic non flavorful food. I've been here on dates with girls who are vegetarian / health enthusiasts which I don't mind but why sacrifice flavor.   The only saving grace is the tasty juices.

Best lunch I've had in a while.. The chicken teriyaki bowl is perfect.. Wouldn't change a thing, and it's the perfect serving size. My friend has the miso soup and the shrimp with noodles entree, and she loved her options also! The Root and Remedy juice was too earthy for me, but my friend who loves beets really enjoyed it! Perfect outdoor restaurant for lunch before it gets too hot!  Came back today for lunch. Ordered ancient grains bowl, and it was incredible. Perfect flavor on all components and portion. Mom had the turkey wrap with sweet potatoes side. She said it's the best turkey wrap she's ever had, highlighting the avocado and hummus mixture. I had the apple, carrot, ginger juice and will order it every time I visit!!!
Quality organic food that tastes good. Food is clean and delicious , but i gotta day bring back the bison burger !

A friend of mine wanted to go for lunch this past weekend.  He suggested since it is the New Year and we are looking to eat on the healthier side, that we try this new restaurant called True Food Kitchen.    We arrived and at first glance I thought, this place is pretty cool.  It's located where the old Coffee Plantation used to be in the Biltmore Fashion Park.  It's over-sized dramatic lights and open "Cafeteria style" seating with a hip twist was interesting to me.   Bringing the kitchen to the middle of the dinning room was certainly a new concept.  They had food prep and pasta making in the middle of the room.  Not sure how well that goes over with the Health Department, but it certainly was innovative.    We were seated and immediately approached by our waitress who was very nice and helpful.  She took our drink order (oh no soda by the way) and returned to take orders. We both decided on salads. I went with the Harvest Chopped Salad, Butternut Squash, Apples, Walnuts, Goat Cheese & Balsamic Vinaigrette.   Meanwhile I saw the table next to us was served soup, and that sounded good, so I asked the waitress to add the Miso soup.   After all was delivered it was honestly very delicious!  The Goat Cheese was SO creamy and with the tangy vinaigrette and other added items in the salad it was such a good meal!    Now for the bad news...I guess it depends on the person but I thought for the portion sizes, It was a little pricey.  At first a $10 salad didn't seem like a big deal to me based on my experience on salads at other establishments, but honestly this was more like the size of a side salad.  I know the ingredients are "Organic" and "Fresh" but where do we draw lines?  Mind you, I am not complaining about the portion size, because I agree we as Americans over-eat, however the comparability to the price was off.  I don't think I am a cheap, but I just question why we pay more for food that is healthy?  This never really made sense to me.  Just some "Food for thought".

Me and my boyfriend decided to stop by here on our way back to california. And we were so glad we did! The place is really cute, and such fresh vibrant colors. we sat outside in the super comfortable chairs.   He had this grass-fed bison burger and it was extremely good! I wanted his meal more than mine, but I was trying to eat a little healthier. And to my surprise my choice was also really good! I ordered the street tacos.  The drinks we ordered was the hangover rx and the green arnie. Both were very good, and the hangover one tasted like an orange julius. I don't live in arizona, so I can't wait to try the True Food Kitchen in Santa Monica. I hope it is just as good.

Really very good. Delicious smoked salmon, and the kid's pizza was the best quality I have seen. The chili shrimp was great, and there were super healthy, non-alcoholic cocktails in addition to a really nice wine list and alcoholic cocktails as well, although I didn't try them. True Food Kitchen is not cheap, but the quality is terrific.

The food itself was okay, not bad but also not great.  I would not go again but what really killed the place for me was the lousy service.  Once glass of water, took 20 minutes to get a juice and I gave up on trying to get more catch up or a box.  Skip it, I can save $70 and feel judged with lousy service by having dinner at my mother's house.
Good and fresh! My turkey burger was a bit salty but still good. The squash pie was great.

THEY TAKE YOUR FOOD AND DRINK BEFORE YOU'RE FINISHED AND DON'T EVEN ASK YOU!   Well, I felt the need to change my review here because I had an over zealous server who, not once, but twice pickup my drink or food without asking if I was done!!!!  First she pickup my martini that was only 2/3 finished and than had the audacity to charge me for another one!  Then I ordered the chicken dish and eat less than half of it and next thing I know it was gone from my table!!!  She didn't even ask me if I was finished!  Last time I'm going here!
Amazing artisan cocktails and great eats. The tacos where excellent.

Please save our hearing! If you are so healthy minded then you should care about this sense. Good grief from the moment I walked in it was blaring and once the room was getting full you almost couldn't hear it but you know no one turned it down. Ruined the experience for me.
Great food, great ambiance. A bit pricey - we got two non-alcoholic drinks and an appetizer to share and the bill came up to 30$ before tip.

So, always been a fan of this place until I started eating there regularly since I work in the area. So now I can poke holes through this place...kind of like when you stay at a friend's house a while, you start finding out things that you didn't suspect.  Some dishes I will never grow tired of: the caramelized onion tart, kale salad, curry, and the big bowl of raw veggies with the two dips. All outstanding. Other dishes vary from just ok to not at all my flavor profile. I won't hold it against them. But there are a couple of rip offs... ALL DRINKS. All rip offs. Medicine man whatever...watered down. So expensive, flushed with soda water, full of ice. There is literally two sips in the glass.  Totally not worth it at $6 each. At least. Say yes to a refill? Get charged an other $6.  Salads are teeny tiny. I still pay $8 for the tangy kale salad since I'm a bit addicted, but the chicken chopped at $14 is a total joke. I ordered it to go just a few days ago and it looked like a $3 salad. Not even an once of chicken, a few tiny pieces of manchego and ONE date. ONE!!! The container was about 6 inches long and had about an inch tall of salad. Not even appetizer size. With tax, it was over $16. That makes me angry. And that makes me give only two stars.

It's so incredibly rare to find a restaurant at the intersection of healthy and delicious. I give True Foods major kudos for executing on this combo really well. My husband had a really tasty Red Chili Shrimp dish, and my kids had healthy turkey burgers with (baked, not fried) sweet potato bits. They loved their homemade honey lemonade and grapefruit sodas. The hummus appetizer and gluten free pita were to die for. A must for gluten-free vegetarians!  I liked the open kitchen concept but the decor was a bit sterile and chain-y for my preferences (only reason I didn't give it a 5). I'd go back in a heartbeat.

I couldn't WAIT to check this place out. It's another Fox Concept restaurant (and really, they're all delicious). We had friends in town who are mostly vegetarian like us. They love a variety of veggies and aren't afraid to take risks with us.  It's real food, so it's hardly a "risk" but the server even said their most popular dish is the chicken salad and not because he thinks it's the best, but because people just select their go-to because they know it's safe and what they like.   We tried the butternut squash pizza (good), ancient grains bowl (amazing spicy sweet potatoes!), Mediterranean salad with sliced raw tuna and fish tacos. We also had the guacamole and charred cauliflower. Of all the food options, the cauliflower was my favorite, but I liked everything.  One thing worth mentioning are the cocktails. YOU GUYS. I know they are a pretty penny, but you will be SO impressed. We tried 3 different ones and loved them all.   It was a wonderfully enjoyable dinner. With 4 alcoholic drinks, 4 entrees and a kid's meal, it came to $152. It was such a lovely evening out. Yum.

I was out for a business dinner last night and a client recommended True Food in North Scottsdale.  The restaurant itself was trendy and had an awesome atmosphere.  It sits in a lifestyle shopping center, but feels like it is by itself.  The entire place opens up to the elements and you feel like you are sitting outside even if in the middle of the place.  The tables outside wrap around the restaurant like a horseshoe.    Cool menu with very fresh ingredients and refreshing beverages.  I had the Cool Spring Salad (over ate on this trip and needed something light).  The salad had a balsamic vinaigrette dressing with strawberries and blue cheese.  It was delicious!    The service was great, yet everyone had bronzed tans, which made my Wisconsin style like whiteness even more noticeable in the AZ sunset...  Definitely a great place for a casual dinner or date...

I've heard the name before, but my manager was in town last week and she decided to take us here for dinner. It was surprisingly busy for a Thursday night, but we hung out on the patio until our table was ready. I really like the layout of the restaurant, open kitchen, open layout, lots of green and natural materials. Our server was nice and took great care of us. I had their green tea which was good, and had the miso soup and tuscan kale salad with chicken, both of which were really good. Being very "green", I didn't feel guilty after eating, especially since the portions were just the right size. I will definitely be back.

"No, they're not fried... they're Wok'd"   (picture it.....the original Hairspray movie....this was said to me with the same inflection and tone of  Tracy Turblad when speaking to her Geometry Teacher about her hair.. "Its feathered....not ratted")     True Food is a better choice for other people.   I finally was able to eat here... as most everyone I know has already been here and raved.  Why?  That.. I'm not sure about.   The place has warm inviting "butter" tones with wood accents that all come together to create this bright and spacious restaurant.  It features an "exposition" style kitchen with basic comfortable seating.    The first thing I noticed was the STAFF! ... so many..... so available... so...so... Visible.  There was no place for the staff to hide and compare notes on bad tippers or to avoid refilling your water.  Quickly looking around the place, I counted 14 servers, a few bartenders and a few bus/host persons... all to serve about 60 of us that were in for an early dinner (6:30).  The restaurant, when full, seats 120. The staff moved about the place like a dance troupe (yes.. in all sense of the word) , all young , fresh , energy infused servers..Smiling, helping each other out.. it was kinda sickening to see such a large group get along so well... I'm thinking that antidepressants are served with the employee meals.    I noticed a great perk in the refreshments menu, you can add a shot of organic vodka to any of the natural drinks for a $3.00 up charge!  See mom... you were totally wrong.. Drinking CAN be healthy!!  We started our meals with the Shrimp Dumplings and the herb hummus.  When I asked if the dumplings were steamed or pan fried our waiter replied "No, they're not fried... they're Wok'd"... silly me and all this time I thought a wok was a pan.    The plump wok'd dumplings were very good, served in a mild mushroom broth with cilantro and scallions  ($10) the creamy hummus was delicious with fresh pita ($8).  The "salad" in the menu's description was basically just a small bit of salad place on top of the 2/3c portion of hummus.  Impressed by the apps were really looking forward to the entrees.  Being pressured to choose an entree, I opted for the steak tacos ($14) (What the hell was I thinking? ), my friends ordered the butternut squash ravioli with mushrooms ($13)  and also the natural pan roasted chicken ($18).  2 losers 1 winner arrived...I shouldn't say losers... because, they were ok... just not equal.     The steak tacos were just that... YAWN... I blame myself for not taking the time to review the menu.  2 large steak tacos with a large side of yummy, spicy Anasazi beans.. if I closed my eyes and tasted the tacos, I don't think I could tell if I were at Baja Fresh or True Food... Honestly.. Order the chicken.  The Squash Ravioli were very good, but it was agreed by all that the sweetness of the filling did not pair very well with the scrumptious (yes... scrumptious)  mushroom sauce.  What a shame, the sauce over simple pasta would have fared better in our eyes.  The star of the night, or shall I said DIVA... was the chicken... OH MY GOD.. who would have guessed a boneless, free range chicken would be soooooooooo delicious.  The chicken was pan fried to perfection (skin on to retain moisture) with a light savory seasoning, served over farro (a new whole grain for me).    THIS WAS THE MOST DELIOUS CHICKEN I HAVE EVER EATEN..so very juicy, the flavors so subtle ,  I was pissed the server did not steer me in that direction.   We all ended up eating the chicken since we were all impressed by it.  I hear that the Kale salad paired with the pan roasted chicken is the meal of the gods.    All in all we enjoyed our time there.. but not over the top impressed... I can tell you we will never order the ravioli or tacos again.. but the kale salad and the chicken...that's a different story.  I hear from the manager that the restaurant will be getting tons of attention from both local and nationwide media, so this concept might become the next healthy Chili's.  When leaving the restaurant we noticed a "protected" private dining area in the back of the place... may want to inquire if you're with a larger group.

True Foods does not disappoint. If you have a desire to eat a nutritious meal with good flavor, True Foods is your choice. They have refreshing drinks with ginger and lime - yummy. They serve a variety of meals to appeal to different palates. It may be a bit too healthy for some. And for dessert, one of the best chocolate cakes with caramel and vanilla ice cream.

I love the concept.  Healthy food with a trendy flare.   A cool, hip staff and an incredible buildout make this place a pleasure to eat at.  I've never had a bad experience with the staff.  The food is good, the soup is amazing.  My only quibble: How can you market yourself as a place that makes "true food" and sell farmed salmon?

A very pleasant atmosphere.  Sited in an upscale shopping area it is a good pick if you are interested in so-called healthy dining.  The menu is good with options for all tastes unless you think fine dining is found at Applebee's. Pricing is very reasonable for this area. Wait staff was good and the person greeting us at the door did not flinch or seem peeved when I rejected the table near the door she attempted to foist upon us. (All restaurant staff know to fill the less desirable tables first.).

What an amazing place. Everything  was delicious... the quinoa burger, the spaghetti  squash casserole were to die for. Service was incredible, everyone was super  nice !  The cucumber lemonade was soo refreshing. It is one of the yummiest places i have ever been to !
Really great food and the experience is always amazing. Try their mixed drinks/juices too, the freshness is unbeatable. I love taking clients, friends and family when they come to visit.

Food is always fresh and delicious.  The drink selection is interesting but expensive.  Hummus appetizer is very good.  Dumpling appetizer a little too "fishy" for me.  The bison burger is perfect.  Love eating on the terrace.

Wow the food was so delicious! I Oder the Spaghetti Squash and the mediterranean salad,they were amazing. For drinks I Oder a pina colada also a good choice. Last but not least,  for dessert I Oder the cranberry almond cake it was a little dry, so  defiantly getting their flourless chocolate  cake next time. The service was outstanding, our server was very helpful and sweet.

Ok this place I can go to 5 days a week, just because I need to cook a couple of days at home. I call this place my "other kitchen". Yesterday I enjoyed their Citrus Skinny Mojito and just had to have another; which having just one at lunch (non-work) is an anomaly. Keep up the amazing work! And THANK YOU!

First time trying True Food Kitchen. Very hip and trendy place. Food is impressive in its freshness, simplicity and flavor.  Lots of vegetable/organic options to choose from.  Good place to meet new clients for a quick lunch.  Will try again.

I know this is kind of a yuppy healthy chain, but I gotta say, I like it. Having just changed my diet, this is one place where I can stay within my restrictions and still eat great tasting food -- here's an even better hint: I order all sauce/dressing on the side and the food tastes just as good or better without it!!

Had a great waitress, excellent food and first class wine and drinks at the Kitchen last night. The waitress, who is part Columbian and part Lebanese was extremely attentive and helpful. We had the Penang curry which was very tasteful and authentic, and the Farmers Market salad. The Truchard Pinot was pricey but worth it.  misters kept us cool despite the incredible heat of the evening. The AC was due to be replaced and inside it was muggy so sitting outside was a fair option. Would recommend this place and never saw or heard any examples of snootiness from anyone. 1/6/13 - have to update on this place as last night we were not happy with our meal. I had my staple ( yes I have it every time I go there) the Penang Curry, usually it is very good but have noticed over the last two visits that it is getting very watered down, and last night it was way too fluidic and had very little Tofu or rice in it. Not impressed, and Diane had the the roast chicken which was not very good, lots of chicken but very little else and she was I'll when we got home. Going downhill or just a bad night, who knows?

I'm sorry I'm sorry... I ate my food and didn't take a photo. It was just SO GOOD I couldn't contain myself. First of all the location is wonderful and the large glass windows make it so welcoming. It's always busy and they do take reservations. The menu is always changing and that's what makes it so interesting. I had the turkey burger and it was super juicy and flavourful. It tasted healthy not greasy. The TLT is PACKED with Tempeh and all around overly stuffed!! My friend got one of the bowls and said it was delicious. I also treated myself to the honey lemonade and it was a different taste which was super refreshing. Overall this experience was 10/10. You are eating delicious food in a great environment.

I usually go to the True Food in the Biltmore for lunch, but came here for date night on Friday. We were offered the patio seating which was low/patio furniture type seating because the wait was long.  We were sat in comfortable chairs next to a fire pit (too hot to turn on), with a view of the courtyard with trees and lighting. We really enjoyed the atmosphere and the weather was perfect. My boyfriend ordered green tea, and we both tried something new- the curry. The waitress let us know that we could do half order of shrimp/half chicken. It was delicious!! Warning: it comes out extremely hot! I usually order either the tacos or the chicken teryaki bowl, which are both also very good. You really can't go wrong with anything you order, including the different lemonades and other pressed juices! Highly recommend this place!

Staying at the Camby and next door was the Biltmore Fashion Park. I wanted to try something new in Scottsdale. True food is not new but 1st choice of crepes didn't work out since they were closing in 15 mins.  The waiter was very welcoming and asked if we had been to True Food. I said yes in Houston.  He was cool this one is the original.  The food, decor, and service was good and consistent between the locations.  I got a nice light dinner of spaghetti squash casserole and was happy.

True food was all I was hoping it would be!  I am always up for a restaurant that serves fresh, healthy VEGGIE food.  I think I am in love with the harvest pomegranate salad--it has butternut squash, nuts, goat cheese, apples and pom seed vinaigrette.  Then I had the butternut squash ravioli which was all I could hope for as well.  The restaurant is light, open and the staff is all wearing yoga style outfits--very Andrew Weil!  I still miss coffee plantation, but I am happy to have True Food in its place.

Good food that is healthy! Yes please! Went with a couple people and everyone's was happy with their food. I ordered the turkey lasagna which was really good and flavorful. My husband had the teriyaki chicken bowl which was really yummy too! I don't think my husband expected to like food with only healthy options ha!!! Service was slow and the restaurant was pretty slow during a Thursday night but the waiter was nice. Overall this restaurant is def worth checking out!

OMG, YES, YES, YESSSS! As a food-a-phile this was fantorgasmic! Healthy, they understood allergies, they used organic food. They made the most freaking delicious raw fish specials that I've ever had. Ate there every freaking day when I was in Phoenix. They care about everything down to the service. CLEAN, DELICIOUS...What can I say, if I had my way the future of all restaurants would be going in this direction! Seriously, if I ruled the world...they would be in every airport.   Thank you Dr. Andrew Weil, thank you caring people at True Foods. Thank you to whoever the manager is there as they keep the place rocking and on top of it. I love the juices, fantabulous! Absolutely fantabulous.  Love the Nojito, the buddha, the medicine man. Told them I had a soy allergy they understood. The sweet potato hash rocks. Can you tell that I sort of love this place???   Oh yeah, even the bathrooms are cool...Check out the cool hand dryers, so jet space age.

Spot on delicious! Super fresh food. Try the grapefruit martini to start. We had sea bass over the top sweet and moist, cooked to perfection with ancient grains and broccoli ingredients. Edemami dumplings were tender and tasty. Burnt cauliflower was to die for, and last but not least were the desserts. We had squash pie with coconut cream whipped cream and dark graham cracker crust and flourless chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream.   Go, go now! Not inexpensive, but worth every bit of it.  The only thing keeping it back from a 5 Star was the level of service. It was haphazard and inattentive although the food came out hot and quickly

I have been to the True Food in LA and loved everything about it. Last night I brought my parents in with my 3 year old daughter. Our waitress Katie (name was on the check) was absolutely amazing. I was very impressed with her attention to my daughter and asking if she could get her meal out right away for her. Also the edamame dumplings and guacamole are so amazing. Will be back very soon.
Ate here last night. Food was poor at best.  Don't let the concept fool you, it's no good...

I have always loved this place. The atmosphere is awesome, service is always great, and the food always tastes wonderful! I am a big fan of the Pita and Hummus. They also have a wonderful selection of drinks, however I always resort back to their delicious Black tea. Prices are reasonable, given it's a healthy menu. You pay for what you get!
Very good food. I had a pleasant experience because they accommodated us very well. Would recommend to anyone looking for a healthier option.

I had a delicious lunch at True Food. Went on a Sunday and they were packed but we were able to find a table outside with no wait. The weather was gorgeous so we took a seat and ordered sparkling iced teas, they were refreshing and tart and perfect for a fall day.  I split the quinoa burger with sweet potato hash and the chicken chop salad. The quinoa burger was served "inside out" with no bun, basically two quinoa patties covering lettuce, tomato, feta and some dill dressing. It was really good and the sweet potato hash was the perfect pairing.   The chop salad was excellent, chicken, canberries, dates, jicama, manchego cheese, almonds and champagne vinaigrette.   This would be a 4 star experience except for the fact that the wait was incredibly long. Long to order, get our food and pay our bill. This is a reoccurring theme this place needs to work out. Otherwise if time isn't an issue this is a great spot for lunch.

Terrible service!  We have been sitting here for 10 minutes...waitress finally comes over to ask if we have been helped. I respond...no we have been waiting for someone to come over.  She gives a sarcastic smile and says... Ok let me take your drink order.  Meanwhile the other 5 plus waiters are wondering around the restaurant doing nothing.  If it wasn't for the fact that I know the food is good we would have left.  This location needs some serious training in customer service!

I love the idea of True Food and what it is all about, but honestly I don't know if any of the dishes I've had here make me want to scream from the rooftops. I had the spaghetti squash casserole and I feel like I've made it at home before. We got the sweet potato pie, which a friend raved about, and I found it to be just "okay". Same with the charred cauliflower. I did enjoy the people watching, however.

I have wanted to go here for a while and am so glad I finally made it here. The food was so fresh and delicious and I felt great just eating it. I had half a harvest salad and half a kale salad with chicken. Also a glass of delicious Parducci. My husband had the chicken sausage pizza and it was delicious. The crudites were popular according to what other people had on their tables, so can only imagine that was good. I am a fan!

Healthy options here...it's true....foods kitchen!  I love their Seabass entree. I haven't had the spaghetti squash casserole in a long time, but I remember liking it at the time. Their pizza is yummy too!  Restaurant week came by not too long ago and I felt like going here twice because the first time was that good!   So on a weekday and the weekend, I basically ate the same thing.   First course:  Shitaki lettuce cups (tofu, jicama, Thai basil, cashew, sambal) & hummus - both very flavorful, tofu mix tasted hearty for a vegan appetizer  Wild caught albacore tataki w/avocado, jalapeño, yuzu ponzu - this was presented and tasted sharp and salty in a good way  Second course:  Scottish Steelhead Salmon w/smoked onion farro, arugula, corn, roasted beets, pumpkin seeds - I loved this entree! Salmon was cooked medium ish medium rare with a soft pink flesh center. The combo is genius! Flavor, colors and textures were perfect!   Dessert:  flourless chocolate cake w/vanilla ice cream, caramel, cocoa nibs - decadent chocolate but balances well with the vanilla and the nibs give it a solid crunch The chia seed pudding came with bananas and toasted coconut - a nice and light dessert if you don't want something heavy  I also got the refreshing seasonal watermelon drink!   Battle of weekday vs weekend:  Weekday: I enjoyed the albacore tataki this day maybe because it had more avocado, heartier and bigger bowl of shitaki tofu app, great service  Weekend: the shitaki lettuce cups just tasted a bit more overcooked and didn't seem as big in portion as the weekday.  Refill was available on the watermelon refresher as it was not on the weekday. The forever nightmare - friend had the grass-fed steak tacos. Good stuff right? Until she got to the middle of the second taco. A dark think piece of short hair. Hard not to gag, but so sad the rest of that taco went to waste. So sad. And sad I have to envision that hair because I love tacos!  Winner = Starboy weekday  Loser = weekend weak end

This is one of my favorite restaurants!!  I love all the delicious healthy options.  I feel that this location at Scottsdale Quarter is much better than the Biltmore location.  The atmosphere and food are both better here.  Everything I have tried here is great, including their drinks, so you can't go wrong with anything on their menu.  The only person who might not like this restaurant is someone who prefers "unhealthy" or greasy foods ;)
Excellent food ! Organic healthy . Love it . We need more restaurants like this one!!!!!!

Delicious healthy food and fantastic service every time we drop in! We used to go to the Santa Monica location and now that we live in Scottsdale this has quickly become a favorite. The juices are fabulous and the TLT sandwich is perfect for lunch. Two thumbs up!

I ordered the winter ingredient salad and even tho there were no greens it still was delish. I loved the natural flavors and the subtle vinaigrette drizzled. Fun menu and loved that most everything is local and organic. Def would recommend and return.
Love this place. Super healthy, good food that always leaves me satisfied without guilt.  Really good food and customer service. Good for business lunches.

I have been going here for years! It is such a great restaurant! Not too pricy! The decoration adds a great touch and the outdoors patio has a shade which is great-especially during the summer! Outstanding food! Very nice staff and great service!
The hummus and pita was appetizer was to die for!  I took the servers recommendation and ordered the breakfast sandwich special.  It was delicious and didn't disappoint.

We have been to True Food at the Quarter about 4 times - it is definitely our favorite Fox restaurant geared after Dr. Andrew Weil's Diet.  The food is good some are better then others.  The mushroom pizza was good the first time but not so good the 2nd time.  The appetizer with all the fresh organic veggies is good but the price of $11.00 is kind of high for veggies with two sauces. All portions are very small so if you are very hungry you might go elsewhere or get 2 entrees.  The appetizers some are bigger than others so ask how many you get before ordering.  Lots of the entrees have soy in them and they do not have Non-GMO soy so this is a downer and not all of the ingredients is Organic so make sure you ask before you order.  The dairy free pudding and the lemon cake were a hit.  the flourless cake was way too little for the price tag.  Expect to pay a lot for little portions and some good food and you will be okay.  the atmosphere in the quarters with the mist outside is great and the wait staff rocks, they will answer all your questions and bring you samples of all the food before you order. Great customer service

We haven't visit True Food in a few years but someone gave us a gift card so we ventured out.  They updated their menu and it is very very very small. One page with maybe 15 items on it....Not much of a selection, limited options for someone who is soy free and gluten free to less than a handful...  I  ordered the Lasagna which was way overpowering with spices it burned my tongue and very very spicy.  I ordered the ancient grain bowl with no miso and sunflower seeds rather than hemp seeds and it was very good and filling, would order it again.  Wish they had more vegan options and the menu was a little bigger.  My brother had the a bowl as well and we also ordered a coconut refresher.  Two bowls, one refresher drink it came out to about $25.per person....Wish they had GF pizza.  It was cool enough to sit outside but lots of flies, Good place for healthy food if you can find something on the menu but if you have allergies the choices are limited.  The Ancient Grain Bowl I would go back for plus they have Key Lime Pie Yummy

Love this restaurant. I had the kale salad, the smoked salmon and the raviolis. All executed to perfection. We certainly miss Michael Stebner's cooking in San Diego.. Now I ll have to come to Scottsdale more often :)

LOVE this place. I can get anything I want and not feel poorly afterwards. I always get the turkey wrap with extra lemon dressing on the side and a side of sweet potatoes. We have also tried and loved the hummus and pita, kale grapefruit guacamole, some of their specialty drinks, the margherita pizza, their bowls, their burger, and tacos. Everything is great. Service is great. If you are going to go to Fox restaurants often, get the $100 gift card at Costco for $79.99. It's worth it!!!!!!!
Good for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Whenever I go, it's usually with vegan friends, and yet I am able to find something to fill me up. Great decore and atmosphere. Will return again and again.

I was here for a business lunch. Was in town for a meeting 2-3 weeks ago & it was a nice find. I had the fish taco plate & lemonade.  It's not something you find out in LA, so I thought it was quite interesting and lively.  I like how the restaurant is laid out.  The atmosphere was quite lively & it's hard to talk business, but aside from that, I'd come back again if I were ever in town.  I saw that they had another location in Scottsdale too.  Try it!

Good but not great. The ingredients do make you feel better about what you're eating (it's healthier) but I can't say the taste is great. I have always had good service here. Flatbreads and salads are different, kinda weird. They have a chia seed banana pudding that's really yummy!

One of my favorite restaurants in Scottsdale, and that says a lot because there are so many great ones to choose from.  Yes it is a chain restaurant but it does not feel like one.  The food is unbelievable and very healthy, the staff are all very friendly, and the atmosphere is kind of like a hispster organic vibe but without being pretentious.  I would highly recommend it for a casual weekend brunch or a nice dinner.
I decided to go out on a limb and eat Ahi tuna sushi in the Poke bowl. I usually don't eat sushi. The bowl was an eclectic mix of flavors that mostly worked well together. I'm glad I tried it.

The food here is really awesome. Love going here bc there's a variety of options for everyone. The menu is quite refreshing! I like the atmosphere of the restaurant and the staff is really friendly and helpful

I am on week one of moving to scottsdale and I am soo happy to see many somewhat healthy restaurants or at least GF choices - this place was good.  I'm thinking scottsdale maybe 2nd place behind SF for the healthy and upscale foodie stuff.  So while I think this place it good, and pretty, they could be even better - I'm not an agave fan, i'd rather see raw honey or natural sugar being used - i am fructose sensitive and from what i've read agave is actually high on the fructose side and not that balanced of a sugar - not as healthy as people think it is.  I'd also like to see more veggies.  Other than that - - great place.

Lots of unique, healthy choices here. Often very busy, so expect to wait. Seems to be well staffed and well managed. Food is earthy and tasty. Prices are high, but Scottsdale Quarter, so... valet your Bentley and enjoy.

Food was good and the ambiance was nice. They were able to accommodate our large group of almost 12 pregnant/new mom plus babies group.  Only thing I had a big issue with was the price for the quantity. I ordered a bowl of the soup of the day and it look more like a cup in most other restaurants. I would have been okay with it if I didn't have to pay $9 for it. I also paid $5 for the kale juice and it was almost all ice and no juice in the cup. I felt a little cheated as I could have just made a batch of both the soup and kale juice at home :( I don't know what the other ladies paid for their portions and everyone got something very different.  So I left feeling hungry and kinda bummed... Oh well. Hanging out with my other hot mamas made up for it. However, I don't know if I will be returning too soon.   Nice spot to go shopping after!

Great selection of natural, local (when possible) food.  Menu changes with the season.  I had the Steak Tacos which were great.  A bit small, but they were very good.  I tried an off menu watermelon soda (that they make there) and it was really good.  Not a huge watermelon fan, but the drink turned me into one!

I absolutely love True Foods, so much so that I don't mind the prices. I recommend the chicken salad with farro and dates, the butternut squash pizza, and the chicken curry. Their cocktails are also very good, and their patio is nice. Their healthy drinks are also tasty, too.  Good service every time I go, and I've never had to wait for a table. I also love their open kitchen.   I just wish they had a happy hour.

I am a fan of True Food in San Diego and this Phoenix location did not disappoint.  My Kale salad was perfectly yummy. I tried the steak street tacos and they were tasty. 3 tacos were a blend of the warm steak bits, and yummy veggies with some sour cream. my son in law had the chicken sausage pizza on a gluten free crust. again, very tasty! The food is tasty and comes out attractively prepared. Our waitress was a delight-helpful and knowledgeable.   This location is in the Biltmore shopping center. Parking is validated.

If I had 6 stars to give to one single restaurant, I would definitely give them to True Food! By far my ultimate favorite restaurant. Healthy but great tasting food, excellent customer service and great atmosphere.   I have gone there several times and loved every dish I have ordered. My friends options were excellent as well! Their Kale salad is really good, but the shrimp & goat cheese pizza is to die for!!! I am also a big fan of their turkey burger. The sea bass melts away in your mouth. Yummy!   There is nothing I dislike about this restaurant (with exception of sometimes having to wait to be seated during lunch hours)! I love the concept. Ingredients used are organic, hormone and anti-biotic free, and locally grown. Plenty of gluten free, vegan and vegeterian dishes.   Highly recommend this restaurant!

It's difficult to rate this place because I truly do factor in value when I rate a location and I have a hard time justifying the prices here. I know it's in a prime spot on Camelback but I just don't like spending $5 on hot tea or $10 on a small portion of guacamole.   I know, I know... The ingredients are seasonal! And if that's what you value in a restaurant then this place gets 5 stars all day. Tasty food - delicious, really. Friendly staff, cool ambiance - you're fine in a t-shirt or sports jacket. I get the vegan pizza every time, and as far as vegan pizzas go, this is one of the best. Great, memorable flavors ensure this is always part of my order. Everything else is good but can be a little underwhelming.   If you're vegan you need to order the vegan key lime pie. It's stupid good

The ambience and look was terrific-- I admit, I had to touch what appeared to be the wheatgrass covered hostess podium.  Dined indoors, but their patio looked to be a comfortable option if not for the triple digit heat (to which I'm not acclimated.)  The kale salad was fantastic-- never had it served that way and really enjoyed it.  The entrees were tasty, fairly simple.   The service was attentive, when you add it up in the end, not particularly a deal, but good place to go.

I think I'll have to go again to try what others rave about...  I experienced friendly, attentive service, refreshing cucumber, citrus margarita but the Tuscan Kale salad- blah! The Kale was well-prepared and very good, but the dish needed something more than a dry slab of salmon. Boring!    Also, we had to wait for a table, but nearly every table of two was sitting at a table for 4 that was designed to be split for more seating- why wouldn't they use their available seating to it's potential?!?! Annoying.

Me: steak and potatoes, maybe a salad before hand. This place: eat your vegetables!!!!  OK, so I don't come here because unlike the food. I come here because my wife does and they sneak veggies into my meals. I do t love anything here, but that's because the focus is on veggies. I eat veggies, I'm trying to eat more, so this place is good for that. However, its not my first choice.   That said, the food is always cooked well and my wife loves this place. Is prefer if they used more simple stuff. I hate arugula, but places like this love to put it on burgers.  I love the atmosphere and location though. If you want to eat healthy this is the place to go
I love all Fox Concepts restaurants and True Foods was all I'd hoped for and more.  Fresh delicious foods and great service. Love the concept and atmosphere.

Hmmm... what to say about True Food Kitchen.  It seems to have take Coffee Plantation's spot at the Biltmore Shopping Center (Coffee Plantation sucked donkey) so Hooray!    TFK  looks fucking sweet from the outside with its floor to ceiling window/walls, but  it's a bit of a tangle on the inside.  While I can see what the owners/desingers where aiming at (wait maybe I can't I've never designed a restaurant...)  ,  I could not find a unifying theme for all of the decorative elements inside. Neon green tiles near the open kitchen , 70's wood pannel lamps in the dinning room, dark stone near the bathroom, and astro turf covering the hostess stand.  The place feels like a mix between fresh and easy and put-put golf.  The wait staff were dressed like car-hops working a veggy-brave-new-world drive thu..  I did like the wobbly butcher block tables.  Neat.    So who gives a crap about how a restaurant looks right?  I'm in it for the food.  I had the ahi tuna sliders (rare of course) with a side of sweet potatoe hash.  Sliders = derishious.  SPH = sadness :(  I loved the tuna, but god damn if the hash didn't come off as icky.   My date had the Teriyaki chicken with bown rice and veggies.  The chicken was overcooked and the bed of rice it came served over was saturated in Teryakie sauce that was rather tasty but became snail killing salty after 3 bites.  She also caught a snag of hot pepper on her first bite that made her scared the dish was spicy.  Keepy Spicey Separately.    Overall it was edible.  Have I had better?  Yup.  Do they have delish drink options, like natural ginger ale and organic honey lemonade? yesh!   But will all the neat stuff about this place and the fact that, like the Tuck Shop, they don't charge and arm and a leg, I still don't see myself ever comming back.  .

Celebration dinner for 9 ladies.  They let us make reservations.  The table was ready.  Trendy decor unfortunately it was too loud in the big open room and hard to have converesations. They were willing to work with us on our adds and deletes to menu selections.  I added shrimp to an appetizer and it turned out being a great meal.  The wine pourer was very entertaining.

I had brunch here on a Sunday morning; it was fairly crowded and loud, which was fine by me. We opted to sit indoors since there was a 20 minute wait for the patio seating. Plenty of high chairs available, and we were asked to park our stroller in the front of the restaurant. We were seated in what felt like the kids corner-which suited us..our daughter was having a ball smiling at another kid in front of us. The menu was interesting-lots of drinks available.  I loved that they had almond milk available for my coffee. hooray! I had the blueberry muffin with almonds-it was amazingly good, and I had the tofu scramble with chorizo. Waaaayyyyy tooo spicy for me, so unfortunately, I can't give that a good review. It gave me horrible indigestion for hours and hours. I'd definitely go back and try something else.  The menu was inventive and choices colorful-though not a lot of variety.   NO idea if there was a changing table in the rest room. It was completely occupied when I went in, so I opted for the public restroom across the way (right next to the escalator).

Once upon a time, I ate a buffalo burger at True Food Kitchen, and ever since I stopped eating the meats I've been anticipating another visit.   The menu these days looks really good. With various vegetarian options and vegan opt-ins you won't have to read too far through the items before something catches your eye (and taste buds).   For the most part, true food is prepared with healthful ingredients that leave a clean aftertaste. Much care and precision go into the dishes and the young staff is trained in presentation and pleasantries.  This was a genuinely beautiful autumn afternoon and although there were some cons with the service, I may not have paid full attention so - giving the benefit of the doubt - I won't mark that against the restaurant. It gets a solid 4 stars from me.  - wrong order was promptly corrected - questions were asked about our experience - motions were made to please us  It was just like fine dining. Yes, dining there was just that fine. Fine, let me tell you what I ordered...a couple of plates from the "Vegetables and Fruit" section and one from "Sandwiches."   1. Torched Avocado:  slices of blackened avocado on top of cucumber noodles, mushrooms, snap pea, watermelon radish, black sesame seeds, and drizzle of turmeric ponzu.  This is DELICIOUSly savory and I will order it again in a heartbeat.  2. Charred Cauliflower:  florets of cauliflower mixed with medjool dates, dill, mint, and pistachio nuts all covered in harissa tahini. This is good, but heavy on the dates. I don't like starting meals with sweetness so if I order this again I'll eat it last - right before dessert.  3. Quinoa Burger:  quinoa patties (actual grains of quinoa shaped into patties and used as buns) that sandwiched a smear of hummus, tzatziki, tomato, cucumber, red onion, avocado, and feta. I ordered this sans the dairy stuff. No likely. Not for me. Not this lifetime.  4. Vegan Pizza:  small thin crust pizza with skimpy toppings. We added nut "cheese" too and without this, the pizza wouldn't have been worth it.    If I could have a do-over, I would order 1 and 2 and request a side of fries to fill me up. Mmmm that sounds good. You might see me at TFK again for another meal sooner than I expected.

I absolutely loved the openness of the restaurant with it's brightness and open kitchen.  There were literally people preparing food several feet from us.  They definitely don't have anything to hide in their kitchen.  Upon quick glance of the menu I found a couple vegan options to choose from and had a tough time deciding between "Andy's Favorite 'TLT'" and the "Teriyaki Brown Rice Bowl" but when with Andy's Favorite "TLT" which Tempeh, Lettuce. Tomato. Avocado, Vegenaise, and Whole Grain Bread.  I had the choice to pair it with a kale salad or sweet potato hash and went with the hash.  While it was tasty and I'd say our experience at True Food Kitchen was unique I must say the prices are a bit steep for the amount of food you receive.  I understand it's healthier food and often that comes with a price tag, but $10 for a basic sandwich is a bit much in my opinion.

I got the lasagna bolognese and it was tasty. The ginger beer was to die for. I would come back just for their ginger beer. They were very busy and our server was just OK. We didn't make a reservation and waited about 20 minutes which was understandable.
Love this place- great food and service. Everything is consistent. They are expensive, but you get great quality food. A must try

I finally tried TFK and you should believe the hype.  Thai shrimp dumplings with basil, mint & red chili.....amazing!!!!  Panang curry w/ brown rice & shrimp....fantastic, but needed a little sriracha.  Organic corn & eggplant pizza with sweet onion, roasted garlic, goat cheese & basil....outstanding.   Nectarine & berry cobbler w/ vanilla ice cream....so very good!!!!!!!  Not everyone will enjoy the food as much as I did, but I recommend giving it a try.

When one of our spa guests asked me yesterday where she could get a gluten-free pizza that tasted good, I couldn't wait to tell her about True Foods! My girlfriends and I had eaten there last week and we couldnt believe our luck. We had the mediteranean salad which was a revelation, and the kale pesto pizza with sun dried tomatoes. Who knew good food could taste this good?! As the owner of Arizona's largest freestanding resort-style spa, guests expect me to eat healthy. Now I actually want to!   Heidi Lamar, Spa Lamar

I don't think you will ever be disappointed in this place no matter what you order. You will also feel happy after getting full because most likely you ended up eating something healthy. For sure 5 stars!

I really like True Food. Most of my meals there have left me feeling satsified but not full. We went this Sunday for Breakfast/Brunch & sat outside, which is always nice before the impending doom of summer. We had the greek frittata and chicken hash. Unfortunately both of our meals were just "eh" but I'll go back for more again. I love the concept. Hoping for some changes to the menu soon!

This is the place my co-workers and I go to for lunch every now and then. I am not really sure why lol... It's good but I am bored with the menu. It is just ok and it's always busy. Is it because we think it's healthy? Not sure... I like what I get which always the same... The turkey pita with sweet potatoes. It is decent and pricey.
First time here last week and I'm extremely bitter I hadn't made it over here sooner. Loved my Ancient grains with chicken. Can't wait to come back to try everything else!

Yum! Clean, fresh vibe to the place. Wonderful veggie options and adult beverages?! A rarity for veg friendly restaurants in the valley. Only complaint is the seating. I hate being in the middle of the room and most of the seating leaves you feeling exposed.

First the good stuff. We could get a table on a Saturday night with no wait just by calling ahead a bit. They have a lot of fresh, in-season, and organic food. They cater to people with food allergies, so my gluten-free and dairy-free requests weren't considered at all difficult. Nice variety on the menu. They had 4 desserts, 2 of which I could eat! That alone scores major points with me. The squash pie with coconut cream was a bit heavy on the cinnamon and sweet for my taste, but still delicious. I didn't try the banana-coconut chia pudding, but it sounded good. Staff was very attentive and friendly.  Now the not-so-good stuff. It's in a large shopping center, so parking is quite difficult especially on a Saturday night. The music is very loud, which makes all the customers talk loud, so the ambience felt "trendy" but it's annoying to have to almost shout to your friends and family. The drinks are delicious but watered down and over priced. I'd avoid them next time. Food portions on some dishes are quite small. Husband's salmon came with just a small side of mixed greens.
says they are open at 9am on Sunday well we just got here and they aren't opening until 10 soooooo .... um weird
says they are open at 9am on Sunday well we just got here and they aren't opening until 10 soooooo .... um weird

Pleasantly surprised by this well-priced, quality restaurant that focuses on clean and healthy food choices. Roomy eating area. Plenty if parking. August (server) was terrific, knowledgeable, professional, knew the menu, and did a great job. Enjoyed my edamame appetizer, and loved my teriyaki quinoa bowl selection, which was prepared Prefecture and was a generous sized meal. Menu offers pizzas, bowls, sandwiches, and entrees, and so many things sounded good. Moderately priced. Will definitely return.

I didn't realize how close this place was after hearing about it.  I was staying at the Westin and thought walking over in 90 degree heat would be a fabulous idea.  It was packed on a Wednesday.  I figured I would pass the time and talk with coworkers while having a drink.  I liked the concept a lot and the bar scene.  I ended up having a chicken entree, and shared a salad appetizer and hummus with colleagues.  I wasn't so blown away by the place but I enjoyed the vibe.  The food was okay and the hummus was great. 3 Stars.

I can't get enough of this place! Everything I have tried on the menu is absolutely amazing. The food was seasoned perfectly and the drinks were mixed well. I love the ability to never feel full even though I ate too much...

They allow dogs in a restaurant?  They do here and no it was not a medical dog. This dog was barking and wondering around. Trained dogs do not do that they sit or lay down and behave. So if you would not like dog hair in your food find another place to eat.

In a land full of diners, sports bars, and fast food chains, I was delighted to find True Food, a truly unique restaurant that's both health-conscious and delicious. I stopped in for dinner with my brother, sister-in-law, and nephew on the night before our 7-summit hike. We needed fuel to get us ready.  We each had a fun beverage to start. They have an impressive list of 'Natural Refreshers' consisting of various concoctions of veggies, tea, spices, and fruit. I ordered the Honey Bee Ginger Beer, which is a mix of ginger honey, chai spice, lime, and sparkling water. I like all of those ingredients individually, but wasn't sure how they'd taste together. Was I going to have a 'Rachel's trifle' situation on my hands? Maybe, but I went all Joey on this one and loved it. Very refreshing and cleansing. My sister-in-law had the Sparkling Apple Soda, which was basically apple pie in liquid form. She was a fan.  Our entrees arrived quickly:  Turkey Burger for me, Inside-Out Quinoa Burger for her, Seared Spicy Wild Caught Tuna Wrap for bro, and a pizza for the little one. My turkey burger was pretty good despite the weird tasting flax seed bun. I had a choice of kale salad, sweet potato hash, or both as a side and obvi got both. The kale salad was so satisfying with it's perfectly chopped kale, tart dressing and parmesan cheese. I could have eaten a whole plate of those sweet potatoes. Sis and bro both devoured their plates, so I think they liked theirs too. My nephew, who's 2 years old, had a pizza off the kids menu which was ENORMOUS. Easily an adult-sized individual pizza. I think he ate a slice, but luckily it was also delicious so the rest of us had no problem helping him out :)  The ambiance is pretty cool too. It's a large, open, airy restaurant with big windows, exposed stainless steel prep tables, and a big kitchen right in front of you. Service was good, though bro and I both think our server could've let up a bit on the eye-contact-intensity.   Awesome spot overall. Can't wait to go back and try the butternut squash pizza!

We had dinner there, the place is always packed. Once you eat there you will know why. The food was amazing. We ordered this "The natural" drink, ohh the flavors I loved them. Then came the Mediterranean salad, very good, then the Kale something pizza, which was totally completely unique... We ordered cheese ravioli from the kids menu for my son. My son just loved it, i mean i know my son, he is so picky and fussy about his food and it was just 6 o clock and he ate his meal very nicely, that means it was sure was delicious.  We are vegans so great for us. The food was so healthy and fresh, we just loved it

This place is so yummy. They have this raw veggies appetizer and it's nothing like I'd ever seen before. When i say raw, I mean it seems like they have a garden in the back and they just picked them.   Their edamame and dumplings are so good. They are flavorful! I wish the portion was bigger. I always get their squash casserole and it's one of the best tasting foods I have ever had. I find myself craving it at random times very frequently.   I love eating here because you can taste the fresh quality in every bite of the food but also because you don't feel like you're gonna have a heart attack after you eat.

I really love this place. I was looking to take my mom out for her birthday and wanted to dine at a restaurant that gave us that going out for a fancy dinner feel, while still being healthy. My parents were slightly skeptical (it was a drive for us) but once we arrived they were pleased with every plate we ordered. My dad had the poke bowl and he was in heaven! It made me happy to see my parents enjoy such a good meal that was HEALTHY. The roasted veggies to start were also phenomenal. I don't live in AZ though and I was looking forward to being reunited with the edamame dumplings and they were out which really made me sad!
